2555  ///<summary>
2556  /// All types of edges and vertices can be in the chain.
2557  ///</summary>
2558  MixedTag = 1,
2559 
2560  ///<summary>
2561  /// Every edge in an edge chain has the same smooth/crease property.
2562  ///</summary>
2563  EqualEdgeTag = 2,
2564 
2565  ///<summary>
2566  /// Every edge in an edge chain has the same smooth/crease edge tag
2567  /// and interior vertices have the corresponding smooth/crease vertex tag.
2568  ///</summary>
2569  EqualEdgeAndVertexTag = 3,
2570 
2571  ///<summary>
2572  /// Every edge in an edge chain has the same smooth/crease property
2573  /// and every edge has the same number of faces.
2574  /// If the edges have 1 face, then interior vertices have valence = 3.
2575  /// If the edges have 2 faces, then interior vertices have valence = 4.
2576  ///</summary>
2577  EqualEdgeTagAndOrdinary = 4,
2578 
2579  ///<summary>
2580  /// Every edge in an edge chain has the same smooth/crease edge tag,
2581  /// every edge has the same number of faces,
2582  /// and interior vertices have the corresponding smooth/crease vertex tag.
2583  /// If the edges have 1 face, then interior vertices have valence = 3.
2584  /// If the edges have 2 faces, then interior vertices have valence = 4.
2585  ///</summary>
2586  EqualEdgeAndVertexTagAndOrdinary = 5
2587  };
2588 #pragma endregion
2589 
2590  /*
2591  Parameters:
2592  sit - [in]
2593  vertex sector iterator
2594  component_ring - [out]
2595  A sorted list of ON_SubDComponentPtr values are returned in component_ring[]
2596  component_ring[0] is the central vertex.
2597  component_ring[1] and subsequent components with odd indices are sector edges.
2598  component_ring[2] and subsequent components with even indices are sector faces.
2599  For edge components (i is odd), component_ring[i].ComponentMark() is the index of
2600  the center vertex in ON_SubDEge.m_vertex[].
2601  component_ring_capacity - [in]
2602  capacity of component_ring[] array
2603  1 + center_vertex.m_edge_count + center_vertex.m_face_count
2604  will be large enough.
2605  Returns:
2606  Number of components set in component_ring[].
2607 
2608  0: failure
2609 
2610  >= 4 and even:
2611  component_ring[0] = center vertex
2612  component_ring[1] = starting crease edge
2613  component_ring[2] = starting face
2614  ... zero or more interior smooth edge, face pairs ...
2615  component_ring[component_count-1] = ending crease edge
2616 
2617  >= 5 and odd:
2618  component_ring[0] = vit.CenterVertex()
2619  component_ring[1] = first edge (smooth)
2620  component_ring[2] = first face
2621  ... zero or more smooth edge, face, pairs ...
2622  component_ring[component_count-2] = last edge (smooth)
2623  component_ring[component_count-1] = last face
2624 
2625  Example:
2626  unsinged int component_ring_count = GetVertexComponentRing(vit,component_ring);
2627  unsinged int N = component_ring_count/2; // number of edges in ring
2628  const bool bSectorHasCreaseBoundary = (0 == (component_ring_count % 2));
2629  */
2630  static unsigned int GetSectorComponentRing(
2631  const class ON_SubDSectorIterator& sit,
2632  ON_SubDComponentPtr* component_ring,
2633  size_t component_ring_capacity
2634  );
2635 
2636  /*
2637  Parameters:
2638  sit - [in]
2639  vertex sector iterator
2640  component_ring - [out]
2641  A sorted listof ON_SubDComponentPtr values are returned in component_ring[]
2642 
2643 
2644 
2645  Returns:
2646  Number of components set in component_ring[].
2647 
2648  0: failure
2649 
2650  >= 4 and even:
2651  component_ring[0] = vit.CenterVertex()
2652  component_ring[1] = starting crease edge
2653  component_ring[2] = starting face
2654  ... zero or more interior smooth edge, face pairs ...
2655  component_ring[component_count-1] = ending crease edge
2656 
2657  >= 5 and odd:
2658  component_ring[0] = center vertex
2659  component_ring[1] = first edge (smooth)
2660  component_ring[2] = first face
2661  ... zero or more smooth edge, face, pairs ...
2662  component_ring[component_count-2] = last edge (smooth)
2663  component_ring[component_count-1] = last face
2664 
2665  Example:
2666  unsinged int component_ring_count = GetVertexComponentRing(vit,component_ring);
2667  unsinged int N = component_ring_count/2; // number of edges in ring
2668  const bool bSectorHasCreaseBoundary = (0 == (component_ring_count % 2));
2669  */
2670  static unsigned int GetSectorComponentRing(
2671  const class ON_SubDSectorIterator& sit,
2672  ON_SimpleArray<ON_SubDComponentPtr>& component_ring
2673  );
2674 
2675  /*
2676  Returns:
2677  Number of edges in an component ring returned by ON_SubD::GetVertexComponentRing();
2678  */
2679  static unsigned int ComponentRingEdgeCount(
2680  size_t component_ring_count
2681  );
2682 
2683  /*
2684  Returns:
2685  Number of faces in an component ring returned by ON_SubD::GetVertexComponentRing();
2686  */
2687  static unsigned int ComponentRingFaceCount(
2688  size_t component_ring_count
2689  );
2690 
2691  static bool ComponentRingIsValid(
2692  const ON_SubDComponentPtr* component_ring,
2693  size_t component_ring_count
2694  );
2695 
2696  /*
2697  Returns:
2698  Number of points in the subdivision ring or 0 if the call fails.
2699  */
2700  static unsigned int GetSectorSubdivsionPointRing(
2701  const ON_SubDComponentPtr* component_ring,
2702  size_t component_ring_count,
2703  double* point_ring,
2704  size_t point_ring_capacity,
2705  size_t point_ring_stride
2706  );
2707 
2708  static unsigned int GetSectorSubdivisionPointRing(
2709  const ON_SubDComponentPtr* component_ring,
2710  size_t component_ring_count,
2711  ON_SimpleArray<ON_3dPoint>& subd_point_ring
2712  );
2713 
2714  static unsigned int GetSectorPointRing(
2715  bool bSubdivideIfNeeded,
2716  const ON_SubDComponentPtr* component_ring,
2717  size_t component_ring_count,
2718  double* subd_point_ring,
2719  size_t subd_point_ring_capacity,
2720  size_t subd_point_ring_stride
2721  );
2722 
2723  static unsigned int GetSectorPointRing(
2724  bool bSubdivideIfNeeded,
2725  size_t component_ring_count,
2726  const ON_SubDComponentPtr* component_ring,
2727  ON_SimpleArray<ON_3dPoint>& point_ring
2728  );
2729 
2730  static unsigned int GetSectorPointRing(
2731  bool bSubdivideIfNeeded,
2732  const class ON_SubDSectorIterator& sit,
2733  double* point_ring,
2734  size_t point_ring_capacity,
2735  size_t point_ring_stride
2736  );
2737 
2738  static unsigned int GetSectorPointRing(
2739  bool bSubdivideIfNeeded,
2740  const class ON_SubDSectorIterator& sit,
2741  ON_SimpleArray<ON_3dPoint>& point_ring
2742  );
2743 
2744  /*
2745  Parameters:
2746  subd_type - [in]
2747  A quad based subdivision algorithm.
2748  bFirstPass - [in]
2749  If bFirstPass is true and the components are in standard form for the vertex
2750  and subdivision type, then locations of the component vertices opposite the
2751  center vertex are returned in the point ring.
2752  bSecondPass - [in]
2753  If bSecondtPass is true and the first pass is disable or does not succeed,
2754  then the component subdivision locations are returned in the point ring.
2755  vertex0 - [in]
2756  If not null, then vertex0->m_edges and vertex0->m_faces must
2757  be radially sorted and span a single sector and component_ring[]
2758  is ignored.
2759  component_ring_count - [in]
2760  If vertex0 is null, then component_ring_count specifies the number
2761  of components in the component_ring[] array.
2762  component_ring[] - [in]
2763  If vertex0 is null, then component_ring[0] is the central vertex,
2764  component_ring[1] and subsequent components with odd indices are
2765  sector edges, component_ring[2] and subsequent components with even
2766  indices are sector faces, all sorted radially.
2767  point_ring_stride - [in]
2768  point_ring - [out]
2769  point locations are returned here.
2770  Returns:
2771  Number of points in the subdivision ring or 0 if the call fails.
2772  The number of points is
2773  1 + ON_SubD::ComponentRingEdgeCount(component_ring_count) + ON_SubD::ComponentRingFaceCount(component_ring_count).
2774  Remarks:
2775  No validation checking is performed. This function will crash
2776  if the input is not valid. Call GetSubdivisionPointRing() if
2777  you want a crash proof call.
2778  */
2779  static unsigned int GetQuadSectorPointRing(
2780  bool bFirstPass,
2781  bool bSecondPass,
2782  const class ON_SubDVertex* vertex0,
2783  const class ON_SubDComponentPtr* component_ring,
2784  size_t component_ring_count,
2785  double* point_ring,
2786  size_t point_ring_stride
2787  );
2788 
2789  static const class ON_SubDVertex* SubdivideSector(
2790  const class ON_SubDVertex* center_vertex,
2791  const class ON_SubDComponentPtr* component_ring,
2792  size_t component_ring_count,
2793  class ON_SubD_FixedSizeHeap& fsh
2794  );
2795 
2796  /*
2797  Returns:
2798  true if sector_edge_count is valid for the vertex type
2799  */
2800  static bool IsValidSectorEdgeCount(
2801  ON_SubDVertexTag vertex_tag,
2802  unsigned int sector_edge_count
2803  );
2804 
2805  static bool IsValidSectorFaceCount(
2806  ON_SubDVertexTag vertex_tag,
2807  unsigned int sector_face_count
2808  );
2809 
2810 #pragma region RH_C_SHARED_ENUM [ON_SubD::SubDFriendlyKnotType] [Rhino.Geometry.SubDFriendlyKnotType] [byte]
2811  /// <summary>
2812  /// ON_SubD::SubDFriendlyKnotType identifies the types of subd friendly NURBS knot vectors.
2813  /// SubD friendly NURBS curves and surfacaes are always cubic and nonrational.
2814  /// Any time there is a multiple knot, the 2nd derivative is zero at the corresponding parameter.
2815  /// SubD friendly NURBS curves are either periodic or have zero 2nd derivative at the ends.
2816  /// </summary>
2817  enum class SubDFriendlyKnotType : unsigned char
2818  {
2819  ///<summary>
2820  /// Not a valid type. Used to indicate the type has not been set and to encourage developers to explicitly specify a type.
2821  ///</summary>
2822  Unset = 0,
2823 
2824  ///<summary>
2825  /// NURBS knot vector is an unclamped uniform cubic knot vector.
2826  /// Every knot interval has the same length.
2827  /// Every knot has multiplicity 1.
2828  ///</summary>
2829  UnclampedUniform = 1,
2830 
2831  ///<summary>
2832  /// NURBS knot vector is a clamped uniform cubic knot vector.
2833  /// Every interior knot interval has the same length.
2834  /// End knots have multiplicity 3 and interior knots have multiplicity 1.
2835  ///</summary>
2836  ClampedUniform = 2,
2837 
2838  ///<summary>
2839  /// NURBS knot vector is a clamped piecewise uniform cubic knot vector.
2840  /// All nonzero knot intervals have the same length.
2841  /// End knots have multiplicity 3 and interior knots have multiplicity 1 or 3.
2842  /// Interior knots with multiplicity 3 correspond to interior SubD creases.
2843  ///</summary>
2844  ClampedPiecewiseUniform = 4,
2845 
2846  ///<summary>
2847  /// NURBS knot vector is not subd friendly.
2848  ///</summary>
2849  Unfriendly = 127
2850  };
2851  #pragma endregion
2852 
2853  /*
2854  Parameters:
2855  order - [in]
2856  NURBS knot vector order.
2857  cv_count - [in]
2858  Number of NURBS knot vector control points.
2859  knots - [in]
2860  NURBS knot vector. This is an array of (cv_count+2) knot values.
2861  Returns:
2862  SubD friendly knot vector type.
2863  Remarks:
2864  If order is not 4, cv_count is not valid, or knot is nullptr, then
2865  ON_SubD::SubDFriendlyKnotType::Unfriendly is returned.
2866  */
2867  static ON_SubD::SubDFriendlyKnotType NurbsKnotType(
2868  int order,
2869  int cv_count,
2870  const double* knots
2871  );
2872 
2873  static ON_SubD::SubDFriendlyKnotType NurbsKnotType(
2874  int order,
2875  int cv_count,
2876  const double* knots,
2877  ON_SimpleArray<double>* triple_knots
2878  );
2879 
2880 #if defined(OPENNURBS_PLUS)
2881  /*
2882  Description:
2883  Mark all vertices, edges, and faces in the connected region containing seed_component
2884  by setting ON_SubDComponentBase.Mark() to true.
2885  Parameters:
2886  seed_component - [in]
2887  bManifoldRegions - [in]
2888  If true, marking will stop at nonmanifold vertices and nonmanifold edges.
2889  Returns:
2890  Number of marked components.
2891  */
2892  unsigned int MarkConnectedRegion(
2893  const ON_SubDComponentPtr seed_component,
2894  bool bManifoldRegions
2895  ) const;
2896 
2897  /*
2898  Description:
2899  Assign group ids to sets vertices, edges, and faces in the connected regions.
2900  Parameters:
2901  bManifoldRegions - [in]
2902  If true, groups will stop at nonmanifold vertices and nonmanifold edges.
2903  Returns:
2904  Number of connected regions.
2905  The assigned group ids will run from 1 to the returned value.
2906  If bManifoldRegions is true and a nonmanifold component is on the boundary between
2907  two or more connected regions, then that component will have m_group_id = 0.
2908  */
2909  unsigned int GroupConnectedRegions(
2910  bool bManifoldRegions
2911  ) const;
2912 
2913  /*
2914  Description:
2915  If this subd has two or more connected regions, create a new subd for each connected region.
2916  Parameters:
2917  bManifoldRegions - [in]
2918  If true, the connected regions will stop at nonmanifold vertices and nonmanifold edges.
2919  connected_components - [out]
2920  If there are two or more connected regions, they are appended to connected_regions[]
2921  Returns:
2922  Number of connected components appended to connected_components[].
2923  */
2924  unsigned int GetConnectedRegions(
2925  bool bManifoldRegions,
2926  ON_SimpleArray< ON_SubD* >& connected_regions
2927  ) const;
2928 #endif
2929 
2930 #if defined(OPENNURBS_PLUS)
2931 
2932  /*
2933  Description:
2934  Create a NURBS curve that close to being on the SubD surface.
2935  Parameters:
2936  edge_count
2937  edge_chain[] - [in]
2938  An edge chain.
2939  edge[i].RelativeVertex(1) == edge[i+1].RelativeVertex(0).
2940  destination_curve - [in]
2941  If destination_curve is not nullptr, then the resulting curve
2942  will be created in destination_curve.
2943  Returns:
2944  If the input is valid, then a cubic NURBS curve is returned.
2945  Any time there is a vertex that is a crease with a smooth edge or any type of corner,
2946  then corresponding location on the curve will have a triple knot.
2947  If the input is not valid, nullptr is returned.
2948  Remarks:
2949  When destination_curve is nullptr, the returned curve is on the heap and the caller must
2950  manage it.
2951  */
2952  static class ON_NurbsCurve* CreateSubDFriendlyCurve(
2953  const ON_SubDEdgePtr* edge_chain,
2954  size_t edge_count,
2955  class ON_NurbsCurve* destination_curve
2956  );
2957 
2958  static class ON_NurbsCurve* CreateSubDFriendlyCurve(
2959  ON_SimpleArray< ON_SubDEdgePtr >& edge_chain,
2960  class ON_NurbsCurve* destination_curve
2961  );
2962 
2963  /*
2964  Description:
2965  Create a NURBS curve that is suitable for calculations like
2966  lofting SubD objects through a sequence of curves.
2967  Parameters:
2968  points[] - [in]
2969  Adjacent points must not be equal.
2970  If bPeriodicClosedCurve is false, there must be at least two points.
2971  If bPeriodicClosedCurve is true, there must be at least three points
2972  and it is not necessary to duplicate the first and last points.
2973  When bPeriodicClosedCurve is true and the first and last points are equal,
2974  the duplicate last point is automatically ignored.
2975  bInterpolatePoints -[in]
2976  True if the curve should interpolate the points.
2977  False if points[] specify control point locations.
2978  In either case, the curve will begin at the first point
2979  and end at the last point.
2980  bPeriodicClosedCurve - [in]
2981  true to create a periodic closed curve.
2982  destination_curve - [in]
2983  If destination_curve is not nullptr, then the resulting curve
2984  will be created in destination_curve.
2985  Returns:
2986  If the input is valid, then a uniform cubic NURBS curve with unclamped knots is returned.
2987  If the input is not valid, nullptr is returned.
2988  Remarks:
2989  When destination_curve is nullptr, the returned curve is on the heap and the caller must
2990  manage it.
2991  */
2992  static class ON_NurbsCurve* CreateSubDFriendlyCurve(
2993  const ON_SimpleArray<ON_3dPoint>& points,
2994  bool bInterpolatePoints,
2995  bool bPeriodicClosedCurve,
2996  class ON_NurbsCurve* destination_curve
2997  );
2998 
2999  /*
3000  Description:
3001  Create a NURBS curve that is suitable for calculations like
3002  lofting SubD objects through a sequence of curves.
3003  Parameters:
3004  point_count - [in]
3005  Must be >= 2.
3006  points[] - [in]
3007  Adjacent points must not be equal.
3008  If bPeriodicClosedCurve is false, there must be at least two points.
3009  If bPeriodicClosedCurve is true, there must be at least three points
3010  and it is not necessary to duplicate the first and last points.
3011  When bPeriodicClosedCurve is true and the first and last points are equal,
3012  the duplicate last point is automatically ignored.
3013  bInterpolatePoints -[in]
3014  True if the curve should interpolate the points.
3015  False if points[] specify control point locations.
3016  In either case, the curve will begin at the first point
3017  and end at the last point.
3018  bPeriodicClosedCurve - [in]
3019  true to create a periodic closed curve.
3020  Do not duplicate the start/end point in the point[] input.
3021  destination_curve - [in]
3022  If destination_curve is not nullptr, then the resulting curve
3023  will be created in destination_curve.
3024  Returns:
3025  If the input is valid, then a uniform cubic NURBS curve with unclamped knots is returned.
3026  If the input is not valid, nullptr is returned.
3027  Remarks:
3028  When destination_curve is nullptr, the returned curve is on the heap and the caller must
3029  manage it.
3030  */
3031  static class ON_NurbsCurve* CreateSubDFriendlyCurve(
3032  const ON_3dPoint* points,
3033  size_t point_count,
3034  bool bInterpolatePoints,
3035  bool bPeriodicClosedCurve,
3036  class ON_NurbsCurve* destination_curve
3037  );
3038 
3039  /*
3040  Description:
3041  Expert user tool to create a NURBS curve that is suitable for calculations like
3042  lofting SubD objects through a sequence of curves.
3043  Parameters:
3044  point_count - [in]
3045  >= 2
3046  point_stride - [in]
3047  abs(point_stride) >= 3
3048  points[] - [in]
3049  Adjacent points must not be equal.
3050  If bPeriodicClosedCurve is false, there must be at least two points.
3051  If bPeriodicClosedCurve is true, there must be at least three points
3052  and it is not necessary to duplicate the first and last points.
3053  When bPeriodicClosedCurve is true and the first and last points are equal,
3054  the duplicate last point is automatically ignored.
3055  bInterpolatePoints -[in]
3056  True if the curve should interpolate the points.
3057  False if points[] specify control point locations.
3058  In either case, the curve will begin at the first point
3059  and end at the last point.
3060  bPeriodicClosedCurve - [in]
3061  true to create a periodic closed curve.
3062  Do not duplicate the start/end point in the point[] input.
3063  destination_curve - [in]
3064  If destination_curve is not nullptr, then the resulting curve
3065  will be created in destination_curve.
3066  Returns:
3067  If the input is valid, then a uniform cubic NURBS curve with
3068  point_count+2 control points and unclamped knots is returned.
3069  If the input is not valid, nullptr is returned.
3070  Remarks:
3071  When destination_curve is nullptr, the returned curve is on the heap and the caller must
3072  manage it.
3073  */
3074  static class ON_NurbsCurve* CreateSubDFriendlyCurve(
3075  const double* points,
3076  size_t point_count,
3077  int point_stride,
3078  bool bInterpolatePoints,
3079  bool bPeriodicClosedCurve,
3080  class ON_NurbsCurve* destination_curve
3081  );
3082 
3083  /*
3084  Description:
3085  Expert user tool to create a NURBS curve that is suitable for calculations like
3086  lofting SubD objects through a sequence of curves.
3087  Parameters:
3088  point_count - [in]
3089  >= 2
3090  point_stride - [in]
3091  abs(point_stride) >= 3
3092  points[] - [in]
3093  Adjacent points must not be equal.
3094  If bPeriodicClosedCurve is false, there must be at least two points.
3095  If bPeriodicClosedCurve is true, there must be at least three points
3096  and it is not necessary to duplicate the first and last points.
3097  When bPeriodicClosedCurve is true and the first and last points are equal,
3098  the duplicate last point is automatically ignored.
3099  bInterpolatePoints -[in]
3100  True if the curve should interpolate the points.
3101  False if points[] specify control point locations.
3102  In either case, the curve will begin at the first point
3103  and end at the last point.
3104  bPeriodicClosedCurve - [in]
3105  true to create a periodic closed curve.
3106  Do not duplicate the start/end point in the point[] input.
3107  creases[] - [in]
3108  If creases is nullptr, this parameter is ignored.
3109  If bPeriodicClosedCurve is true, this parameter is ignored.
3110  Otherwise creases[] is an array of point_count bools and when creases[i]
3111  is true there will be a natural crease/kink at the corresponding point.
3112  The values of creases[0] and creases[point_count-1] are ignored.
3113  destination_curve - [in]
3114  If destination_curve is not nullptr, then the resulting curve
3115  will be created in destination_curve.
3116  Returns:
3117  If the input is valid, then a uniform cubic NURBS curve with
3118  point_count+2 control points and unclamped knots is returned.
3119  If the input is not valid, nullptr is returned.
3120  Remarks:
3121  When destination_curve is nullptr, the returned curve is on the heap and the caller must
3122  manage it.
3123  */
3124  static class ON_NurbsCurve* CreateSubDFriendlyCurve(
3125  const double* points,
3126  size_t point_count,
3127  int point_stride,
3128  bool bInterpolatePoints,
3129  bool bPeriodicClosedCurve,
3130  const bool* creases,
3131  class ON_NurbsCurve* destination_curve
3132  );
3133 
3134  /*
3135  Description:
3136 
3137  Parameters:
3138  curve - [in]
3139  curve to rebuild as a SubD friendly curve.
3140  cv_count - [in]
3141  Desired number of control points.
3142  0: automatic
3143  >0: Number of control points in the SubD friendly curve.
3144  If bPeriodicClosedCurve is true, the number must be >= 6, otherwise
3145  the number must be >= 4.
3146  bPeriodicClosedCurve - [in]
3147  True if the SubD friendly curve should be closed and periodic.
3148  False in all other cases.
3149  destination_curve - [in]
3150  If destination_curve is not nullptr, the SubD friendly curve
3151  is created in destination_curve. Otherwise the SubD friendly curve
3152  is allocated on heap.
3153  Returns:
3154  A pointer to the SubD friendly curve.
3155  Remarks:
3156  A "natural" spline has zero 2nd derivatives (and hence zero curvature) at the start and end.
3157  A "periodic" spline has unclampled periodic knots and periodic control points.
3158  */
3159  static class ON_NurbsCurve* CreateSubDFriendlyCurve(
3160  const class ON_Curve& curve,
3161  int cv_count,
3162  bool bPeriodicClosedCurve,
3163  class ON_NurbsCurve* destination_curve
3164  );
3165 
3166  static class ON_NurbsCurve* CreateSubDFriendlyCurve(
3167  const class ON_Curve& curve,
3168  int cv_count,
3169  class ON_NurbsCurve* destination_curve
3170  );
3171 
3172  static class ON_NurbsCurve* CreateSubDFriendlyCurve(
3173  const class ON_Curve& curve,
3174  class ON_NurbsCurve* destination_curve
3175  );
3176 
3177 
3178  /*
3179  Parameters:
3180  curve - [in]
3181  curve to test.
3182  Returns:
3183  True if the curve is a cubic, nonrational, uniform NURBS curve that is either
3184  periodic or has natural end contitions.
3185  Othewise, false is returned.
3186  Remarks:
3187  A "natural" spline has zero 2nd derivatives (and hence zero curvature) at the start and end.
3188  A "periodic" spline has unclampled periodic knots and periodic control points.
3189  */
3190  static bool IsSubDFriendlyCurve(
3191  const ON_Curve* curve
3192  );
3193 
3194  /*
3195  Parameters:
3196  curve - [in]
3197  curve to test.
3198  Returns:
3199  True if the curve is a nonrational, uniform, natural or periodic, cubic NURBS curve.
3200  Othewise, 0 is returned.
3201  Remarks:
3202  A "natural" spline has zero 2nd derivatives (and hence zero curvature) at the start and end.
3203  A "periodic" spline has unclampled periodic knots and periodic control points.
3204  */
3205  static bool IsSubDFriendlySurface(
3206  const ON_Surface* surface
3207  );
3208 
3209  /*
3210  Description:
3211  Creates a list of SubD friendly nurbs curves that can be used to loft
3212  a SubD fit to the input surface.
3213  Parameters:
3214  surface - [in]
3215  iso_dir - [in]
3216  surface parameter direction for the loft_curves[]
3217  loft_curves - [out]
3218  A list of non-rational NURBS curves that can be lofted into a SubD friendly surface.
3219  Each curve must be either a degree 3 subd-friendly curve or a degree 1 polyline.
3220  bPeriodicClosedLoft - [out]
3221  True if a closed periodic lofted surface should be created throught loft_curves[]. In this case
3222  loft_creases.Count() = 0.
3223  loft_creases -[out]
3224  If the surface has creases, then a loft_creases.Count() = loft_curves.Count() and loft_curves[i] is a crease
3225  when loft_crease[i] is true.
3226  Otherwise loft_creases.Count() = 0.
3227  loft_parameters - [out]
3228  The curve loft_curves[i] is a SubD friendly fit to the curve surface.IsoCurve(iso_dir, loft_parameters[i]);
3229  These values are for use to build a correspondence between surface and any resulting loft. Up to an domain
3230  change, the SubD friendly loft will have its parameters completely determined by loft_creases.Count(),
3231  loft_creases[], and bPeriodicClosedLoft.
3232  Returns:
3233  true if loft_curves[] and related information was successfully calculated.
3234  */
3235  static bool CreateSubDFriendlyIsoCurves(
3236  const class ON_Surface& surface,
3237  int iso_dir,
3238  ON_ClassArray<ON_NurbsCurve>& loft_curves,
3239  bool& bPeriodicClosedLoft,
3240  ON_SimpleArray<bool>& loft_creases,
3241  ON_SimpleArray<double>& loft_parameters
3242  );
3243 
3244  /*
3245  Description:
3246  Create a bicubic subd friendly surface by lofting through subd friendly cubic curves.
3247  Parameters:
3248  cubic_curves - [in]
3249  SubD friendly cubic curves.
3250  bPeriodicClosedLoft - [in]
3251  If true, the returned surface will be a periodic loft through the curves.
3252  destination_surface - [in]
3253  If not nullptr, the SubD friendly surface will be created in destination_surface
3254  */
3255  static class ON_NurbsSurface* CreateSubDFriendlySurface(
3256  const ON_ObjectArray<ON_NurbsCurve>& cubic_curves,
3257  bool bPeriodicClosedLoft,
3258  class ON_NurbsSurface* destination_surface
3259  );
3260 
3261  /*
3262  Description:
3263  Create a bicubic subd friendly surface by lofting through subd friendly cubic curves.
3264  Parameters:
3265  cubic_curves - [in]
3266  SubD friendly cubic curves.
3267  bPeriodicClosedLoft - [in]
3268  If true, the returned surface will be a periodic loft through the curves.
3269  destination_surface - [in]
3270  If not nullptr, the SubD friendly surface will be created in destination_surface
3271  */
3272  static class ON_NurbsSurface* CreateSubDFriendlySurface(
3273  const ON_ClassArray<ON_NurbsCurve>& cubic_curves,
3274  bool bPeriodicClosedLoft,
3275  class ON_NurbsSurface* destination_surface
3276  );
3277 
3278  /*
3279  Description:
3280  Create a bicubic subd friendly surface by lofting through subd friendly cubic curves.
3281  Parameters:
3282  cubic_curves - [in]
3283  SubD friendly cubic curves.
3284  bPeriodicClosedLoft - [in]
3285  If true, the returned surface will be a periodic loft through the curves.
3286  destination_surface - [in]
3287  If not nullptr, the SubD friendly surface will be created in destination_surface
3288  */
3289  static class ON_NurbsSurface* CreateSubDFriendlySurface(
3290  const ON_SimpleArray<const ON_NurbsCurve*>& cubic_curves,
3291  bool bPeriodicClosedLoft,
3292  class ON_NurbsSurface* destination_surface
3293  );
3294 
3295  /*
3296  Description:
3297  Create a bicubic subd friendly surface by lofting through subd friendly cubic curves.
3298  Parameters:
3299  cubic_curves - [in]
3300  SubD friendly cubic curves.
3301  bPeriodicClosedLoft - [in]
3302  If true, the returned surface will be a periodic loft through the curves.
3303  creases - [in]
3304  If bPeriodicClosedLoft is false and creases is not nullptr,
3305  then it must be an array of cubic_curves.Count() bools. In this case,
3306  if creases[i] is true, then the returned surface will have a crease along cubic_curves[i].
3307  destination_surface - [in]
3308  If not nullptr, the SubD friendly surface will be created in destination_surface
3309  */
3310  static class ON_NurbsSurface* CreateSubDFriendlySurface(
3311  const ON_SimpleArray<const ON_NurbsCurve*>& cubic_curves,
3312  bool bPeriodicClosedLoft,
3313  const bool* creases,
3314  class ON_NurbsSurface* destination_surface
3315  );
3316 
3317  /*
3318  Description:
3319  Create a bicubic subd friendly surface by lofting through subd friendly cubic curves.
3320  Parameters:
3321  cubic_curves - [in]
3322  SubD friendly cubic curves.
3323  bPeriodicClosedLoft - [in]
3324  If true, the returned surface will be a periodic loft through the curves.
3325  destination_surface - [in]
3326  If not nullptr, the SubD friendly surface will be created in destination_surface
3327  */
3328  static class ON_NurbsSurface* CreateSubDFriendlySurface(
3329  const class ON_Surface& surface,
3330  class ON_NurbsSurface* destination_surface
3331  );
3332 
3333  /*
3334  Description:
3335  Loft a subd through curves
3336  Parameters:
3337  curves - [in]
3338  A list of compatible SubD-friendly NURBS curves.
3339  bPeriodicClosedLoft - [in]
3340  bCorners - [in]
3341  If true, and bPeriodicClosedLoft is false, and the curves are open,
3342  then the 4 corners will will be tagged ON_SubDVertexTag::Corner.
3343  span_divisions - [in]
3344  number of subd divisions between input shape locations
3345  */
3346  static ON_SubD* CreateFromLoftCurves(
3347  const ON_SimpleArray<const ON_NurbsCurve*>& curves,
3348  bool bPeriodicClosedLoft,
3349  bool bCorners,
3350  unsigned int span_divisions,
3351  ON_SubD* destination_subd
3352  );
3353 
3354  static ON_SubD* CreateFromLoftCurves(
3355  const ON_ClassArray<ON_NurbsCurve>& curves,
3356  bool bPeriodicClosedLoft,
3357  bool bCorners,
3358  unsigned int span_divisions,
3359  ON_SubD* destination_subd
3360  );
3361 
3362  static ON_SubD* CreateFromLoftCurves(
3363  const ON_ObjectArray<ON_NurbsCurve>& curves,
3364  bool bPeriodicClosedLoft,
3365  bool bCorners,
3366  unsigned int span_divisions,
3367  ON_SubD* destination_subd
3368  );
3369 
3370  /*
3371  Description:
3372  Loft a subd control net through a list of polylines.
3373  */
3374  static ON_SubD* CreateControlNetFromPolylines(
3375  const ON_SimpleArray<const ON_Polyline*>& polylines,
3376  bool bPeriodicClosedLoft,
3377  bool bCorners,
3378  unsigned int span_divisions,
3379  ON_SubD* destination_subd
3380  );
3381 
3382  /*
3383  Description:
3384  Loft a subd control net through a list of polylines.
3385  */
3386  static ON_SubD* CreateControlNetFromPolylines(
3387  const ON_ClassArray<ON_Polyline>& polylines,
3388  bool bPeriodicClosedLoft,
3389  bool bCorners,
3390  unsigned int span_divisions,
3391  ON_SubD* destination_subd
3392  );
3393 
3394  /*
3395  Description:
3396  Loft a subd control net through a list of polylines.
3397  */
3398  static ON_SubD* CreateControlNetFromPolylines(
3399  const ON_SimpleArray<const ON_PolylineCurve*>& polylines,
3400  bool bPeriodicClosedLoft,
3401  bool bCorners,
3402  unsigned int span_divisions,
3403  ON_SubD* destination_subd
3404  );
3405 
3406  /*
3407  Description:
3408  Loft a subd control net through a list of polylines.
3409  */
3410  static ON_SubD* CreateControlNetFromPolylines(
3411  const ON_ClassArray<ON_PolylineCurve>& polylines,
3412  bool bPeriodicClosedLoft,
3413  bool bCorners,
3414  unsigned int span_divisions,
3415  ON_SubD* destination_subd
3416  );
3417 
3418  /*
3419  Description:
3420  Loft a subd control net through a list of polylines.
3421  */
3422  static ON_SubD* CreateControlNetFromPolylines(
3423  const ON_ObjectArray<ON_PolylineCurve>& polylines,
3424  bool bPeriodicClosedLoft,
3425  bool bCorners,
3426  unsigned int span_divisions,
3427  ON_SubD* destination_subd
3428  );
3429 
3430  /*
3431  Description:
3432  Loft a subd control net through a list of nurbs curve control nets.
3433  */
3434  static ON_SubD* CreateControlNetFromNurbsCurves(
3435  const ON_SimpleArray<const ON_NurbsCurve*>& polylines,
3436  bool bPeriodicClosedLoft,
3437  bool bCorners,
3438  unsigned int span_divisions,
3439  ON_SubD* destination_subd
3440  );
3441 
3442  /*
3443  Description:
3444  Loft a subd control net through a list of nurbs curve control nets.
3445  */
3446  static ON_SubD* CreateControlNetFromNurbsCurves(
3447  const ON_ClassArray<ON_NurbsCurve>& polylines,
3448  bool bPeriodicClosedLoft,
3449  bool bCorners,
3450  unsigned int span_divisions,
3451  ON_SubD* destination_subd
3452  );
3453 
3454  /*
3455  Description:
3456  Loft a subd control net through a list of nurbs curve control nets.
3457  */
3458  static ON_SubD* CreateControlNetFromNurbsCurves(
3459  const ON_ObjectArray<ON_NurbsCurve>& polylines,
3460  bool bPeriodicClosedLoft,
3461  bool bCorners,
3462  unsigned int span_divisions,
3463  ON_SubD* destination_subd
3464  );
3465 
3466  /*
3467  Description:
3468  Create a subd that approsimates the surface.
3469  If the surface is a subd friendly NURBS surface and bCorners is true,
3470  then the subd and input surface will have the same geometry.
3471  Parameters:
3472  surface - [in]
3473  method - [in]
3474  Selects the method used to calculate the subd.
3475  bCorners - [in]
3476  If the surface is open, then the corner vertices with be tagged as ON_SubD::VertexTagCorner.
3477  This makes the resulting subd have sharp corners to match the appearance of the input surface.
3478  */
3479  static ON_SubD* CreateFromSurface(
3480  const class ON_Surface& surface,
3481  const ON_SubDFromSurfaceParameters* from_surface_parameters,
3482  ON_SubD* destination_subd
3483  );
3484 
3485  /*
3486  Description:
3487  Uses the input surface to define a SubD.
3488  Parameters:
3489  curve - [in]
3490  A closed curve.
3491  If the closed curve is a uniform cubic periodic NURBS curve,
3492  then the boundary of the returned SubD will exactly match
3493  that curve. Otherwise,
3494  ON_SubD::CreateSubDFriendlyCurve(curve) will be the boundary.
3495  destination_subd - [in]
3496  Can be nullptr
3497  Returns:
3498  SubD with specified boundary or nullptr if input is not valid.
3499  */
3500  static ON_SubD* CreateFromBoundary(
3501  const class ON_Curve& curve,
3502  ON_SubD* destination_subd
3503  );
3504 
3505  static ON_SubD* ToSubD(
3506  const class ON_Geometry* geometry,
3507  const class ON_SubDFromMeshParameters* from_mesh_parameters,
3508  const class ON_SubDFromSurfaceParameters* from_surface_parameters,
3509  ON_SubD* destination_subd
3510  );
3511 #endif
3512 
3513 
3514 #if defined(OPENNURBS_PLUS)
3515  /*
3516  Parameters:
3517  offset_distance - [in]
3518  A valid nonzero value .
3519  bOffsetSurface - [in]
3520  If true, the offset is caluclated by interpolating offet surface points.
3521  Otherwise the offset is calculated by offsetting the control net.
3522  Using interpolation is slower and typiclly produces less pleasing appearance.
3523  Using the control net typically means the surface offset distance is not exactly offset_distance.
3524  bBothSides - [in]
3525  If true, the input subd is offset both directions.
3526  bMakeSolid - [in]
3527  If true, the result is a solid made by adding quads connecting corresponding boundary edges the input subd and the offset or both sides of the offset.
3528  destination_subd - [in]
3529  If not nullptr, the result will be created in this subd.
3530  If this and destination_subd are the same, the subd is offset in place.
3531  If nullptr is passed, the returned ON_SubD is on the heap and the caller
3532  is resposible for managing it.
3533  Returns:
3534  If successful, the offset is returned. Otherwise nullptr is returned.
3535  */
3536  ON_SubD* Offset(
3537  double offset_distance,
3538  bool bOffsetSurface,
3539  bool bBothSides,
3540  bool bMakeSolid,
3541  ON_SubD* destination_subd
3542  ) const;
3543 
3544  /*
3545  Parameters:
3546  offset_direction - [in]
3547  non zero vector
3548  bOffsetSurface - [in]
3549  If true, the offset is caluclated by interpolating offet surface points.
3550  Otherwise the offset is calculated by offsetting the control net.
3551  Using interpolation is slower and typiclly produces less pleasing appearance.
3552  Using the control net typically means the surface offset distance is not exactly offset_distance.
3553  bBothSides - [in]
3554  If true, the input subd is offset both directions.
3555  bMakeSolid - [in]
3556  If true, the result is a solid made by adding quads connecting corresponding boundary edges the input subd and the offset or both sides of the offset.
3557  destination_subd - [in]
3558  If not nullptr, the result will be created in this subd.
3559  If this and destination_subd are the same, the subd is offset in place.
3560  If nullptr is passed, the returned ON_SubD is on the heap and the caller
3561  is resposible for managing it.
3562  Returns:
3563  If successful, the offset is returned. Otherwise nullptr is returned.
3564  */
3565  ON_SubD* Offset(
3566  ON_3dVector offset_direction,
3567  bool bOffsetSurface,
3568  bool bBothSides,
3569  bool bMakeSolid,
3570  ON_SubD* destination_subd
3571  ) const;
3572 #endif
3573 
3574 
3575 
3576  ON_SubD() ON_NOEXCEPT;
3577  virtual ~ON_SubD();
3578 
3579 
3580 
3581  /*
3582  Description:
3583  Creates an independent copy of src.
3584  */
3585  ON_SubD( const ON_SubD& src );
3586 
3587  /*
3588  Description:
3589  Creates an independent copy of src.
3590  */
3591  ON_SubD& operator=(const ON_SubD& src);
3592 
3593 #if defined(ON_HAS_RVALUEREF)
3594  // rvalue copy constructor
3595  ON_SubD( ON_SubD&& ) ON_NOEXCEPT;
3596 
3597  // The rvalue assignment operator calls ON_Object::operator=(ON_Object&&)
3598  // which could throw exceptions. See the implementation of
3599  // ON_Object::operator=(ON_Object&&) for details.
3600  ON_SubD& operator=( ON_SubD&& );
3601 #endif
3602 
3603  /*
3604  Description:
3605  The subdivision information referenced by src_subd will be shared with this
3606  Remarks:
3607  ON_Geometry base class information, like ON_UserData, is not copied or shared.
3608  */
3609  void ShareContentsFrom(
3610  ON_SubD& subd
3611  );
3612 
3613  static void SwapContents(
3614  ON_SubD& a,
3615  ON_SubD& b
3616  );

3700  bool bDelete = true
3701  ) override;

3720  For ON_SubD objects, ClearBoundingBox() and DestroyRuntimeCache()
3721  are identical.
3722  */
3723  //virtual
3724  void ClearBoundingBox() override;

3761  ON_Brep* BrepForm(
3762  ON_Brep* brep = nullptr
3763  ) const override;

3769  bool EvaluatePoint(
3770  const class ON_ObjRef& objref,
3771  ON_3dPoint& P
3772  ) const override;
3773 
3774  /*
3775  Description:
3776  Uses the input mesh to define the level zero control polygon.
3777  Parameters:
3778  level_zero_mesh - [in]
3779  from_mesh_parameters - [in]
3780  To get the smoothest possible result, pass nullptr
3781  or ON_SubDFromMeshParameters::Smooth. To get a sub-D with interior
3782  creases use other static ON_SubDFromMeshParameters values or
3783  create one with custom settings.
3784  */
3785  static ON_SubD* CreateFromMesh(
3786  const class ON_Mesh* level_zero_mesh,
3787  const class ON_SubDFromMeshParameters* from_mesh_parameters,
3788  ON_SubD* subd
3789  );
3790 
3791 public:
3792 #pragma region RH_C_SHARED_ENUM [ON_SubD::AutomaticMeshToSubDContext] [Rhino.Geometry.SubDAutomaticMeshToSubDContext] [byte]
3793  /// <summary>
3794  /// ON_SubD::AutomaticMeshToSubDContext indentifies a context where meshes can automatically
3795  /// be converted to subds.
3796  /// </summary>
3797  enum class AutomaticMeshToSubDContext : unsigned char
3798  {
3799  ///<summary>
3800  /// Indicates the context has not been initialized.
3801  ///</summary>
3802  Unset = 0,
3803 
3804  ///<summary>
3805  /// A mesh in a Rhino 5 3dm file that is a representation of a box mode T-spline.
3806  /// By default, these meshes are automatically converted to subds.
3807  ///</summary>
3808  Rhino5BoxModeTSpline = 1,
3809 
3810  ///<summary>
3811  /// A mesh in an FBX file that has nonzero values for either preview division levels or render division levels.
3812  /// Some FBX files created by Maya save subdivision objects as meshes with nonzero division level values.
3813  /// By default, FBX division levels are ignored.
3814  ///</summary>
3815  FBXMeshWithDivisionLevels = 2
3816  };
3817 #pragma endregion
3818 
3819  /*
3820  Returns:
3821  true if SubDs are automatically created when an ON_Mesh is found in the specified context.
3822  false otherwise.
3823  */
3824  static bool AutomaticMeshToSubD(
3825  ON_SubD::AutomaticMeshToSubDContext context
3826  );
3827 
3828  /*
3829  Parameters:
3830  context - [in]
3831  Situation where an ON_Mesh can automatically be converted into a subd.
3832  bAutomaticallyCreateSubD - [in]
3833  true if SubDs are automatically created when an ON_Mesh is found in the specified context.
3834  false otherwise.
3835  */
3836  static void SetAutomaticMeshToSubD(
3837  ON_SubD::AutomaticMeshToSubDContext context,
3838  bool bAutomaticallyCreateSubD
3839  );
3840 
3841  /*
3842  Parameters:
3843  context - [in]
3844  If context is ON_SubD::AutomaticMeshToSubDContext::Unset, all defaults will be restored.
3845  Otherwise, the default for the specific context will be restored.
3846  */
3847  static void AutomaticMeshToSubDRestoreDefaults(
3848  ON_SubD::AutomaticMeshToSubDContext context
3849  );
3850 
3851 private:
3852  static const bool AutomaticRhino5BoxModeTSplineToSubDDefault; // = true
3853  static const bool AutomaticFBXMeshWithDivisionLevelsToSubDDefault; // = false
3854  static bool AutomaticRhino5BoxModeTSplineToSubD; // current setting
3855  static bool AutomaticFBXMeshWithDivisionLevelsToSubD; // current setting
3856 
3857 private:
3858  static ON_SubD* Internal_CreateFromMeshWithValidNgons(
3859  const class ON_Mesh* level_zero_mesh_with_valid_ngons,
3860  const class ON_SubDFromMeshParameters* from_mesh_parameters,
3861  ON_SubD* subd
3862  );
3863 
3864 public:
3865 
3866  /*
3867  Description:
3868  Creates a SubD box
3869  Parameters:
3870  corners - [in]
3871  Box corners.
3872  The bottom quad is specified by the first 4 points
3873  and the top quad specified by the last 4 points.
3874  edge_tag - [in]
3875  If edge_tag = ON_SubDEdgeTag::Crease, then the box will have
3876  creases and corners. Otherwise the box will be smooth.
3877  facecount_x - [in] Number of faces in x direction
3878  facecount_y - [in] Number of faces in y direction
3879  facecount_z - [in] Number of faces in z direction
3880  destination_subd [out] -
3881  If destination_subd is not null, make the SubD box there
3882  Returns:
3883  Pointer to the resulting SubD if successful
3884  Null for error
3885  */
3886  static ON_SubD* CreateSubDBox(
3887  const ON_3dPoint corners[8],
3888  ON_SubDEdgeTag edge_tag,
3889  unsigned int facecount_x,
3890  unsigned int facecount_y,
3891  unsigned int facecount_z,
3892  ON_SubD* destination_subd
3893  );
3894 
3895  /*
3896  Description:
3897  Creates a SubD sphere with 24 quad faces
3898  Parameters:
3899  sphere - [in]
3900  Location, size and orientation of the sphere
3901  destination_subd [out] -
3902  If destination_subd is not null, make the SubD box there
3903  Returns:
3904  Pointer to the resulting SubD if successful
3905  Null for error
3906  */
3907  //static ON_SubD* CreateSubDSphere(
3908  // const ON_Sphere sphere,
3909  // ON_SubD* destination_subd);
3910 
3911  /*
3912  Description:
3913  Creates a SubD cylinder
3914  Parameters:
3915  box - [in]
3916  Location, size and orientation of the cylinder
3917  facecount_around - [in] Number of faces around the cylinder
3918  facecount_length - [in] Number of faces in the axis direction
3919  facecouont_z - [in] Number of faces in z direction
3920  destination_subd [out] -
3921  If destination_subd is not null, make the SubD box there
3922  Returns:
3923  Pointer to the resulting SubD if successful
3924  Null for error
3925  */
3926  //static ON_SubD* CreateSubDCylinder(
3927  // const ON_Cylinder& cylinder,
3928  // unsigned int facecount_around,
3929  // unsigned int facecount_length,
3930  // ON_SubD* destination_subd);
3931 
3932  /*
3933  Description:
3934  Creates a SubD cone
3935  Parameters:
3936  cone - [in]
3937  Location, size and orientation of the cone
3938  facecount_around - [in] Number of faces around the cone
3939  facecount_length - [in] Number of faces in the axis direction
3940  destination_subd [out] -
3941  If destination_subd is not null, make the SubD cone there
3942  Returns:
3943  Pointer to the resulting SubD if successful
3944  Null for error
3945  */
3946  //static ON_SubD* CreateSubDCone(
3947  // const ON_Cone& cone,
3948  // unsigned int facecount_around,
3949  // unsigned int facecount_length,
3950  // ON_SubD* destination_subd);
3951 
3952  /*
3953  Description:
3954  Creates a SubD truncated cone
3955  Parameters:
3956  cone - [in]
3957  Location, size and orientation of the cone
3958  truncate_param - [in] 0.0 < truncate_param <= 1.0
3959  Normalized parameter for truncation
3960  0.0: Base of cone
3961  1.0: Tip of cone
3962  facecount_around - [in] Number of faces around the cone
3963  facecount_length - [in] Number of faces in the axis direction
3964  destination_subd [out] -
3965  If destination_subd is not null, make the SubD cone there
3966  Returns:
3967  Pointer to the resulting SubD if successful
3968  Null for error
3969  */
3970  //static ON_SubD* CreateSubDTruncatedCone(
3971  // const ON_Cone& cone,
3972  // const double truncate_param,
3973  // unsigned int facecount_around,
3974  // unsigned int facecount_length,
3975  // ON_SubD* destination_subd);
3976 
3977  /*
3978  Description:
3979  Creates a SubD torus
3980  Parameters:
3981  torus - [in]
3982  Location, size and orientation of the torus
3983  major_facecount - [in] Number of faces around the major axis
3984  minor_facecount - [in] Number of faces around the minor axis
3985  destination_subd [out] -
3986  If destination_subd is not null, make the SubD torus there
3987  Returns:
3988  Pointer to the resulting SubD if successful
3989  Null for error
3990  */
3991  //static ON_SubD* CreaptSubDTorus(
3992  // ON_Torus& torus,
3993  // unsigned int major_facecount,
3994  // unsigned int minor_facecount,
3995  // ON_SubD* destination_subd);
3996 
3997  unsigned int DumpTopology(
3998  ON_TextLog&
3999  ) const;
4000 
4001  unsigned int DumpTopology(
4002  ON_2udex vertex_id_range,

4004  ON_2udex face_id_range,
4005  ON_TextLog&
4006  ) const;
4007 
4008  /*
4009  Description:
4010  Discard all contents of this ON_SubD.
4011  Remarks:
4012  More efficient than Destroy() if this ON_SubD will be reused soon.
4013  */
4014  void Clear();
4015 
4016  /*
4017  Description:
4018  Delete all contents release all memory used by this ON_SubD.
4019  */
4020  void Destroy();
4021 
4022  /*
4023  Returns:
4024  The number of explicitly computed levels that are currently available.
4025  A value of 0 indicates this SubD is empty.
4026  */
4027  unsigned int LevelCount() const;
4028 
4029  /*
4030  Returns:
4031  If the SubD is not empty, then the index of the active level is returned. This value will be < LevelCount().
4032  If the SubD is empty, then ON_UNSET_UINT_INDEX is returned.
4033  */
4034  unsigned int ActiveLevelIndex() const;
4035 
4036  /*
4037  Description:
4038  Remove subdivision levels
4039  Paramters:
4040  max_level_index - [in]
4041  Remove all levels after max_level_index
4042  Returns:
4043  Number of removed levels.
4044  */
4045  unsigned int ClearHigherSubdivisionLevels(
4046  unsigned int max_level_index
4047  );
4048 
4049  /*
4050  Description:
4051  Remove subdivision levels
4052  Paramters:
4053  min_level_index - [in]
4054  Remove all levels before min_level_index
4055  Returns:
4056  Number of removed levels.
4057  */
4058  unsigned int ClearLowerSubdivisionLevels(
4059  unsigned int min_level_index
4060  );
4061 
4062  /*
4063  Remove all levels except the active level.
4064  Returns:
4065  Number of removed levels.
4066  */
4067  unsigned ClearInactiveLevels();
4068 
4069  bool IsEmpty() const;
4070  bool IsNotEmpty() const;
4071

4073  /*
4074  Description:
4075  Get aggregate edge demographics for the subd.
4076  Returns:
4077  Bitwise or of ON_ComponentAttributes::EdgeAttributes values for every edge in the subd.
4078  */
4079  unsigned int AggregateEdgeAttributes() const;

4093  ) const;

4096  const ON_COMPONENT_INDEX* ci_list,
4097  size_t ci_count,
4098  bool bIncludeVertices,
4099  bool bIncludeEdges,
4100  bool bIncludeFaces,
4101  ON_SimpleArray<ON_SubDComponentPtr>& cptr_list
4102  ) const;

4104  /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
4105  //
4106  // Vertex access
4107  //
4108 
4109  unsigned int VertexCount() const;
4110 
4111  const class ON_SubDVertex* FirstVertex() const;
4112  const class ON_SubDVertex* LastVertex() const;
4113 
4114  /*
4115  Example:
4116  ON_SubDVertexIterator vit = subd.VertexIterator();
4117  for ( const ON_SubDVertex* v = vit.FirstVertex(); nullptr != v; v = vit.NextVertex())
4118  {
4119  ...
4120  }
4121  */
4122  class ON_SubDVertexIterator VertexIterator() const;
4123 
4124  /*
4125  Description:
4126  Avoid using this class. It is more efficient to use
4127  an ON_SubDVertexIterator returned by VertexIterator().
4128  */
4129  class ON_SubDVertexArray VertexArray() const;
4130 
4131  /*
4132  Parameters:
4133  vertex_id - [in]
4134  Returns:
4135  If vertex_id identifies a valid vertex in this ON_SubD, then
4136  a pointer to that vertex is returned.
4137  Otherwise, nullptr is returned.
4138  */
4139  const class ON_SubDVertex* VertexFromId(
4140  unsigned int vertex_id
4141  ) const;
4142 
4143  const class ON_SubDVertex* VertexFromComponentIndex(
4144  ON_COMPONENT_INDEX component_index
4145  ) const;
4146 
4147  /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
4148  //
4149  // Edge access
4150  //
4151 
4152  unsigned int EdgeCount() const;
4153 
4154  const class ON_SubDEdge* FirstEdge() const;
4155  const class ON_SubDEdge* LastEdge() const;
4156 
4157  /*
4158  Example:
4159  ON_SubDEdgeIterator eit = subd.EdgeIterator();
4160  for ( const ON_SubDEdge* e = eit.FirstEdge(); nullptr != e; e = eit.NextEdge())
4161  {
4162  ...
4163  }
4164  */
4165  class ON_SubDEdgeIterator EdgeIterator() const;
4166 
4167  /*
4168  Description:
4169  Avoid using this class. It is more efficient to use
4170  an ON_SubDEdgeIterator returned by EdgeIterator().
4171  */
4172  class ON_SubDEdgeArray EdgeArray() const;
4173 
4174  /*
4175  Parameters:
4176  edge_id - [in]
4177  Returns:
4178  If edge_id identifies a valid edge in this ON_SubD, then
4179  a pointer to that edge is returned.
4180  Otherwise, nullptr is returned.
4181  */
4182  const class ON_SubDEdge* EdgeFromId(
4183  unsigned int edge_id
4184  ) const;
4185 
4186  const class ON_SubDEdge* EdgeFromComponentIndex(
4187  ON_COMPONENT_INDEX component_index
4188  ) const;
4189 
4190  /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
4191  //
4192  // Face access
4193  //
4194 
4195  unsigned int FaceCount() const;
4196 
4197  const class ON_SubDFace* FirstFace() const;
4198  const class ON_SubDFace* LastFace() const;
4199 
4200  /*
4201  Example:
4202  ON_SubDFaceIterator fit = subd.FaceIterator();
4203  for ( const ON_SubDFace* f = fit.FirstFace(); nullptr != f; f = fit.NextFace())
4204  {
4205  ...
4206  }
4207  */
4208  class ON_SubDFaceIterator FaceIterator() const;
4209 
4210  /*
4211  Description:
4212  Avoid using this class. It is more efficient to use
4213  an ON_SubDFaceIterator returned by FaceIterator().
4214  */
4215  class ON_SubDFaceArray FaceArray() const;
4216 
4217  /*
4218  Parameters:
4219  face_id - [in]
4220  Returns:
4221  If face_id identifies a valid face in this ON_SubD, then
4222  a pointer to that face is returned.
4223  Otherwise, nullptr is returned.
4224  */
4225  const class ON_SubDFace* FaceFromId(
4226  unsigned int face_id
4227  ) const;
4228 
4229 
4230  const class ON_SubDFace* FaceFromComponentIndex(
4231  ON_COMPONENT_INDEX component_index
4232  ) const;
4233 
4234 
4235  /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
4236  //
4237  // Component (vertex, edge, face) state ( selected, highlighted, ... ) tools
4238  // NOTE:
4239  // All component status settings are mutable
4240  // All are copied.
4241  // None are saved.
4242  //
4243 
4244  /*
4245  Parameters:
4246  states_filter - [in]
4247  bAllEqualStates - [in]
4248  If a state is set in states_filter, all active level components
4249  with the same state set will be included in the
4250  components_with_set_states[] array.
4251  If bAllEqualStates is true, then ON_ComponentStatus::AllEqualStates()
4252  is used to test for inclusion.
4253  If bAllEqualStates is false, then ON_ComponentStatus::SomeEqualStates()
4254  is used to test for inclusion.
4255  components_with_set_states - [out]
4256  Returns:
4257  Number of returned components.
4258  */
4259  unsigned int GetComponentsWithSetStates(
4260  ON_ComponentStatus states_filter,
4261  bool bAllEqualStates,
4262  ON_SimpleArray< ON_SubDComponentPtr >& components_with_set_states
4263  ) const;
4264 
4265 
4266  /*
4267  Description:
4268  Set states on an individual component.
4269  Parameters:
4270  component_ptr - [in]
4271  The states will be set on this component.
4272  states_to_set - [in]
4273  If a state is set in the states_to_set parameter, the same
4274  state will be set on the component.
4275  Returns:
4276  0: no state settings changed on the component.
4277  1: some state setting changed on the component.
4278  */
4279  unsigned int SetComponentStates(
4280  ON_SubDComponentPtr component_ptr,
4281  ON_ComponentStatus states_to_set
4282  ) const;
4283 
4284  /*
4285  Description:
4286  Clear states on an individual component.
4287  Parameters:
4288  component_ptr - [in]
4289  The states will be cleared on this component.
4290  states_to_clear - [in]
4291  If a state is set in the states_to_clear parameter, the same
4292  state will be cleared on the component.
4293  Returns:
4294  0: no state settings changed on the component.
4295  1: some state setting changed on the component.
4296  */
4297  unsigned int ClearComponentStates(
4298  ON_SubDComponentPtr component_ptr,
4299  ON_ComponentStatus states_to_clear
4300  ) const;
4301 
4302  /*
4303  Description:
4304  Copy status settings to an individual component.
4305  Parameters:
4306  component_ptr - [in]
4307  The states will be copied to this component.
4308  status_to_copy - [in]
4309  Returns:
4310  1: some state settings changed on the component.
4311  1: some state setting changed on the component.
4312  */
4313  unsigned int SetComponentStatus(
4314  ON_SubDComponentPtr component_ptr,
4315  ON_ComponentStatus status_to_copy
4316  ) const;
4317 
4318  /*
4319  Description:
4320  Delete components in cptr_list[].
4321  If a vertex is in cptr_list[], the vertex and every edge and face attached
4322  to the vertex are deleted.
4323  If an edge is in cptr_list[], the edge and every face attached
4324  to the edge are deleted.
4325  If a face is in cptr_list[], the face is deleted.
4326  Parameters:
4327  cptr_list - [in]
4328  cptr_count - [in]
4329  length of cptr_list[] array.
4330  bMarkDeletedFaceEdges - [in]
4331  If true, surviving edges attached to delete faces
4332  have their runtmime mark set.
4333  Returns:
4334  1: some state settings changed on the component.
4335  1: some state setting changed on the component.
4336  */
4337  bool DeleteComponents(
4338  const ON_SubDComponentPtr* cptr_list,
4339  size_t cptr_count,
4340  bool bMarkDeletedFaceEdges
4341  );
4342 
4343  bool DeleteComponents(
4344  const ON_SimpleArray<ON_SubDComponentPtr>& cptr_list,
4345  bool bMarkDeletedFaceEdges
4346  );
4347 
4348  bool DeleteComponentsForExperts(
4349  const ON_SubDComponentPtr* cptr_list,
4350  size_t cptr_count,
4351  bool bDeleteIsolatedEdges,
4352  bool bUpdateTagsAndCoefficients,
4353  bool bMarkDeletedFaceEdges
4354  );
4355 
4356  /*
4357  Description:
4358  Delete marked components.
4359  Parameters:
4360  bDeleteMarkedComponents - [in]
4361  If true, marked components are deleted.
4362  If false, unmarked components are deleted.
4363  mark_bits - [in]
4364  A component is marked if component.m_status.IsMarked(mark_bits) is true.
4365  */
4366  bool DeleteMarkedComponents(
4367  bool bDeleteMarkedComponents,
4368  ON__UINT8 mark_bits,
4369  bool bMarkDeletedFaceEdges
4370  );
4371 
4372  /*
4373  Description:
4374  Delete marked components.
4375  Parameters:
4376  bDeleteMarkedComponents - [in]
4377  If true, marked components are deleted.
4378  If false, unmarked components are deleted.
4379  mark_bits - [in]
4380  A component is marked if component.m_status.IsMarked(mark_bits) is true.
4381  */
4382  bool DeleteMarkedComponentsForExperts(
4383  bool bDeleteMarkedComponents,
4384  ON__UINT8 mark_bits,
4385  bool bDeleteIsolatedEdges,
4386  bool bUpdateTagsAndCoefficients,
4387  bool bMarkDeletedFaceEdges
4388  );
4389 
4390 public:
4391  /*
4392  Description:
4393  Removes all per face material channel index overrides on the active level.
4394  Returns:
4395  Number of changed faces.
4396  Remarks:
4397  Per face material channel indices are a mutable property on ON_SubDFace and are set with ON_SubDFace.SetMaterialChannelIndex().
4398  */
4399  unsigned int ClearPerFaceMaterialChannelIndices();
4400 
4401  /*
4402  Returns:
4403  True if one or more faces on the active level have per face material channel index overrides.
4404  Remarks:
4405  Per face material channel indices are a mutable property on ON_SubDFace and are set with ON_SubDFace.SetMaterialChannelIndex().
4406  */
4407  bool HasPerFaceMaterialChannelIndices() const;
4408 
4409  /*
4410  Description:
4411  Removes all per face color overrides on the active level.
4412  Returns:
4413  Number of changed faces.
4414  Remarks:
4415  Per face colors are a mutable property on ON_SubDFace and are set with ON_SubDFace.SetPerFaceColor().
4416  */
4417  unsigned int ClearPerFaceColors() const;
4418 
4419  /*
4420  Returns:
4421  True if one or more faces on the active level have per face color overrides.
4422  Remarks:
4423  Per face colors are a mutable property on ON_SubDFace and are set with ON_SubDFace.SetPerFaceColor().
4424  */
4425  bool HasPerFaceColors() const;
4426 
4427  /*
4428  Description:
4429  If a face has a nonzero PackId(), then its per face color is set to ON_Color::RandomColor(f->PackId()).
4430  Otherwise, its per face color is cleared.
4431  */
4432  void SetPerFaceColorsFromPackId() const;
4433 
4434 #if defined(OPENNURBS_PLUS)
4435 public:
4436  ON_SubD* ExtractMarkedComponents(
4437  ON__UINT8 mark_bits,
4438  ON_SubD* destination_subd
4439  ) const;
4440 
4441 public:
4442  /*
4443  Description:
4444  Appends a copy of disjoint_subd to this.
4445  No conincidence checking or merging is performed.
4446 
4447  Parameters:
4448  disjoint_subd - [in]
4449  SubD to append to this.
4450 
4451  bMarkAddedComponents - [in]
4452  If true, then added components have RuntimeMark() set to true.
4453 
4454  bMarkOriginalComponents - [in]
4455  If true, then the original components have RuntimeMark() set to true.
4456 
4457  Returns:
4458  Number of components (vertices, edges, and faces) added to this.
4459 
4460  Remarks:
4461  Existing compenent marks on this are erased. Then bMarkMergedComponents and
4462  bMarkAddedComponents determine which components get marked.
4463  */
4464  unsigned int AppendDisjoint(
4465  const ON_SubD& disjoint_subd,
4466  bool bMarkOriginalComponents,
4467  bool bMarkAddedComponents
4468  );
4469 
4470  unsigned int AppendDisjoint(
4471  const ON_SubD& disjoint_subd,
4472  bool bMarkOriginalComponents,
4473  bool bMarkAddedComponents,
4474  ON_SimpleArray<ON_SubDComponentPtrPair>* merge_map
4475  );
4476 
4477 
4478 public:
4479  /*
4480  Description:
4481  Appends a copy of subd to this and updates
4482  Coincident vertices and edges are merged.
4483 
4484  Parameters:
4485  subd - [in]
4486  SubD to append to this.
4487 
4488  tolerance - [in]
4489  When in doubt, pass 0.
4490  Distance tolerance used to consider which vertices in to merge.
4491 
4492  prefered_merged_edge_tag - [in]
4493  If set, merged edges that have two faces will be assigned this tag.
4494 
4495  bMergeAllCoincidentVertices - [in]
4496  When in doubt, pass false.
4497  If true, all coincident vertices will be merged.
4498  If false, only conincident corner vertices and conindident crease edges with at
4499  most one face will be merged.
4500 
4501  bMarkMergedComponents - [in]
4502  If true, then merged components have RuntimeMark() set to true.
4503 
4504  bMarkAddedComponents - [in]
4505  If true, then added components have RuntimeMark() set to true.
4506 
4507  Returns:
4508  Number of components (vertices, edges, and faces) added to this.
4509 
4510  Remarks:
4511  Existing compenent marks on this are erased. Then bMarkMergedComponents and
4512  bMarkAddedComponents determine which components get marked.
4513  */
4514  unsigned int Append(
4515  const ON_SubD& subd,
4516  double tolerance,
4517  ON_SubDEdgeTag prefered_merged_edge_tag,
4518  bool bMergeAllCoincidentVertices,
4519  bool bMarkMergedComponents,
4520  bool bMarkAddedComponents
4521  );
4522 
4523  /*
4524  Description:
4525  Appends a copy of subd to this and updates
4526  Coincident vertices and edges are merged.
4527 
4528  Parameters:
4529  subd - [in]
4530  SubD to append to this.
4531 
4532  tolerance - [in]
4533  When in doubt, pass 0.
4534  Distance tolerance used to consider which vertices in to merge.
4535 
4536  prefered_merged_edge_tag - [in]
4537  If set, merged edges that have two faces will be assigned this tag.
4538 
4539  bMergeAllCoincidentVertices - [in]
4540  When in doubt, pass false.
4541  If true, all coincident vertices will be merged.
4542  If false, only conincident corner vertices and conindident crease edges with at
4543  most one face will be merged.
4544 
4545  bMarkMergedComponents - [in]
4546  If true, then merged components have RuntimeMark() set to true.
4547 
4548  bMarkAddedComponents - [in]
4549  If true, then added components have RuntimeMark() set to true.
4550 
4551  bPermitDisjointAppend - [in]
4552  If true, subd is always appended.
4553  If false, subd is appended only when there are vertices that can be merged.
4554 
4555  merge_map - [out]
4556  If not nullptr, merge_map[] is a list of
4557  (vertex in this,vertex from subd)
4558  pairs.
4559 
4560  Returns:
4561  Number of components (vertices, edges, and faces) added to this.
4562 
4563  Remarks:
4564  Existing compenent marks on this are erased. Then bMarkMergedComponents and
4565  bMarkAddedComponents determine which components get marked.
4566  */
4567  unsigned int Append(
4568  const ON_SubD& subd,
4569  double tolerance,
4570  ON_SubDEdgeTag prefered_merged_edge_tag,
4571  bool bMergeAllCoincidentVertices,
4572  bool bMarkMergedComponents,
4573  bool bMarkAddedComponents,
4574  bool bPermitDisjointAppend,
4575  ON_SimpleArray<ON_SubDComponentPtrPair>* merge_map
4576  );
4577 
4578 public:
4579  /*
4580  Description:
4581  Merge a copy of subd into this.
4582 
4583  Parameters:
4584  subd - [in]
4585  SubD to append to this.
4586 
4587  vertex_pairs - [in]
4588  Pairs of vertices to to merge. The first pair component (vertex_pairs[i][0])
4589  must be a vertex in this and the second pair component (vertex_pairs[i][1])
4590  must be the corresponding vertex in subd.
4591  Vertices in subd that are not identified in vertex_pairs[] will be added
4592  to this as new vertices.
4593  When possible, invalid elements in vertex_pairs[] are silently ignored, but
4594  garbage in will often result in garbage out.
4595 
4596  prefered_merged_edge_tag - [in]
4597  If set, merged edges that have two faces will be assigned this tag.
4598 
4599  bMergeAllCoincidentVertices - [in]
4600  When in doubt, pass false.
4601  If true, all coincident vertices will be merged.
4602  If false, only conincident corner vertices and conindident crease edges with at
4603  most one face will be merged.
4604 
4605  bMarkMergedComponents - [in]
4606  If true, then merged components have RuntimeMark() set to true.
4607 
4608  bMarkAddedComponents - [in]
4609  If true, then added components have RuntimeMark() set to true.
4610 
4611  Returns:
4612  Number of components (vertices, edges, and faces) added to this.
4613 
4614  Remarks:
4615  Existing compenent marks on this are erased. Then bMarkMergedComponents and
4616  bMarkAddedComponents determine which components get marked.
4617  */
4618  unsigned int Merge(
4619  const ON_SubD& subd,
4620  const ON_SimpleArray<ON_SubDComponentPtrPair>& vertex_pairs,
4621  ON_SubDEdgeTag prefered_merged_edge_tag,
4622  bool bMergeAllCoincidentVertices,
4623  bool bMarkMergedComponents,
4624  bool bMarkAddedComponents
4625  );
4626 
4627 public:
4628  /*
4629  Description:
4630  Merge a copy of subd into this.
4631  Parameters:
4632 
4633  Parameters:
4634  subd - [in]
4635  SubD to append to this.
4636 
4637  vertex_pairs_count - [in]
4638  vertex_pairs - [in]
4639  Pairs of vertices to to merge. The first pair component (vertex_pairs[i][0])
4640  must be a vertex in this and the second pair component (vertex_pairs[i][1])
4641  must be the corresponding vertex in subd.
4642  Vertices in subd that are not identified in vertex_pairs[] will be added
4643  to this as new vertices.
4644  When possible, invalid elements in vertex_pairs[] are silently ignored, but
4645  garbage in will often result in garbage out.
4646 
4647  prefered_merged_edge_tag - [in]
4648  If set, merged edges that have two faces will be assigned this tag.
4649 
4650  bMergeAllCoincidentVertices - [in]
4651  When in doubt, pass false.
4652  If true, all coincident vertices will be merged.
4653  If false, only conincident corner vertices and conindident crease edges with at
4654  most one face will be merged.
4655 
4656  bMarkMergedComponents - [in]
4657  If true, then merged components have RuntimeMark() set to true.
4658 
4659  bMarkAddedComponents - [in]
4660  If true, then added components have RuntimeMark() set to true.
4661 
4662  Returns:
4663  Number of components (vertices, edges, and faces) added to this.
4664 
4665  Remarks:
4666  Existing compenent marks on this are erased. Then bMarkMergedComponents and
4667  bMarkAddedComponents determine which components get marked.
4668  */
4669  unsigned int Merge(
4670  const ON_SubD& subd,
4671  const class ON_SubDComponentPtrPair* vertex_pairs,
4672  size_t vertex_pairs_count,
4673  ON_SubDEdgeTag prefered_merged_edge_tag,
4674  bool bMergeAllCoincidentVertices,
4675  bool bMarkMergedComponents,
4676  bool bMarkAddedComponents
4677  );
4678 #endif
4679 
4680  /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
4681  //
4682  // Topology Queries
4683  //
4684 
4685  /*
4686  Description:
4687  Determine solid orientation of the active level.
4688  Returns:
4689  +2 subd is a solid but orientation cannot be computed
4690  +1 subd is a solid with outward facing normals
4691  -1 subd is a solid with inward facing normals
4692  0 subd is not a solid
4693  See Also:
4694  ON_SubD::IsSolid
4695  */
4696  int SolidOrientation() const;
4697 
4698  /*
4699  Description:
4700  Test subd to see if the active level is a solid.
4701  A "solid" is a closed oriented manifold.
4702  Returns:
4703  true subd is a solid
4704  fals subd is not a solid
4705  See Also:
4706  ON_SubDp::SolidOrientation
4707  ON_SubDp::IsManifold
4708  */
4709  bool IsSolid() const;
4710 
4711  /*
4712  Description:
4713  Test subd to see if the active level is an oriented manifold.
4714  Parameters:
4715  bIsOriented - [out]
4716  True if every edge that has two faces is oriented.
4717  Note that non-manifold edges are ignored.
4718  bHasBoundary - [in]
4719  True if there is at least one edge with a single face.
4720  Returns:
4721  True if the subd is a manifold (has at lease one face and every edge has 1 or 2 faces).
4722  False if the subd is not a manifold (has no faces or at least one edge with 0 or 3 or more faces)
4723  See Also:
4724  ON_SubDp::IsSolid
4725  */
4726  bool IsManifold(
4727  bool& bIsOriented,
4728  bool& bHasBoundary
4729  ) const;
4730 
4731  bool IsManifold() const;
4732 
4733 
4734 #if defined(OPENNURBS_PLUS)
4735  /*
4736  Parameters:
4737  minimum_face_count - [in]
4738  maximum_face_count - [in]
4739  Only edges with
4740  edge->FaceCount() >= minimum_face_count
4741  and edge->FaceCount() <= maximum_face_count
4742  will be converted into curves.
4743  Pass 0, ON_SubDEdge::MaximumFaceCount if you want all possible boundary edge chains.
4744  boundary_edge_chains - [out]
4745  The boundary_edge_chains[] array is sorted into edge chains.
4746  Returns:
4747  Number of chains embedded in boundary_edge_chains[]
4748  */
4749  unsigned int GetBoundaryEdgeChains(
4750  unsigned int minimum_face_count,
4751  unsigned int maximum_face_count,
4752  ON_SimpleArray<ON_SubDEdgePtr>& boundary_edge_chains
4753  ) const;
4754 #endif
4755 
4756  /*
4757  Description:
4758  Automatically get a boundary from a seed edge.
4759  Parameters:
4760  first_edge - [in]
4761  An edge with FaceCount() <= 1.
4762  The search for the second edge occurs and first_edge.RelativeVertex(1)
4763  and all edges added to boundary_edge_chain[] have FaceCount() = first_edge.Edge()->FaceCount().
4764  bUseEdgeMarks -[in]
4765  If true, only unmarked edges will be added to boundary_edge_chain[]
4766  and they will be marked when added to boundary_edge_chain[].
4767  boundary_edge_chain - [out]
4768  Edge chain beginning with first_edge.
4769  When true is returned, boundary_edge_chain[] has 3 or more edges and is a closed loop.
4770  When false is returned, boundary_edge_chain[] will contain an open chain with 0 or more edges.
4771  Returns:
4772  true if boundary_edge_chain[] is a closed loop of 3 or more boundary edges.
4773  */
4774  static bool GetBoundaryEdgeChain(
4775  ON_SubDEdgePtr first_edge,
4776  bool bUseEdgeMarks,
4777  ON_SimpleArray< ON_SubDEdgePtr >& boundary_edge_chain
4778  );
4779 
4780  /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
4781  //
4782  // Editing tools
4783  //
4784 
4785  unsigned int MergeColinearEdges(
4786  bool bMergeBoundaryEdges,
4787  bool bMergeInteriorCreaseEdges,
4788  bool bMergeInteriorSmoothEdges,
4789  double distance_tolerance,
4790  double maximum_aspect,
4791  double sin_angle_tolerance
4792  );
4793 
4794  /*
4795  Description:
4796  Merge consecutive edges into a single edge.
4797  eptr0 - [in]
4798  first edge (will not be deleted)
4799  eptr1 - [in]
4800  second edge (will be deleted if edges can be merged)
4801  Returns:
4802  Merged edge (eptr0) or ON_SubDEdgePtr::Null if edges could not be merged
4803  */
4804  ON_SubDEdgePtr MergeConsecutiveEdges(
4805  ON_SubDEdgePtr eptr0,
4806  ON_SubDEdgePtr eptr1
4807  );
4808 
4809  /*
4810  Returns:
4811  True if eptr0.RelativeVetex(1) == eptr1.RelativeVetex(0) and both edges
4812  have the same set of faces.
4813  */
4814  static bool EdgesAreConsecutive(
4815  ON_SubDEdgePtr eptr0,
4816  ON_SubDEdgePtr eptr1
4817  );
4818 
4819  // returns true if all facets are consistently oriented
4820  bool IsOriented() const;
4821 
4822  // reverses the orientation of all facets
4823  bool ReverseOrientation() const;
4824 
4825  // Attempts to orient all facet to match the first facet.
4826  bool Orient() const;
4827 
4828  /*
4829  Description:
4830  Split and edge.
4831  The input edge is modifed to terminate at the input vertex.
4832  The new edge begins at the input vertex and ends at the final vertex
4833  of the original input edge.
4834  edge - [in]
4835  edge to split.
4836  vertex_location - [in]
4837  location of inserted vertex.
4838  If vertex_location == ON_ON_3dPoint::UnsetPoint,
4839  then the edge's midpoint is used.
4840  Returns:
4841  A pointer to the new edge or nullptr if the input is not valid.
4842  Remarks:
4843  After all editing operations are completed, you must call this->UpdateEdgeSectorCoefficients(true) before
4844  evaluation.
4845  */
4846  const class ON_SubDEdge* SplitEdge(
4847  class ON_SubDEdge* edge,
4848  ON_3dPoint vertex_location
4849  );
4850 
4851  /*
4852  Description:
4853  Split a face into two faces by inserting and edge connecting the
4854  specified vertices.
4855  Parameters:
4856  face - [in]
4857  A face with at least four edges.
4858  fvi0 - [in]
4859  fvi1 - [in]
4860  Indices of the inserted edge ends.
4861  Returns:
4862  A pointer to the inserted edge.
4863  The inserted edge runs from face->Vertex(fvi0) to face->Vertex(fvi1).
4864  ON_SubDEdge.Face(0) is the original face and ON_SubDEdge::Face(1) is
4865  the added face.
4866  The first edge of both faces is the inserted edge.
4867  */
4868  const class ON_SubDEdge* SplitFace(
4869  class ON_SubDFace* face,
4870  unsigned int fvi0,
4871  unsigned int fvi1
4872  );
4873 
4874  /*
4875  Description:
4876  Split a face into two faces by inserting and edge connecting the
4877  specified vertices.
4878  Parameters:
4879  face - [in]
4880  A face with at least four edges.
4881  v0 - [in]
4882  v1 - [in]
4883  Vertices on the face boundary.
4884  Returns:
4885  A pointer to the inserted edge.
4886  The inserted edge runs from v0 to v1.
4887  ON_SubDEdge.Face(0) is the original face and ON_SubDEdge::Face(1) is
4888  the added face.
4889  The first edge of the input face remains the first edge of face.
4890  The inserted edge is the first edge of the added face.
4891  */
4892  const class ON_SubDEdge* SplitFace(
4893  class ON_SubDFace* face,
4894  const class ON_SubDVertex* v0,
4895  const class ON_SubDVertex* v1
4896  );
4897 
4898  /*
4899  Description:
4900  Replace a face with a triangle fan by adding a single new vertex at fan_center_point
4901  and adding tringle made from the face's edes to the center point.
4902  Parameters:
4903  face - [in]
4904  This face is replaced with a triangle fan and becomes the first triangle in the fan.
4905  fan_center_point - [in]
4906  If valid, this point is used as the fan's center.
4907  Otherwise the centriod of the face's vertices is used s the fan's center.
4908  When in doubt, pass ON_3dPoint::UnsetPoint.
4909  bMarkFaces - [in]
4910  If true, face and new triangles are marked.
4911  Existing marks are not modified.
4912  Returns:
4913  If successfull, the new vertex at the center of the triangle fan.
4914  Otherwise, nullptr is returned.
4915  */
4916  const class ON_SubDVertex* ReplaceFaceWithTriangleFan(
4917  class ON_SubDFace* face,
4918  ON_3dPoint fan_center_point,
4919  bool bMarkFaces
4920  );
4921 
4922 #if defined(OPENNURBS_PLUS)
4923  /*
4924  Description:
4925  Replace a face by trangulating its boundary into with (face->EdgeCount()-2) triangles.
4926  No new vertices are added.
4927  Parameters:
4928  face - [in]
4929  This face is replaced with a trianglulation of its boundary and
4930  becomes the first triangle in the triangulation.
4931  triangluation_plane_normal - [in]
4932  If valid and nonzero, this vector is used as the normal of the plane
4933  for calculating the boundary triangulation. Othewise, the plane normal
4934  is calculated from the boundary vertices.
4935  When in doubt, pass ON_3dVector::ZeroVector.
4936  bMarkFaces - [in]
4937  If true, face and new triangles are marked.
4938  Existing marks are not modified.
4939  Returns:
4940  Number of triangles.
4941  */
4942  unsigned int ReplaceFaceWithTrianglation(
4943  class ON_SubDFace* face,
4944  ON_3dVector triangluation_plane_normal,
4945  bool bMarkFaces
4946  );
4947 #endif
4948 
4949 #if defined(OPENNURBS_PLUS)
4950  /*
4951  Description:
4952  Merge the faces attached to a vertex into a single face.
4953  Parameters:
4954  vertex - [in]
4955  An vertex with no nonmanifold edges and that has zero or two boundary edges.
4956  Returns:
4957  A pointer to the merged face or nullptr if the input was not valid.
4958  */
4959  const class ON_SubDFace* MergeFaces(
4960  const class ON_SubDVertex* vertex
4961  );
4962 
4963  /*
4964  Description:
4965  Merge the edge's faces into a single face.
4966  Parameters:
4967  edge - [in]
4968  An edge with two attached faces.
4969  Returns:
4970  A pointer to the merged face or nullptr if the input was not valid.
4971  */
4972  const class ON_SubDFace* MergeFaces(
4973  const class ON_SubDEdge* edge
4974  );
4975 
4976  /*
4977  Description:
4978  Merge a set of faces into a single face.
4979  Parameters:
4980  face_list - [in]
4981  A list of faces that can be merged into a single face.
4982  bFaceListMayBeInvalid - [in]
4983  True indicates that it is possible the set of faces in face_list may
4984  not be contiguous with a single boundary component.
4985  Returns:
4986  A pointer to the merged face or nullptr if the input was not valid.
4987  */
4988  const class ON_SubDFace* MergeFaces(
4989  ON_SubDFace const *const* face_list,
4990  size_t face_count,
4991  bool bFaceListMayBeInvalid
4992  );
4993 
4994  /*
4995  Description:
4996  Merge a set of faces into a single face.
4997  Parameters:
4998  face_list - [in]
4999  A list of faces that can be merged into a single face.
5000  bFaceListMayBeInvalid - [in]
5001  True indicates that it is possible the set of faces in face_list may
5002  not be contiguous with a single boundary component.
5003  Returns:
5004  A pointer to the merged face or nullptr if the input was not valid.
5005  */
5006  const class ON_SubDFace* MergeFaces(
5007  const ON_SimpleArray<const ON_SubDFace*>& face_list,
5008  bool bFaceListMayBeInvalid
5009  );
5010 
5011  /*
5012  Description:
5013  Merge a set of faces into a single face.
5014  Parameters:
5015  face_list - [in]
5016  A list of faces that can be merged into a single face.
5017  size_t face_count - [in]
5018  bFaceListMayBeInvalid - [in]
5019  True indicates that it is possible the set of faces in face_list may
5020  not be contiguous with a single boundary component.
5021  Returns:
5022  A pointer to the merged face or nullptr if the input was not valid.
5023  */
5024  const class ON_SubDFace* MergeFaces(
5025  const ON_SubDFacePtr* face_list,
5026  size_t face_count,
5027  bool bFaceListMayBeInvalid
5028  );
5029 
5030  /*
5031  Description:
5032  The collection of faces in face_list[] is partitioned into subsets that
5033  can be merged into a single face.
5034  Parameters:
5035  face_list - [in]
5036  A list of faces.
5037  Returns:
5038  Number of merged faces, all of which have m_status.RuntimeMark() set to true.
5039  */
5040  unsigned int MergeFaceSets(
5041  const ON_SimpleArray<const ON_SubDFace*>& face_list
5042  );
5043 
5044  /*
5045  Description:
5046  The collection of components in faces in cptr_list[] is used to
5047  generate subsets or faces that can be merged into a single face.
5048  Parameters:
5049  ci_list - [in]
5050  A list of components.
