5051  bMergeSharedEdges - [in]
5052  When in doubt, pass true.
5053  If true, contiguous edges on the boundary of a merged face will
5054  be merged into a single edge when possible.
5055  Returns:
5056  Number of merged faces, all of which have m_status.RuntimeMark() set to true.
5057  Remarks:
5058  If an edge in cptr_list[] is part of a boundary of a face in cptr_list[],
5059  then that edge is ignored.
5060  If an vertex in cptr_list[] is attached to a face in cptr_list[] or attached
5061  to a face that is attached to an edge in cptr_list[], then that vertex is ignored.
5062  */
5063  unsigned int MergeFaceSets(
5064  const ON_SimpleArray<ON_COMPONENT_INDEX>& ci_list,
5065  bool bMergeSharedEdges
5066  );
5067 
5068  /*
5069  Description:
5070  The collection of components in faces in cptr_list[] is used to
5071  generate subsets or faces that can be merged into a single face.
5072  Parameters:
5073  cptr_list - [in]
5074  A list of components.
5075  bMergeSharedEdges - [in]
5076  When in doubt, pass true.
5077  If true, contiguous edges on the boundary of a merged face will
5078  be merged into a single edge when possible.
5079  Returns:
5080  Number of merged faces, all of which have m_status.RuntimeMark() set to true.
5081  Remarks:
5082  If an edge in cptr_list[] is part of a boundary of a face in cptr_list[],
5083  then that edge is ignored.
5084  If an vertex in cptr_list[] is attached to a face in cptr_list[] or attached
5085  to a face that is attached to an edge in cptr_list[], then that vertex is ignored.
5086  */
5087  unsigned int MergeFaceSets(
5088  const ON_SimpleArray<ON_SubDComponentPtr>& cptr_list,
5089  bool bMergeSharedEdges
5090  );
5091 
5092  /*
5093  Description:
5094  The collection of components in faces in cptr_list[] is used to
5095  generate subsets or faces that can be merged into a single face.
5096  Parameters:
5097  cptr_list - [in]
5098  A list of components.
5099  cptr_count - [in]
5100  number of components
5101  bMergeSharedEdges - [in]
5102  When in doubt, pass true.
5103  If true, contiguous edges on the boundary of a merged face will
5104  be merged into a single edge when possible.
5105  Returns:
5106  Number of merged faces, all of which have m_status.RuntimeMark() set to true.
5107  Remarks:
5108  If an edge in cptr_list[] is part of a boundary of a face in cptr_list[],
5109  then that edge is ignored.
5110  If an vertex in cptr_list[] is attached to a face in cptr_list[] or attached
5111  to a face that is attached to an edge in cptr_list[], then that vertex is ignored.
5112  */
5113  unsigned int MergeFaceSets(
5114  const ON_SubDComponentPtr* cptr_list,
5115  size_t cptr_count,
5116  bool bMergeSharedEdges
5117  );
5118 
5119  /*
5120  Description:
5121  Use MergeFaceSets to dissolve edges and vertices and use DeleteComponents
5122  to delete faces.
5123  Parameters:
5124  ci_list - [in]
5125  Vertices, edges, and faces.
5126  Returns:
5127  Number of merged faces created by dissolving edges and vertices.
5128  */
5129  unsigned int DissolveOrDelete(
5130  const ON_SimpleArray<ON_COMPONENT_INDEX>& ci_list
5131  );
5132 
5133  /*
5134  Description:
5135  Use MergeFaceSets to dissolve edges and vertices and use DeleteComponents
5136  to delete faces.
5137  Parameters:
5138  cptr_list - [in]
5139  Vertices, edges, and faces.
5140  Returns:
5141  Number of merged faces created by dissolving edges and vertices.
5142  Runtime mark is set on merged faces and edges that were a boundary
5143  of a deleted face.
5144  */
5145  unsigned int DissolveOrDelete(
5146  const ON_SimpleArray<ON_SubDComponentPtr>& cptr_list
5147  );
5148 
5149  /*
5150  Description:
5151  Remove all zero length edges.
5152  When an edge is removed, the edge vertex with the smallest id survives.
5153  Returns:
5154  Number of edges that were removed.
5155  Remarks:
5156  If a faces end up with < 3 edges, they are removed as well.
5157  */
5158  unsigned int RemoveZeroLengthEdges();
5159 
5160 #endif
5161 
5162  /*
5163  Description:
5164  When finished editing a SubD, call this function to delete all cached evaluation
5165  values and update all vertex tag, edge tags, edge sector coefficients.
5166  Remarks:
5167  This function is the most reliable (and heavy handed) way to update SubD component
5168  information. Expert users can choose to be more selective when certain about
5169  exactly what needs to be modified.
5170  */
5171  void SubDModifiedNofification();
5172 
5173 
5174  /*
5175  Description:
5176  Updates vertex tag, edge tag, and edge coefficient values
5177  on the active level.
5178 
5179  After completing custom editing operations that modify the
5180  topology of the SubD control net or changing values of
5181  vertex or edge tags, the tag and sector coefficients
5182  information on nearby components in the edited areas
5183  need to be updated.
5184 
5185  Parameters:
5186  bUnsetValuesOnly - [in]
5187  If true, the update is restricted to vertices tagged as
5188  ON_SubDVertexTag::Unset and edges tagged as ON_SubDEdgeTag::Unset.
5189 
5190  Returns:
5191  Number of vertices and edges that were changed during the update.
5192  */
5193  unsigned int UpdateAllTagsAndSectorCoefficients(
5194  bool bUnsetValuesOnly
5195  );
5196 
5197  /*
5198  Description:
5199  This tool if for expert users writing advanced editing tools.
5200  After completing custom editing operations that modify the
5201  topology of the SubD control net or changing values of
5202  vertex or edge tags, the tag and sector coefficients
5203  information on nearby components in the edited areas
5204  need to be updated.
5205  Parameters:
5206  bUnsetTagsOnly - [in]
5207  If bUnsetTagsOnly is true, then only unset tags and
5208  ill be updated.
5209  If bUnsetTagsOnly is false, then all tags and
5210  will be checked and updated as needed.
5211  Returns:
5212  Number of vertices that changed during the update.
5213  Remarks:
5214  It is easiest to call UpdateAllTagsAndSectorCoefficients().
5215  */
5216  unsigned int UpdateVertexTags(
5217  bool bUnsetVertexTagsOnly
5218  );
5219 
5220  /*
5221  Description:
5222  This tool if for expert users writing advanced editing tools.
5223  After completing custom editing operations that modify the
5224  topology of the SubD control net or changing values of
5225  vertex or edge tags, the tag and sector coefficients
5226  information on nearby components in the edited areas
5227  need to be updated.
5228  Parameters:
5229  bUnsetValuesOnly - [in]
5230  If bUnsetValuesOnly is true, then only unset tags and
5231  sector weights will be updated.
5232  If bUnsetValuesOnly is false, then all tags and
5233  sector weights will be checked and updated as needed.
5234  Returns:
5235  Number of edges that had a tag value changed or sector
5236  coefficient set to ON_SubDSectorType::UnsetSectorCoefficient.
5237  Remarks:
5238  It is easiest to call UpdateAllTagsAndSectorCoefficients().
5239  */
5240  unsigned int UpdateEdgeTags(
5241  bool bUnsetEdgeTagsOnly
5242  );
5243 
5244  /*
5245  Description:
5246  This tool if for expert users writing advanced editing tools.
5247  After completing custom editing operations that modify the
5248  topology of the SubD control net or changing values of
5249  vertex or edge tags, the tag and sector coefficients
5250  information on nearby components in the edited areas
5251  need to be updated.
5252  Parameters:
5253  bUnsetValuesOnly - [in]
5254  If bUnsetValuesOnly is true, then only unset tags and
5255  sector weights will be updated.
5256  If bUnsetValuesOnly is false, then all tags and
5257  sector weights will be checked and updated as needed.
5258  Returns:
5259  Number of edges that had a tag value changed or sector
5260  coefficient set to ON_SubDSectorType::UnsetSectorCoefficient.
5261  Remarks:
5262  It is easiest to call UpdateAllTagsAndSectorCoefficients().
5263  */
5264  unsigned int UpdateEdgeSectorCoefficients(
5265  bool bUnsetSectorCoefficientsOnly
5266  ) const;
5267 
5268 
5269  /*
5270  Descripiton:
5271  Sets the m_group_id value to 0 for every vertex, edge and face.
5272  Returns:
5273  Number of marks that were cleared.
5274  */
5275  unsigned int ClearGroupIds() const;
5276 
5277  /*
5278  Descripiton:
5279  Sets the m_group_id value to 0 for every vertex.
5280  Returns:
5281  Number of group id values that were changed.
5282  */
5283  unsigned int ClearVertexGroupIds() const;
5284 
5285  /*
5286  Descripiton:
5287  Sets the m_group_id value to 0 for every edge.
5288  Returns:
5289  Number of group id values that were changed.
5290  */
5291  unsigned int ClearEdgeGroupIds() const;
5292 
5293  /*
5294  Descripiton:
5295  Sets the m_group_id value to 0 for every face.
5296  Returns:
5297  Number of group id values that were changed.
5298  */
5299  unsigned int ClearFaceGroupIds() const;
5300 
5301  /*
5302  Descripiton:
5303  Sets the m_group_id value to 0 for the specified components.
5304  Parameters:
5305  bClearVertexGroupIds - [in]
5306  If true, m_group_id for every vertex is set to zero.
5307  bClearEdgeGroupIds - [in]
5308  If true, m_group_id for every edge is set to zero.
5309  bClearFaceGroupIds - [in]
5310  If true, m_group_id for every face is set to zero.
5311  Returns:
5312  Number of group id values that were changed.
5313  */
5314  unsigned int ClearComponentGroupIds(
5315  bool bClearVertexGroupIds,
5316  bool bClearEdgeGroupIds,
5317  bool bClearFaceGroupIds
5318  ) const;
5319 
5320 
5321  /*
5322  Descripiton:
5323  Sets the m_status.MarkBits() value to 0 for every vertex, edge and face.
5324  Returns:
5325  Number of marks that were cleared.
5326  */
5327  unsigned int ClearMarkBits() const;
5328 
5329  /*
5330  Descripiton:
5331  Sets the m_status.MarkBits() value to 0 for every vertex.
5332  Returns:
5333  Number of group id values that were changed.
5334  */
5335  unsigned int ClearVertexMarkBits() const;
5336 
5337  /*
5338  Descripiton:
5339  Sets the m_status.MarkBits() value to 0 for every edge.
5340  Returns:
5341  Number of group id values that were changed.
5342  */
5343  unsigned int ClearEdgeMarkBits() const;
5344 
5345  /*
5346  Descripiton:
5347  Sets the m_status.MarkBits() value to 0 for every face.
5348  Returns:
5349  Number of group id values that were changed.
5350  */
5351  unsigned int ClearFaceMarkBits() const;
5352 
5353  /*
5354  Descripiton:
5355  Sets the m_status.MarkBits() value to 0 for the specified components.
5356  Parameters:
5357  bClearVertexMarkBits - [in]
5358  If true, m_status.MarkBits() for every vertex is set to zero.
5359  bClearEdgeMarkBits - [in]
5360  If true, m_status.MarkBits() for every edge is set to zero.
5361  bClearFaceMarkBits - [in]
5362  If true, m_status.MarkBits() for every face is set to zero.
5363  Returns:
5364  Number of group id values that were changed.
5365  */
5366  unsigned int ClearComponentMarkBits(
5367  bool bClearVertexMarkBits,
5368  bool bClearEdgeMarkBits,
5369  bool bClearFaceMarkBits
5370  ) const;
5371 
5372  /*
5373  Descripiton:
5374  Clears the m_status.RuntimeMark() for every vertex, edge and face.
5375  Returns:
5376  Number of marks that were cleared.
5377  */
5378  unsigned int ClearComponentMarks() const;
5379 
5380  /*
5381  Descripiton:
5382  Clears the m_status.RuntimeMark() for every vertex.
5383  Returns:
5384  Number of marks that were cleared.
5385  */
5386  unsigned int ClearVertexMarks() const;
5387 
5388  /*
5389  Descripiton:
5390  Clears the m_status.RuntimeMark() for every edge.
5391  Returns:
5392  Number of marks that were cleared.
5393  */
5394  unsigned int ClearEdgeMarks() const;
5395 
5396  /*
5397  Descripiton:
5398  Clears the m_status.RuntimeMark() for every face.
5399  Returns:
5400  Number of marks that were cleared.
5401  */
5402  unsigned int ClearFaceMarks() const;
5403 
5404  /*
5405  Descripiton:
5406  Selectively clear m_status.RuntimeMark()
5407  Parameters:
5408  bClearVertexMarks - [in]
5409  If true, m_status.ClearRuntimeMark() is called for every vertex.
5410  bClearEdgeMarks - [in]
5411  If true, m_status.ClearRuntimeMark() is called for every edge.
5412  bClearFaceMarks - [in]
5413  If true, m_status.ClearRuntimeMark() is called for every face.
5414  marked_component_list - [out]
5415  If not nullptr, then pointer to components that were marked
5416  are returned in this marked_component_list[]
5417  Returns:
5418  Number of marks that were cleared.
5419  */
5420  unsigned int ClearComponentMarks(
5421  bool bClearVertexMarks,
5422  bool bClearEdgeMarks,
5423  bool bClearFaceMarks,
5424  ON_SimpleArray< const class ON_SubDComponentBase* >* marked_component_list
5425  ) const;
5426 
5427  unsigned int SetComponentMarks(
5428  bool bClearBeforeSet,
5429  const ON_SimpleArray< const class ON_SubDComponentBase* >& marked_component_list
5430  ) const;
5431 
5432  unsigned int GetMarkedComponents(
5433  bool bIncludeVertices,
5434  bool bIncludeEdges,
5435  bool bIncludeFaces,
5436  ON_SimpleArray< const class ON_SubDComponentBase* >& marked_component_list
5437  ) const;
5438 
5439  /*
5440  Parameters:
5441  bAddMarkedComponents - [in]
5442  If true, marked components are added to component_list[].
5443  If false, unmarked components are added to component_list[].
5444  mark_bits - [in]
5445  If mark_bits is zero, then a component is "marked" if component.Mark() is true.
5446  Otherwise a component is "marked" if mark_bits = component.MarkBits().
5447  */
5448  unsigned int GetMarkedComponents(
5449  bool bAddMarkedComponents,
5450  ON__UINT8 mark_bits,
5451  bool bIncludeVertices,
5452  bool bIncludeEdges,
5453  bool bIncludeFaces,
5454  ON_SimpleArray< class ON_SubDComponentPtr >& component_list
5455  ) const;
5456 
5457  unsigned int UnselectComponents(
5458  bool bUnselectAllVertices,
5459  bool bUnselectAllEdges,
5460  bool bUnselectAllFaces
5461  ) const;
5462 
5463  /*
5464  Description:
5465  Save the current component status of the indictated subd components.
5466  Parameters:
5467  bGetVertexStatus - [in]
5468  bGetEdgeStatus - [in]
5469  bGetFaceStatus - [in]
5470  bClearStatus - [in]
5471  If true, the bits in status_mask will also be cleared for the components.
5472  status_mask - [in]
5473  Status bits to save.
5474  component_list - [out]
5475  status_list - [out]
5476  component_list[] and status_list[] are parallel arrays for components with
5477  a matching status bit set.
5478  */
5479  unsigned int GetComponentStatus(
5480  bool bGetVertexStatus,
5481  bool bGetEdgeStatus,
5482  bool bGetFaceStatus,
5483  bool bClearStatus,
5484  ON_ComponentStatus status_mask,
5485  ON_SimpleArray< const class ON_SubDComponentBase* >& component_list,
5486  ON_SimpleArray< ON_ComponentStatus >& status_list
5487  ) const;
5488 
5489  unsigned int SetComponentStatus(
5490  ON_ComponentStatus status_mask,
5491  const ON_SimpleArray< const class ON_SubDComponentBase* >& component_list,
5492  const ON_SimpleArray< ON_ComponentStatus >& status_list
5493  ) const;
5494 
5495  /*
5496  Description:
5497  Transforms the SubD components in ci_list[].
5498  Parameters:
5499  xform - [in]
5500  ci_list - [in]
5501  ci_count - [in]
5502  component_location - [in]
5503  Select between applying the tranform to the control net (faster)
5504  or the surface points (slower).
5505  Returns:
5506  Number of vertex locations that changed.
5507  */
5508  unsigned int TransformComponents(
5509  const ON_Xform& xform,
5510  const ON_COMPONENT_INDEX* ci_list,
5511  size_t ci_count,
5512  ON_SubDComponentLocation component_location
5513  );
5514 
5515  unsigned int TransformComponents(
5516  const ON_Xform& xform,
5517  const ON_SubDComponentPtr* cptr_list,
5518  size_t cptr_count,
5519  ON_SubDComponentLocation component_location
5520  );
5521 
5522  /*
5523  Description:
5524  Extrude entire subd bay adding a ring of faces around the boundary and moving the original subd.
5525  */
5526  unsigned int Extrude(
5527  const ON_Xform& xform
5528  );
5529 
5530  unsigned int ExtrudeComponents(
5531  const ON_Xform& xform,
5532  const ON_COMPONENT_INDEX* ci_list,
5533  size_t ci_count
5534  );
5535 
5536  unsigned int ExtrudeComponents(
5537  const ON_Xform& xform,
5538  const ON_SubDComponentPtr* cptr_list,
5539  size_t cptr_count
5540  );
5541 
5542  unsigned int ExtrudeComponents(
5543  const ON_Xform& xform,
5544  const ON_COMPONENT_INDEX* ci_list,
5545  size_t ci_count,
5546  bool bExtrudeBoundaries,
5547  bool bPermitNonManifoldEdgeCreation
5548  );
5549 
5550  unsigned int ExtrudeComponents(
5551  const ON_Xform& xform,
5552  const ON_SubDComponentPtr* cptr_list,
5553  size_t cptr_count,
5554  bool bExtrudeBoundaries,
5555  bool bPermitNonManifoldEdgeCreation
5556  );
5557 
5558 private:
5559  unsigned int Internal_ExtrudeComponents(
5560  const ON_Xform& xform,
5561  const ON_SubDComponentPtr* cptr_list,
5562  size_t cptr_count,
5563  bool bExtrudeBoundaries,
5564  bool bPermitNonManifoldEdgeCreation
5565  );
5566 
5567 public:
5568 
5569  /*
5570  Parameters:
5571  ci_list - [in]
5572  Array of ci_count ON_COMPONENT_INDEX values that identify the vertices.
5573  Elements that do not identifiy a SubD vertex are ignored.
5574  ci_count - [in]
5575  Number of elements in the ci_list[] array.
5576  vertex_tag - [in]
5577  Desired tag. If a vertex has the desired tag or cannot accept the desired tag,
5578  then that vertex is skipped.
5579  If vertex_tag is ON_SubDVertexTag::Corner, then every edge touching
5580  that vertex is converted to a crease.
5581  Returns:
5582  number of vertex tags that were changed.
5583  */
5584  unsigned int SetVertexTags(
5585  const ON_COMPONENT_INDEX* ci_list,
5586  size_t ci_count,
5587  ON_SubDVertexTag vertex_tag
5588  );
5589 
5590  /*
5591  Parameters:
5592  ci_list - [in]
5593  Array of ci_count ON_COMPONENT_INDEX values that identify the vertices.
5594  Elements that do not identifiy a SubD vertex are ignored.
5595  ci_count - [in]
5596  Number of elements in the ci_list[] array.
5597  vertex_tag - [in]
5598  Desired tag. If a vertex has the desired tag or cannot accept the desired tag,
5599  then that vertex is skipped.
5600  If vertex_tag is ON_SubDVertexTag::Corner, then every edge touching
5601  that vertex is converted to a crease.
5602  Returns:
5603  number of vertex tags that were changed.
5604  */
5605  unsigned int SetVertexTags(
5606  const ON_SubDComponentPtr* cptr_list,
5607  size_t cptr_count,
5608  ON_SubDVertexTag vertex_tag
5609  );
5610 
5611  /*
5612  Returns:
5613  number of tags that were changed.
5614  */
5615  unsigned int SetEdgeTags(
5616  const ON_COMPONENT_INDEX* ci_list,
5617  size_t ci_count,
5618  ON_SubDEdgeTag edge_tag
5619  );
5620 
5621  /*
5622  Returns:
5623  number of tags that were changed.
5624  */
5625  unsigned int SetEdgeTags(
5626  const ON_SubDComponentPtr* cptr_list,
5627  size_t cptr_count,
5628  ON_SubDEdgeTag edge_tag
5629  );
5630 
5631 #if defined(OPENNURBS_PLUS)
5632  /*
5633  Description:
5634  Combine (merge / weld) two boundary vertices in this subd into a single vertex.
5635  Parameters:
5636  vertex0 - [in]
5637  A boundary vertex - will survive as the merged vertex
5638  vertex1 - [in]
5639  A boundary vertex - will be deleted
5640  combined_vertex_control_net_point - [in]
5641  combined vertex's control net point
5642  Pass ON_3dPoint::UnsetPoint to use the average of the input control net points.
5643  combined_vertex_tag - [in]
5644  Sugggested vertex tag.
5645  Returns:
5646  If the vertices are combined, true is returned. Othwise, false is returned.
5647  */
5648  bool CombineBoundaryVertices(
5649  const ON_SubDVertex* vertex0,
5650  const ON_SubDVertex* vertex1,
5651  ON_3dPoint combined_vertex_control_net_point,
5652  ON_SubDVertexTag combined_vertex_tag
5653  );
5654 
5655  /*
5656  Description:
5657  Combine (merge / weld) conincident vertices into single vertex.
5658  Parameters:
5659  ci_list - [in]
5660  A list of vertices to consider for combining.
5661  combined_vertex_tag - [in]
5662  Sugggested vertex tag for combined vertices.
5663  Returns:
5664  Number of combined vertices that were created.
5665  */
5666  unsigned int CombineBoundaryVertices(
5667  const ON_SimpleArray<const ON_SubDVertex*>& ci_list,
5668  ON_SubDVertexTag combined_vertex_tag
5669  );
5670 
5671  /*
5672  Description:
5673  Combine (merge / weld) conincident vertices into single vertices.
5674  Parameters:
5675  vertex_list - [in]
5676  A list of vertices to consider for combining.
5677  combined_vertex_tag - [in]
5678  Sugggested vertex tag for combined vertices.
5679  Returns:
5680  Number of merges performed.
5681  */
5682  unsigned int CombineBoundaryVertices(
5683  const ON_SimpleArray<ON_COMPONENT_INDEX>& vertex_list,
5684  ON_SubDVertexTag combined_vertex_tag
5685  );
5686 
5687  /*
5688  Description:
5689  Combine (merge / weld) two boundary edges in this subd into a single edge.
5690  Parameters:
5691  edge0 - [in]
5692  A boundary edge. This edge will become the combined edge.
5693  edge1 - [in]
5694  A boundary edge. This edge will be deleted.
5695  combined_edge_location - [in]
5696  a value between 0 and 1.
5697  0 = combined edge location = edge0
5698  1 = combined edge location = edge1
5699  combined_edge_tag - [in]
5700  Prefered tag for the combined edge
5701  Returns:
5702  If successful, true is returned.
5703  */
5704  bool CombineBoundaryEdges(
5705  const ON_SubDEdgePtr edge0,
5706  const ON_SubDEdgePtr edge1,
5707  double merged_edge_location,
5708  ON_SubDEdgeTag merged_edge_tag
5709  );
5710 
5711 
5712  /*
5713  Description:
5714  Combine (merge / weld) two boundary edges in this subd into a single edge.
5715  Parameters:
5716  edge0 - [in]
5717  A boundary edge. This edge will become the combined edge.
5718  edge1 - [in]
5719  A boundary edge. This edge will be deleted.
5720  combined_edge_location - [in]
5721  a value between 0 and 1.
5722  0 = combined edge location = edge0
5723  1 = combined edge location = edge1
5724  combined_edge_tag - [in]
5725  Prefered tag for the combined edge
5726  Returns:
5727  If successful, true is returned.
5728  Remarks:
5729  The relative orientation of the edges is determined by inspecting the topology
5730  and control net directions. If you want more control over edge orientation,
5731  the use the version that has ON_SubDEdgePtr parameters.
5732  */
5733  bool CombineBoundaryEdges(
5734  const ON_SubDEdge* edge0,
5735  const ON_SubDEdge* edge1,
5736  double merged_edge_location,
5737  ON_SubDEdgeTag merged_edge_tag
5738  );
5739 
5740  /*
5741  Description:
5742  Combine (merge / weld) two boundary edges in this subd into a single edge.
5743  Parameters:
5744  edge_chain0 - [in]
5745  A chain of boundary edges. These will survive as the combined edges.
5746  edge_chain1 - [in]
5747  A chain of boundary edges. These edges will be deleted.
5748  edge_chain1 and edge_chain2 must have the same number of edges.
5749  combined_edge_location - [in]
5750  a value between 0 and 1.
5751  0 = combined edge location = edge0
5752  1 = combined edge location = edge1
5753  combined_edge_tag - [in]
5754  Prefered tag for the combined edge
5755  Returns:
5756  Number of combined edges.
5757  */
5758  unsigned int CombineBoundaryEdgeChains(
5759  const ON_SimpleArray< const ON_SubDEdge* >& edge_chain0,
5760  const ON_SimpleArray< const ON_SubDEdge* >& edge_chain1,
5761  double combined_edge_location,
5762  ON_SubDEdgeTag combined_edge_tag
5763  );
5764 
5765  /*
5766  Description:
5767  Combine (merge / weld) two boundary edges in this subd into a single edge.
5768  Parameters:
5769  edge_chain0 - [in]
5770  A chain of boundary edges. These will survive as the combined edges.
5771  edge_chain1 - [in]
5772  A chain of boundary edges. These edges will be deleted.
5773  edge_chain1 and edge_chain2 must have the same number of edges.
5774  combined_edge_location - [in]
5775  a value between 0 and 1.
5776  0 = combined edge location = edge0
5777  1 = combined edge location = edge1
5778  combined_edge_tag - [in]
5779  Prefered tag for the combined edge
5780  Returns:
5781  Number of combined edges.
5782  */
5783  unsigned int CombineBoundaryEdgeChains(
5784  const ON_SimpleArray< ON_SubDEdgePtr >& edge_chain0,
5785  const ON_SimpleArray< ON_SubDEdgePtr >& edge_chain1,
5786  double combined_edge_location,
5787  ON_SubDEdgeTag combined_edge_tag
5788  );
5789 
5790  /*
5791  Description:
5792  Combine (merge / weld) two boundary edges in this subd into a single edge.
5793  Parameters:
5794  edge_chain0 - [in]
5795  A chain of boundary edges. These will survive as the combined edges.
5796  edge_chain1 - [in]
5797  A chain of boundary edges. These edges will be deleted.
5798  edge_chain1 and edge_chain2 must have the same number of edges.
5799  combined_edge_location - [in]
5800  a value between 0 and 1.
5801  0 = combined edge location = edge0
5802  1 = combined edge location = edge1
5803  combined_edge_tag - [in]
5804  Prefered tag for the combined edge
5805  Returns:
5806  Number of combined edges.
5807  */
5808  unsigned int CombineBoundaryEdgeChains(
5809  const ON_SimpleArray< ON_SubDComponentPtr >& edge_chain0,
5810  const ON_SimpleArray< ON_SubDComponentPtr >& edge_chain1,
5811  double combined_edge_location,
5812  ON_SubDEdgeTag combined_edge_tag
5813  );
5814 
5815  /*
5816  Description:
5817  Combine (merge / weld) two boundary edges in this subd into a single edge.
5818  Parameters:
5819  edge_chain0 - [in]
5820  A chain of boundary edges. These will survive as the combined edges.
5821  edge_chain1 - [in]
5822  A chain of boundary edges. These edges will be deleted.
5823  edge_chain1 and edge_chain2 must have the same number of edges.
5824  combined_edge_location - [in]
5825  a value between 0 and 1.
5826  0 = combined edge location = edge0
5827  1 = combined edge location = edge1
5828  combined_edge_tag - [in]
5829  Prefered tag for the combined edge
5830  Returns:
5831  Number of combined edges.
5832  */
5833  unsigned int CombineBoundaryEdgeChains(
5834  const ON_SimpleArray< ON_COMPONENT_INDEX >& edge_chain0,
5835  const ON_SimpleArray< ON_COMPONENT_INDEX >& edge_chain1,
5836  double combined_edge_location,
5837  ON_SubDEdgeTag combined_edge_tag
5838  );
5839 
5840  /*
5841  Description:
5842  Separate (unweld) interior edges.
5843  Parameters:
5844  edge_chains - [in]
5845  edge chains that will be separated into conincident boundary edges.
5846  separated_edges - [out]
5847  If not null, the pairs of separated edges are returned here.
5848  separated_edges[].First().EdgePtr() will be an original edge.
5849  separated_edges[].Second().EdgePtr() will be a new edge edge.
5850  Returns:
5851  Number of separated edges.
5852  */
5853  unsigned int SeparateInteriorEdgeChains(
5854  const ON_SimpleArray< const ON_SubDEdge* >& edge_chains,
5855  ON_SimpleArray< ON_SubDComponentPtrPair >* separated_edges
5856  );
5857 
5858  /*
5859  Description:
5860  Separate (unweld) interior edges.
5861  Parameters:
5862  edge_chains - [in]
5863  edge chains that will be separated into conincident boundary edges.
5864  separated_edges - [out]
5865  If not null, the pairs of separated edges are returned here.
5866  separated_edges[].First().EdgePtr() will be an original edge.
5867  separated_edges[].Second().EdgePtr() will be a new edge edge.
5868  Returns:
5869  Number of separated edges.
5870  */
5871  unsigned int SeparateInteriorEdgeChains(
5872  const ON_SimpleArray< ON_COMPONENT_INDEX >& edge_chains,
5873  ON_SimpleArray< ON_SubDComponentPtrPair >* separated_edges
5874  );
5875 
5876  /*
5877  Description:
5878  Separate (unweld) interior edges.
5879  Parameters:
5880  edge_chains - [in]
5881  edge chains that will be separated into conincident boundary edges.
5882  separated_edges - [out]
5883  If not null, the pairs of separated edges are returned here.
5884  separated_edges[].First().EdgePtr() will be an original edge.
5885  separated_edges[].Second().EdgePtr() will be a new edge edge.
5886  Returns:
5887  Number of separated edges.
5888  */
5889  unsigned int SeparateInteriorEdgeChains(
5890  const ON_SimpleArray< ON_SubDEdgePtr >& edge_chains,
5891  ON_SimpleArray< ON_SubDComponentPtrPair >* separated_edges
5892  );
5893 
5894  /*
5895  Description:
5896  Separate (unweld) interior edges.
5897  Parameters:
5898  edge_chains - [in]
5899  edge chains that will be separated into conincident boundary edges.
5900  separated_edges - [out]
5901  If not null, the pairs of separated edges are returned here.
5902  separated_edges[].First().EdgePtr() will be an original edge.
5903  separated_edges[].Second().EdgePtr() will be a new edge edge.
5904  Returns:
5905  Number of separated edges.
5906  */
5907  unsigned int SeparateInteriorEdgeChains(
5908  const ON_SimpleArray< ON_SubDComponentPtr >& edge_chains,
5909  ON_SimpleArray< ON_SubDComponentPtrPair >* separated_edges
5910  );
5911 
5912  /*
5913  Description:
5914  Separate (unweld) interior edges.
5915  Parameters:
5916  edges - [in]
5917  edges that will be sorted into edge chains that will be separated into conincident boundary edges.
5918  separated_edges - [out]
5919  If not null, the pairs of separated edges are returned here.
5920  separated_edges[].First().EdgePtr() will be an original edge.
5921  separated_edges[].Second().EdgePtr() will be a new edge edge.
5922  Returns:
5923  Number of separated edges.
5924  */
5925  unsigned int SeparateInteriorEdges(
5926  const ON_SimpleArray< const ON_SubDEdge* >& edges,
5927  ON_SimpleArray< ON_SubDComponentPtrPair >* separated_edges
5928  );
5929 
5930  /*
5931  Description:
5932  Separate (unweld) interior edges.
5933  Parameters:
5934  edges - [in]
5935  edges that will be sorted into edge chains that will be separated into conincident boundary edges.
5936  separated_edges - [out]
5937  If not null, the pairs of separated edges are returned here.
5938  separated_edges[].First().EdgePtr() will be an original edge.
5939  separated_edges[].Second().EdgePtr() will be a new edge edge.
5940  Returns:
5941  Number of separated edges.
5942  */
5943  unsigned int SeparateInteriorEdges(
5944  const ON_SimpleArray< ON_SubDEdgePtr >& edges,
5945  ON_SimpleArray< ON_SubDComponentPtrPair >* separated_edges
5946  );
5947 
5948  /*
5949  Description:
5950  Separate (unweld) interior edges.
5951  Parameters:
5952  edges - [in]
5953  edges that will be sorted into edge chains that will be separated into conincident boundary edges.
5954  separated_edges - [out]
5955  If not null, the pairs of separated edges are returned here.
5956  separated_edges[].First().EdgePtr() will be an original edge.
5957  separated_edges[].Second().EdgePtr() will be a new edge edge.
5958  Returns:
5959  Number of separated edges.
5960  */
5961  unsigned int SeparateInteriorEdges(
5962  const ON_SimpleArray< ON_SubDComponentPtr >& edges,
5963  ON_SimpleArray< ON_SubDComponentPtrPair >* separated_edges
5964  );
5965 
5966  /*
5967  Description:
5968  Separate (unweld) interior edges.
5969  Parameters:
5970  edges - [in]
5971  edges that will be sorted into edge chains that will be separated into conincident boundary edges.
5972  separated_edges - [out]
5973  If not null, the pairs of separated edges are returned here.
5974  separated_edges[].First().EdgePtr() will be an original edge.
5975  separated_edges[].Second().EdgePtr() will be a new edge edge.
5976  Returns:
5977  Number of separated edges.
5978  */
5979  unsigned int SeparateInteriorEdges(
5980  const ON_SimpleArray< ON_COMPONENT_INDEX >& edges,
5981  ON_SimpleArray< ON_SubDComponentPtrPair >* separated_edges
5982  );
5983 
5984 
5985  /*
5986  Description:
5987  Separate (unweld) an interior edge into two conincident boundary edges.
5988  Parameters:
5989  edge - [in]
5990  Interior edge to separate.
5991  separator0 - [in]
5992  If interior_edge.RelativeVertex(0) is an interior vertex, then a separator0
5993  may be included to specify how the vertex faces should be divided into two sectors.
5994  If interior_edge.RelativeVertex(0) is a boundary vertex, separator0 is ignored.
5995  If separator0 is not included, an automatic choice is made.
5996  separator1 - [in]
5997  If interior_edge.RelativeVertex(1) is an interior vertex, then a separator1
5998  may be included to specify how the vertex faces should be divided into two sectors.
5999  If interior_edge.RelativeVertex(1) is a boundary vertex, separator1 is ignored.
6000  If separator0 is not included, an automatic choice is made.
6001  Returns:
6002  If successful, the separated edges are returned as a pair with the original edge in pair.First().EdgePtr()
6003  and the new edge in pair.Second().EdgePtr().
6004  Otherwise, ON_SubDComponentPtrPair::Null is returned.
6005  */
6006  ON_SubDComponentPtrPair SeparateInteriorEdge(
6007  ON_SubDEdgePtr interior_edge,
6008  const ON_SubDEdge* separator0,
6009  const ON_SubDEdge* separator1
6010  );
6011 
6012  /*
6013  Description:
6014  Separate (unweld) a vertex into two vertices.
6015  Parameters:
6016  vertex - [in]
6017  If the vertex is a nonmanifold vertex with multiple manifold sectors, it is separated into manifold sectors.
6018  If vertex is an interior vertex with 3 or more edges and optional_separator0 and optional_separator1
6019  point to two of these edges, then the vertex is separated into 2 sectors along thos edges.
6020  If vertex is a boundary vertex with 4 or more edges and optional_separator0 or optional_separator1
6021  point to an interior edge, then the vertex is separated into 2 sectors along that edge.
6022  Othewise the vertex is separated into single face sectors.
6023  separator0 - [in]
6024  separator1 - [in]
6025  Returns:
6026  If separation occured, then an array of the separated vertices is returned with the original vertex is the first element in the array.
6027  Otherwise an empty array is returned.
6028  */
6029  const ON_SimpleArray<const ON_SubDVertex*> SeparateVertex(
6030  ON_SubDVertex* vertex,
6031  const ON_SubDEdge* separator0,
6032  const ON_SubDEdge* separator1
6033  );
6034 
6035  /*
6036  Description:
6037  Separate (unweld) a vertex into the default number of sectors.
6038  Parameters:
6039  vertex - [in]
6040  If the vertex is a nonmanifold vertex with multiple manifold sectors, it is separated into manifold sectors.
6041  bApplyCreaseBias - [in]
6042  If the vertex has a single sector and the topology and creases cleary create two sectors,
6043  then the separation will be performed along the creases.
6044  Returns:
6045  If separation occured, then an array of the separated vertices is returned with the original vertex is the first element in the array.
6046  Otherwise an empty array is returned.
6047  */
6048  const ON_SimpleArray<const ON_SubDVertex*> SeparateVertex(
6049  ON_SubDVertex* vertex,
6050  bool bApplyCreaseBias
6051  );
6052 
6053 #endif
6054 
6055  /*
6056  Description:
6057  Remove all interior creases.
6058  Returns:
6059  Number of edges converted from crease to smooth.
6060  */
6061  unsigned int RemoveAllCreases();
6062 
6063  /*
6064  Description:
6065  Apply the Catmull-Clark subdivision algorithm and save the results
6066  in this ON_SubD.
6067  Parameters:
6068  level_index - [in]
6069  Level where subdivision starts
6070  count - [in] > 0
6071  Number of times to subdivide.
6072  Returns:
6073  Number of subdivision steps that succeeded.
6074  (= count when everything works, < count when input is not valid)
6075  */
6076  bool GlobalSubdivide(
6077  unsigned int count
6078  );
6079 
6080  bool GlobalSubdivide();
6081 
6082  /*
6083  Description:
6084  Apply the Catmull-Clark subdivision algorithm to the faces in face_list[].
6085  Parameters:
6086  face_list - [in]
6087  faces to subdivide
6088  face_count - [in]
6089  number of components.
6090  Returns:
6091  true if successful.
6092  */
6093  bool LocalSubdivide(
6094  class ON_SubDFace const*const* face_list,
6095  size_t face_count
6096  );
6097 
6098  bool LocalSubdivide(
6099  const ON_SimpleArray< const class ON_SubDFace* >& face_list
6100  );
6101 
6102  bool LocalSubdivide(
6103  const ON_SimpleArray<ON_COMPONENT_INDEX>& face_list
6104  );
6105 
6106  /*
6107  Description:
6108  Adds a vertex with tag = ON_SubDVertexTag::Unset.
6109  */
6110  class ON_SubDVertex* AddVertex(
6111  const double* P
6112  );
6113 
6114  /*
6115  Description:
6116  Adds a vertex with specified tag.
6117  */
6118  class ON_SubDVertex* AddVertex(
6119  ON_SubDVertexTag vertex_tag,
6120  const double* P
6121  );
6122 
6123  /*
6124  Description:
6125  Expert user tool to add a vertex with specified information. This function
6126  is useful when copying portions of an existing SubD to a new SubD.
6127  Parameters:
6128  candidate_vertex_id - [in]
6129  If candidate_vertex_id is > 0 and is available,
6130  the returned value with have id = candidate_vertex_id.
6131  Otherwise a new id will be assigned.
6132  vertex_tag - [in]
6133  Pass ON_SubDVertexTag::Unset if not known.
6134  P - [in]
6135  nullptr or a 3d point.
6136  initial_edge_capacity - [in]
6137  Initial capacity of the m_edges[] array. Pass 0 if unknown.
6138  initial_face_capacity - [in]
6139  Initial capacity of the m_faces[] array. Pass 0 if unknown.
6140  */
6141  class ON_SubDVertex* AddVertexForExperts(
6142  unsigned int candidate_vertex_id,
6143  ON_SubDVertexTag vertex_tag,
6144  const double* P,
6145  unsigned int initial_edge_capacity,
6146  unsigned int initial_face_capacity
6147  );
6148 
6149  /*
6150  Description:
6151  Search for a vertex with a specificed control net point.
6152  Parameters:
6153  control_net_point - [in]
6154  Look for a vertex with this value for ControlNetPoint().
6155  tolerance - [in]
6156  Use 0.0 when in doubt.
6157  If > 0.0, then the vertex closest to control_net_point
6158  will be returned if the distance from that vertex to control_net_point
6159  is <= distance_tolerance.
6160  Returns:
6161  An ON_SubDVertex pointer or nullptr if none exists.
6162  */
6163  const class ON_SubDVertex* FindVertex(
6164  const double* control_net_point,
6165  double distance_tolerance
6166  ) const;
6167 
6168  /*
6169  Description:
6170  Search for a vertex with a specificed control net point. If one does not
6171  exist, add a new one.
6172  Parameters:
6173  control_net_point - [in]
6174  Look for a vertex with this value for ControlNetPoint().
6175  tolerance - [in]
6176  Use 0.0 when in doubt.
6177  If > 0.0, then the vertex closest to control_net_point
6178  will be returned if the distance from that vertex to control_net_point
6179  is <= distance_tolerance.
6180  Returns:
6181  An ON_SubDVertex pointer or nullptr if none exists.
6182  */
6183  const class ON_SubDVertex* FindOrAddVertex(
6184  const double* control_net_point,
6185  double distance_tolerance
6186  );
6187 
6188  /*
6189  Parameters:
6190  edge_face_count - [in]
6191  Number of faces the edge will eventually have.
6192  Pass 0 if the value is not known.
6193  v0 - [in]
6194  starting vertex
6195  v1 - [in]
6196  ending vertex
6197  Returns:
6198  If edge_face_count > 0x7FFFU, then ON_SubDEdgeTag::Unset is returned.
6199 
6200  If edge_face_count is 1 or >= 3, then ON_SubDEdgeTag::Crease is returned.
6201 
6202  If both vertex tags are ON_SubDVertexTag::Smooth, then ON_SubDEdgeTag::Smooth is returned.
6203 
6204  If edge_face_count is 1 and both vertex tags are ON_SubDVertexTag::Crease or ON_SubDVertexTag::Corner,
6205  then ON_SubDEdgeTag::Crease is returned.
6206 
6207  If edge_face_count is 2 and both vertex tags are set and both are not ON_SubDVertexTag::Smooth,
6208  then ON_SubDEdgeTag::SmoothX is returned.
6209 
6210  Otherwise, ON_SubDEdgeTag::Unset is returned.
6211  */
6212  static ON_SubDEdgeTag EdgeTagFromContext(
6213  unsigned int edge_face_count,
6214  const ON_SubDVertexTag v0_tag,
6215  const ON_SubDVertexTag v1_tag
6216  );
6217 
6218  static ON_SubDEdgeTag EdgeTagFromContext(
6219  unsigned int edge_face_count,
6220  const ON_SubDVertex* v0,
6221  const ON_SubDVertex* v1
6222  );
6223 
6224  /*
6225  Description:
6226  Add an edge with tag = ON_SubDEdgeTag::Unset to the subd.
6227  Parameters:
6228  v0 - [in]
6229  v1 - [in]
6230  The edge begins at v0 and ends at v1.
6231  The edge will be on the same level as the vertices.
6232  Returns:
6233  Pointer to the allocated edge.
6234  Remarks:
6235  ON_SubD::EdgeTagFromContext() can be used to determine edge
6236  tag values in simple situations.
6237  */
6238  class ON_SubDEdge* AddEdge(
6239  class ON_SubDVertex* v0,
6240  class ON_SubDVertex* v1
6241  );
6242 
6243  /*
6244  Description:
6245  Search for an edge connecting v0 and v1.
6246  Parameters:
6247  v0 - [in]
6248  v1 - [in]
6249  The edge begins at v0 and ends at v1.
6250  The edge will be on the same level as the vertices.
6251  Returns:
6252  An ON_SubDEdgePtr to a connecting edge or ON_SubDEdgePtr::Null if none exists.
6253  */
6254  const ON_SubDEdgePtr FindEdge(
6255  const class ON_SubDVertex* v0,
6256  const class ON_SubDVertex* v1
6257  ) const;
6258 
6259  /*
6260  Description:
6261  Search for an edge connecting v0 and v1. If none exists, then add one.
6262  Parameters:
6263  v0 - [in]
6264  v1 - [in]
6265  The edge begins at v0 and ends at v1.
6266  The edge will be on the same level as the vertices.
6267  Returns:
6268  An ON_SubDEdgePtr to a connecting edge or ON_SubDEdgePtr::Null if none exists.
6269  */
6270  const ON_SubDEdgePtr FindOrAddEdge(
6271  class ON_SubDVertex* v0,
6272  class ON_SubDVertex* v1
6273  );
6274 
6275 
6276  /*
6277  Description:
6278  Add an edge to the subd.
6279  Parameters:
6280  edge_tag - [in]
6281  ON_SubDEdgeTag::Unset
6282  Edge tag is not known at this time.
6283  ON_SubDEdgeTag::Smooth
6284  Smooth edge. If both vertices are tagged as not smooth, the
6285  tag on the returned edge will be ON_SubDEdgeTag::SmoothX. This
6286  tag is changed to ON_SubDEdgeTag::Smooth on the first
6287  subdivision step.
6288  ON_SubDEdgeTag::Crease.
6289  Crease edge. Both vertices must be tagged as not smooth.
6290  v0 - [in]
6291  v1 - [in]
6292  The edge begins at v0 and ends at v1.
6293  The edge will be on the same level as the vertices.
6294  Returns:
6295  Pointer to the allocated edge.
6296  Remarks:
6297  ON_SubD::EdgeTagFromContext() can be used to determine edge
6298  tag values in simple situations.
6299  */
6300  class ON_SubDEdge* AddEdge(
6301  ON_SubDEdgeTag edge_tag,
6302  class ON_SubDVertex* v0,
6303  class ON_SubDVertex* v1
6304  );
6305 
6306  /*
6307  Description:
6308  Expert use tool to add an edge with precomputed sector coefficients.
6309  Parameters:
6310  edge_tag - [in]
6311  This expert user function does not automatically set the edge tag.
6312  v0 - [in]
6313  The edge begins at v0 and ends at v1.
6314  v0_sector_coefficient - [in]
6315  Pass ON_SubDSectorType::UnsetSectorCoefficient if unknown.
6316  v1 - [in]
6317  The edge begins at v0 and ends at v1.
6318  v1_sector_coefficient - [in]
6319  Pass ON_SubDSectorType::UnsetSectorCoefficient if unknown.
6320  */
6321  class ON_SubDEdge* AddEdgeWithSectorCoefficients(
6322  ON_SubDEdgeTag edge_tag,
6323  class ON_SubDVertex* v0,
6324  double v0_sector_coefficient,
6325  class ON_SubDVertex* v1,
6326  double v1_sector_coefficient
6327  );
6328 
6329  /*
6330  Description:
6331  Expert user tool to add an edge with specified information. This function
6332  is useful when copying portions of an existing SubD to a new SubD.
6333  Parameters:
6334  candidate_edge_id - [in]
6335  If candidate_edge_id is > 0 and is available,
6336  the returned edge with have id = candidate_edge_id.
6337  Otherwise a new id will be assigned.
6338  edge_tag - [in]
6339  Pass ON_SubDEdgeTag::Unset if not known.
6340  v0 - [in]
6341  The edge begins at v0 and ends at v1.
6342  v0_sector_coefficient - [in]
6343  Pass ON_SubDSectorType::UnsetSectorCoefficient if unknown.
6344  v1 - [in]
6345  The edge begins at v0 and ends at v1.
6346  v1_sector_coefficient - [in]
6347  Pass ON_SubDSectorType::UnsetSectorCoefficient if unknown.
6348  initial_face_capacity - [in]
6349  Initial face capacity. Pass 0 if unknown.
6350  */
6351  class ON_SubDEdge* AddEdgeForExperts(
6352  unsigned int candidate_edge_id,
6353  ON_SubDEdgeTag edge_tag,
6354  class ON_SubDVertex* v0,
6355  double v0_sector_coefficient,
6356  class ON_SubDVertex* v1,
6357  double v1_sector_coefficient,
6358  unsigned int initial_face_capacity
6359  );
6360 
6361  /*
6362  Parameters:
6363  edge0 - [in]
6364  edge1 - [in]
6365  edge2 - [in]
6366  The face will be oriented so the boundary has the edges
6367  in the order (edge0, edge1, edge2).
6368  Consecutive edges must have a single common vertex.
6369  The orientations of the ON_SubDEdgePtr elements in the
6370  face's edge list are automatically calculated.
6371  Returns:
6372  A pointer to the added face.
6373  The returned face is managed by the subd.
6374  */
6375  class ON_SubDFace* AddTriangleFace(
6376  class ON_SubDEdge* edge0,
6377  class ON_SubDEdge* edge1,
6378  class ON_SubDEdge* edge2
6379  );
6380 
6381  /*
6382  Parameters:
6383  edge_count - [in]
6384  Must be >= 3.
6385  edge0 - [in]
6386  edge1 - [in]
6387  edge2 - [in]
6388  The ON_SubDEdgePtr parameters must be oriented so that for consecutive pairs of edges,
6389  edge0.RelativeVertex(1) and edges1.RelativeVertex(0) are same vertex.
6390  The face will be oriented so the boundary has the edges
6391  in the order (edge0, edge1, edge2).
6392  Returns:
6393  A pointer to the added face.
6394  The returned face is managed by the subd.
6395  */
6396  class ON_SubDFace* AddTriangleFace(
6397  ON_SubDEdgePtr edge0,
6398  ON_SubDEdgePtr edge1,
6399  ON_SubDEdgePtr edge2
6400  );
6401 
6402  /*
6403  Parameters:
6404  edge0 - [in]
6405  edge1 - [in]
6406  edge2 - [in]
6407  edge3 - [in]
6408  The face will be oriented so the boundary has the edges
6409  in the order (edge0, edge1, edge2. edge3).
6410  Consecutive edges must have a single common vertex.
6411  The orientations of the ON_SubDEdgePtr elements in the
6412  face's edge list are automatically calculated.
6413  Returns:
6414  A pointer to the added face.
6415  The returned face is managed by the subd.
6416  */
6417  class ON_SubDFace* AddQuadFace(
6418  class ON_SubDEdge* edge0,
6419  class ON_SubDEdge* edge1,
6420  class ON_SubDEdge* edge2,
6421  class ON_SubDEdge* edge3
6422  );
6423 
6424  /*
6425  Parameters:
6426  edge_count - [in]
6427  Must be >= 3.
6428  edge0 - [in]
6429  edge1 - [in]
6430  edge2 - [in]
6431  edge3 - [in]
6432  The ON_SubDEdgePtr parameters must be oriented so that for consecutive pairs of edges,
6433  edge0.RelativeVertex(1) and edges1.RelativeVertex(0) are same vertex.
6434  The face will be oriented so the boundary has the edges
6435  in the order (edge0, edge1, edge2,edge3).
6436  Returns:
6437  A pointer to the added face.
6438  The returned face is managed by the subd.
6439  */
6440  class ON_SubDFace* AddQuadFace(
6441  ON_SubDEdgePtr edge0,
6442  ON_SubDEdgePtr edge1,
6443  ON_SubDEdgePtr edge2,
6444  ON_SubDEdgePtr edge3
6445  );
6446 
6447  /*
6448  Parameters:
6449  edges[] - [in]
6450  edges[] must have 3 or more elements.
6451  edges[i] and edges[(i+1)%edge_count] must have a single common vertex.
6452  The face will be oriented so the boundary has the edges
6453  in the order (edges[0], edges[1], ..., edges[edge_count-1]).
6454  The orientations of the ON_SubDEdgePtr elements in the
6455  face's edge list are automatically calculated.
6456  Returns:
6457  A pointer to the added face.
6458  The returned face is managed by the subd.
6459  */
6460  class ON_SubDFace* AddFace(
6461  const ON_SimpleArray<ON_SubDEdge*>& edges
6462  );
6463 
6464  /*
6465  Parameters:
6466  edges[] - [in]
6467  edges[] must have 3 or more elements.
6468  The ON_SubDEdgePtr parameters must be oriented so that
6469  edges[i].RelativeVertex(1) and edges[(i+1)%edge_count].RelativeVertex(0)
6470  are the same vertex.
6471  The face will be oriented so the boundary has the edges
6472  in the order (edges[0], edges[1], ..., edges[edge_count-1]).
6473  Returns:
6474  A pointer to the added face.
6475  The returned face is managed by the subd.
6476  */
6477  class ON_SubDFace* AddFace(
6478  const ON_SimpleArray<ON_SubDEdgePtr>& edges
6479  );
6480 
6481  /*
6482  Parameters:
6483  edge_count - [in]
6484  Must be >= 3.
6485  edges[] - [in]
6486  edges[i] and edges[(i+1)%edge_count] must have a single common vertex.
6487  The face will be oriented so the boundary has the edges
6488  in the order (edges[0], edges[1], ..., edges[edge_count-1]).
6489  The orientations of the ON_SubDEdgePtr elements in the
6490  face's edge list are automatically calculated.
6491  Returns:
6492  A pointer to the added face.
6493  The returned face is managed by the subd.
6494  */
6495  class ON_SubDFace* AddFace(
6496  class ON_SubDEdge * const * edges,
6497  unsigned int edge_count
6498  );
6499 
6500  /*
6501  Parameters:
6502  edge_count - [in]
6503  Must be >= 3.
6504  edges[] - [in]
6505  The ON_SubDEdgePtr parameters must be oriented so that
6506  edges[i].RelativeVertex(1) and edges[(i+1)%edge_count].RelativeVertex(0)
6507  are the same vertex.
6508  The face will be oriented so the boundary has the edges
6509  in the order (edges[0], edges[1], ..., edges[edge_count-1]).
6510  Returns:
6511  A pointer to the added face.
6512  The returned face is managed by the subd.
6513  */
6514  class ON_SubDFace* AddFace(
6515  const class ON_SubDEdgePtr* edges,
6516  unsigned int edge_count
6517  );
6518 
6519  /*
6520  Parameters:
6521  candidate_face_id - [in]
6522  If candidate_face_id is > 0 and is available,
6523  the returned face with have id = candidate_face_id.
6524  Otherwise a new id will be assigned.
6525  edge[] - [in]
6526  The edge[] array must be sorted and correct oriented
6527  (edge[i].RelativeVertex(1) == edge[(i+1)%edge_count].RelativeVertex(0)).
6528  edge_count - [in]
6529  Must be >= 3.
6530  */
6531  class ON_SubDFace* AddFaceForExperts(
6532  unsigned candidate_face_id,
6533  const class ON_SubDEdgePtr* edge,
6534  unsigned int edge_count
6535  );
6536 
6537  /*
6538  Description:
6539  Add texture points to a face.
6540  Parameters:
6541  texture_points - [in]
6542  An array of face->EdgeCount() points.
6543  texture_points_count - [in]
6544  number of elements in texture_points[].
6545  Must be >= face->EdgeCount().
6546  Returns:
6547  True if texture points were set.
6548  Remarks:
6549  This function automatically handles the management of face texture point storage.
6550  Texture points are a mutable property on ON_SubDFace.
6551  */
6552  bool AddFaceTexturePoints(
6553  const class ON_SubDFace* face,
6554  const class ON_3dPoint* texture_points,
6555  size_t texture_points_count
6556  ) const;
6557 
6558  /*
6559  Description:
6560  Add texture point storage capacity to a face.
6561  Parameters:
6562  face - [in]
6563  The ability to store at least face->EdgeCount() texture points will be added to this face.
6564  Returns:
6565  Number of texture points that can be set (>= face->EdgeCount()).
6566  */
6567  unsigned int AllocateFaceTexturePoints(
6568  const class ON_SubDFace* face
6569  ) const;
6570 
6571 public:
6572 
6573 #pragma region RH_C_SHARED_ENUM [ON_SubD::PatchStyle] [Rhino.Geometry.SubDPatchStyle] [byte]
6574  /// <summary>
6575  /// SubD::PatchStyle identifies the style of patch used to fill holes.
6576  /// </summary>
6577  enum class PatchStyle : unsigned char
6578  {
6579  ///<summary>
6580  /// Not a valid style.
6581  /// This encourages developers to thoughtfully select a patch style and can
6582  /// be used to indicate a UI control is not initialized.
6583  ///</summary>
6584  Unset = 0,
6585 
6586  ///<summary>
6587  /// Automatically choose a patch style that will generally create a good looking result.
6588  /// If a hole boundary is not convex, it is triangulated. Otherwise:
6589  /// If a hole has 3 edges, a single triangle face is used.
6590  /// If a hole has 4 edges, a single quad face is used.
6591  /// If a hole has 5 or more edges and an odd number of edges, a triangle fan is used.
6592  /// If a hole has 6 or more edges and an even number of edges, a quad fan is used.
6593  ///</summary>
6594  Automatic = 1,
6595 
6596  ///<summary>
6597  /// A single face is used under all conditions.
6598  ///</summary>
6599  SingleFace = 2,
6600 
6601  ///<summary>
6602  /// A triangle fan used under all conditions. The center of the fan
6603  /// is the average of the hole boundary vertex control net points.
6604  ///</summary>
6605  TriangleFan = 3,
6606 
6607  ///<summary>
6608  /// If the hole boundary has an even mumber of edges, a quad fan is used.
6609  /// Otherwise a triangle fan is used. The center of the fan
6610  /// is the average of the hole boundary vertex control net points.
6611  ///</summary>
6612  QuadOrTriangleFan = 4,
6613 
6614  ///<summary>
6615  /// The hole boundary is triangluated.
6616  /// Typically this style is selected when a boundary not convex
6617  /// and the other styles produce faces with overlapping regions.
6618  ///</summary>
6619  Triangulated = 5
6620  };
6621 #pragma endregion
6622 
6623 #if defined(OPENNURBS_PLUS)
6624 public:
6625  /*
6626  Description:
6627  Automatically add a collection of faces that patches a hole.
6628  Parameters:
6629  patch_style - [in]
6630  patch_boundary_edge_tag - [in]
6631  If ON_SubDEdgeTag::Crease, the patch boundary edges will be creased whenever possible.
6632  Otherwise, the patch boundary edges will be smooth whenever possible.
6633  edges[] - [in]
6634  A closed loop of edges that wil become the patch boundary.
6635  bMarkNewFaces - [in]
6636  If true, new faces have their runtime mark set to true.
6637  Otherwise new faces are not marked.
6638  In all cases, the runtime marks of input faces are not changed.
6639  Returns:
6640  If the patch is a single face, the face is returned.
6641  If the patch is a ring of quads or triangles around
6642  a central vertex, the central vertex is returned.
6643  If the patch is a set of faces in some other configuration,
6644  a face from that set is returned.
6645  If no patch was added, ON_SubDComponentPtr::Null is returned.
6646  */
6647  const ON_SubDComponentPtr AutoPatch(
6648  ON_SubD::PatchStyle patch_style,
6649  ON_SubDEdgeTag patch_boundary_edge_tag,
6650  const ON_SimpleArray< ON_SubDEdgePtr >& edges,
6651  bool bMarkNewFaces
6652  );
6653 
6654  /*
6655  Description:
6656  Automatically add a collection of faces that patches a hole.
6657  Parameters:
6658  bridge_boundary_edge_tag - [in]
6659  If ON_SubDEdgeTag::Crease, the bridge boundary edges will be creased whenever possible.
6660  Otherwise, the patch boundary edges will be smooth whenever possible.
6661  edge_count - [in]
6662  Number of edges in the start_edges[] and end_edges[] arrays.
6663  start_edges - [in]
6664  end_edges - [in]
6665  bMarkNewFaces - [in]
6666  If true, new faces have their runtime mark set to true.
6667  Otherwise new faces are not marked.
6668  In all cases, the runtime marks of input faces are not changed.
6669  Returns:
6670  The number of added faces.
6671  */
6672  unsigned int AutoBridge(
6673  ON_SubDEdgeTag bridge_boundary_edge_tag,
6674  const ON_SubDEdgePtr* start_edges,
6675  const ON_SubDEdgePtr* end_edges,
6676  unsigned int edge_count,
6677  bool bMarkNewFaces
6678  );
6679 
6680  unsigned int AutoBridge(
6681  ON_SubDEdgeTag bridge_boundary_edge_tag,
6682  const ON_SubDEdgePtr start_edge,
6683  const ON_SubDEdgePtr end_edge,
6684  bool bMarkNewFaces
6685  );
6686 
6687  /*
6688  Description:
6689  Automatically add a collection of faces that patches a hole.
6690  Parameters:
6691  patch_style - [in]
6692  patch_boundary_edge_tag - [in]
6693  If ON_SubDEdgeTag::Crease, the patch boundary edges will be creased whenever possible.
6694  Otherwise, the patch boundary edges will be smooth whenever possible.
6695  unsorted_edges[] - [in]
6696  An unsorted collection of edges that will be used to generate patch boundaries.
6697  bMarkNewFaces - [in]
6698  If true, new faces have their runtime mark set to true.
6699  Otherwise new faces are not marked.
6700  In all cases, the runtime marks of input faces are not changed.
6701  Returns:
6702  Number of patches added.
6703  */
6704  unsigned int AutoMultiPatch(
6705  ON_SubD::PatchStyle patch_style,
6706  ON_SubDEdgeTag patch_boundary_edge_tag,
6707  const ON_SimpleArray< const ON_SubDEdge* >& unsorted_edges,
6708  bool bMarkNewFaces
6709  );
6710 
6711  unsigned int AutoMultiPatch(
6712  ON_SubD::PatchStyle patch_style,
6713  ON_SubDEdgeTag patch_edge_tag,
6714  const ON_SimpleArray< ON_SubDEdgePtr >& unsorted_edges,
6715  bool bMarkNewFaces
6716  );
6717 
6718 private:
6719  unsigned int Internal_AutoMultiPatch(
6720  ON_SubD::PatchStyle patch_style,
6721  ON_SubDEdgeTag patch_boundary_edge_tag,
6722  const ON_SimpleArray< ON_SubDEdgePtr >& sorted_edge_chains,
6723  bool bMarkNewFaces
6724  );
6725 
6726  const ON_SubDComponentPtr Internal_AutoPatch(
6727  ON_SubD::PatchStyle patch_style,
6728  ON_SubDEdgeTag patch_boundary_edge_tag,
6729  const ON_SimpleArray< ON_SubDEdgePtr >& validated_edges,
6730  bool bMarkNewFaces
6731  );
6732 
6733 
6734  unsigned int Internal_AutoBridge(
6735  ON_SubDEdgeTag bridge_boundary_edge_tag,
6736  const ON_SubDEdgePtr* start_edges,
6737  const ON_SubDEdgePtr* end_edges,
6738  unsigned int edge_count,
6739  bool bMarkNewFaces
6740  );
6741 
6742 #endif
6743 
6744 
6745 public:
6746  /*
6747  Description:
6748  Expert user tool to insert an edge in the face's edge array.
6749  Parameters:
6750  face - [in]
6751  edge - [in]
6752  edge_direction -[in]
6753  i - [in]
6754  index where the edge should be inserted.
6755  Returns:
6756  true if successful.
6757  Remarks:
6758  This tool is used during construction or editing of a SubD and the
6759  connection is added even if the result is an invalid face or edge.
6760  It is up to the expert user to make enough changes to create a valid SubD.
6761  */
6762  bool AddFaceEdgeConnection(
6763  ON_SubDFace* face,
6764  unsigned int i,
6765  ON_SubDEdge* edge,
6766  ON__UINT_PTR edge_direction
6767  );
6768 
6769  /*
6770  Description:
6771  Expert user tool to insert an edge in the face's edge array.
6772  Parameters:
6773  face - [in]
6774  eptr - [in]
6775  direction must be set correctly
6776  i - [in]
6777  index where the edge should be inserted.
6778  Returns:
6779  true if successful.
6780  Remarks:
6781  This tool is used during construction or editing of a SubD and the
6782  connection is added even if the result is an invalid face or edge.
6783  It is up to the expert user to make enough changes to create a valid SubD.
6784  */
6785  bool AddFaceEdgeConnection(
6786  ON_SubDFace* face,
6787  unsigned int i,
6788  ON_SubDEdgePtr eptr
6789  );
6790 
6791  /*
6792  Description:
6793  Expert user tool to insert an edge in the face's edge array.
6794  Parameters:
6795  face - [in]
6796  edge - [in]
6797  edge to remove
6798  Returns:
6799  true if successful.
6800  Remarks:
6801  This tool is used during construction or editing of a SubD and the
6802  connection is removed even if the result is an invalid face or edge.
6803  It is up to the expert user to make enough changes to create a valid SubD.
6804  */
6805  bool RemoveFaceEdgeConnection(
6806  ON_SubDFace* face,
6807  ON_SubDEdge* edge
6808  );
6809 
6810  /*
6811  Description:
6812  Expert user tool to insert an edge in the face's edge array.
6813  Parameters:
6814  face - [in]
6815  i - [in]
6816  index where the edge should be removed.
6817  removed_edge - [out]
6818  removed edge
6819  Remarks:
6820  This tool is used during construction or editing of a SubD and the
6821  connection is removed even if the result is an invalid face or edge.
6822  It is up to the expert user to make enough changes to create a valid SubD.
6823  */
6824  bool RemoveFaceEdgeConnection(
6825  ON_SubDFace* face,
6826  unsigned int i
6827  );
6828 
6829  /*
6830  Description:
6831  Expert user tool to insert an edge in the face's edge array.
6832  Parameters:
6833  face - [in]
6834  i - [in]
6835  index where the edge should be removed.
6836  removed_edge - [out]
6837  removed edge
6838  Remarks:
6839  This tool is used during construction or editing of a SubD and the
6840  connection is removed even if the result is an invalid face or edge.
6841  It is up to the expert user to make enough changes to create a valid SubD.
6842  */
6843  bool RemoveFaceEdgeConnection(
6844  ON_SubDFace* face,
6845  unsigned int i,
6846  ON_SubDEdgePtr& removed_edge
6847  );
6848 
6849 
6850  /*
6851  Description:
6852  Expert user tool to remove all edge and vertex connnections from a face
6853  Parameters:
6854  face - [in]
6855  Remarks:
6856  This tool is used during editing of a SubD and the
6857  connections are removed even if the result is an invalid face or edge.
6858  It is up to the expert user to make enough changes to create a valid SubD.
6859  */
6860  bool RemoveFaceConnections(
6861  ON_SubDFace* face
6862  );
6863 
6864  bool GrowVertexEdgeArray(
6865  ON_SubDVertex* v,
6866  size_t capacity
6867  );
6868  bool GrowVertexFaceArray(
6869  ON_SubDVertex* v,
6870  size_t capacity
6871  );
6872  bool GrowEdgeFaceArray(
6873  ON_SubDEdge* e,
6874  size_t capacity
6875  );
6876  bool GrowFaceEdgeArray(
6877  ON_SubDFace* f,
6878  size_t capacity
6879  );
6880 
6881 #if defined(OPENNURBS_PLUS)
6882  /*
6883  Description:
6884  Get the cached surface mesh for this subD.
6885  Returns:
6886  A mesh of the SubD surface.
6887  Remarks:
6888  The mesh is a reference counted mesh managed by this ON_SubD.
6889  */
6890  class ON_SubDMesh SubDSurfaceMesh() const;
6891 
6892  /*
6893  Description:
6894  Get the cached control net mesh for this subD.
6895  Returns:
6896  A mesh of the SubD control net.
6897  Remarks:
6898  The mesh is a reference counted mesh managed by this ON_SubD.
6899  */
6900  class ON_SubDMesh SubDControlNetMesh() const;
6901 #endif
6902 
6903  /*
6904  Description:
6905  Clear all cached evaluation information (meshes, surface points, boundiang boxes, ...)
6906  that depends on edge tags, vertex tags, and the location of vertex control points.
6907  */
6908  void ClearEvaluationCache() const;
6909 
6910  /*
6911  Description:
6912  This function copies cached evaluations of component subdivision points and limit
6913  surface information from src to this. Typically this is done for performance critical
6914  sitations like control point editing.
6915  */
6916  bool CopyEvaluationCacheForExperts(const ON_SubD& src);
6917 
6918 #if defined(OPENNURBS_PLUS)

6920  Description:
6921  Get an ON_Mesh of the subdivision limit surface
6922  Parameters:
6923  display_parameters - [in]
6924  mesh - [in]
6925  If not null, the returned mesh will be stored on
6926  the input class.
6927  Returns:
6928  A mesh of the subdivision limit surface.
6929  */
6930  class ON_Mesh* GetSurfaceMesh(
6931  const class ON_SubDDisplayParameters& display_parameters,
6932  class ON_Mesh* mesh
6933  ) const;
6934 #endif
6935 
6936  /*
6937  Description:
6938  Get a mesh representation of the ON_SubD control net.
6939  Parameters:
6940  mesh - [in]
6941  If not null, the returned mesh will be stored on
6942  the input class.
6943 
6944  priority - [in]
6945  Specifies what type of SubD information is most important to transfer to the mesh.
6946  For more details, see the comments for ON_SubDGetControlNetMeshPriority.
6947 
6948  Returns:
6949  A mesh representation of the ON_SubD control net.
6950  */
6951  class ON_Mesh* GetControlNetMesh(
6952  class ON_Mesh* mesh,
6953  ON_SubDGetControlNetMeshPriority priority
6954  ) const;
6955 
6956 private:
6957  bool Internal_GetGeometryControlNetMesh(
6958  const class ON_SubDLevel& level,
6959  class ON_SubDLevelComponentIdIterator& vit_by_id,
6960  class ON_SubDLevelComponentIdIterator& fit_by_id,
6961  class ON_Mesh& mesh
6962  ) const;
6963  bool Internal_GetTextureCoordinatesGeometryControlNetMesh(
6964  const class ON_SubDLevel& level,
6965  class ON_Mesh& mesh
6966  ) const;
6967 public:
6968 
6969 
6970 #if defined(OPENNURBS_PLUS)
6971 
6972  /*
6973  Description:
6974  Get a collection of NURBS curves that lie on the SubD limit surface edges.
6975  Parameters:
6976  edge_tag - [in]
6977  If edge_tag is not ON_SubDEdgeTag::Unset, then only edges with
6978  a matching tag will be converted to curves.
6979  minimum_face_count - [in]
6980  maximum_face_count - [in]
6981  Only edges with
6982  edge->FaceCount() >= minimum_face_count
6983  and edge->FaceCount() <= maximum_face_count
6984  will be converted into curves.
6985  Pass 0, ON_SubDEdge::MaximumFaceCount if you want all possible face counts.
6986  chain_type - [in]
6987  Controls which edges joined into a single curves.
6988  ON_SubD::ChainType::Unset will create one curve per edge.
6989  edge_chain_callback_context - [in]
6990  edge_chain_callback_function - [in]
6991  Each edge chain is returned by calling
6992  edge_chain_callback_function(edge_chain_callback_context,edge_chain,edge_chain_count).
6993  The function edge_chain_callback_function() must copy any information it wants to
6994  reference later. It returns true to continue, false to terminate GetWireframeEdgeChains().
6995  edge_chain[] reports which edges are represented byt nurbs_curve
6996  Returns:
6997  Number of curves generated.
6998  */
6999  unsigned int GetWireframeEdgeChains(
7000  ON_SubDEdgeTag edge_tag,
7001  unsigned int minimum_face_count,
7002  unsigned int maximum_face_count,
7003  ON_SubD::ChainType chain_type,
7004  ON__UINT_PTR edge_chain_callback_context,
7005  bool (*edge_chain_callback_function)(ON__UINT_PTR, const ON_SubDEdgePtr*, unsigned int)
7006  ) const;
7007 
7008  /*
7009  Description:
7010  Get a collection of NURBS curves that lie on the SubD limit surface edges.
7011  Parameters:
7012  edge_tag - [in]
7013  If edge_tag is not ON_SubDEdgeTag::Unset, then only edges with
7014  a matching tag will be converted to curves.
7015  minimum_face_count - [in]
7016  maximum_face_count - [in]
7017  Only edges with
7018  edge->FaceCount() >= minimum_face_count
7019  and edge->FaceCount() <= maximum_face_count
7020  will be converted into curves.
7021  Pass 0, ON_SubDEdge::MaximumFaceCount if you want all possible face counts.
7022  chain_type - [in]
7023  Controls which edges joined into a single curves.
7024  ON_SubD::ChainType::Unset will create one curve per edge.
7025  curve_callback_context - [in]
7026  curve_callback_function - [in]
7027  Each curve is returned by calling
7028  curve_callback_function(curve_callback_context,edge_chain_count,edge_chain,nurbs_curve).
7029  The function curve_callback_function() must copy any information it wants to
7030  reference later. It returns true to continue, false to terminate GetSurfaceWireframe().
7031  edge_chain[] reports which edges are represented byt nurbs_curve
7032  Returns:
7033  Number of curves generated.
7034  */
7035  unsigned int GetSurfaceWireframe(
7036  ON_SubDEdgeTag edge_tag,
7037  unsigned int minimum_face_count,
7038  unsigned int maximum_face_count,
7039  ON_SubD::ChainType chain_type,
7040  ON__UINT_PTR curve_callback_context,
7041  bool (*curve_callback_function)(
7042  ON__UINT_PTR,
7043  const ON_SubDEdgePtr*,
7044  unsigned int,
7045  const class ON_NurbsCurve&)
7046  ) const;
7047 
7048  /*
7049  Description:
7050  Get a collection of NURBS curves that lie on the SubD limit surface edges.
7051  Parameters:
7052  edge_tag - [in]
7053  If edge_tag is not ON_SubDEdgeTag::Unset, then only edges with
7054  a matching tag will be converted to curves.
7055  minimum_face_count - [in]
7056  maximum_face_count - [in]
7057  Only edges with
7058  edge->FaceCount() >= minimum_face_count
7059  and edge->FaceCount() <= maximum_face_count
7060  will be converted into curves.
7061  Pass 0, ON_SubDEdge::MaximumFaceCount if you want all possible face counts.
7062  chain_type - [in]
7063  Controls which edges joined into a single curves.
7064  ON_SubD::ChainType::Unset will create one curve per edge.
7065  curves - [out]
7066  The wireframe curves are appended to curves[].
7067  The caller is responsible for deleting them.
7068  Returns:
7069  Number of curves appended to nurbs_curves.
7070  */
7071  unsigned int GetSurfaceWireframe(
7072  ON_SubDEdgeTag edge_tag,
7073  unsigned int minimum_face_count,
7074  unsigned int maximum_face_count,
7075  ON_SubD::ChainType chain_type,
7076  ON_SimpleArray<ON_NurbsCurve*>& nurbs_curves
7077  ) const;
7078 
7079  /*
7080  Description:
7081  Get the limit surface mesh as a set of fragments.
7082  Parameters:
7083  display_parameters - [in]
7084 
7085  fragment_callback_context - [in]
7086  first parameter for the FragmentCallback function
7087 
7088  fragment_callback_function - [in]
7089  A function pointer with prototype:
7090 
7091  bool fragment_callback_function(
7092  void *fragment_callback_context,
7093  const class ON_SubDMeshFragment* fragment
7094  );
7095 
7096  For each fragment that is produced, fragment_callback_function() is called.
7097  You must copy the retuned fragment if you want to keep it for future use.
7098  If fragment_callback_function returns false, the calculation is canceled.
7099  Returns:
7100  Number of fragments produced.
7101  */
7102  unsigned int GetMeshFragments(
7103  const class ON_SubDDisplayParameters& display_parameters,
7104  ON__UINT_PTR fragment_callback_context,
7105  bool(*fragment_callback_function)(ON__UINT_PTR , const class ON_SubDMeshFragment*)
7106  ) const;
7107 
7108  /*
7109  Description:
7110  Updates limit surface information returned by
7111  ON_SubDVertex.GetSurfacePoint(),
7112  ON_SubDEdge.EdgeSurfaceCurve(), and
7113  ON_SubDFace.SurfaceMeshFragments().
7114 
7115  Parameters:
7116  bLazyUpdate - [in]
7117  If false, all information is updated.
7118  If true, only missing information is updated. If a relatively small subset
7119  of a SubD has been modified and care was taken to mark cached subdivision
7120  information as stale, then passing true can substantually improve performance.
7121  Returns:
7122  Number of elements that were updated.
7123  */
7124  unsigned int UpdateSurfaceMeshCache(
7125  bool bLazyUpdate
7126  );
7127 
7128  /*
7129  Description:
7130  Updates limit surface information returned by
7131  ON_SubDVertex.GetSurfacePoint(),
7132  ON_SubDEdge.EdgeSurfaceCurve(), and
7133  ON_SubDFace.SurfaceMeshFragments().
7134 
7135  Parameters:
7136  bLazyUpdate - [in]
7137  If false, all information is updated.
7138  If true, only missing information is updated. If a relatively small subset
7139  of a SubD has been modified and care was taken to mark cached subdivision
7140  information as stale, then passing true can substantually improve performance.
7141  bSetUnchangedFaceColor - [in]
7142  unchanged_face_color - [in]
7143  If bSetUnchangedFaceColor is true, then unchanged_face_color is set as the per face color for faces whose
7144  mesh fragments are not recalculated.
7145  This is typically used in debugging.
7146  bSetUpdatedFaceColor - [in]
7147  updated_face_color - [in]
7148  If bSetUpdatedFaceColor is true, then updated_face_color is set as the per face color for faces whose
7149  mesh fragments are recalculated.
7150  This is typically used in debugging.
7151  Returns:
7152  Number of elements that were updated.
7153  */
7154  unsigned int UpdateSurfaceMeshCache(
7155  bool bLazyUpdate,
7156  bool bSetUnchangedFaceColor,
7157  ON_Color unchanged_face_color,
7158  bool bSetUpdatedFaceColor,
7159  ON_Color updated_face_color
7160  );
7161 
7162 private:
7163  unsigned int Internal_GetMeshFragments(
7164  const class ON_SubDDisplayParameters& display_parameters,
7165  ON__UINT_PTR callback_context,
7166  bool (*face_filter_callback_function)(ON__UINT_PTR , const ON_SubDFace*),
7167  bool(*fragment_callback_function)(ON__UINT_PTR , const class ON_SubDMeshFragment*)
7168  ) const;
7169 
7170 public:
7171 #endif
7172 
7173 #if defined(OPENNURBS_PLUS)
7174  /*
7175  Returns:
7176  The number of limit surface mesh fragments (ON_SubDMeshFragment) that
7177  GetMeshFragments() will produce.
7178  */
7179  unsigned int MeshFragmentCount() const;
7180 #endif
7181 
7182 #if defined(OPENNURBS_PLUS)
7183  /*
7184  Description:
7185  Get the limit surface as a set of bicubic patch fragments.
7186  Parameters:
7187  display_parameters - [in]
7188 
7189  callback_context - [in]
7190  first parameter for the callback functions
7191 
7192  begin_face_callback_function - [in]
7193  nullptr or a function pointer with prototype:
7194 
7195  bool begin_face_callback_function(
7196  void *fragment_callback_context,
7197  const class ON_SubDFaceRegion& face_region,
7198  );
7199 
7200  At the beginning of each quad face, this function is called.
7201  If the original SubD face is a quad, then face_region identifies that quad.
7202  If the original SubD face is not a quad, then face_region identifies the
7203  level 1 subdivision quad. The face region information is useful in building
7204  a correspondence between the original SubD and the Nurbs patches.
7205  If begin_face_callback_function returns false, the calculation is canceled.
7206 
7207  fragment_callback_function - [in]
7208  A function pointer with prototype:
7209 
7210  bool fragment_callback_function(
7211  void *fragment_callback_context,
7212  const class ON_SubDSurfaceNurbsFragment* fragment
7213  );
7214 
7215  For each fragment that is produced, fragment_callback_function() is called.
7216  You must copy the retuned fragment if you want to keep it for future use.
7217  If fragment_callback_function returns false, the calculation is canceled.
7218  Returns:
7219  Number of fragments produced.
7220  */
7221  unsigned int GetSurfaceNurbsFragments(
7222  const class ON_SubDDisplayParameters& display_parameters,
7223  ON__UINT_PTR callback_context,
7224  bool(*begin_face_callback_function)(ON__UINT_PTR ,const class ON_SubDFaceRegion&),
7225  bool(*fragment_callback_function)(ON__UINT_PTR ,const class ON_SubDSurfaceNurbsFragment*)
7226  ) const;
7227 #endif
7228 
7229 
7230 
7231 #if defined(OPENNURBS_PLUS)
7232  ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
7233  ///
7234  /// SubD symmetry interface
7235  ///
7236 
7237  /*
7238  Returns:
7239  Current symmetry propeties.
7240  */
7241  const class ON_Symmetry& Symmetry() const;
7242 
7243 
7244  /*
7245  Description:
7246  Remove symmetry from this subd.
7247  */
7248 
7249  void ClearSymmetry();
7250  /*
7251  Description:
7252  Make this subd symmetric.
7253  Parameters:
7254  symmetry - [in]
7255  desired symmetry.
7256  bEnableTrimming - [in]
7257  If true, portions of the subd outside the motif region will be deleted.
7258  bEnableFilling - [in]
7259  If true, filling will be used when trimming removes portions of a face.
7260  Returns:
7261  True if succesful
7262  */
7263  bool MakeSymmetric(
7264  ON_Symmetry symmetry,
7265  bool bEnableTrimming,
7266  bool bEnableFilling
7267  );
7268 
7269  /*
7270  Description:
7271  Apply reflection symmetry
7272  */
7273  bool MakeReflectSymmetric(
7274  ON_Symmetry symmetry
7275  );
7276 
7277  /*
7278  Description:
7279  Apply radial symmetry
7280  */
7281  bool MakeRadialSymmetric(
7282  ON_Symmetry symmetry
7283  );
7284 
7285 
7286  /*
7287  Description:
7288  Sets the symmetry properties. Does not modify the subd geometry.
7289  Parameters:
7290  symmetry - [in]
7291  desired symmetry
7292  SetContentSerialNumber - [in]
7293  IF true, the current content serial number will be set on symmetry information saved on the subd.
7294  Returns:
7295  True if succesful
7296  */
7297  void SetSymmetryForExperts(
7298  const class ON_Symmetry& symmetry,
7299  bool SetContentSerialNumber
7300  );
7301 
7302  /*
7303  Returns:
7304  this->Symmetry().IsSet()
7305  && this->Symmetry().SymmetricObjectContentSerialNumber() == this->ContentSerialNumber()
7306  && this->ContentSerialNumber() > 0
7307  */
7308  bool ContentIsSymmetric() const;
7309 
7310  void SetContentIsSymmetricForExperts(
7311  bool bContentIsSymmetric
7312  ) const;
7313 
7314  /*
7315  Description:
7316  Snaps points within tuneup_tol of plane to the plane.
7317  Parameters:
7318  planae_eq - [in]
7319  ON_PlaneEquation of the target plane
7320  tuneup_tol - [in]
7321  Distance tolerance .
7322  Returns:
7323  number of points moved
7324  */
7325  unsigned int SnapPointsToPlane(
7326  ON_PlaneEquation plane_eq,
7327  double tuneup_tol);
7328 
7329 
7330  /*
7331  Description:
7332  Delete faces that are on a plane in preparation for
7333  mirroring the subd or joining to somethinng across the plane
7334  Parameters:
7335  planae_eq - [in]
7336  ON_PlaneEquation of the target plane
7337  tuneup_tol - [in]
7338  Distance tolerance - Delete faces within this distance of the plane
7339  Returns:
7340  number of faces deleted
7341  */
7342  unsigned int DeleteFacesOnPlane(
7343  ON_PlaneEquation plane_eq,
7344  double delete_tol);
7345 
7346 #endif
7347 
7348 #pragma region RH_C_SHARED_ENUM [ON_SubD::NurbsSurfaceType] [Rhino.Geometry.SubD.NurbsSurfaceType] [nested:byte]
7349  /// <summary>
7350  /// ON_SubD::NurbsSurfaceType specifies what type of NURBS surfaces are returned by ON_SubD.GetSurfaceNurbsFragments()
7351  /// </summary>
7352  enum class NurbsSurfaceType : unsigned char
7353  {
7354  ///<summary>
7355  /// Not a valid type. Used to indicate the type has not been set and to encourage developers to explicitly specify a type.
7356  /// When in doubt, specify NurbsSurfaceType::Large.
7357  ///</summary>
7358  Unset = 0,
7359 
7360  ///<summary>
7361  /// Onee NURBS surface will be generated for each SubD quad.
7362  /// N NURBS surfaces will be generated for each SubD N-gon (N = 3, 5 or more). ON_Brepface may cover multiple
7363  /// Near extraordinary vertices, the surfaces may have lots of knots.
7364  ///</summary>
7365  Large = 1,
7366 
7367  ///<summary>
7368  /// NURBS surfaces will be as large as possible without the addition of extra knots.
7369  /// Near extraordinary vertices, the surfaces may have lots of knots.
7370  /// This option is prefered when a user wants larger NURBS surfaces but not at the cost of addtional NURBS control points.
7371  ///</summary>
7372  Medium = 2,
7373 
7374  ///<summary>
7375  /// NURBS surfaces will not be merged and will have clamped knots.
7376  ///</summary>
7377  Small = 3,
7378 
7379  ///<summary>
7380  /// NURBS surfaces will not be merged and will have unclamped uniform knots.
7381  /// This is useful as a starting point for customized merging and modifying
7382  /// continuity at extraordinary vertices.
7383  ///</summary>
7384  Unprocessed = 4
7385  };
7386 #pragma endregion
7387 
7388 
7389 #if defined(OPENNURBS_PLUS)
7390  /*
7391  Description:
7392  Get the SubD limit surface as bicubic NURBS surfaces.
7393 
7394  Parameters:
7395  nurbs_surface_type - [in]
7396  Controls the size and knot properties of the returned NURBS sufaces.
7397 
7398  callback_context - [in]
7399  first parameter for the callback functions
7400 
7401  nurbs_callback_function - [in]
7402  nullptr or a function pointer with prototype:
7403 
7404  bool nurbs_callback_function(
7405  ON__UINT_PTR callback_context,
7406  const ON_SubDComponentRegion& subd_face_region,
7407  const ON_SubDComponentRegion subd_edge_region[4],
7408  const class ON_NurbsSurface*& nurbs_surface
7409  );
7410 
7411  For each NURBS surface that is produced, nurbs_callback_function() is called.
7412 
7413  subd_face_region identifies the region of the SubD that this NURBS surface
7414  models.
7415 
7416  subd_edge_region[4] identifies the edges the NURBS surface abuts in
7417  the order South,East,North,West.
7418 
7419  When an edge is a subdivision edge, then
7420  subd_edge_region[i].m_level0_component.ComponentType() is ON_SubDComponentPtr::Type::Edge,
7421  subd_edge_region[i].m_level0_component.ComponentBase() is nullptr, and
