7422  ON_SubDComponentRegion::IsTransientId(subd_edge_region[i].m_level0_component_id) is true
7423 
7424  The nurbs_surface pointer points to an ON_NurbsSurface on the heap.
7425  You must take responsibility for managing this surface and deleting it
7426  at the appropriate time.
7427 
7428  Returns:
7429  Number of NURBS surfaces returned.
7430 
7431  */
7432  unsigned int GetSurfaceNurbs(
7433  ON_SubD::NurbsSurfaceType nurbs_surface_type,
7434  ON__UINT_PTR callback_context,
7435  bool(*nurbs_callback_function)(ON__UINT_PTR , const class ON_SubDFaceRegion&, class ON_NurbsSurface*)
7436  ) const;
7437 #endif
7438 
7439 #if defined(OPENNURBS_PLUS)
7440  /*
7441  Description:
7442  Get the SubD limit surface as a list of bicubic NURBS patches.
7443  Parameters:
7444  nurbs_surface_type - [in]
7445  Controls the size and knot properties of the returned NURBS sufaces.
7446  patches - [out]
7447  The bicubic NURBS patches are appended to this array.
7448  Returns:
7449  Number of patches appended to patches[]
7450  */
7451  unsigned int GetSurfaceNurbs(
7452  ON_SubD::NurbsSurfaceType nurbs_surface_type,
7453  ON_SimpleArray< ON_NurbsSurface* >& patches
7454  ) const;
7455 #endif
7456 
7457 #if defined(OPENNURBS_PLUS)
7458  unsigned int GetSurfaceNurbs(
7459  ON_SubD::NurbsSurfaceType nurbs_surface_type,
7460  ON_SimpleArray< ON_SubDFaceRegionAndNurbs >& patches
7461  ) const;
7462 #endif
7463 
7464 #if defined(OPENNURBS_PLUS)
7465  /*
7466  Description:
7467  Get a brep representation of the SubD.
7468  Parameters:
7469  brep_parameters - [in]
7470  */
7471  ON_Brep* GetSurfaceBrep(
7472  const ON_SubDToBrepParameters& brep_parameters,
7473  ON_Brep* destination_brep
7474  ) const;
7475 #endif
7476 
7477 #if defined(OPENNURBS_PLUS)
7478  /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
7479  // SubD proxy brep interface.
7480 
7481  /*
7482  Returns:
7483  GetSurfaceBrep( ON_SubDToBrepParameters::Default, destination_brep );
7484  */
7485  class ON_Brep* ProxyBrep(ON_Brep* destination_brep) const;
7486 
7487  /*
7488  Parameters:
7489  proxy_brep - [in]
7490  Brep created on this->ProxyBrep()
7491  subd_vertex_id - [in]
7492  Returns:
7493  The proxy_brep vertex corresponding to the subd vertex.
7494  */
7495  const class ON_BrepVertex* ProxyBrepVertex(const ON_Brep* proxy_brep, unsigned subd_vertex_id) const;
7496 
7497  /*
7498  Parameters:
7499  proxy_brep - [in]
7500  Brep created on this->ProxyBrep()
7501  subd_edge_id - [in]
7502  Returns:
7503  A proxy_brep edge corresponding to some part of the subd edge.
7504  */
7505  const class ON_BrepEdge* ProxyBrepEdge(const ON_Brep* proxy_brep, unsigned subd_edge_id, const class ON_BrepEdge* prev_proxy_edge) const;
7506 
7507  /*
7508  Parameters:
7509  proxy_brep - [in]
7510  Brep created on this->ProxyBrep()
7511  subd_face_id - [in]
7512  Returns:
7513  A proxy_brep face corresponding to some part of the subd face.
7514  */
7515  const class ON_BrepFace* ProxyBrepFace(const ON_Brep* proxy_brep, unsigned subd_face_id, const class ON_BrepFace* prev_proxy_face) const;
7516 #endif
7517 
7518 
7519 #if defined(OPENNURBS_PLUS)
7520  /*
7521  Description:
7522  Get the system of linear equations that calculate vertex limit point locations
7523  from the corresponding ring vertices's control net points.
7524  This information is useful when solving location interpolation problems.
7525  Parameters:
7526  coefficients - [out]
7527  The returned array is sorted by ON_SubDVertexSurfacePointCoefficient::CompareSurfacePointAndRingVertexId().
7528  If (coefficients[i0],....,coefficients[i1]) is the set of all coefficients with
7529  the same value of ON_SubDVertexSurfacePointCoefficient.m_limit_point_vertex,
7530  then the location of the limit point for that vertex is the sum of
7531  coefficients[i].m_c*coefficients[i].m_ring_vertex->ControlNetPoint()
7532  where (i0 <= i <= i1).
7533  coefficient_matrix_size - [out]
7534  If not nullptr, then
7535  coefficient_matrix_size->i = number of unique m_limit_point_vertex values in coefficients[]
7536  and coefficient_matrix_size->j = number of unique m_ring_vertex values in coefficients[].
7537  If this SubD is valid, then both of these numbers are this->VertexCount(). Put another way,
7538  if this SubD is valid, the linear system of equations can be represented by an NxN matrix
7539  where N = this->VertexCount().
7540  Returns:
7541  True if the linear system could be calculated.
7542  */
7543  bool GetSurfacePointLinearSystem(
7544  ON_SimpleArray<ON_SubDVertexSurfacePointCoefficient>& coefficients,
7545  ON_2udex* coefficient_matrix_size
7546  ) const;
7547 
7548  /*
7549  Description:
7550  Get the system of linear equations that calculate vertex limit point locations
7551  from the corresponding ring vertices's control net points in matrix form.
7552  Parameters:
7553  m - [out]
7554  v - [out]
7555  v[i] limit point = sum( 0 <= j < v.Count() of m[i][j]*v[j]->ContolNetPoint() )
7556  Returns:
7557  True if the linear system could be calculated and is square.
7558  */
7559  bool GetSurfacePointLinearSystem(
7560  ON_Matrix& m,
7561  ON_SimpleArray<const ON_SubDVertex*>& v
7562  ) const;
7563 
7564  /*
7565  Description:
7566  Modifies the SubD so that the SubD vertex limit surface points
7567  are equal to surface_points[]
7568  Parameters:
7569  surface_points - [in]
7570  point for limit surface to interpolate.
7571  surface_points[i] is the location for the i-th vertex
7572  returned by ON_SubVertexIterator vit(*this).
7573  */
7574  bool InterpolateSurfacePoints(
7575  const ON_SimpleArray<ON_3dPoint>& surface_points
7576  );
7577 
7578  /*
7579  Description:
7580  Modifies the SubD so that the SubD vertex limit points
7581  are equal to input control net locations.
7582  */
7583  bool InterpolateControlNet();
7584 
7585 
7586  /*
7587  Description:
7588  Modifies the SubD so that the SubD vertex limit surface points
7589  are equal to vertex_surface_points[]
7590  Parameters:
7591  vertices - [in]
7592  free vertices
7593  surface_points - [in]
7594  surface_points[i] is the desired location for vertices[i].SurfacePoint().
7595  */
7596  bool InterpolateSurfacePoints(
7597  const ON_SimpleArray<const ON_SubDVertex*>& vertices,
7598  const ON_SimpleArray<ON_3dPoint>& surface_points
7599  );
7600  bool InterpolateSurfacePoints(
7601  const ON_SimpleArray<ON_COMPONENT_INDEX>& vertices,
7602  const ON_SimpleArray<ON_3dPoint>& surface_points
7603  );
7604  bool InterpolateSurfacePoints(
7605  const ON_SimpleArray<ON_SubDVertexPtr>& vertices,
7606  const ON_SimpleArray<ON_3dPoint>& surface_points
7607  );
7608  bool InterpolateSurfacePoints(
7609  const ON_SimpleArray<ON_SubDComponentPtr>& vertices,
7610  const ON_SimpleArray<ON_3dPoint>& surface_points
7611  );
7612 
7613 #endif
7614 
7615 public:
7616  /*
7617  Parameters:
7618  minimum_rectangle_count - [in]
7619  >= 1 minimum number of rectangles in texture domain
7620  image_width - [in]
7621  image_height = [in]
7622  If a texture image size is known, pass it here. Otherwise pass 0.0 for both parameters.
7623  Returns:
7624  Suggested way to partition a texture coodinate domain into rectangles.
7625  ON_2udex.i = "x" count
7626  ON_2udex.j = "y" count
7627  For example (3,2) would mean divide the 2d texture domain into 3 segments across and 2 segments vertically.
7628  */
7629  static const ON_2udex TextureDomainGridSize(
7630  unsigned minimum_rectangle_count,
7631  double image_width,
7632  double image_height
7633  );
7634 
7635  enum : unsigned int
7636  {
7637  /// <summary>
7638  /// ON_SUbDFace packing rectangle information is calculated so that there is at least
7639  /// one unused pixel between adjacent packing rectangles when a texture image size is
7640  /// TextureImageSuggestedMinimumSize x TextureImageSuggestedMinimumSize
7641  /// pixels or larger.
7642  /// Core subd code assumes TextureImageSuggestedMinimumSize is a power of 2 and >= 512.
7643  /// </summary>
7644  TextureImageSuggestedMinimumSize = 1024
7645  };
7646 
7647  static ON_SubDTextureCoordinateType TextureCoordinateTypeFromUnsigned(
7648  unsigned int texture_coordinate_type_as_unsigned
7649  );
7650 
7651  static ON_SubDTextureCoordinateType TextureCoordinateTypeFromObsoleteTextureDomainType(
7652  unsigned int obsolete_texture_domain_type_as_unsigned
7653  );
7654 
7655  static unsigned char ObsoleteTextureDomainTypeFromTextureCoordinateType(
7656  ON_SubDTextureCoordinateType texture_coordinate_type
7657  );
7658 
7659 
7660  static const ON_wString TextureCoordinateTypeToString(
7661  ON_SubDTextureCoordinateType texture_domain_type
7662  );
7663 
7664  /*
7665  Description:
7666  Set the texture coordinate type.
7667  Parameters:
7668  texture_coordinate_type - [in]
7669  Type of texture coordinates.
7670  If ON_SubDTextureCoordinateType::Unset or ON_SubDTextureCoordinateType::Custom,
7671  is passed, the type setting is changed but no changes are made to texture coordinates.
7672  Remarks:
7673  Call SetTextureCoordinates() to restore them to the default values.
7674 
7675  If texture_coordinate_type is ON_SubDTextureCoordinateType::FromMapping, then
7676  the mapping this->TextureCoordinateMapping() is used. You may call
7677  this->SetTextureCoordinateMapping() to set the mapping.
7678 
7679  Calling this->SetTextureCoordinateType() does not change existing cached
7680  texture coordinates. At an approprite time, call SetFragmentTextureCoordinates()
7681  to update texture coordinates on any cached fragments.
7682 
7683  SubD texture coordinate type and fragment texture coordinates are a mutable property.
7684  They can be changed by rendering applications as needed.
7685  */
7686  void SetTextureCoordinateType(
7687  ON_SubDTextureCoordinateType texture_coordinate_type
7688  ) const;
7689 
7690  ON_SubDTextureCoordinateType TextureCoordinateType() const;
7691 
7692  /*
7693  Returns:
7694  Number of faces with ON_SubDFace.TexturePointsAreSet() = true.
7695  */
7696  unsigned int TexturePointsAreSet() const;
7697 
7698  /*
7699  Description:
7700  Delete texture points from faces.
7701  Returns:
7702  Number of faces that had texture points.
7703  */
7704  unsigned int ClearTexturePoints() const;
7705 
7706  /*
7707  Parameters:
7708  bIgnoreTextureCoordinateType - [in]
7709  If true, the current texture mapping tag is returned.
7710  If false, the current texture mapping tag is returned only when ON_SubDTextureCoordinateType::FromMapping = TextureCoordinateType().
7711  Returns:
7712  The current texture mapping tag.
7713  Remarks:
7714  The texture mapping tag should be applied only when this->TextureCoordinateType()
7715  is ON_SubDTextureCoordinateType::FromMapping.
7716  SubD texture domains and coordinates are a mutable property.
7717  They can be changed by rendering applications as needed.
7718  */
7719  const ON_MappingTag TextureMappingTag(
7720  bool bIgnoreTextureCoordinateType
7721  ) const;
7722 
7723  /*
7724  Description:
7725  Set the texture mapping tag.
7726  Remarks:
7727  The texture mapping tag should be applied only when this->TextureCoordinateType()
7728  is ON_SubDTextureCoordinateType::FromMapping.
7729 
7730  Calling this->SetTextureMappingTag() does not change existing cached
7731  texture coordinates. At an approprite time, call this->SetFragmentTextureCoordinates()
7732  to update texture coordinates on any cached fragments.
7733 
7734  SubD texture domains and coordinates are a mutable property.
7735  They can be changed by rendering applications as needed.
7736  */
7737  void SetTextureMappingTag(const class ON_MappingTag&) const;
7738 
7739  /*
7740  Returns:
7741  True if setting texture coordinates requires a set ON_TextureMapping mapping.
7742  Remarks:
7743  An explict texture mapping is required when TextureCoordinateType() is
7744  ON_SubDTextureCoordinateType::FromMapping and TextureMappingTag()
7745  is set and not ON_MappingTag::SurfaceParameterMapping or an equivalent
7746  surface parameter mapping.
7747  */
7748  bool TextureMappingRequired() const;
7749 
7750  /*
7751  Parameters:
7752  texture_coordinate_type - [in]
7753  texture_mapping_tag - [in]
7754  If texture_coordinate_type is ON_SubDTextureCoordinateType::Custom, then
7755  then texture_mapping_tag information is included in the hash.
7756  Otherwise, texture_mapping_tag is ignored.
7757  Returns:
7758  A hash that uniquely identifies the information in TextureCoordinateType() and
7759  TextureMappingTag() that applies to the current subd.
7760  */
7761  static const ON_SHA1_Hash TextureSettingsHash(
7762  ON_SubDTextureCoordinateType texture_coordinate_type,
7763  const class ON_MappingTag& texture_mapping_tag
7764  );
7765 
7766  /*
7767  Returns:
7768  ON_SubD::TextureSettingsHash(this->TextureCoordinateType(),this->TextureMappingTag());
7769  Remarks:
7770  Comparing with this->FragmentTextureCoordinatesTextureSettingsHash() can tell you
7771  if the current fragment texture coordinates were calculated using the same settings.
7772  */
7773  const ON_SHA1_Hash TextureSettingsHash() const;
7774 
7775  /*
7776  Description:
7777  If needed, set the frament texture coordinates.
7778  Parameters:
7779  mapping - [in]
7780  If ON_SubD::TextureMappingRequired() is true, then you must
7781  pass a mapping with a tag that matches ON_SubDTextureMappingTag().
7782  Otherwise, mapping is ignored and you may pass ON_TextureMapping::Unset.
7783  bLazy - [in]
7784  If true and the m_T[] values were set using the same
7785  mapping parameters, then no calculation is performed.
7786  Returns:
7787  True if successful.
7788  Remarks:
7789  SubD texture domains and coordinates are a mutable property.
7790  They can be changed by rendering applications as needed.
7791  Call SetTextureCoordinatesFromFaceDomains() to restore them to the default values.
7792  */
7793  bool SetFragmentTextureCoordinates(
7794  const class ON_TextureMapping& mapping,
7795  bool bLazy
7796  ) const;
7797 
7798  /*
7799  Returns:
7800  The value of ON_SubD::TextureSettingsHash(texture_coordinate_type,texture_mapping_tag)
7801  for the texture_coordinate_type and texture_mapping_tag used to set the current
7802  fragment texture coordinates. If no fragments exist or the coordinates are not set,
7803  then ON_SHA1_Hash::EmptyContentHash is returned.
7804  */
7805  const ON_SHA1_Hash FragmentTextureCoordinatesTextureSettingsHash() const;
7806 
7807  /*
7808  Description:
7809  If a change requires existing fragment texture coordinates to be recalculated,
7810  then call ClearFragmentTextureCoordinatesTextureSettingsHash().
7811  */
7812  void ClearFragmentTextureCoordinatesTextureSettingsHash() const;
7813 
7814 private:
7815  /*
7816  Description:
7817  Unconditionally sets fragment texture coordinates when a mapping is not required or is not available.
7818  */
7819  bool Internal_SetFragmentTextureCoordinatesWithoutMapping() const;
7820 
7821  /*
7822  Description:
7823  Sets the value returned by FragmentTextureCoordinatesTextureSettingsHash()
7824  */
7825  void Internal_SetFragmentTextureCoordinatesTextureSettingsHash(ON_SHA1_Hash hash) const;
7826 
7827  ON_SubDTextureCoordinateType Internal_BestChoiceTextureCoordinateType(
7828  const class ON_TextureMapping& available_mapping
7829  ) const;
7830 
7831 
7832 public:
7833  /*
7834  Description:
7835  Pretend this function and ON_SubDimple do not exist.
7836  Returns:
7837  Something that you are pretending does not exist.
7838  Remarks:
7839  It is intentional that the definition of ON_SubDimple class is not
7840  available in the opennurbs library interface (not in a header file).
7841  The size and design of ON_SubDimple will change constantly.
7842  If you choose to hack and whack so you can dereference an
7843  ON_SubDimple* pointer, then your code will crash unpredictably.
7844  */
7845  const class ON_SubDimple* SubDimple() const;
7846  const class ON_SubDLevel& ActiveLevel() const;
7847  unsigned int SubDimpleUseCount() const;
7848 
7849  void ShareDimple(const ON_SubD&);
7850  void SwapDimple(ON_SubD&);
7851 
7852  void ShareDimple(const class ON_SubDMeshImpl&);
7853  void SwapDimple(class ON_SubDMeshImpl& );
7854 
7855 private:
7856  class ON_SubDimple* SubDimple(bool bCreateIfNeeded);
7857  class ON_SubDLevel const * ActiveLevelConstPointer() const;
7858  class ON_SubDLevel* ActiveLevelPointer();
7859 
7860  void CopyHelper(const ON_SubD&);
7861 
7862  public:
7863  /*
7864  Returns:
7865  True if every face has a nonzero PackId and a set PackRect.
7866  */
7867  bool FacesArePacked() const;
7868 
7869 #if defined(OPENNURBS_PLUS)
7870  public:
7871  /*
7872  Description:
7873  All faces are assigned a PackId.
7874  Quad faces are divided into maximum sized rectangular grids and every face in the rectangular grid
7875  is assigned the same PackId.
7876  In addition, every face is assigned a distinct PackRect which is a sub-rectangle in (0,1)x(0,1).
7877  If quad faces are adjacent and have the same PackId, then their PactRects are also adjacent.
7878  Returns:
7879  Number of face packs.
7880  */
7881  unsigned int PackFaces();
7882 #endif
7883 
7884 private:
7885  friend class ON_SubDRef;
7886 #pragma ON_PRAGMA_WARNING_PUSH
7887 #pragma ON_PRAGMA_WARNING_DISABLE_MSC( 4251 )
7888  // C4251: ... needs to have dll-interface to be used by clients of class ...
7889  // m_subdimple_sp is private and all code that manages m_subdimple_sp is explicitly implemented in the DLL.
7890 private:
7891  std::shared_ptr<class ON_SubDimple> m_subdimple_sp;
7892 #pragma ON_PRAGMA_WARNING_POP
7893 
7894 public:
7895  // The ON_SubD code increments ON_SubD::ErrorCount everytime something
7896  // unexpected happens. This is useful for debugging.
7897  static unsigned int ErrorCount;
7898 };
7899 
7900 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
7901 //
7902 // ON_SubDRef
7903 //
7904 class ON_CLASS ON_SubDRef
7905 {
7906 #if defined(ON_SUBD_CENSUS)
7907 private:
7908  ON_SubDRefCensusCounter m_census_counter;
7909 #endif
7910 
7911 public:
7912  static const ON_SubDRef Empty;
7913 
7914  ON_SubDRef() ON_NOEXCEPT;
7915  ~ON_SubDRef();
7916  ON_SubDRef(const ON_SubDRef& src) ON_NOEXCEPT;
7917  ON_SubDRef& operator=(const ON_SubDRef& src);
7918 
7919 #if defined(ON_HAS_RVALUEREF)
7920  // rvalue copy constructor
7921  ON_SubDRef( ON_SubDRef&& ) ON_NOEXCEPT;
7922  // rvalue assignment operator
7923  ON_SubDRef& operator=( ON_SubDRef&& );
7924 #endif
7925 
7926  const class ON_SubD& SubD() const;
7927 
7928  /*
7929  Returns:
7930  Number of references to the managed ON_SubD, including the one by this ON_SubDRef.
7931  */
7932  unsigned int ReferenceCount() const;
7933 
7934  /*
7935  Description:
7936  Allocates a new empty ON_SubD and has this ON_SubDRef reference it.
7937  */
7938  class ON_SubD& NewSubD();
7939 
7940  /*
7941  Description:
7942  Allocates a new ON_SubD and has this ON_SubDRef reference it.
7943  Parameters:
7944  src - [in]
7945  The new ON_SubD managed by this ON_SubDRef will be a copy of src.SubD().
7946  Returns:
7947  A reference to the new ON_SubD managed by this ON_SubDRef.
7948  */
7949  class ON_SubD& CopySubD(
7950  const ON_SubDRef& src
7951  );
7952 
7953  /*
7954  Description:
7955  Allocates a new ON_SubD and has this ON_SubDRef reference it.
7956  Parameters:
7957  src - [in]
7958  The new ON_SubD managed by this ON_SubDRef will be a copy of src.
7959  Returns:
7960  A reference to the new ON_SubD managed by this ON_SubDRef.
7961  */
7962  class ON_SubD& CopySubD(
7963  const ON_SubD& src
7964  );
7965 
7966  /*
7967  Description:
7968  If ReferenceCount() > 1, then have this ON_SubDRef reference a
7969  new copy. Otherwise do nothing. The result being that this will
7970  be the unique reference to the ON_SubD managed by this ON_SubDRef.
7971  Returns:
7972  A reference to the ON_SubD uniquely managed by this ON_SubDRef.
7973  */
7974  class ON_SubD& UniqueSubD();
7975 
7976  /*
7977  Description:
7978  Remove this reference to the managed ON_SubD.
7979  If this is the last reference, then the managed ON_SubD is deleted.
7980  */
7981  void Clear();
7982 
7983 public:
7984  class ON_SubDVertexIterator VertexIterator() const;
7985  class ON_SubDEdgeIterator EdgeIterator() const;
7986  class ON_SubDFaceIterator FaceIterator() const;
7987 
7988  /*
7989  Description:
7990  Expert user function to have this ON_SubDRef manage the lifetime of subd.
7991  Parameters:
7992  subd - [in/out]
7993  subd must point to an ON_SubD that was constructed on the heap using
7994  an operator new call with a public ON_SubD constructor.
7995  Returns:
7996  a pointer to the managed subd or nullptr subd in not valid.
7997  Example:
7998  ON_SubD* subd = new ON_SubD(...);
7999  ON_SubDRef subr;
8000  ON_SubD* managed_subd = subdr.SetSubD(subd);
8001  // subd = nullptr
8002  // managed_subd = pointer you can use
8003  */
8004  class ON_SubD* SetSubDForExperts(
8005  class ON_SubD*& subd
8006  );
8007 
8008  /*
8009  Description:
8010  Expert user function to have this ON_SubDRef reference the
8011  contents of an existing ON_SubD.
8012  Do not use if user data on the referenced subd needs to be accessed.
8013  Parameters:
8014  subd - [in]
8015  Any subd on the heap or the stack.
8016  Returns:
8017  true if successful.
8018  */
8019  static ON_SubDRef CreateReferenceForExperts(
8020  const ON_SubD& subd
8021  );
8022 
8023 private:
8024  /*
8025  Description:
8026  Expert user function to have this ON_SubDRef reference the
8027  contents of an existing ON_SubD.
8028  Do not use if user data on the referenced subd needs to be accessed.
8029  Parameters:
8030  subd - [in]
8031  Any subd on the heap or the stack.
8032  */
8033  ON_SubDRef(
8034  const class ON_SubD& subd
8035  );
8036 
8037 private:
8038 #pragma ON_PRAGMA_WARNING_PUSH
8039 #pragma ON_PRAGMA_WARNING_DISABLE_MSC( 4251 )
8040  // C4251: ... needs to have dll-interface to be used by clients of class ...
8041  // m_subd_sp is private and all code that manages m_subd_sp is explicitly implemented in the DLL.
8042 private:
8043  std::shared_ptr<class ON_SubD> m_subd_sp;
8044 #pragma ON_PRAGMA_WARNING_POP
8045 };
8046 
8047 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
8048 //
8049 // ON_SubDComponentList
8050 //
8051 class ON_CLASS ON_SubDComponentList
8052 {
8053 public:
8054  ON_SubDComponentList() = default;
8055  ~ON_SubDComponentList() = default;
8056  ON_SubDComponentList(const ON_SubDComponentList&);
8057  ON_SubDComponentList& operator=(const ON_SubDComponentList&);
8058 
8059 public:
8060  static const ON_SubDComponentList Empty;
8061 
8062 public:
8063  unsigned CreateFromMarkedComponents(const ON_SubD& subd, bool bComponentInListMark);
8064  unsigned CreateFromMarkedVertices(const ON_SubD& subd, bool bVertexInListMark);
8065  unsigned CreateFromMarkedEdges(const ON_SubD& subd, bool bEdgeInListMark);
8066  unsigned CreateFromMarkedFaces(const ON_SubD& subd, bool bFaceInListMark);
8067 
8068  unsigned CreateFromComponentList(const ON_SubD& subd, const ON_SimpleArray<ON_COMPONENT_INDEX>& component_list);
8069  unsigned CreateFromComponentList(const ON_SubD& subd, const ON_SimpleArray<ON_SubDComponentPtr>& component_list);
8070 
8071  unsigned CreateFromVertexIdList(const ON_SubD& subd, const ON_SimpleArray<unsigned>& free_vertex_ids);
8072  unsigned CreateFromVertexList(const ON_SubD& subd, const ON_SimpleArray<ON_SubDVertexPtr>& free_vertices);
8073  unsigned CreateFromVertexList(const ON_SubD& subd, const ON_SimpleArray<const ON_SubDVertex*>& free_vertices);
8074 
8075  void Destroy();
8076 
8077  /*
8078  Returns:
8079  Number of removed components.
8080  */
8081  unsigned int RemoveAllComponents();
8082 
8083  /*
8084  Returns:
8085  Number of removed components.
8086  */
8087  unsigned int RemoveAllVertices();
8088 
8089  /*
8090  Returns:
8091  Number of removed components.
8092  */
8093  unsigned int RemoveAllEdges();
8094 
8095  /*
8096  Returns:
8097  Number of removed components.
8098  */
8099  unsigned int RemoveAllFaces();
8100 
8101  /*
8102  Returns:
8103  SubD runtime serial number.
8104  */
8105  ON__UINT64 SubDRuntimeSerialNumber() const;
8106 
8107  /*
8108  Returns:
8109  SubD content serial number when this list was created or the last
8110  time UpdateContentSerialNumbers() was run.
8111  */
8112  ON__UINT64 SubDGeometryContentSerialNumber() const;
8113 
8114  /*
8115  Returns:
8116  SubD content serial number when this list was created or the last
8117  time UpdateContentSerialNumbers() was run.
8118  */
8119  ON__UINT64 SubDRenderContentSerialNumber() const;
8120 
8121  unsigned int Count() const;
8122 
8123  /*
8124  operator[] returns ON_SubDComponentPtr::Null when index is out of bounds.
8125  */
8126  const ON_SubDComponentPtr operator[](int) const;
8127  const ON_SubDComponentPtr operator[](unsigned int) const;
8128  const ON_SubDComponentPtr operator[](ON__INT64) const;
8129  const ON_SubDComponentPtr operator[](ON__UINT64) const;
8130 #if defined(ON_RUNTIME_APPLE)
8131  const ON_SubDComponentPtr operator[](size_t) const;
8132 #endif
8133 
8134  const ON_SimpleArray< ON_SubDComponentPtr >& ComponentList() const;
8135 
8136  const ON_SubD& SubD() const;
8137 
8138  /*
8139  Description:
8140  Update the saved subd geometry and render content serial number to the current values
8141  of SubD().GeometryContentSerialNumber() and SubD().RenderContentSerialNumber().
8142  */
8143  void UpdateContentSerialNumbers();
8144 
8145  /*
8146  Description:
8147  Change the component list to reference components in a different subd.
8148  Parameters:
8149  new_subd - [in]
8150  subd to replace current referenced subd
8151  bUpdateDeletedComponents - [in]
8152  false: current components that are deleted will be ignored.
8153  true: if the corresponding component in new_sub is not deleted, it
8154  will be added to the list.
8155  Returns:
8156  Number of components in list after updating.
8157  */
8158  unsigned int UpdateSubDForExperts(const ON_SubD& subd, bool bUpdateDeletedComponents);
8159 
8160 
8161 private:
8162  unsigned Internal_Create(
8163  const ON_SubD& subd,
8164  bool bAddVertices,
8165  bool bAddEdges,
8166  bool bAddFaces,
8167  bool bComponentInListMark,
8168  unsigned marked_component_count
8169  );
8170 
8171  unsigned Internal_RemoveComponents(
8172  bool bRemoveVertices,
8173  bool bRemoveEdges,
8174  bool bRemoveFaces
8175  );
8176 
8177 private:
8178  ON__UINT64 m_subd_runtime_serial_number = 0;
8179  ON__UINT64 m_subd_geometry_content_serial_number = 0;
8180  ON__UINT64 m_subd_render_content_serial_number = 0;
8181 
8182  unsigned m_subd_vertex_count = 0;
8183  unsigned m_subd_edge_count = 0;
8184  unsigned m_subd_face_count = 0;
8185  unsigned m_reserved = 0;
8186 
8187 private:
8188  ON_SubD m_subd; // keeps subd dimple in scope while m_component_list[] is active
8189  ON_SimpleArray< ON_SubDComponentPtr > m_component_list;
8190 };
8191 
8192 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
8193 //
8194 // ON_SubDComponentMarksClearAndRestore
8195 //
8196 class ON_SubDComponentMarksClearAndRestore
8197 {
8198 public:
8199  // Constructor saves current component RuntimeMark() settings and then clears them.
8200  ON_SubDComponentMarksClearAndRestore(
8201  const ON_SubD& subd
8202  );
8203 
8204  // Destructor restores saved marks.
8205  ~ON_SubDComponentMarksClearAndRestore();
8206 
8207  /*
8208  Description:
8209  Restore marks saved by the constructor.
8210  Parameters:
8211  bDisableFutureRestores - [in]
8212  If true, no additional restores, including by the destructor, will occur.
8213  */
8214  bool Restore(
8215  bool bDisableFutureRestores
8216  );
8217 
8218  // Call DisableRestore() to prevent the destructor from restoring saved marks.
8219  void DisableRestore();
8220 
8221  const ON_SimpleArray< const class ON_SubDComponentBase* >& ComponentList() const;
8222 
8223 private:
8224  ON_SubD m_subd;
8225 
8226  ON_SimpleArray< const class ON_SubDComponentBase* > m_component_list;
8227 
8228  bool m_bRestore = true;
8229  unsigned char m_reserved1 = 0;
8230  unsigned char m_reserved2 = 0;
8231  unsigned char m_reserved3 = 0;
8232  unsigned int m_reserved4 = 0;
8233 
8234 private:
8235  ON_SubDComponentMarksClearAndRestore(const ON_SubDComponentMarksClearAndRestore&) = delete;
8236  ON_SubDComponentMarksClearAndRestore& operator=(const ON_SubDComponentMarksClearAndRestore&) = delete;
8237 };
8238 
8239 
8240 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
8241 //
8242 // ON_SubDSectorType
8243 //
8244 class ON_CLASS ON_SubDSectorType
8245 {
8246 public:
8247  ON_SubDSectorType() = default;
8248  ON_SubDSectorType(const ON_SubDSectorType&) = default;
8249  ON_SubDSectorType& operator=(const ON_SubDSectorType&) = default;
8250 
8251  static const ON_SubDSectorType Empty;
8252 
8253  bool IsValid() const;
8254 
8255  unsigned int SectorTypeHash() const;
8256 
8257  static int Compare(const ON_SubDSectorType*, const ON_SubDSectorType*);
8258 
8259 
8260  /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
8261  //
8262  // Sector Coefficients
8263  //
8264  /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
8265  //
8266  // In the comment below,
8267  // F = number of faces in the sector,
8268  // E = number of edges in the sector.
8269  //
8270  // There are five valid sector configurations of edges and faces. In all
8271  // configurations, the edges have one end at the center vertex and the
8272  // faces have one corner at the center vertex.
8273  //
8274  // SMOOTH
8275  // 1) The center vertex is smooth.
8276  // 2) F >= 2
8277  // 3) E = F
8278  // 4) Every edge is smooth.
8279  // 5) Every edge is an edge of two different faces in the sector.
8280  //
8281  // DART
8282  // 1) The center vertex is a dart.
8283  // 2) F >= 2
8284  // 3) E = F
8285  // 4) One edge is a crease.
8286  // 5) The crease edge is an edge of two geometrically adjacent sector faces.
8287  //
8288  // DART* (The same as "DART", but the crease edge has been duplicated.)
8289  // 1) The center vertex is a dart.
8290  // 2) F >= 2
8291  // 3) E = F+1
8292  // 4) Two edges are creases that have the same end locations.
8293  // 5) Each crease edge is an edge of a single face in the sector,
8294  // these faces are different and are geometrically adjacent.
8295  //
8296  // BOUNDED
8297  // 1) The center vertex is a crease or corner vertex.
8298  // 2) F >= 2
8299  // 3) E = F+1
8300  // 4) Two edges are crease edges that have different vertices at their ends.
8301  // 5) Each crease edge is an edge of a single face in the sector,
8302  // these faces are different and not geometrically adjacent.
8303  //
8304  // BOUNDED*
8305  // 1) The center vertex is a crease or corner vertex.
8306  // 2) F = 1
8307  // 3) E = 2
8308  // 4) The edges are crease edges that have different vertices at their ends.
8309  // 5) The edges a edges of the face.
8310  //
8311  /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
8312  //
8313  // The sector weight is used when subdividing smooth edges in sectors
8314  // with a DART, DART* or BOUNDED configuration. In these cases the
8315  // sector weight is a value strictly between 0.0 and 1.0 that depends on
8316  // 1) the center vertex tag (crease, corner or dart),
8317  // 2) the value of F,
8318  // 3) and when the center vertex is a corner, the angle between
8319  // the boundary edges.
8320  //
8321  // The sector weight is ignored when dividing smooth edges in SMOOTH sectors.
8322  // The sector weight is ignored when subdividing crease edges.
8323  //
8324  // For a smooth edge in a sector with a DART, DART* or BOUNDED configuration,
8325  // with w = sector weight, C = location of the center vertex
8326  // and P = location of the smooth vertex at the other end
8327  // of the smooth edge, the point
8328  //
8329  // Q = 3/4 * (w*C + (1-w)*P)
8330  //
8331  // is the contribution of C and P to the edge's subdivision point.
8332  //
8333  // When a smooth edge has smooth vertices at both ends located
8334  // at A and B, the contribution of A and B to the edge's subdivision
8335  // point is
8336  //
8337  // Q = 3/8 * (A + B) = 3/4 * (1/2*A + 1/2*B)
8338  //
8339  // A crease edge's subdivision point is alwasy the edge's midpoint.
8340  /*
8341  Description:
8342  Calculates sector weight value for the sector type
8343  identified by this ON_SubDSectorType.
8344  Returns:
8345  w: 0.0 <= w < 1.0
8346  w = sector theta value.
8347  ON_SubDSectorType::ErrorSectorCoefficient
8348  This ON_SubDSectorType is not valid and the calculation failed.
8349  */
8350  double SectorCoefficient() const;
8351 
8352 
8353  unsigned int FacetEdgeCount() const;
8354 
8355  ON_SubDVertexTag VertexTag() const;
8356 
8357 
8358  unsigned int EdgeCount() const;
8359 
8360  unsigned int FaceCount() const;
8361 
8362  /*
8363  Returns:
8364  Number of points in the point ring.
8365  For quad subds, this is 1 + FaceCount() + EdgeCount().
8366  For tri subds, this is 1 + EdgeCount().
8367  */
8368  unsigned int PointRingCount() const;
8369 
8370  /*
8371  Returns:
8372  1 + FaceCount() + EdgeCount()
8373  */
8374  unsigned int ComponentRingCount() const;
8375 
8376  /*
8377  Returns:
8378  If the sector vertex tag is ON_SubDVertexTag::Corner,
8379  the angle between the corner crease boundary edges is
8380  returned.
8381  Otherwise, ON_SubDSectorType::ErrorCornerSectorAngle is returned.
8382  */
8383  double CornerSectorAngleRadians() const;
8384 
8385  /*
8386  Returns:
8387  a value >= 0 and <= ON_SubDSectorType::MaximumCornerAngleIndex
8388  */
8389  unsigned int CornerSectorAngleIndex() const;
8390 
8391  /*
8392  Description:
8393  An angle index value of ON_SubDSectorType::MaximumCornerAngleIndex indicates
8394  the angle is 2pi radians.
8395  */
8396  enum : unsigned int
8397  {
8398  MaximumCornerAngleIndex = 72
8399  };
8400 
8401  // ON_SubDSectorType::MinimumCornerAngleRadians = (2.0*ON_PI)/((double)(ON_SubDSectorType::MaximumCornerAngleIndex));
8402  static const double MinimumCornerAngleRadians;
8403 
8404  // ON_SubDSectorType::MaximumCornerAngleRadians = 2.0*ON_PI - ON_SubDSectorType::MinimumCornerAngleRadians;
8405  static const double MaximumCornerAngleRadians;
8406 
8407  /*
8408  Parameters:
8409  angle_radians - [in] (0.0 <= angle_radians <= 2*ON_PI)
8410  The angle between the bounding crease edges
8411  Returns:
8412  If angle_radians is valid input, then the value angle_index is returned.
8413  The value angle_index is selected so that
8414  (0 < angle_index < ON_SubDSectorType::MaximumCornerSectorIndex) and
8415  fabs(angle_index*angle_quantum - angle_radians) is as small as possible, where
8416  angle_quantum = (2.0*ON_PI)/ON_SubDSectorType::MaximumCornerSectorIndex.
8417  Otherwise ON_UNSET_UINT_INDEX is returned.
8418  */
8419  static unsigned int CornerAngleIndexFromCornerAngleRadians(
8420  double angle_radians
8421  );
8422 
8423  /*
8424  Convert and angle index into radians
8425  Parameters:
8426  corner_angle_index - [in]
8427  0 to ON_SubDSectorType::MaximumCornerAngleIndex.
8428  Returns:
8429  If angle_index is valid, the corresponding angle in radians is returned.
8430  = (angle_index / ((double)ON_SubDSectorType::MaximumCornerAngleIndex)) * ON_2PI
8431  Otherwise ON_UNSET_VALUE is returned.
8432  */
8433  static double AngleRadiansFromCornerAngleIndex(
8434  unsigned int corner_angle_index
8435  );
8436 
8437  /*
8438  Returns:
8439  True if this is a smooth interior vertex sector
8440  */
8441  bool IsSmoothSector() const;
8442 
8443 
8444  /*
8445  Returns:
8446  True if this is a dart interior vertex sector
8447  */
8448  bool IsDartSector() const;
8449 
8450 
8451  /*
8452  Returns:
8453  True if this is a crease vertex sector
8454  */
8455  bool IsCreaseSector() const;
8456 
8457  /*
8458  Returns:
8459  True if this is a corner vertex sector
8460  */
8461  bool IsCornerSector() const;
8462 
8463  /*
8464  Returns:
8465  True if this is a convex corner vertex sector (sector angle <= pi)
8466  */
8467  bool IsConvexCornerSector() const;
8468 
8469  /*
8470  Returns:
8471  True if this is a concave corner vertex sector (sector angle > pi)
8472  */
8473  bool IsConcaveCornerSector() const;
8474 
8475  /*
8476  Parameters:
8477  sector_boundary_edge0_ptr - [in]
8478  sector_boundary_edge1_ptr - [in]
8479  Crease edges that bound the sector containing the smooth edge.
8480  The edge direction must identify the corner vertex.
8481  corner vertex = sector_boundary_edge0_ptr.RelativeVertex(0) = sector_boundary_edge1_ptr.RelativeVertex(0)
8482  Returns:
8483  tagged end angle for a smooth edge that
8484  1) ends at a vertex tagged on ON_SubDVertexTag::Corner
8485  2) has two adjacent faces.
8486  3) lies in a sector bounded by 2 distinct crease edges.
8487  */
8488  static double CornerSectorAngleRadiansFromEdges(
8489  ON_SubDEdgePtr sector_boundary_edge0_ptr,
8490  ON_SubDEdgePtr sector_boundary_edge1_ptr
8491  );
8492 
8493  static bool IsValidCornerSectorAngleRadians(
8494  double corner_sector_angle_radians
8495  );
8496 
8497  static double ClampCornerSectorAngleRadians(
8498  double corner_sector_angle_radians
8499  );
8500 
8501  /*
8502  Returns:
8503  Number of subdivision points in a sector ring
8504  facet_type vertex_tag ring count
8505  tri smooth N+1
8506  tri crease N+2
8507  quad smooth 2N+1
8508  quad crease 2N+2
8509  (2 * valence + 1) for quad subds
8510  (valence + 1) for tri subds
8511  */
8512  static unsigned int SectorPointRingCountFromEdgeCount(
8513  ON_SubDVertexTag vertex_tag,
8514  unsigned int sector_edge_count
8515  );
8516 
8517  static unsigned int SectorPointRingCountFromFaceCount(
8518  ON_SubDVertexTag vertex_tag,
8519  unsigned int sector_face_count
8520  );
8521 
8522  static unsigned int SectorFaceCountFromEdgeCount(
8523  ON_SubDVertexTag vertex_tag,
8524  unsigned int sector_edge_count
8525  );
8526 
8527  static unsigned int SectorEdgeCountFromFaceCount(
8528  ON_SubDVertexTag vertex_tag,
8529  unsigned int sector_face_count
8530  );
8531 
8532  static unsigned int MinimumSectorEdgeCount(
8533  ON_SubDVertexTag vertex_tag
8534  );
8535 
8536  static unsigned int MinimumSectorFaceCount(
8537  ON_SubDVertexTag vertex_tag
8538  );
8539 
8540 public:
8541  /*
8542  Returns:
8543  ON_SubDSectorType::IgnoredSectorCoefficient
8544  */
8545  static double SmoothSectorCoefficient();
8546 
8547  /*
8548  Parameters:
8549  face_type - [in]
8550  sector_face_count - [in]
8551  number of faces in the smooth sector.
8552  Returns:
8553  0:
8554  failed to caclulate weight
8555  ON_SubDSectorType::UnsetSectorCoefficient:
8556  This typically happens when a SubD control net is being
8557  created and a facet type is not specified.
8558  The weights will be calculated at the first subdivision.
8559  0 < w < 1:
8560  1/2 + 1/3*cos(tagged end angle) for quadrangle facets
8561  1/3 + 1/3*cos(tagged end angle) for triangle facets
8562  Remarks:
8563  This is a useful tool when calling AddEdge while a subdivision
8564  level is being constructed.
8565  */
8566  static double CreaseSectorCoefficient(
8567  unsigned int sector_face_count
8568  );
8569 
8570  static double DartSectorCoefficient(
8571  unsigned int sector_face_count
8572  );
8573 
8574  static double CornerSectorCoefficient(
8575  unsigned int sector_face_count,
8576  double corner_sector_angle_radians
8577  );
8578 
8579  // This value is is used to set sector angles when the
8580  // actual value is not needed. This occurs at both ends
8581  // of a creased edge and when the end of a smooth edge
8582  // is a smooth vertex.
8583  static const double IgnoredCornerSectorAngle; // = 0.0;
8584 
8585  // This value is used to set sector weights that could not be
8586  // correctly set because something in the calculation failed.
8587  // It is typically used when an invalid component in SubD object
8588  // was needed to calculate the weight.
8589  static const double UnsetCornerSectorAngle; // = -8881.0;
8590 
8591  // This value is indicate a corner sector angle calculation failed.
8592  static const double ErrorCornerSectorAngle; // = -9991.0;
8593 
8594 
8595  // This value is used for smooth sector thetas
8596  static const double SmoothSectorTheta; // = 0.5*ON_PI
8597 
8598  // This value is used to indicate a sector theta needs to be set
8599  static const double UnsetSectorTheta; // = -8882.0;
8600 
8601  // This value is used to indicate a sector theta calculation failed.
8602  static const double ErrorSectorTheta; // = -9992.0;
8603 
8604 
8605  // This value is is used to set edge sector coefficients when the
8606  // actual value is not needed. This occurs at both ends
8607  // of a creased edge and when the end of a smooth edge
8608  // is a smooth vertex.
8609  static const double IgnoredSectorCoefficient; // = 0.0;
8610 
8611  // This value is used to mark edge sector coefficients that need to be
8612  // set in the future when more information is available.
8613  // It is typically used when creating a subD control net
8614  // and the facet type is not known. Any value < 0.0 and not
8615  // equal to ON_UNSET_VALUE would work. The fact that the actual
8616  // value is -999.0 has no other significance.
8617  static const double UnsetSectorCoefficient; // = -8883.0;
8618 
8619  // This value indicates an edge sector coefficient calculation failed.
8620  static const double ErrorSectorCoefficient; // = -9993.0;
8621 
8622  static bool IsValidSectorCoefficientValue(
8623  double weight_value,
8624  bool bAllowUnsetTaggedEndCoefficient
8625  );
8626 
8627  /*
8628  Returns:
8629  ON_SubDSectorType::ErrorSectorCoefficient and calls debug breakpoint
8630  */
8631  static double SectorCoefficientCalculationError();
8632 
8633 
8634  /*
8635  Description:
8636  Create a ON_SubDSectorType from a ON_SubDSectorIterator.
8637  Parameters:
8638  subd_type - [in]
8639  vertex_tag - [in]
8640  sector_face_count - [in]
8641  Number of faces in the sector.
8642  corner_sector_angle_radians - [in]
8643  If vertex_tag is ON_SubDVertexTag::Corner, this
8644  parameter is the angle between the crease edges
8645  that bound the corner.
8646  If vertex_tag is not ON_SubDVertexTag::Corner,
8647  this parameter is ignored.
8648  Returns:
8649  An ON_SubDSectorType for the case the input parameters
8650  identify.
8651  */
8652  static ON_SubDSectorType Create(
8653  ON_SubDVertexTag vertex_tag,
8654  unsigned int sector_face_count,
8655  double corner_sector_angle_radians
8656  );
8657 
8658 
8659  /*
8660  Description:
8661  Create a ON_SubDSectorType from a ON_SubDSectorIterator.
8662  Parameters:
8663  subd_type - [in]
8664  sit - [in]
8665  Returns:
8666  An ON_SubDSectorType for the sector identified by sit.
8667  */
8668  static ON_SubDSectorType Create(
8669  const ON_SubDSectorIterator& sit
8670  );
8671 
8672  /*
8673  Description:
8674  Create a ON_SubDSectorType for the sector containing the face.
8675  Parameters:
8676  subd_type - [in]
8677  face - [in]
8678  face_vertex_index - [in]
8679  face->Vertex(face_vertex_index) will be the sector's
8680  center vertex.
8681  Returns:
8682  An ON_SubDSectorType for the sector containing the face.
8683  */
8684  static ON_SubDSectorType Create(
8685  const class ON_SubDFace* face,
8686  unsigned int face_vertex_index
8687  );
8688 
8689  static ON_SubDSectorType Create(
8690  const class ON_SubDFace* face,
8691  const class ON_SubDVertex* vertex
8692  );
8693 
8694  /*
8695  Description:
8696  Create a ON_SubDSectorType for the sector containing the edge.
8697  Parameters:
8698  subd_type - [in]
8699  edge - [in]
8700  edge_vertex_index - [in]
8701  edge->Vertex(edge_vertex_index) will be the sector's
8702  center vertex.
8703  Returns:
8704  An ON_SubDSectorType for the sector containing the edge.
8705  */
8706  static ON_SubDSectorType Create(
8707  const class ON_SubDEdge* edge,
8708  unsigned int edge_vertex_index
8709  );
8710 
8711  /*
8712  Description:
8713  Create a smooth ON_SubDSectorType.
8714  Parameters:
8715  subd_type - [in]
8716  sector_face_count - [in]
8717  Number of faces in the sector.
8718  Returns:
8719  An ON_SubDSectorType for the smooth sector case specified
8720  by the input parameters.
8721  */
8722  static ON_SubDSectorType CreateSmoothSectorType(
8723  unsigned int sector_face_count
8724  );
8725 
8726  /*
8727  Description:
8728  Create a crease ON_SubDSectorType.
8729  Parameters:
8730  subd_type - [in]
8731  sector_face_count - [in]
8732  Number of faces in the sector.
8733  Returns:
8734  An ON_SubDSectorType for the crease sector case specified
8735  by the input parameters.
8736  */
8737  static ON_SubDSectorType CreateCreaseSectorType(
8738  unsigned int sector_face_count
8739  );
8740 
8741  /*
8742  Description:
8743  Create a dart ON_SubDSectorType.
8744  Parameters:
8745  subd_type - [in]
8746  sector_face_count - [in]
8747  Number of faces in the sector.
8748  Returns:
8749  An ON_SubDSectorType for the dart sector case specified
8750  by the input parameters.
8751  */
8752  static ON_SubDSectorType CreateDartSectorType(
8753  unsigned int sector_face_count
8754  );
8755 
8756  /*
8757  Description:
8758  Create a corner ON_SubDSectorType.
8759  Parameters:
8760  subd_type - [in]
8761  sector_face_count - [in]
8762  Number of faces in the sector.
8763  corner_sector_angle_radians - [in]
8764  The angle between the crease edges that bound the corner.
8765  Returns:
8766  An ON_SubDSectorType for the corner sector case specified
8767  by the input parameters.
8768  */
8769  static ON_SubDSectorType CreateCornerSectorType(
8770  unsigned int sector_face_count,
8771  double sector_corner_angle_radians
8772  );
8773 
8774  static int Compare(
8775  const ON_SubDSectorType& a,
8776  const ON_SubDSectorType& b
8777  );
8778 
8779 
8780  /*
8781  Description:
8782  Get the subdivision matrix for the default subdivison algorithms
8783  used by ON_SubD.
8784 
8785  The matrix coefficents are ordered so that the matrix acts on
8786  the left of the points returned by ON_SubDSectorIterator::GetVertexRing().
8787 
8788  For an interior vertex (smooth or dart), the coefficents are ordered
8789  so that one iteration of subdivision is given by:
8790  S*Transpose(V, E[0], F[0], E[1], F[1], ..., E[N-1], F[N-1]).
8791  For a dart vertex, E[0] is the point at the end of the creased edge.
8792 
8793 
8794  For a boundary vertex (crease or corner), the coefficents are ordered
8795  so that one iteration of subdivision is given by:
8796  S*Transpose(V, E[0], F[0], E[1], F[1], ..., F[N-2], E[N-1]).
8797 
8798  N = edge valence = number of edges in the sector.
8799  E[i] = end of i-th edge radiating from V.
8800  F[i] = point on the quad that is opposite V.
8801  The edges and faces are ordered radially so that the face for F[i]
8802  lies between the edges for E[i] and E[(i+1)%N].
8803 
8804  Parameters:
8805  S - [out]
8806  subdivision matrix
8807  Matrix coefficent (i,j) = S[i][j]
8808  0 <= i < R, 0 <= j < R, R = ON_SubDSectorType.PointRingCount()
8809  matrix_capacity - [in]
8810  S[] can store any RxR matrix with R <= matrix_capacity.
8811 
8812  Returns:
8813  R > 0:
8814  R = PointRingCount() and S is the RxR subdivision matrix for the sector type.
8815  0: Invalid input
8816  */
8817  unsigned int GetSubdivisionMatrix(
8818  double** S,
8819  size_t matrix_capacity
8820  ) const;
8821 
8822  /*
8823  Parameters:
8824  S - [out]
8825  subdivision matrix.
8826  Matrix coefficent (i,j) = S[i*R + j],
8827  0 <= i < R, 0 <= j < R, R = ON_SubDSectorType.PointRingCount()
8828  S_capacity - [in]
8829  Number of elements in S[] array
8830  Returns:
8831  0: Invalid input.
8832  >0: Number of rows and columns in S.
8833  This number is always ON_SubDSectorType.PointRingCount().
8834  */
8835  unsigned int GetSubdivisionMatrix(
8836  double* S,
8837  size_t S_capacity
8838  ) const;
8839 
8840  /*
8841  Description:
8842  All the subdivision matrices for the ON_SubD built-in
8843  subdivision algorithms have eigenvalues (1, lambda1, lambda2, e4, ..., eR),
8844  where 1 > lambda1 >= lambda2 > |e4| >= ... >= |eR| > 0.
8845 
8846  The subdominant eigenvalue is lambda1 and,
8847  with one exception, lambda1 = lambda2.
8848  The exception is described in the description of
8849  ON_SubDSectorType::SubdominantEigenvalueMulitiplicity().
8850 
8851  Returns:
8852  > 0.0:
8853  The subdominant eigenvalue for the subdivision matrix.
8854 
8855  ON_UNSET_VALUE:
8856  This ON_SubDSectorType is not valid.
8857  */
8858  double SubdominantEigenvalue() const;
8859 
8860  /*
8861  Returns:
8862  0:
8863  The sector type is not set.
8864 
8865  2:
8866  The subdominant eigenvalue has algebraic and geometric multiplicty = 2.
8867  This is the most common case.
8868 
8869  1:
8870  The subdominant eigenvalue has algebraic and geometric multiplicty = 1.
8871  This occures in Catmull-Clark subdivision at a crease vertex with
8872  two crease edges and a single face. The subdivision matrix for this
8873  case is
8874  S is a 4 x 4 matrix with rows =
8875  (3/4, 1/8, 0, 1/8),
8876  (1/2, 1/2, 0, 0),
8877  (1/4, 1/4, 1/4, 1/4),
8878  (1/2, 0, 0, 1/2).
8879  S has 4 real eigenvalues = (1, 1/2, 1/4, 1/4), all wtih
8880  geometric multiplicity = 1.
8881  The three eigenvectors are
8882  (1, 1, 1, 1), (0, -1, 0, 1), (0, 0, 1, 0).
8883  */
8884  unsigned int SubdominantEigenvalueMulitiplicity() const;
8885 
8886  /*
8887  Description:
8888  With one exception, which is described below,
8889  all the subdivision matrices for the ON_SubD built-in
8890  subdivision algorithms have eigenvalues (1, lambda, lambda, e4, ..., eR),
8891  where lambda is real, 1 > lambda > |e4| >= ... >= |eR| > 0, and the
8892  geometric dimension of the lambda eigenspace is 2 (there are two
8893  linearly independent lambda eigenvectors).
8894 
8895  The subdominant eigenvalue is lamda. This function returns an
8896  orthogonal basis, (E1, E2), for the subdominant eigenspace.
8897 
8898  An eigenvector for the dominant eigen value 1 has is (1,1,...,1).
8899  The domainant eignevector is orthogonal to the subdominant eigenspace.
8900 
8901  Put another way,
8902  0 = E1[0] + ... + E1[R-1]
8903  0 = E2[0] + ... + E2[R-1]
8904  0 = E1[0]*E2[0] + ... + E1[R-1]*E2[R-1]
8905 
8906  Exceptional case:
8907  The Catmull-Clark subdivision matrix for a crease vertex with
8908  two crease edges and a single face is a special case.
8909  In this exceptional, this function returns
8910  lambda = 1/2, E1 = {0,-1,0,-1} and E2 = {1, -2, -5, -2}.
8911  For more information about the exceptional case, see the description of
8912  ON_SubDSectorType::SubdominantEigenvalueMulitiplicity().
8913 
8914  Parameters:
8915  E1_capacity - [in]
8916  Capacity of the E1[] array.
8917  E1 - [out]
8918  E2_capacity - [in]
8919  Capacity of the E2[] array.
8920  E2 - [out]
8921  When E1_capacity > 0 and E2_capacity > 0, two orthoganal eigenvectors
8922  spanning the subdivision matrix subdominant eigenspace are returned
8923  in E1[] and E2[].
8924  If one of E1_capacity or E2_capacity is > 0, then both must be > 0.
8925 
8926  Returns:
8927  ON_UNSET_VALUE: Invalid input.
8928  e > 0.0 and e < 1.0:
8929  subdominant eigenvalue.
8930  */
8931  double GetSubdominantEigenvectors(
8932  double* E1,
8933  size_t E1_capacity,
8934  double* E2,
8935  size_t E2_capacity
8936  ) const;
8937 
8938  /*
8939  Parameters:
8940  LPev_capacity - [in]
8941  Capacity of the LPev[] array.
8942  LPev - [out]
8943  When LPev_capacity > 0, then the limit surface point evaluation coefficients are
8944  returned in LPev[]. Otherwise LPev is ignored.
8945  LT0ev_capacity - [in]
8946  Capacity of the LPev[] array.
8947  LT0ev - [out]
8948  LT1ev_capacity - [in]
8949  Capacity of the LPev[] array.
8950  LT1ev - [out]
8951  When LT0ev_capacity > 0 and LT1ev_capacity > 0, then the limit surface
8952  tangent coefficients are returned in LT0ev[] and LT1ev[]. Otherwise,
8953  LT0ev[] and LT1ev[] are ignored.
8954  If one of LT0ev_capacity or LT1ev_capacity is > 0, then both must be > 0.
8955  Returns:
8956  0: Invalid input.
8957  >0: Number of evaluation coefficients in the L*ev[] arrays.
8958  This number is always ON_SubDSectorType.PointRingCount().
8959  */
8960  unsigned int GetSurfaceEvaluationCoefficients(
8961  double* LPev,
8962  size_t LPev_capacity,
8963  double* LT0ev,
8964  size_t LT0ev_capacity,
8965  double* LT1ev,
8966  size_t LT1ev_capacity
8967  ) const;
8968 
8969  // SurfaceNormalSign() is a debugging tool - slow and not useful in general
8970  double SurfaceNormalSign() const;
8971 
8972  bool SurfaceEvaluationCoefficientsAvailable() const;
8973 
8974  /*
8975  Parameters:
8976  eigenvalues_capacity - [in]
8977  Capacity of the eigenvalues[] array.
8978  Must be 0 or >= PointRingCount()
8979  eigenvalues - [out]
8980  If 0 = eigenvalues_capacity, eigenvalues must be nullptr.
8981  If eigenvalues_capacity > 0, is specifies the capactiy
8982  of the eigenvalues[] array.
8983  Returns:
8984  R > 0:
8985  A complete set of eigenvalues is available for this sector type.
8986  The eigenvalues are (1, lambda, lambda, e3, ..., eR), where
8987  1 > lambda > e3 >= ... >= eR > 0.
8988  0:
8989  Invalid input or the eigenvalues for this sector typoe are not available.
8990  */
8991  unsigned int GetAllEigenvalues(
8992  double* eigenvalues,
8993  size_t eigenvalues_capacity
8994  );
8995 
8996  /////*
8997  ////Description:
8998  //// The subdivision matrix for all cases is known.
8999  //// A complete set of eigenvalues are available for some cases.
9000  ////Parameters:
9001  //// facet_type - [in]
9002  //// vertex_tag - [in]
9003  //// sector_edge_count - [in]
9004  //// The input parameters identify the subdivision case.
9005  ////Returns:
9006  //// R > 0: Eigenvalues are known. There subdivison matrix is R x R.
9007  //// 0: Eigenvalues for this case are not known.
9008  ////*/
9009  ////static unsigned int AllEigenvaluesAvailableKnown(
9010  //// ON_SubDVertexTag vertex_tag,
9011  //// unsigned int sector_edge_count
9012  //// );
9013 
9014  /*
9015  Description:
9016  Create a partial subdivison sector around vertex.
9017  The resulting ON_SubD has an outer ring with smooth edges and vertices,
9018  which is not valid as a stand-alone subd. This is typically used for
9019  testing.
9020  Parameters:
9021  radius - [in]
9022  The center vertex is located at (0,0,0),
9023  If radius > 0.0, then the end of the first edge is at (radius,0,0),
9024  subsequent edges are in a radial array and quad face points, if any,
9025  are 2*radius from the origin.
9026  sector_angle_radians - [in]
9027  If radius > 0,
9028  this->VertexTag() is ON_SubDVertexTag::Crease,
9029  crease_sector_angle_radians > 0.0 and
9030  crease_sector_angle_radians < 2.0*ON_PI,
9031  then this will be the angle between the crease boundary edges.
9032  In all other cases, crease_sector_angle_radians is ignored.
9033  subd - [in]
9034  If subd is not null, the vertex ring is put in this
9035  subd.
9036  Returns:
9037  a pointer to the vertex ring
9038  nullptr is returned if the input is not valid.
9039  */
9040  ON_SubD* SectorRingSubD(
9041  double radius,
9042  double sector_angle_radians,
9043  ON_SubD* subd
9044  ) const;
9045 
9046 private:
9047  ON_SubDVertexTag m_vertex_tag = ON_SubDVertexTag::Unset;
9048  unsigned char m_reserved1 = 0;
9049  unsigned short m_reserved2 = 0;
9050  unsigned int m_hash = 0; // SetHash() sets this field, SectorTypeHash() returns its value.
9051  unsigned int m_corner_sector_angle_index = 0; // >= 0 and <= ON_SubDSectorType::MaximumCornerAngleIndex
9052  unsigned int m_sector_face_count = 0;
9053  double m_sector_coefficient = 0.0;
9054  double m_sector_theta = 0.0;
9055  double m_corner_sector_angle_radians = 0.0;
9056 
9057 private:
9058  void SetHash();
9059 
9060  /*
9061  Description:
9062  Calculates sector theta value for the sector type
9063  identified by this ON_SubDSectorType.
9064  Returns:
9065  theta: 0.0 <= theta <= ON_PI
9066  The sector theta value.
9067  ON_SubDSectorType::ErrorSectorTheta
9068  This ON_SubDSectorType is not valid and the calculation failed.
9069  */
9070  double SectorTheta() const;
9071 
9072  /*
9073  Parameters:
9074  sector_face_count - [in] >= 1
9075  Number of faces in the crease sector.
9076  Returns:
9077  theta: 0.0 < theta <= ON_PI
9078  sector theta value for a crease sector with sector_face_count faces.
9079  ON_SubDSectorType::ErrorSectorTheta
9080  sector_face_count is not valid and the calculation failed.
9081  */
9082  static double CreaseSectorTheta(
9083  unsigned int sector_face_count
9084  );
9085 
9086  /*
9087  Parameters:
9088  sector_face_count - [in] >= 2
9089  Number of faces in the dart sector.
9090  Returns:
9091  theta: 0.0 < theta <= ON_PI
9092  sector theta value for a dart sector with sector_face_count faces.
9093  ON_SubDSectorType::ErrorSectorTheta
9094  sector_face_count is not valid and the calculation failed.
9095  */
9096  static double DartSectorTheta(
9097  unsigned int sector_face_count
9098  );
9099 
9100  /*
9101  Parameters:
9102  sector_face_count - [in] >= 2
9103  Number of faces in the dart sector.
9104  corner_sector_angle_radians - [in] (0.0 <= corner_sector_angle_radians <= 2*ON_PI
9105  The angle between the bounding crease edges
9106  Returns:
9107  theta: 0.0 < theta <= ON_PI/2
9108  sector theta value for the corner sector.
9109  ON_SubDSectorType::ErrorSectorTheta
9110  sector_face_count or corner_sector_angle_radians were not valid
9111  and the calculation failed.
9112  */
9113  static double CornerSectorThetaFromCornerAngle(
9114  unsigned int sector_face_count,
9115  double corner_sector_angle_radians
9116  );
9117 
9118  /*
9119  Parameters:
9120  sector_theta - [in] 0 < sector_theta <= 2*ON_PI
9121  value from one of the sector theta functions.
9122  ON_SubDEdge::SectorTheta()
9123  ON_SubDEdge::SmoothSectorTheta()
9124  ON_SubDEdge::CreaseSectorTheta()
9125  ON_SubDEdge::CornerSectorTheta()
9126  ON_SubDEdge::DartSectorTheta()
9127  Returns:
9128  0:
9129  failed to caclulate weight
9130  ON_SubDSectorType::ErrorSectorCoefficient:
9131  sector_theta is not valid.
9132  0 < w < 1:
9133  The returned value is
9134  1/2 + 1/3*cos(sector_angle_radians). (1/6 <= w <= 5/6)
9135  Remarks:
9136  This is a useful tool when calling AddEdge while a subdivision
9137  level is being constructed.
9138  */
9139  static double SectorCoefficientFromTheta(
9140  double sector_theta
9141  );
9142 };
9143 
9144 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
9145 //
9146 // ON_SubDMeshFragment
9147 //
9148 // Meshes of ON_SubD limit surface are calculated in fragments.
9149 //
9150 class ON_CLASS ON_SubDMeshFragmentGrid
9151 {
9152 public:
9153  // No construction for performance reasons.
9154  // use = ON_SubDMeshFragmentGrid::Empty
9155  // QuadGridFromSideSegmentCount(...)
9156  // or QuadGridFromDisplayDensity(...) to initialize.
9157  //
9158  //ON_SubDMeshFragmentGrid() = default;
9159  //~ON_SubDMeshFragmentGrid() = default;
9160  //ON_SubDMeshFragmentGrid(const ON_SubDMeshFragmentGrid&) = default;
9161  //ON_SubDMeshFragmentGrid& operator=(const ON_SubDMeshFragmentGrid&) = default;
9162 
9163 
9164  static const ON_SubDMeshFragmentGrid Empty;
9165 
9166  static const ON_SubDMeshFragmentGrid OneQuadGrid;
9167 
9168  /*
9169  Description:
9170  Get mesh facet quads that index into a grid of points.
9171  Parameters:
9172  side_segment_count - [in]
9173  number quads in each row and column of the quad grid.
9174  side_segment_count >= 1
9175  side_segment_count <= ON_SubDMesh::MaximumSideSegmentCount
9176  side_segment_count must be a power of 2
9177 
9178  level_of_detail - [in]
9179  0: quad count = maximum quad count = (side_count x side_count)
9180  1: quad count = 1/4 maximum quad count
9181  1: quad count = 1/16 maximum quad count
9182  ...
9183  If 4^level_of_detail > maximum quad count, then a single quad is returned.
9184  */
9185  static ON_SubDMeshFragmentGrid QuadGridFromSideSegmentCount(
9186  unsigned int side_segment_count,
9187  unsigned int level_of_detail
9188  );
9189 
9190  static ON_SubDMeshFragmentGrid QuadGridFromDisplayDensity(
9191  unsigned int display_density,
9192  unsigned int level_of_detail
9193  );
9194 
9195 private:
9196  /*
9197  Description:
9198  Get mesh facet quads that index into a grid of points.
9199  Parameters:
9200  side_segment_count - [in]
9201  number quads in each row and column of the quad grid
9202  with the highest level of detail (level_of_detail = 0)
9203  side_count must be a power of 2
9204  level_of_detail - [in]
9205  Desired level of detail of the returned grid
9206  0: highest (side_count x side_count) quads
9207  1: 1/4 density (side_count x side_count)/4 quads
9208  2: 1/16 density (side_count x side_count)/16 quads
9209  ...
9210  side_count-2: 4 quads
9211  side_count-1: 1 quad
9212  >= side_count: 1 quad
9213  Returns:
9214  Number of quads in the grid.
9215  */
9216  static unsigned int SetQuads(
9217  unsigned int side_segment_count,
9218  unsigned int level_of_detail,
9219  unsigned int* quads,
9220  size_t quad_capacity,
9221  size_t quad_stride,
9222  unsigned int* sides,
9223  size_t side_capacity,
9224  size_t side_stride
9225  );
9226 
9227 public:
9228  unsigned int SideSegmentCount() const;
9229 
9230  /*
9231  Returns:
9232  SideSegmentCount() + 1;
9233  */
9234  unsigned int SidePointCount() const;
9235 
9236  /*
9237  Description:
9238  The GridId() is persistent and unique based on the contents of the
9239  grid. It is intended to be used in render applications that store
9240  copies of ON_SubDMeshFragmentGrid settings in things like
9241  vertex object buffers and want a reliable way to index into them.
9242  The Empty grid has id = 0;
9243  Returns:
9244  0:
9245  when the grid is empty
9246  32*n + 2*lod + t:
9247  t = 0 for quads and 1 for tris,
9248  (0 <= n <= 8) m_F_count = 2^(2n),
9249  (0 <= lod <= 8) m_F_level_of_detail = lod
9250  Remarks:
9251  m_F_count is always
9252  */
9253  unsigned int GridId() const;
9254 
9255 
9256  unsigned int GridFaceCount() const;
9257 
9258  /*
9259  Returns:
9260  Total number of points in the grid = SidePointCount()*SidePointCount().
9261  */
9262  unsigned int GridPointCount() const;
9263 
9264  /*
9265  Parameters:
9266  grid_point_index - [in]
9267  0 <= grid_point_index < GridPointCount().
9268  grid_parameters = [out]
9269  normalize parameters for that point.
9270  These could be used in the role of surface evaluation parameters
9271  for texture mapping applications.
9272  Returns:
9273  True if grid_point_index was valid and grid_parameters was returned.
9274  */
9275  bool GetGridParameters(
9276  unsigned int grid_point_index,
9277  double grid_parameters[2]
9278  ) const;
9279 
9280  /*
9281  Parameters:
9282  grid_point_index - [in]
9283  0 <= grid_point_index < GridPointCount().
9284  Returns:
9285  Grid (i,j) for that grid_point_index.
9286  0 <= i < SidePointCount()
9287  0 <= j < SidePointCount()
9288  */
9289  const ON_2udex Grid2dexFromPointIndex(
9290  unsigned int grid_point_index
9291  ) const;
9292 
9293  /*
9294  Parameters:
9295  i - [in]
9296  0 <= i < SidePointCount()
9297  j - [in]
9298  0 <= j < SidePointCount()
9299  Returns:
9300  0 <= grid_point_index < GridPointCount().
9301  */
9302  unsigned int PointIndexFromGrid2dex(
9303  unsigned int i,
9304  unsigned int j
9305  ) const;
9306 
9307  /*
9308  Returns:
9309  A number between 0 and 8 or ON_UNSET_INT_INDEX.
9310  SideSegmentCount() = 2^DisplayDensity().
9311  */
9312  unsigned int DisplayDensity() const;
9313 
9314  unsigned int LevelOfDetail() const;
9315 
9316 private:
9317  unsigned char m_reserved;
9318 
9319 public:
9320  unsigned char m_reserved1 = 0;
9321  unsigned char m_side_segment_count; // = 2^n for non-empty grids (0 <= n <= 8)
9322  unsigned short m_F_count; // = m_side_segment_count*m_side_segment_count
9323  unsigned short m_F_level_of_detail; // 0 = highest, > 0 = reduced
9324  unsigned short m_F_stride;
9325  const unsigned int* m_F;
9326  const unsigned int* m_S; // [4*m_side_segment_count + 1] indices that form the polyline boundary.
9327  const ON_SubDMeshFragmentGrid* m_prev_level_of_detail; // nullptr or the previous level with more facets.
9328  const ON_SubDMeshFragmentGrid* m_next_level_of_detail; // nullptr or the next level with fewer facets.
9329 };
9330 
9331 class ON_CLASS ON_SubDMeshFragment
9332 {
9333 public:
9334  // No construction for performance reasons.
9335  // If you require initialization, use = ON_SubDMeshFragment::Empty
9336  //
9337  //ON_SubDMeshFragment() = default;
9338  //~ON_SubDMeshFragment() = default;
9339  //ON_SubDMeshFragment(const ON_SubDMeshFragment&) = default;
9340  //ON_SubDMeshFragment& operator=(const ON_SubDMeshFragment&) = default;
9341 
9342  bool CopyFrom( const ON_SubDMeshFragment& src_fragment );
9343 
9344  /*
9345  Parameters:
9346  src_fragment - [in]
9347  fragment to copy
9348  display_density - [in]
9349  The desired display density of the copy.
9350 
9351  If display_density = ON_UNSET_UINT_INDEX, then this->m_P_capacity must
9352  be at least srf_fragment.m_P_count, all points are copied, and
9353  this->m_grid = srf_fragment.m_grid.
9354 
9355  Otherwise, src_fragment must have enough points to provide
9356  the specified denisity and this must have enough
9357  point capacity to store the specified density.
9358 
9359  this - [out]
9360  This must have a point capacity large enough to accomodate the
9361  requested display density.
9362 
9363  */
9364  bool CopyFrom(
9365  const ON_SubDMeshFragment& src_fragment,
9366  unsigned int display_density
9367  );
9368 
9369  // Every field of ON_SubDMeshFragment::Empty is zero.
9370  static const ON_SubDMeshFragment Empty;
9371 
9372  enum : unsigned int
9373  {
9374  MaximumSideSegmentCount = (1U << ON_SubDDisplayParameters::MaximumDensity)
9375  };
9376 
9377  /*
9378  Returns:
9379  side_segment_count = 2^display_density
9380  */
9381  static unsigned int SideSegmentCountFromDisplayDensity(
9382  unsigned int display_density
9383  );
9384 
9385  /*
9386  Returns:
9387  base 2 log of side_segment_count.
9388  Remarks:
9389  side_segment_count = 2^display_density
9390  */
9391  static unsigned int DisplayDensityFromSideSegmentCount(
9392  unsigned int side_segment_count
9393  );
9394 
9395  /*
9396  Parameters:
9397  display_density - [in]
9398  >= 0
9399  Returns:
9400  total number of points in the limit mesh fragment.
9401  Remarks:
9402  The number of points is the same for quad or tri subdivision limit
9403  mesh fragments, even though one is a rectanglular collection of
9404  quads and the other is a trianglular collection of triangles.
9405  */
9406  static unsigned int PointCountFromDisplayDensity(
9407  unsigned int display_density
9408  );
9409 
9410  /*
9411  Parameters:
9412  display_density - [in]
9413  >= 0
9414  Returns:
9415  total number of faces in the limit mesh fragment.
9416  */
9417  static unsigned int FaceCountFromDisplayDensity(
9418  unsigned int display_density
9419  );
9420 
9421  /*
9422  Returns:
9423  true if side_segment_count is valid.
9424  Otherwise 0 is returned.
9425  */
9426  static bool SideSegmentCountIsValid(
9427  unsigned int side_segment_count
9428  );
9429 
9430  /*
9431  Returns:
9432  If side_segment_count is valide, then (side_segment_count+1) is returned.
9433  Otherwise 0 is returned.
9434  */
9435  static unsigned int SidePointCountFromSideCount(
9436  unsigned int side_segment_count
9437  );
9438 
9439  /*
9440  Returns:
9441  If side_segment_count is valide, then (side_segment_count+1)^2 is returned.
9442  Otherwise 0 is returned.
9443  */
9444  static unsigned int QuadGridPointCountFromSideCount(
9445  unsigned int side_segment_count
9446  );
9447 
9448  /*
9449  Returns:
9450  If side_segment_count is valide, then side_segment_count^2 is returned.
9451  Otherwise 0 is returned.
9452  */
9453  static unsigned int QuadGridQuadCountFromSideCount(
9454  unsigned int side_segment_count
9455  );
9456 
9457  /*
9458  Description:
9459  Copies location and optionally normal information from a side of src_fragment
9460  to a side of dst_fragment. This is often used for "sealing" adjacent fragments
9461  where the same edge is evaluated from different faces. All evaluations are as accurate
9462  as IEEE double precision arithmetic can produce. However there are often tiny differences
9463  (last few bits of the coordinate values differ) in vertext locations because we are
9464  using finite precision arithmetic with operations in different orders.
9465  In general, rendering, mesho topology, and edge analysis calculations perform poorly
9466  when tinity differences exist.
9467 
9468  Parameters:
9469  bTestNearEqual - [in]
9470  If true, then the copy is performed only when the points or normals are nearly
9471  identical. In this case if the discrepance between coordinates is too large,
9472  then this function returns false.
9473  bCopyNormals - [in]
9474  If true, then normal information is copied along with point information.
9475  src_fragment - [in]
9476  source fragment
9477  i0, i1 - [in]
9478  indices for the src_fragment.m_S[] array.
9479  dst_fragment - [in]
9480  destination fragment
9481  j0, j1 - [in]
9482  indices for dst_fragment.m_S[] array.
9483  abs(j0-j1) = abs(i0-i1);
9484  Remarks:
9485  It is required that max(i0,i1) - min(i0,i1) = max(j0,j1) - min(j0,j1) and
9486  all indices are valid for the respective fragments.
9487  The src_fragment point/normal identified by src_fragment.m_S[i]
9488  is copied to he dst_fragment point/normal identified by dst_fragment.m_S[j],
9489  where i0->j0, i1->j1.
9490  */
9491  static bool SealAdjacentSides(
9492  bool bTestNearEqual,
9493  bool bCopyNormals,
9494  const ON_SubDMeshFragment& src_fragment,
9495  unsigned int i0,
9496  unsigned int i1,
9497  ON_SubDMeshFragment& dst_fragment,
9498  unsigned int j0,
9499  unsigned int j1
9500  );
9501 
9502  /*
9503  Parameters:
9504  bTestNearEqual - [in]
9505  If true, then the copy is performed only when the points or normals are nearly
9506  identical. In this case if the discrepance between coordinates is too large,
9507  then this function returns false.
9508  src - [in]
9509  dst - [in/out]
9510  The 3d point (src[0],src[1],src2[2]) is copied to (dst[0],dst[1],dst[2]).
9511  Returns:
9512  True if a copy occured.
9513  */
9514  static bool SealPoints(
9515  bool bTestNearEqual,
9516  const double* src,
9517  double* dst
9518  );
9519 
9520  /*
9521  Parameters:
9522  bTestNearEqual - [in]
9523  If true, then the copy is performed only when the points or normals are nearly
9524  identical. In this case if the discrepance between coordinates is too large,
9525  then this function returns false.
9526  src - [in]
9527  dst - [in/out]
9528  The 3d point (src[0],src[1],src2[2]) is copied to (dst[0],dst[1],dst[2]).
9529  Returns:
9530  True if a copy occured.
9531  */
9532  static bool SealNormals(
9533  bool bTestNearEqual,
9534  const double* src,
9535  double* dst
9536  );
9537 
9538  /*
9539  Returns:
9540  Number of mesh quads in a full sized fragment with the specified mesh density.
9541  */
9542  static unsigned int FullFragmentMeshQuadCountFromDensity(
9543  unsigned int mesh_density
9544  );
9545 
9546  /*
9547  Returns:
9548  Number of mesh quads in a half sized fragment with the specified mesh density.
9549  */
9550  static unsigned int HalfFragmentMeshQuadCountFromDensity(
9551  unsigned int mesh_density
9552  );
9553 
9554  /*
9555  Returns:
9556  Number of mesh points in a full sized fragment with the specified mesh density.
9557  */
9558  static unsigned int FullFragmentMeshPointCountFromDensity(
9559  unsigned int mesh_density
9560  );
9561 
9562  /*
9563  Returns:
9564  Number of mesh points in a half sized fragment with the specified mesh density.
9565  */
9566  static unsigned int HalfFragmentMeshPointCountFromDensity(
9567  unsigned int mesh_density
9568  );
9569 
9570 private:
9571  // This field overlaps with ON_FixedSizePoolElement.m_next when a fixed size pool is managing the fragments.
9572  // When m_reserved != 0, the framgment is uninitialized.
9573  ON__UINT64 m_reserved;
9574 
9575 public:
9576  const class ON_SubDFace* m_face;
9577 
9578  // m_face_vertex_index[] stores the information needed for the Vertex()
9579  // and Edge() functions to work.
9580  //
9581  // If m_face is nullptr, then m_face_vertex_index[] has no meaning.
9582  // If m_face is not nullptr and a corner of the grid is on a face
9583  // vertex, then the corresponding m_face_vertex_index[] value
9584  // will be <= ON_SubDFace::MaximumEdgeCount and m_face->Vertex(m_face_vertex_index[])
9585  // is the vertex. Otherwise, the corresponding m_face_vertex_index[] value
9586  // will be > ON_SubDFace::MaximumEdgeCount.
9587  // Catmull-Clark limit meshes:
9588  // When the original SubD face is a quad, a full fragment is created and
9589  // m_face_vertex_index[4] = {0,1,2,3}.
9590  // When the original SuD face is an N-gon with N != 4, a partial fragment
9591  // is delivered and m_face_vertex_index[2] identifies the face vertex
9592  // for that fragment. m_face_vertex_index[0,1,3] = a value > ON_SubDFace::MaximumEdgeCount
9593  unsigned short m_face_vertex_index[4];
9594 
9595  const class ON_SubDFace* SubDFace() const;
9596 
9597  const bool HasValidPointAndNormalGrid() const;
9598 
9599  /*
9600  Returns:
9601  True if the fragment covers the entire SubD face.
9602  */
9603  bool IsFullFaceFragment() const;
9604 
9605  /*
9606  Returns:
9607  True if the fragment covers a corner of the SubD face.
9608  */
9609  bool IsFaceCornerFragment() const;
9610 
9611  /*
9612  Returns:
9613  If IsFaceCornerFragment() is true, then the index of the face's vertex for the corner is returned.
9614  Otherwise, ON_UNSET_UINT_INDEX is returned.
9615  */
9616  unsigned int FaceCornerIndex() const;
9617 
9618  /*
9619  Returns:
9620  Number of fragments that cover this face. 1 for quads and N>= 3 for faces with N sides when N != 4.
9621  */
9622  unsigned int FaceFragmentCount() const;
9623 
9624  /*
9625  Returns:
9626  First fragment for this->m_face.
9627  */
9628  const ON_SubDMeshFragment* FirstFaceFragment() const;
9629 
9630  /*
9631  Returns:
9632  Last fragment for this->m_face.
9633  */
9634  const ON_SubDMeshFragment* LastFaceFragment() const;
9635 
9636  /*
9637  Parameters:
9638  bReturnLastFromFirstFirst - in
9639  If false and this is the first fragment, then nullptr is returned.
9640  If true and this is the first fragment, then LastFaceFragment() is returned.
9641  Returns:
9642  Previous fragment for this->m_face.
9643  */
9644  const ON_SubDMeshFragment* PreviousFaceFragment(
9645  bool bReturnLastFromFirstFirst
9646  ) const;
9647 
9648  /*
9649  Parameters:
9650  bReturnFirstFromLast - in
9651  If false and this is the last fragment, then nullptr is returned.
9652  If true and this is the last fragment, then FirstFaceFragment() is returned.
9653  Returns:
9654  Next fragment for this->m_face.
9655  */
9656  const ON_SubDMeshFragment* NextFaceFragment(
9657  bool bReturnFirstFromLast
9658  ) const;
9659 
9660  /*
9661  Parameters:
9662  fragments_capacity - in
9663  Capacity of the fragments[] array.
9664  fragments[] - out
9665  Fragments are returned here.
9666  */
9667  unsigned int GetFaceFragments(
9668  const ON_SubDMeshFragment** fragments,
9669  size_t fragments_capacity
9670  ) const;
9671 
9672  unsigned int GetFaceFragments(
9673  ON_SimpleArray<const ON_SubDMeshFragment*>& fragments
9674  ) const;
9675 
9676  /*
9677  Parameters:
9678  grid2dex_i - [in]
9679  0 <= grid2dex_i < m_grid.SidePointCount()
9680  grid2dex_j - [in]
9681  0 <= grid2dex_j < m_grid.SidePointCount()
9682  Returns:
9683  */
9684  const ON_3dPoint VertexPoint(
9685  unsigned grid2dex_i,
9686  unsigned grid2dex_j
9687  ) const;
9688  const ON_3dPoint VertexPoint(
9689  ON_2udex grid2dex
9690  ) const;
9691  const ON_3dPoint VertexPoint(
9692  unsigned grid_point_index
9693  ) const;
9694 
9695  /*
9696  Parameters:
9697  grid2dex_i - [in]
9698  0 <= grid2dex_i < m_grid.SidePointCount()
9699  grid2dex_j - [in]
9700  0 <= grid2dex_j < m_grid.SidePointCount()
9701  Returns:
9702  */
9703  const ON_3dVector VertexNormal(
9704  unsigned grid2dex_i,
9705  unsigned grid2dex_j
9706  ) const;
9707  const ON_3dVector VertexNormal(
9708  ON_2udex grid2dex
9709  ) const;
9710  const ON_3dVector VertexNormal(
9711  unsigned grid_point_index
9712  ) const;
9713 
9714  /*
9715  Parameters:
9716  grid2dex_i - [in]
9717  0 <= grid2dex_i < m_grid.SidePointCount()
9718  grid2dex_j - [in]
9719  0 <= grid2dex_j < m_grid.SidePointCount()
9720  Returns:
9721  The texture coordinates calculated by iterpolating the m_ctrlnetT[] values.
9722  */
9723  const ON_3dPoint VertexTextureCoordinateFromCorners(
9724  unsigned grid2dex_i,
9725  unsigned grid2dex_j
9726  ) const;
9727  const ON_3dPoint VertexTextureCoordinateFromCorners(
9728  ON_2udex grid2dex
9729  ) const;
9730  const ON_3dPoint VertexTextureCoordinateFromCorners(
9731  unsigned grid_point_index
9732  ) const;
9733 
9734  /*
9735  Description:
9736  Get the texture coordinate for the specified fragment grid point.
9737  Parameters:
9738  grid2dex_i - [in]
9739  0 <= grid2dex_i < m_grid.SidePointCount()
9740  grid2dex_j - [in]
9741  0 <= grid2dex_j < m_grid.SidePointCount()
9742  Returns:
9743  The texture coordinate for the specified fragment grid point.
9744  TextureCoordinateDimension() reports the number of coordinates to set.
9745  When it is 2, the z coordinate of the returned point is 0.0.
9746  */
9747  const ON_3dPoint VertexTextureCoordinate(
9748  unsigned grid2dex_i,
9749  unsigned grid2dex_j
9750  ) const;
9751  const ON_3dPoint VertexTextureCoordinate(
9752  ON_2udex grid2dex
9753  ) const;
9754  const ON_3dPoint VertexTextureCoordinate(
9755  unsigned grid_point_index
9756  ) const;
9757 
9758  /*
9759  Description:
9760  Set the texture coordinate for the specified fragment grid point.
9761  Parameters:
9762  grid2dex_i - [in]
9763  0 <= grid2dex_i < m_grid.SidePointCount()
9764  grid2dex_j - [in]
9765  0 <= grid2dex_j < m_grid.SidePointCount()
9766  unsigned texture_coordinate_dimension - [in]
9767  2 or 3
9768  texture_coordinate - [in]
9769  Texture coordinates are mutable and are often modified on an otherwise const fragment.
9770  Returns:
9771  True if input was valid and the texture coordinate was set.
9772  */
9773  bool SetVertexTextureCoordinate(
9774  unsigned grid2dex_i,
9775  unsigned grid2dex_j,
9776  ON_3dPoint texture_coordinate
9777  ) const;
9778  bool SetVertexTextureCoordinate(
9779  ON_2udex grid2dex,
9780  ON_3dPoint texture_coordinate
9781  ) const;
9782  bool SetVertexTextureCoordinate(
9783  unsigned grid_point_index,
9784  ON_3dPoint texture_coordinate
9785  ) const;
9786 
9787  bool TextureCoordinatesExist() const;
9788  void SetTextureCoordinatesExist(bool TextureCoordinatesExist) const;
9789 
9790  /*
9791  Parameters:
9792  grid_side_index - [in]
9793  0 to 3 for quad grids.
9794  0 to 2 for tri grids
9795  Returns:
9796  The subd edge that is on the identified side of the grid.
9797  */
9798  const class ON_SubDEdgePtr SubDEdgePtr(
9799  unsigned int grid_side_index
9800  ) const;
9801  const class ON_SubDEdge* SubDEdge(
9802  unsigned int grid_side_index
9803  ) const;
9804 
9805  /*
9806  Parameters:
9807  grid_corner_index - [in]
9808  grid side N is between corner index N and corner index (N+1)%4.
9809  Remarks:
9810  For partial fragments (IsFaceCornerFragment() = true), grid_corner_index = 2 is the only
9811  corner that corresponds to a SubD vertex.
