9812  For partial fragments (IsFaceCornerFragment() = true), grid_side_index = 1 and grid_side_index = 2
9813  correspond to half of original SuD edges.
9814  */
9815  const class ON_SubDVertexPtr SubDVertexPtr(
9816  unsigned int grid_corner_index
9817  ) const;
9818 
9819  /*
9820  Parameters:
9821  grid_corner_index - [in]
9822  grid side N is between corner index N and corner index (N+1)%4.
9823  Remarks:
9824  For partial fragments (IsFaceCornerFragment() = true), grid_corner_index = 2 is the only
9825  corner that corresponds to a SubD vertex.
9826  For partial fragments (IsFaceCornerFragment() = true), grid_side_index = 1 and grid_side_index = 2
9827  correspond to half of original SuD edges.
9828  */
9829  const class ON_SubDVertex* SubDVertex(
9830  unsigned int grid_corner_index
9831  ) const;
9832 
9833 
9834  /*
9835  Parameters:
9836  grid_corner_index - [in]
9837  grid side N is between corner index N and corner index (N+1)%4.
9838  Returns:
9839  Limit surface location at the grid corner or ON_3dPoint::NanPoint if the fragment is empty.
9840  Remarks:
9841  For partial fragments (IsFaceCornerFragment() = true), grid_corner_index = 2 is the only
9842  corner that corresponds to a SubD vertex.
9843  For partial fragments (IsFaceCornerFragment() = true), grid_side_index = 1 and grid_side_index = 2
9844  correspond to half of original SuD edges.
9845  */
9846  const ON_3dPoint CornerPoint(
9847  unsigned int grid_corner_index
9848  ) const;
9849 
9850  /*
9851  Parameters:
9852  grid_corner_index - [in]
9853  grid side N is between corner index N and corner index (N+1)%4.
9854  Returns:
9855  Limit surface normal at the grid corner or ON_3dPoint::NanPoint if the fragment is empty.
9856  Remarks:
9857  For partial fragments (IsFaceCornerFragment() = true), grid_corner_index = 2 is the only
9858  corner that corresponds to a SubD vertex.
9859  For partial fragments (IsFaceCornerFragment() = true), grid_side_index = 1 and grid_side_index = 2
9860  correspond to half of original SuD edges.
9861  */
9862  const ON_3dVector CornerNormal(
9863  unsigned int grid_corner_index
9864  ) const;
9865 
9866  /*
9867  Parameters:
9868  grid_corner_index - [in]
9869  grid side N is between corner index N and corner index (N+1)%4.
9870  Returns:
9871  Limit surface frame at the grid corner or ON_3dPoint::NanPoint if the fragment is empty.
9872  Remarks:
9873  For partial fragments (IsFaceCornerFragment() = true), grid_corner_index = 2 is the only
9874  corner that corresponds to a SubD vertex.
9875  For partial fragments (IsFaceCornerFragment() = true), grid_side_index = 1 and grid_side_index = 2
9876  correspond to half of original SuD edges.
9877  */
9878  const ON_Plane CornerFrame(
9879  unsigned int grid_corner_index
9880  ) const;
9881 
9882  /*
9883  Parameters:
9884  grid_side_index - [in]
9885  grid side N is between corner index N and corner index (N+1)%4.
9886  Returns:
9887  Limit surface location at the midde of the grid side or ON_3dPoint::NanPoint if the fragment is empty.
9888  Remarks:
9889  For partial fragments (IsFaceCornerFragment() = true), grid_corner_index = 2 is the only
9890  corner that corresponds to a SubD vertex.
9891  For partial fragments (IsFaceCornerFragment() = true), grid_side_index = 1 and grid_side_index = 2
9892  correspond to half of original SuD edges.
9893  */
9894  const ON_3dPoint SidePoint(
9895  unsigned int grid_side_index
9896  ) const;
9897 
9898  /*
9899  Parameters:
9900  grid_side_index - [in]
9901  grid side N is between corner index N and corner index (N+1)%4.
9902  Returns:
9903  Limit surface normal at the grid corner or ON_3dPoint::NanPoint if the fragment is empty.
9904  Remarks:
9905  For partial fragments (IsFaceCornerFragment() = true), grid_corner_index = 2 is the only
9906  corner that corresponds to a SubD vertex.
9907  For partial fragments (IsFaceCornerFragment() = true), grid_side_index = 1 and grid_side_index = 2
9908  correspond to half of original SuD edges.
9909  */
9910  const ON_3dVector SideNormal(
9911  unsigned int grid_side_index
9912  ) const;
9913 
9914  /*
9915  Parameters:
9916  grid_side_index - [in]
9917  grid side N is between corner index N and corner index (N+1)%4.
9918  Returns:
9919  Limit surface frame at the grid corner or ON_3dPoint::NanPoint if the fragment is empty.
9920  Remarks:
9921  For partial fragments (IsFaceCornerFragment() = true), grid_corner_index = 2 is the only
9922  corner that corresponds to a SubD vertex.
9923  For partial fragments (IsFaceCornerFragment() = true), grid_side_index = 1 and grid_side_index = 2
9924  correspond to half of original SuD edges.
9925  */
9926  const ON_Plane SideFrame(
9927  unsigned int grid_side_index
9928  ) const;
9929 
9930  /*
9931  Parameters:
9932  grid_side_index - [in]
9933  grid side N is between corner index N and corner index (N+1)%4.
9934  Returns:
9935  Limit surface location at the center of the grid side or ON_3dPoint::NanPoint if the fragment is empty.
9936  Remarks:
9937  For partial fragments (IsFaceCornerFragment() = true), grid_corner_index = 2 is the only
9938  corner that corresponds to a SubD vertex.
9939  For partial fragments (IsFaceCornerFragment() = true), grid_side_index = 1 and grid_side_index = 2
9940  correspond to half of original SuD edges.
9941  */
9942  const ON_3dPoint CenterPoint(
9943  ) const;
9944 
9945  const ON_3dVector CenterNormal() const;
9946 
9947  const ON_Plane CenterFrame() const;
9948 
9949  const ON_3dPoint CenterTextureCoordinate() const;
9950 
9951 private:
9952  bool Internal_GetFrameHelper(
9953  unsigned int P_dex,
9954  unsigned int Q_dex,
9955  ON_Plane& frame
9956  ) const;
9957 
9958 public:
9959 
9960  /*
9961  Returns:
9962  Status of the face.
9963  */
9964  ON_ComponentStatus Status() const;
9965 
9966  bool Transform(
9967  const ON_Xform& xform
9968  );
9969 
9970  ON_SubDMeshFragment* m_next_fragment;
9971  ON_SubDMeshFragment* m_prev_fragment;
9972 
9973  unsigned short m_face_fragment_count; // Number of fragments that will be delivered for this face.
9974  unsigned short m_face_fragment_index; // First fragment has index = 0. Last fragment has index = m_face_fragment_count-1.
9975 
9976  // The mesh fragment is a grid of quads.
9977  // There are m_side_count quad edges along each side of the tesselation,
9978  // There are a total of m_side_count X m_side_count quads, and
9979  // m_P_count = (m_side_count+1)*(m_side_count+1).
9980 
9981 public:
9982  enum : unsigned
9983  {
9984  MaximumVertexCount = 0x3FFF
9985  };
9986 
9987  /*
9988  Returns:
9989  Number of vertices in the mesh fragment grid.
9990  VertexCount() should be identical to m_grid.GridPointCount().
9991  VertexCapacity() should be >= VertexCount().
9992  */
9993  unsigned VertexCount() const;
9994 
9995  /*
9996  Description:
9997  Sets number of fragment vertices being used (number of elements being used in the m_P[], m_N[], and m_T[] arrays).
9998  Parameters:
9999  vertex_count - [in]
10000  A value no larger than ON_SubDMeshFragment::MaximumVertexCount.
10001  */
10002  bool SetVertexCount(size_t vertex_count);
10003 
10004  /*
10005  Returns:
10006  Capactity for vertices in the mesh fragment grid.
10007  VertexCapacity() should be >= VertexCount().
10008  VertexCount() should be identical to m_grid.PointCount().
10009  */
10010  unsigned VertexCapacity() const;
10011 
10012  /*
10013  Description:
10014  Sets number of fragment vertices available (number of elements available in the m_P[], m_N[], and m_T[] arrays).
10015  The memory for the arrays is managed by something besides this ON_SubDManagedMeshFragment instance.
10016  Parameters:
10017  vertex_capacity - [in]
10018  A value no larger than ON_SubDMeshFragment::MaximumVertexCount.
10019  Returns:
10020  True if successful
10021  */
10022  bool SetUnmanagedVertexCapacity(size_t vertex_capacity);
10023 
10024 
10025  /*
10026  Description:
10027  Sets number of fragment vertices available (number of elements available in the m_P[], m_N[], and m_T[] arrays).
10028  The memory for the arrays is managed by something besides this ON_SubDManagedMeshFragment instance.
10029  Parameters:
10030  vertex_capacity - [in]
10031  A value no larger than ON_SubDMeshFragment::MaximumVertexCount.
10032  Returns:
10033  True if successful
10034  */
10035  bool ReserveManagedVertexCapacity(size_t vertex_capacity);
10036 
10037  /*
10038  Returns:
10039  True if the memory in the m_P[], m_N[], and m_T[] is managed by this ON_SubDManagedMeshFragment instance.
10040  */
10041  bool ManagedArrays() const;
10042 
10043  bool DeleteManagedArrays();
10044 
10045  /*
10046  Returns:
10047  True if the memory in the m_P[], m_N[], and m_T[] is managed by something besides this ON_SubDManagedMeshFragment instance.
10048  */
10049  bool UnmanagedArrays() const;
10050 
10051 private:
10052  friend class ON_SubDManagedMeshFragment;
10053  friend class ON_SubDMeshImpl;
10054  // Number of grid vertices and capacity of arrays in certain conditions.
10055  enum : unsigned short
10056  {
10057  ValueMask = 0x3FFF, // maximum vertex count and capacity
10058  EtcMask = 0xC000,
10059  EtcControlNetQuadBit = 0x8000, // bit is on m_vertex_count_etc. Set means 4 m_ctrlnetP[] points are set.
10060  EtcTextureCoordinatesExistBit = 0x4000, // bit is on m_vertex_count_etc
10061  EtcManagedArraysBit = 0x8000, // bit is on m_vertex_capacity_etc. Set means this class manages the m_P[], m_N[], and m_T[] arrays.
10062  };
10063  mutable unsigned short m_vertex_count_etc;
10064  mutable unsigned short m_vertex_capacity_etc;
10065  static void Internal_Set3dPointArrayToNan(double* a, size_t a_count, size_t a_stride);
10066 
10067 private:
10068  // corners for control net display in grid order (counter-clockwise quad order must swap [2] and[3])
10069  double m_ctrlnetP[4][3];
10070 
10071  // Normal used for shading the control net display in grid order.
10072  double m_ctrlnetN[3];
10073 
10074 
10075 public:
10076  /*
10077  Parameters:
10078  grid_corner_index - [in]
10079  grid side N is between corner index N and corner index (N+1)%4.
10080  Returns:
10081  Texture coordinate at that corner.
10082  Remarks:
10083  For partial fragments (IsFaceCornerFragment() = true), grid_corner_index = 2 is the only
10084  corner that corresponds to a SubD vertex.
10085  For partial fragments (IsFaceCornerFragment() = true), grid_side_index = 1 and grid_side_index = 2
10086  correspond to half of original SuD edges.
10087  */
10088  const ON_3dPoint TextureCoordinateCorner(
10089  unsigned int grid_corner_index
10090  ) const;
10091 
10092 private:
10093  // The fragment's current corner texture coordinates in grid order.
10094  // These can be from ON_SubDFace pack rectangles, ON_SubDFace custom texture points,
10095  // a texture mapping, or any other values rendering code deems desirable.
10096  // When a texture mapping evaluatior is not involved, they are typically
10097  // used to generate the fragment's texture coordinates by interpolation.
10098  // m_ctrlnetT[0]
10099  // m_ctrlnetT[1]
10100  // m_ctrlnetT[2]
10101  // m_ctrlnetT[3]
10102  mutable double m_ctrlnetT[4][3];
10103 
10104  // Corner curvatures (2 principal and 2 sectional) in grid order.
10105  mutable double m_ctrlnetK[4][4];
10106 
10107  // Corner false colors in grid order.
10108  mutable ON_Color m_ctrlnetC[4][4];
10109 
10110 private:
10111  // When an ON_SubDFace is a quad, there is a single ON_SubDMeshFragment for the face
10112  // and ON_SubDMeshFragment.m_pack_rect are the corners of the quad face's pack rect in
10113  // ON_SubDMeshFragment gid order.
10114  // When an ON_SubDFace is an N-gon with N !+ 4, there are N ON_SubDMeshFragments for the face
10115  // and ON_SubDMeshFragment.m_pack_rect are corners of a subrect of the face's pack rect
10116  // in ON_SubDMeshFragment gid order.
10117  // The m_pack_rect[] points are in grid order. If the parent ON_SubDFace pack rect is rotated,
10118  // then "lower/upper" and "left/right" are with the rotation applied and hence a lower/left coordinate
10119  // may be greater than an upper/right coorinate value.
10120  // m_pack_rect[0] "lower left"
10121  // m_pack_rect[1] "lower right"
10122  // m_pack_rect[2] "upper left"
10123  // m_pack_rect[3] "upper right"
10124  double m_pack_rect[4][2]; // NOT a mutable property
10125 
10126 public:
10127  /*
10128  Parameters:
10129  grid_corner_index - [in]
10130  grid side N is between corner index N and corner index (N+1)%4.
10131  Returns:
10132  Pack rect corner point.
10133  Remarks:
10134  For partial fragments (IsFaceCornerFragment() = true), grid_corner_index = 2 is the only
10135  corner that corresponds to a SubD vertex.
10136  For partial fragments (IsFaceCornerFragment() = true), grid_side_index = 1 and grid_side_index = 2
10137  correspond to half of original SuD edges.
10138  */
10139  const ON_2dPoint PackRectCorner(
10140  unsigned int grid_corner_index
10141  ) const;
10142 
10143  const ON_2dPoint PackRectCenter() const;
10144 
10145  void SetPackRectCornersForExperts(
10146  bool bGridOrder,
10147  const ON_2dPoint fragment_pack_rect_corners[4]
10148  );
10149 
10150  /*
10151  Description:
10152  This functions sets the pack rect corners on fragments used to render
10153  quad and 3-gon ON_SubDFaces.
10154  When an ON_SubDFace is a quad, it is rendered with one ON_SubDMeshFragment.
10155  When an ON_SubDFace is a 3-gon, it is rendered with three ON_SubDMeshFragments.
10156  Remarks:
10157  It is critcial that m_face_fragment_count and m_face_fragment_index be set
10158  correctly before calling this function.
10159  A ON_SubDMeshFragment used to render a quad ON_SubDFace has
10160  m_face_fragment_count = 1 and m_face_fragment_index = 0.
10161  A ON_SubDMeshFragment used to render a 3-gon ON_SubDFace has
10162  m_face_fragment_count = 3 and m_face_fragment_index = 0, 1 or 2.
10163  */
10164  void SetQuadOr3gonFaceFragmentPackRectCorners(
10165  bool bGridOrder,
10166  const ON_2dPoint face_pack_rect_corners[4]
10167  );
10168 
10169  /*
10170  Description:
10171  This functions sets the pack rect corners on fragments used to render
10172  n-gon ON_SubDFaces when n >= 5.
10173  When an ON_SubDFace is an n-gon, it is rendered with n ON_SubDMeshFragments.
10174  Parameters:
10175  bGridOrder = [in]
10176  Order for face_pack_rect_corners[].
10177  face_texture_coordinate_corners - [in]
10178  The points returned by ON_SubDFace::PackRectCorner(bGridOrder, i)
10179  face_pack_rect_size - [in]
10180  The n-gon face's ON_SubDFace::PackRectSize() value.
10181  ngon_grid_size - [in]
10182  ngon_sub_pack_rect_size - [in]
10183  ngon_sub_pack_rect_delta - [in]
10184  These three parameters are values from ON_SubDFace::GetNgonSubPackRectSizeAndDelta().
10185  ngon_grid_size, ngon_sub_pack_rect_size, and ngon_sub_pack_rect_delta are identical
10186  for all the ON_SubDMeshFragments used to render the n-gon face. The value of
10187  m_face_fragment_index detemines which sub pack rect is assigned to each of
10188  the n ON_SubDMeshFragments use to render the n-gon face.
10189  Remarks:
10190  It is critcial that m_face_fragment_count and m_face_fragment_index be set
10191  correctly before calling this function.
10192  A ON_SubDMeshFragment used to render an n-gon ON_SubDFace has
10193  m_face_fragment_count = n and m_face_fragment_index = 0, ..., n-1.
10194  */
10195  void SetNgonFaceFragmentPackRectCorners(
10196  bool bGridOrder,
10197  const ON_2dPoint face_pack_rect_corners[4],
10198  ON_2dVector face_pack_rect_size,
10199  ON_2udex ngon_grid_size,
10200  ON_2dVector ngon_sub_pack_rect_size,
10201  ON_2dVector ngon_sub_pack_rect_delta
10202  );
10203 
10204  /*
10205  Description:
10206  This functions gets the pack rect corners on fragments used to render 3-gon ON_SubDFaces.
10207  When an ON_SubDFace is an 3-gon, it is rendered with 3 ON_SubDMeshFragments.
10208  Parameters:
10209  bFacePackRectGridOrder - [in]
10210  Order for face_pack_rect_corners[].
10211  face_pack_rect_corners - [in]
10212  The points returned by ON_SubDFace::PackRectCorner(bGridOrder, i)
10213  fragment_index - [in]
10214  0 <= ngon_fragment_index < 3
10215  bFragmentPackRectGridOrder - [in]
10216  Order for face_pack_rect_corners[].
10217  fragment_pack_rect_corners - [out]
10218  */
10219  static bool Get3gonFaceFragmentPackRectCorners(
10220  bool bFaceGridOrder,
10221  const ON_2dPoint face_pack_rect_corners[4],
10222  unsigned int fragment_index,
10223  bool bFragmentGridOrder,
10224  ON_2dPoint fragment_pack_rect_corners[4]
10225  );
10226 
10227  /*
10228  Description:
10229  This functions gets the pack rect corners for fragments used to render
10230  n-gon ON_SubDFaces when n >= 5.
10231  When an ON_SubDFace is an n-gon, it is rendered with n ON_SubDMeshFragments.
10232  Parameters:
10233  ngon_fragment_index - [in]
10234  0 <= ngon_fragment_index < ngon_edge_count
10235  bGridOrder - [in]
10236  Order for face_pack_rect_corners[].
10237  face_pack_rect_corners - [in]
10238  The points returned by ON_SubDFace::PackRectCorner(bGridOrder, i)
10239  face_pack_rect_size - [in]
10240  The n-gon face's ON_SubDFace::PackRectSize() value.
10241  ngon_grid_size - [in]
10242  ngon_sub_pack_rect_size - [in]
10243  ngon_sub_pack_rect_delta - [in]
10244  These three parameters are values from ON_SubDFace::GetNgonSubPackRectSizeAndDelta().
10245  ngon_grid_size, ngon_sub_pack_rect_size, and ngon_sub_pack_rect_delta are identical
10246  for all the ON_SubDMeshFragments used to render the n-gon face. The value of
10247  m_face_fragment_index detemines which sub pack rect is assigned to each of
10248  the n ON_SubDMeshFragments use to render the n-gon face.
10249  fragment_pack_rect_corners - [out]
10250  */
10251  static bool GetNgonFaceFragmentPackRectCorners(
10252  unsigned int ngon_edge_count,
10253  unsigned int ngon_fragment_index,
10254  bool bGridOrder,
10255  const ON_2dPoint face_pack_rect_corners[4],
10256  ON_2dVector face_pack_rect_size,
10257  ON_2udex ngon_grid_size,
10258  ON_2dVector ngon_sub_pack_rect_size,
10259  ON_2dVector ngon_sub_pack_rect_delta,
10260  ON_2dPoint fragment_pack_rect_corners[4]
10261  );
10262 
10263 public:
10264  ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
10265  //
10266  // 3-dimensional grid vertex points
10267  //
10268  // Depending on the strides, m_P[], m_N[], and m_T[] can be separate or interlaced.
10269  //
10270  // The stride m_P_stride and memory m_P references is managed by some other class or function.
10271  // Never modify m_P_stride, m_P, or the values in m_P.
10272  // Use m_grid functions to get point indices and quad face indices.
10273  double* m_P; // surface points
10274  size_t m_P_stride;
10275  const double* PointArray(ON_SubDComponentLocation subd_appearance)const;
10276  size_t PointArrayStride(ON_SubDComponentLocation subd_appearance)const;
10277  unsigned PointArrayCount(ON_SubDComponentLocation subd_appearance) const;
10278 
10279 public:
10280 
10281  /*
10282  Description:
10283  Create a one quad fragment with
10284  m_P = this->m_ctrlnetP[], m_P_stride = 3
10285  m_N = this->m_ctrlnetN, m_N_stride = 0
10286  m_T = this->m_ctrlnetT, m_T_stride = 3
10287  NOTE WELL:
10288  1) "this" must remain in scope and unchanged while the returned value
10289  is used because the returned value references memory in thism_ctrlnetX[] arrays.
10290  2) The next/prev pointers on the returned fragment are copied from this,
10291  but the returned value is not reciprocally referenced by next/prev in the linked list.
10292  Returns:
10293  A control net quad fragment that can be used locally when the SubDAppearance
10294  is ON_SubDComponentLocation::ControlNet.
10295  The points, normals, and texture_coordinates of the returned fragment
10296  are the control net quad points, normals, and texture coordinates
10297  of this fragment. m_grid is a single quad grid.
10298  */
10299  const ON_SubDMeshFragment ControlNetQuadFragmentForExperts() const;
10300 
10301  /*
10302  Parameters:
10303  bGridOrder - [in]
10304  If true, then points are returned in fragment grid order.
10305  Otherwise, points are returned in counter-clockwise quad order.
10306  quad_points - [out]
10307  quad_normal - [out]
10308  */
10309  bool GetControlNetQuad(
10310  bool bGridOrder,
10311  ON_3dPoint quad_points[4],
10312  ON_3dVector& quad_normal
10313  ) const;
10314 
10315  const ON_3dPoint ControlNetQuadPoint(
10316  bool bGridOrder,
10317  unsigned point_index
10318  ) const;
10319 
10320  /*
10321  Parameters:
10322  bGridOrder - [in]
10323  If true, then points are returned in fragment grid order.
10324  Otherwise, points are returned in counter-clockwise quad order.
10325  quad_points - [in]
10326  */
10327  void SetControlNetQuad(
10328  bool bGridOrder,
10329  const ON_3dPoint quad_points[4],
10330  ON_3dVector quad_normal
10331  );
10332 
10333  void UnsetControlNetQuad();
10334 
10335  const ON_BoundingBox SurfaceBoundingBox() const;
10336  const ON_BoundingBox ControlNetQuadBoundingBox() const;
10337  const ON_BoundingBox BoundingBox(ON_SubDComponentLocation subd_appearance) const;
10338 
10339 public:
10340  /*
10341  Returns:
10342  If grid vertex points are available, then VertexCount() is returned.
10343  Otherwise 0 is returned.
10344  */
10345  unsigned int PointCount() const;
10346  unsigned int PointCapacity() const;
10347 
10348  ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
10349  //
10350  // 3-dimensional grid vertex surface normals
10351  //
10352  // The m_N[] and m_P[] arrays are parallel.
10353  // Depending on the strides, m_P[], m_N[], and m_T[] can be separate or interlaced.
10354  //
10355  // If m_N is not nullptr and m_N_stride>0, then m_N[] can accomodate up to m_P_capacity normals.
10356  // If m_N is not nullptr and m_N_stride=0, then m_N[] can accomodate a single normal (flat shaded polygon face).
10357  // The stride m_N_stride and memory m_N references is managed by some other class or function.
10358  // Never modify m_N_stride, m_N, or the values in m_N.
10359  // Use m_grid functions to get normal indices and quad face indices.
10360  // Note well: m_N_stride can be 0 when the normal is constant (control net face normal for example).
10361  double* m_N; // surface normals
10362  size_t m_N_stride;
10363  const double* NormalArray(ON_SubDComponentLocation subd_appearance)const;
10364  size_t NormalArrayStride(ON_SubDComponentLocation subd_appearance)const;
10365  unsigned NormalArrayCount(ON_SubDComponentLocation subd_appearance) const;
10366 
10367 public:
10368  /*
10369  Returns:
10370  If grid vertex surface normals are available, then VertexCount() is returned.
10371  Otherwise 0 is returned.
10372  */
10373  unsigned int NormalCount() const;
10374  unsigned int NormalCapacity() const;
10375 
10376  ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
10377  //
10378  // 3d vertex texture coordinates.
10379  //
10380  // Depending on the strides, m_P[], m_N[], and m_T[] can be separate or interlaced.
10381  //
10382  // If m_T is not nullptr and m_T_stride>0, then m_T[] can accomodate up to m_P_capacity textures coordinates.
10383  // Otherwise there are no texture coordinates.
10384  // Never modify m_T_stride, m_T.
10385  // Use m_grid functions to get texture indices and quad face indices.
10386  // Note well: m_T_stride can be 0 when the texture coordinate is constant (one color per face for example)
10387  mutable double* m_T;
10388  mutable size_t m_T_stride;
10389 
10390  const double* TextureCoordinateArray(ON_SubDComponentLocation subd_appearance)const;
10391  size_t TextureCoordinateArrayStride(ON_SubDComponentLocation subd_appearance)const;
10392  unsigned TextureCoordinateArrayCount(ON_SubDComponentLocation subd_appearance) const;
10393 public:
10394  /*
10395  Returns:
10396  If grid texture coordinates are available, then VertexCount() is returned.
10397  Otherwise 0 is returned.
10398  */
10399  unsigned int TextureCoordinateCount() const;
10400  unsigned int TextureCoordinateCapacity() const;
10401 
10402 
10403  /*
10404  Description:
10405  Sets the values of each fragment's m_ctrlnetT[] member.
10406  Parameters:
10407  bSetTextureCoordinates
10408  If true, the texture coordinate corners are used ti set the fragment's m_T[]
10409  values after m_ctrlnetT[] is set.
10410  */
10411  void SetTextureCoordinateCornersForExperts(
10412  bool bGridOrder,
10413  const ON_3dPoint fragment_texture_coordinate_corners[4],
10414  bool bSetTextureCoordinates
10415  ) const;
10416 
10417  /*
10418  Description:
10419  This functions sets the texture coordinates on fragments used to render
10420  quad and 3-gon ON_SubDFaces.
10421  A quad ON_SubDFace is rendered with one ON_SubDMeshFragment.
10422  A 3-gon ON_SubDFace is rendered with three ON_SubDMeshFragments.
10423  Remarks:
10424  It is critcial that m_face_fragment_count and m_face_fragment_index be set
10425  correctly before calling this function.
10426  A ON_SubDMeshFragment used to render a quad ON_SubDFace has
10427  m_face_fragment_count = 1 and m_face_fragment_index = 0.
10428  A ON_SubDMeshFragment used to render a 3-gon ON_SubDFace has
10429  m_face_fragment_count = 3 and m_face_fragment_index = 0, 1 or 2.
10430  */
10431  void SetQuadOr3gonFaceFragmentTextureCoordinateCorners(
10432  bool bGridOrder,
10433  const ON_3dPoint face_texture_coordinate_corners[4],
10434  bool bSetTextureCoordinates
10435  ) const;
10436 
10437  /*
10438  Description:
10439  When an ON_SubDFace is an n-gon with n >= 5, it is rendered with n ON_SubDMeshFragments.
10440  This functions sets the texture coordinates on those fragments.
10441  Parameters:
10442  bGridOrder = [in]
10443  Order for face_pack_rect_corners[].
10444  face_texture_coordinate_corners - [in]
10445  The points returned by ON_SubDFace::TextureCoordinateCorner(bGridOrder, i, false)
10446  face_pack_rect_size - [in]
10447  The n-gon face's ON_SubDFace::PackRectSize() value.
10448  ngon_grid_size - [in]
10449  ngon_sub_pack_rect_size - [in]
10450  ngon_sub_pack_rect_delta - [in]
10451  These three parameters are values from ON_SubDFace::GetNgonSubPackRectSizeAndDelta().
10452  ngon_grid_size, ngon_sub_pack_rect_size, and ngon_sub_pack_rect_delta are identical
10453  for all the ON_SubDMeshFragments used to render the n-gon face. The value of
10454  m_face_fragment_index detemines which sub pack rect is assigned to each of
10455  the n ON_SubDMeshFragments use to render the n-gon face.
10456  Remarks:
10457  It is critcial that m_face_fragment_count and m_face_fragment_index be set
10458  correctly before calling this function.
10459  A ON_SubDMeshFragment used to render an n-gon ON_SubDFace has
10460  m_face_fragment_count = n and m_face_fragment_index = 0, ..., n-1.
10461  */
10462  void SetNgonFaceFragmentTextureCoordinateCorners(
10463  bool bGridOrder,
10464  const ON_3dPoint face_texture_coordinate_corners[4],
10465  ON_2dVector face_pack_rect_size,
10466  ON_2udex ngon_grid_size,
10467  ON_2dVector ngon_sub_pack_rect_size,
10468  ON_2dVector ngon_sub_pack_rect_delta,
10469  bool bSetTextureCoordinates
10470  ) const;
10471 
10472  /*
10473  Description:
10474  Get the texture coordinate corners.
10475  Parameters:
10476  bGridOrder - [in]
10477  If true, then points are returned in fragment grid order.
10478  Otherwise, points are returned in counter-clockwise quad order.
10479  texture_coordinate_corners - [out]
10480  */
10481  bool GetTextureCoordinteCorners(
10482  bool bGridOrder,
10483  ON_3dPoint texture_coordinate_corners[4]
10484  ) const;
10485 
10486  /*
10487  Description:
10488  Set the texture coordinates in m_T[] from the values in m_ctrlnetT[].
10489  */
10490  void SetTextureCoordinatesFromCorners() const;
10491 
10492  /*
10493  Description:
10494  Set the texture coordinates in m_T[] from the values in m_pack_rect[].
10495  */
10496  void SetPackedTextureCoordinates() const;
10497 
10498  /*
10499  Description:
10500  Set the this fragments texture coordinates in m_T[] to cover (0,1)x(0,1)
10501  */
10502  void SetUnpackedTextureCoordinates() const;
10503 
10504 private:
10505  void Internal_SetTextureCoordinatesFromCorners(
10506  const double* corner0,
10507  const double* corner1,
10508  const double* corner2,
10509  const double* corner3,
10510  double default_coordinate_value,
10511  int corner_dim
10512  ) const;
10513 
10514 private:
10515  ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
10516  //
10517  // Principal curvatures
10518  //
10519  // Depending on the strides, m_P[], m_N[], m_T[], and m_K[] can be separate or interlaced.
10520  //
10521  // If m_K is not nullptr and m_K_stride>0, then m_K[] can accomodate up to m_P_capacity
10522  // principal curvatures and sectional curvatures (four doubles, k1,k2,sx,sy).
10523  // Otherwise there are no principal curvatures or sectional curvatures.
10524  // (sx = sectional curvature in grid "x" direction, sy = sectional curvature in grid "y" direction.)
10525  // At exceptional points, the curvature values may be nan.
10526  // Never modify m_K_stride, m_K.
10527  // Use m_grid functions to get principal curvature indices and quad face indices.
10528  //
10529  // Currently, these fields are not actively used but will be soon. See RH-54144
10530  mutable double* m_K;
10531  mutable size_t m_K_stride;
10532 
10533 public:
10534  /*
10535  Returns:
10536  If grid vertex principal curvatures and sectional curvatures are available, then VertexCount() is returned.
10537  Otherwise 0 is returned.
10538  */
10539  unsigned int CurvatureCount() const;
10540  unsigned int CurvatureCapacity() const;
10541 
10542  const double* CurvatureArray(ON_SubDComponentLocation subd_appearance)const;
10543  size_t CurvatureArrayStride(ON_SubDComponentLocation subd_appearance)const;
10544  unsigned CurvatureArrayCount(ON_SubDComponentLocation subd_appearance) const;
10545 
10546 
10547 private:
10548  ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
10549  //
10550  // Per vertex false colors
10551  //
10552  // Depending on the strides, m_P[], m_N[], m_T[], m_K[], and m_C[] can be separate or interlaced.
10553  //
10554  // If m_C is not nullptr and m_C_stride>0, then m_C[] can accomodate up to m_P_capacity
10555  // elements.
10556  // Otherwise there is no per vertex false color.
10557  // Never modify m_C_stride, m_C.
10558  // Use m_grid functions to get principal curvature indices and quad face indices.
10559  //
10560  // Currently, these fields are not actively used but will be soon. See RH-54144
10561  mutable ON_Color* m_C;
10562  mutable size_t m_C_stride;
10563 
10564 public:
10565  /*
10566  Returns:
10567  If grid vertex colors are available, then VertexCount() is returned.
10568  Otherwise 0 is returned.
10569  */
10570  unsigned int ColorCount() const;
10571  unsigned int ColorCapacity() const;
10572 
10573  const ON_Color* ColorArray(ON_SubDComponentLocation subd_appearance)const;
10574  size_t ColorArrayStride(ON_SubDComponentLocation subd_appearance)const;
10575  unsigned ColorArrayCount(ON_SubDComponentLocation subd_appearance) const;
10576 
10577 public:
10578 
10579  // Normalized grid parameters useful for appling a texture to the grid are available
10580  // from m_grid functions.
10581 
10582  // Information to resolve m_P[], m_N[], and m_T[] into a grid of NxN quads.
10583  ON_SubDMeshFragmentGrid m_grid;
10584 
10585  const ON_SubDMeshFragmentGrid& Grid(ON_SubDComponentLocation subd_appearance) const;
10586 
10587  // 3d bounding box of grid vertex points.
10588  ON_BoundingBox m_surface_bbox;
10589 public:
10590  /*
10591  Parameters:
10592  display_density - [in]
10593  Determines grid size
10594  bTextureArray - [in]
10595  true to include memory for the m_T[] array.
10596  bCurvatureArray - [in]
10597  true to include room for the m_K[] array.
10598  bColor - [in]
10599  true to include room for the m_C[] array.
10600  Returns:
10601  Amount of memory needed for the fragment, the m_P[], m_N[] arrays, and optionally the
10602  m_T[] and m_K[] arrays.
10603  */
10604  static size_t SizeofFragment(
10605  unsigned int display_density,
10606  bool bTextureArray,
10607  bool bCurvatureArray,
10608  bool bFalseColorArray
10609  );
10610 
10611  public:
10612  void Dump(ON_TextLog& text_log) const;
10613 };
10614 
10615 class ON_CLASS ON_SubDManagedMeshFragment : public ON_SubDMeshFragment
10616 {
10617 public:
10618  ON_SubDManagedMeshFragment() ON_NOEXCEPT;
10619  ~ON_SubDManagedMeshFragment() ON_NOEXCEPT;
10620  ON_SubDManagedMeshFragment(const ON_SubDManagedMeshFragment&) ON_NOEXCEPT;
10621  ON_SubDManagedMeshFragment& operator=(const ON_SubDManagedMeshFragment&) ON_NOEXCEPT;
10622 
10623  static ON_SubDManagedMeshFragment Create(const ON_SubDMeshFragment& src) ON_NOEXCEPT;
10624 
10625 #if defined(ON_HAS_RVALUEREF)
10626  // rvalue copy constructor
10627  ON_SubDManagedMeshFragment( ON_SubDManagedMeshFragment&& ) ON_NOEXCEPT;
10628 
10629  // rvalue assignment operator
10630  ON_SubDManagedMeshFragment& operator=( ON_SubDManagedMeshFragment&& ) ON_NOEXCEPT;
10631 #endif
10632 
10633  void Clear() ON_NOEXCEPT;
10634 
10635  void Destroy() ON_NOEXCEPT;
10636 
10637  bool ReserveCapacity(
10638  unsigned int mesh_density
10639  ) ON_NOEXCEPT;
10640 
10641 private:
10642  void CopyHelper(const ON_SubDMeshFragment& src);
10643  size_t m_storage_capacity = 0;
10644  double* m_storage = nullptr;
10645 };
10646 
10647 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
10648 //
10649 // ON_SubDMesh
10650 //
10651 
10652 /// <summary>
10653 /// ON_SubDMesh is used to store a traditional quad mesh of either
10654 /// a SubgD surface or SubD control net. It is typically used for
10655 /// rendering and user interface selection cacluations.
10656 /// It is a list of ON_SubDMeshFragment classes.
10657 /// </summary>
10658 class ON_CLASS ON_SubDMesh
10659 {
10660 #if defined(ON_SUBD_CENSUS)
10661 private:
10662  ON_SubDMeshCensusCounter m_census_counter;
10663 #endif
10664 
10665 public:
10666  static const ON_SubDMesh Empty;
10667 
10668  /*
10669  Returns:
10670  A runtime number that changes if the limit mesh content changes.
10671  0: Empty limit mesh
10672  Remarks:
10673  This is a runtime number. It is not saved in archives and begins
10674  at 1 with each new runtime instance of the opennurbs library.
10675  */
10676  ON__UINT64 ContentSerialNumber() const;
10677 
10678 #if defined(OPENNURBS_PLUS)
10679  static ON_SubDMesh* Create(
10680  const ON_SubD& subd,
10681  const class ON_SubDDisplayParameters& limit_mesh_parameters,
10682  ON_SubDMesh* destination_mesh
10683  );
10684 #endif
10685 
10686 #if defined(OPENNURBS_PLUS)
10687  /*
10688  Description:
10689  This version is for expert users who want to take
10690  responsibility for managing the subd and limit mesh
10691  */
10692  static ON_SubDMesh* Create(
10693  ON_SubDFaceIterator fit,
10694  const class ON_SubDDisplayParameters& limit_mesh_parameters,
10695  ON_SubDMesh* destination_mesh
10696  );
10697 #endif
10698 
10699  /*
10700  Description:
10701  Parameters:
10702  destination_mesh - [in]
10703  If destination_mesh is not nullptr, then the returned mesh
10704  will be store here. Otherwise the returned mesh will be
10705  allocated with a call to new ON_Mesh().
10706  Returns:
10707  If this limit mesh is not empty, an ON_Mesh representation of this limit mesh.
10708  Othewise, nullptr.
10709  */
10710  ON_Mesh* ToMesh(
10711  ON_Mesh* destination_mesh
10712  ) const;
10713 
10714 
10715  /*
10716  Description:
10717  Parameters:
10718  mesh_density - [in]
10719  Larger numbers return denser meshes.
10720  destination_mesh - [in]
10721  If destination_mesh is not nullptr, then the returned mesh
10722  will be store here. Otherwise the returned mesh will be
10723  allocated with a call to new ON_Mesh().
10724  Returns:
10725  If this limit mesh is not empty, an ON_Mesh representation of this limit mesh.
10726  Othewise, nullptr.
10727  */
10728  ON_Mesh* ToMesh(
10729  unsigned int mesh_density,
10730  ON_Mesh* destination_mesh
10731  ) const;
10732 
10733  /*
10734  Description:
10735  Parameters:
10736  frit - [in]
10737  A fragment iterator from an ON_SubDMesh or ON_SubD.
10738  mesh_density - [in]
10739  Larger numbers return denser meshes.
10740  MinimumMeshDensity() <= mesh_density <= MaximumMeshDensity()
10741  destination_mesh - [in]
10742  If destination_mesh is not nullptr, then the returned mesh
10743  will be store here. Otherwise the returned mesh will be
10744  allocated with a call to new ON_Mesh().
10745  Returns:
10746  If this limit mesh is not empty, an ON_Mesh representation of this limit mesh.
10747  Othewise, nullptr.
10748  */
10749  static ON_Mesh* ToMesh(
10750  class ON_SubDMeshFragmentIterator& frit,
10751  unsigned int mesh_density,
10752  ON_Mesh* destination_mesh
10753  );
10754 
10755  ON_SubDMesh() = default;
10756  ~ON_SubDMesh() = default;
10757  ON_SubDMesh(const ON_SubDMesh&) = default;
10758  ON_SubDMesh& operator=(const ON_SubDMesh&) = default;
10759 
10760 
10761 #if defined(ON_HAS_RVALUEREF)
10762  // rvalue copy constructor
10763  ON_SubDMesh( ON_SubDMesh&& ) ON_NOEXCEPT;
10764  // rvalue assignment operator
10765  ON_SubDMesh& operator=( ON_SubDMesh&& );
10766 #endif
10767 
10768  ON_SubDMesh Copy() const;
10769 
10770  ON_SubDMesh& CopyFrom(
10771  const ON_SubDMesh& src
10772  );
10773 
10774  static void Swap(
10775  ON_SubDMesh& a,
10776  ON_SubDMesh& b
10777  );
10778 
10779  bool Transform(
10780  const ON_Xform& xform
10781  );
10782 
10783  unsigned int DisplayDensity() const;
10784  ON_SubDDisplayParameters DisplayParameters() const;
10785  unsigned int FragmentCount() const;
10786  const ON_SubDMeshFragment* FirstFragment() const; // linked list of mesh fragments
10787 
10788  /*
10789  Parameters:
10790  face - [in]
10791  Returns:
10792  The first fragment for this face or nullptr if none is found.
10793  If the face is not a quad, then there will be multiple partial
10794  fragments for the face and this is the first on. The others
10795  follow using m_next_fragment.
10796  */
10797  const ON_SubDMeshFragment* FaceFragment(
10798  const class ON_SubDFace* face
10799  ) const;
10800 
10801  /*
10802  Description:
10803  Get the limit surface point location and normal for
10804  the face's center from the limit mesh grid.
10805  Parameters:
10806  face - [in]
10807  P - [out]
10808  P = limit surface location or ON_3dPoint::NanPoint if not available.
10809  N - [out]
10810  N = limit surface unit normal or ON_3dVector::NanVector if not available.
10811  Returns:
10812  True if the point and normal were set from the limit mesh frament.
10813  False if the limit mesh fragment was not found and nan values were returned.
10814  */
10815  bool GetFaceCenterPointAndNormal(
10816  const class ON_SubDFace* face,
10817  double* P,
10818  double* N
10819  ) const;
10820 
10821  /*
10822  Description:
10823  Get the limit surface point location and normal for
10824  the edge's midpoint from the limit mesh grid.
10825  Parameters:
10826  edge - [in]
10827  edge_face_index - [in]
10828  Index of the face to use for the normal. If the edge is a crease, then
10829  each attached face may have a different normal. Pass 0 when in doubt.
10830  P - [out]
10831  P = limit surface location or ON_3dPoint::NanPoint if not available.
10832  N - [out]
10833  N = limit surface unit normal or ON_3dVector::NanVector if not available.
10834  Returns:
10835  True if the point and normal were set from the limit mesh frament.
10836  False if the limit mesh fragment was not found and nan values were returned.
10837  */
10838  bool GetEdgeCenterPointAndNormal(
10839  const class ON_SubDEdge* edge,
10840  unsigned int edge_face_index,
10841  double* P,
10842  double* N
10843  ) const;
10844 
10845  /*
10846  Description:
10847  If the subd referenced by m_subd_ref changes, then call
10848  Update to update the limit mesh.
10849  */
10850  bool Update(
10851  bool bShareUpdate
10852  );
10853 
10854  /*
10855  Description:
10856  The ON__INT_PTRs in the tree are const ON_SubDMeshFragment* pointers.
10857  */
10858  const ON_RTree& FragmentTree() const;
10859 
10860  /*
10861  Description:
10862  Clears everything.
10863  */
10864  void Clear();
10865 
10866  /*
10867  Description:
10868  If the tree is not needed and memory resources are tight, then call ClearTree()
10869  to remove the RTree.
10870  */
10871  void ClearTree();
10872 
10873  bool IsEmpty() const;
10874 
10875  ON_BoundingBox BoundingBox() const;
10876 
10877  bool GetTightBoundingBox(
10878  ON_BoundingBox& bbox,
10879  bool bGrowBox,
10880  const ON_Xform* xform
10881  ) const;
10882 
10883  ON_SubDRef SubDRef() const;
10884  ON_SubD SubD() const;
10885 
10886 public:
10887  /*
10888  Description:
10889  Pretend this function and ON_SubDMeshImpl do not exist.
10890  Returns:
10891  Something that you are pretending does not exist.
10892  Remarks:
10893  It is intentional that the definition of ON_SubDMeshImpl class is not
10894  available in the opennurbs library interface (not in a header file).
10895  The size and design of ON_SubDMeshImpl will change constantly.
10896  If you choose to hack and whack so you can dereference an
10897  ON_SubDMeshImpl* pointer, then your code will crash unpredictably.
10898  */
10899  class ON_SubDMeshImpl* SubLimple() const;
10900  unsigned int SubLimpleUseCount() const;
10901 
10902 private:
10903 #pragma ON_PRAGMA_WARNING_PUSH
10904 #pragma ON_PRAGMA_WARNING_DISABLE_MSC( 4251 )
10905  friend class ON_SubDMeshImpl;
10906  // C4251: ... needs to have dll-interface to be used by clients of class ...
10907  // m_impl_sp is private and all code that manages m_impl_sp is explicitly implemented in the DLL.
10908 private:
10909  std::shared_ptr< class ON_SubDMeshImpl > m_impl_sp;
10910 #pragma ON_PRAGMA_WARNING_POP
10911 
10912 };
10913 
10914 #if defined(OPENNURBS_PLUS)
10915 
10916 class ON_CLASS ON_SubDSurfaceNurbsFragment
10917 {
10918 public:
10919  ON_SubDSurfaceNurbsFragment() = default;
10920  ~ON_SubDSurfaceNurbsFragment() = default;
10921  ON_SubDSurfaceNurbsFragment(const ON_SubDSurfaceNurbsFragment&) = default;
10922  ON_SubDSurfaceNurbsFragment& operator=(const ON_SubDSurfaceNurbsFragment&) = default;
10923 
10924 public:
10925  // Every field of ON_SubDSurfaceNurbsFragment::Empty is zero.
10926  static const ON_SubDSurfaceNurbsFragment Empty;
10927 
10928  // Every m_patch_cv[][][] value is ON_UNSET_VALUE.
10929  // Every other field of ON_SubDSurfaceNurbsFragment::Unset is zero.
10930  static const ON_SubDSurfaceNurbsFragment Unset;
10931 
10932  // Every m_patch_cv[][][] value is ON_DBL_QNAN.
10933  // Every other field of ON_SubDSurfaceNurbsFragment::Unset is zero.
10934  static const ON_SubDSurfaceNurbsFragment Nan;
10935 
10936 
10937  #pragma region RH_C_SHARED_ENUM [ON_SubDSurfaceNurbsFragment::PatchTypeXYX] [Rhino.Geometry.SubD.PatchFragmentTypeXYX] [internal:nested:byte]
10938  /// <summary>
10939  /// ON_SubDSurfaceNurbsFragment::Type are types bezier bispans covering a portion of a SubD face.
10940  /// </summary>
10941  enum class Type : unsigned char
10942  {
10943  ///<summary>Not a valid patch type.</summary>
10944  Unset = 0,
10945 
10946  ///<summary>This fragment is a single 4x4 bicubic span covering the entire SubD region identified by m_face_region.</summary>
10947  BicubicSingle = 1,
10948 
10949  ///<summary>The bispans in this fragment are quadrants of the SubD region identified by m_face_region.</summary>
10950  BicubicQuadrant = 4
10951  };
10952 #pragma endregion
10953 
10954  #pragma region RH_C_SHARED_ENUM [ON_SubDSurfaceNurbsFragment::BispanAccuracy] [Rhino.Geometry.SubD.FragmentBispanType] [internal:nested:byte]
10955  /// <summary>
10956  /// ON_SubDSurfaceNurbsFragment::BispanAccuracy specifies if a bispan surface is an exact or approximate.
10957  /// </summary>
10958  enum class BispanAccuracy : unsigned char
10959  {
10960  ///<summary>No bispan.</summary>
10961  None = 0,
10962 
10963  ///<summary>Entire region identified by m_face_region is an exact bicubic patch.</summary>
10964  Exact = 1,
10965 
10966  ///<summary>Entire region identified by m_face_region is approximately a bicubic patch.</summary>
10967  Approximate = 2
10968  };
10969 #pragma endregion
10970 
10971 public:
10972  // knot vector is uniform and not clamped. For example {-2,-1,0,1,2,3,4}.
10973  double m_patch_cv[5][5][3];
10974 
10975  // m_face_region identifies what part of the SubD is represented by this patch
10976  ON_SubDFaceRegion m_face_region;
10977 
10978  ON_SubDSurfaceNurbsFragment::Type m_type = ON_SubDSurfaceNurbsFragment::Type::Unset;
10979 
10980  // m_patch_type[] reports what type of patch is returned in m_patch_cv[]
10981  // m_patch_type[0] = the state for the uniform bi-cubic patch:
10982  // CV[i][j] = m_patch_cv[i][j] (0 <= i <= 3, 0 <= j <= 3)
10983  // knot[0] = {-2,-1,0,1,2,3}
10984  // knot[1] = {-2,-1,0,1,2,3}
10985  // m_patch_type[1] = the state for the uniform bi-cubic patch:
10986  // CV[i][j] = m_patch_cv[i+1][j] (0 <= i <= 3, 0 <= j <= 3)
10987  // knot[0] = {-1,0,1,2,3,4}
10988  // knot[1] = {-2,-1,0,1,2,3}
10989  // m_patch_type[2] = the state for the uniform bi-cubic patch:
10990  // CV[i][j] = m_patch_cv[i+1][j+1] (0 <= i <= 3, 0 <= j <= 3)
10991  // knot[0] = {-1,0,1,2,3,4}
10992  // knot[1] = {-1,0,1,2,3,4}
10993  // m_patch_type[3] = the state for the uniform bi-cubic patch:
10994  // CV[i][j] = m_patch_cv[i][j+1] (0 <= i <= 3, 0 <= j <= 3)
10995  // knot[0] = {-2,-1,0,1,2,3}
10996  // knot[1] = {-1,0,1,2,3,4}
10997  //
10998  // Single bicubic bezier covers the region:
10999  // m_patch_type[] = {Bicubic or ApproximateBicubic, Ignore, Ignore, Ignore}
11000  // Bicubic quadrants
11001  // Each m_patch_type[] element is one of BicubicQuadrant, ApproximateBicubicQuadrant, or None.
11002  ON_SubDSurfaceNurbsFragment::BispanAccuracy m_bispan_type[4] = {};
11003 
11004 
11005 private:
11006  // number of edges in the level 0 SubD face.
11007  unsigned char m_reserved1 = 0;
11008  unsigned short m_reserved2 = 0;
11009 
11010 public:
11011  /*
11012  True if there are no set bispans.
11013  */
11014  bool IsEmpty() const;
11015 
11016  /*
11017  Returns:
11018  0: unset NURBS fragment
11019  1: This NURBS fragment uses a single bicubic span to model the region identified by m_face_region.
11020  4: This NURBS fragment uses 4 bicubic spans to model the 4 quadrants of the region identified by m_face_region.
11021  */
11022  unsigned int MaximumBispanCount() const;
11023 
11024  /*
11025  Returns:
11026  0 to 4 indicating the number of bicubic spans that are set in
11027  this NURBS fragment.
11028  Remarks:
11029  If 0 < SetBispanCount() == MaximumBispanCount(),
11030  then the entire region identified by m_face_region is modeled by
11031  this NURBS fragment.
11032 
11033  If 0 < SetBispanCount() < MaximumBispanCount(),
11034  then that many quadrants of the region identified by m_face_region
11035  are modeled by this set bispans in this NURBS fragment.
11036  */
11037  unsigned int SetBispanCount() const;
11038 
11039 
11040  /*
11041  Returns:
11042  0 to 4 indicating the number of unset bicubic spans in "this".
11043  */
11044  unsigned int UnsetBispanCount() const;
11045 
11046  /*
11047  Returns:
11048  One or more of the bispans approximate the SubD surface.
11049  */
11050  bool IsApproximate() const;
11051 
11052  ON_NurbsSurface* GetSurface(
11053  ON_NurbsSurface* destination_surface
11054  ) const;
11055 
11056  ON_NurbsSurface* GetQuadrantSurface(
11057  unsigned int quadrant_index,
11058  ON_NurbsSurface* destination_surface
11059  ) const;
11060 
11061 
11062 private:
11063  unsigned short m_reserved = 0;
11064 };
11065 
11066 #endif
11067 
11068 class ON_CLASS ON_SubDSectorSurfacePoint
11069 {
11070 public:
11071  // For performance reasons, the default the data members are
11072  // not initialized by the default constructor
11073  // Use = ON_SubDSectorSurfacePoint::Unset when initialization is required
11074  static const ON_SubDSectorSurfacePoint Unset; // all doubles are ON_UNSET_VALUE, all pointer are nullptr
11075  static const ON_SubDSectorSurfacePoint Nan; // all doubles are ON_DBL_QNAN, all pointer are nullptr
11076  static const ON_SubDSectorSurfacePoint Zero; // all doubles are 0.0, all pointer are nullptr
11077 
11078  /*
11079  Returns:
11080  true if m_limitP[0] is ON_UNSET_VALUE.
11081  false otherwise.
11082  */
11083  bool IsUnset() const;
11084 
11085  /*
11086  Returns:
11087  true if m_limitP[0] is a nan (like ON_DBL_QNAN).
11088  false otherwise.
11089  */
11090  bool IsNan() const;
11091 
11092  /*
11093  Returns:
11094  true if all coordinates are zero.
11095  false otherwise.
11096  */
11097  bool IsZero() const;
11098 
11099  /*
11100  Returns:
11101  true if all coordinates are valid doubles and the tangents and normal have at least
11102  one nonzero coordinate.
11103  false otherwise.
11104  */
11105  bool IsSet(
11106  bool bUndefinedNormalIsPossible
11107  ) const;
11108 
11109  bool Transform(
11110  const ON_Xform& xform
11111  );
11112 
11113  // limit surface point, tangents and normal
11114  double m_limitP[3]; // point
11115  double m_limitT1[3]; // first unit tangent
11116  double m_limitT2[3]; // second unit tangent
11117  double m_limitN[3]; // unit normal (same direction as m_limitT1 x m_limitT2)
11118 
11119  // When an ON_SubDVertex has a single sector, (ON_SubDVertex.IsSingleSectorVertex() is true),
11120  // these pointers are both null.
11121  // When an ON_SubDVertex has a multiple sectors,
11122  // m_sector_face is the "first" face in the sector and
11123  // m_next_sector_limit_point is used to create a linked list.
11124  // (The "first" face in a sector is the one ON_SubDSectorIterator.IncrementToCrease(-1) returns.)
11125  const class ON_SubDSectorSurfacePoint* m_next_sector_limit_point; // nullptr for vertices with one sector
11126  const class ON_SubDFace* m_sector_face; // nullptr for vertices with one sector
11127 };
11128 
11129 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
11130 //
11131 // ON_SubDComponentBase
11132 //
11133 class ON_CLASS ON_SubDComponentBase
11134 {
11135 public:
11136  static const ON_SubDComponentBase Unset;
11137 
11138  /*
11139  Returns:
11140  True if this component is active in its parent subd or other
11141  relevent context.
11142  Remarks:
11143  When a component is in use, IsActive() = true.
11144  If was used and then deleted, IsActive() is false.
11145  */
11146  bool IsActive() const;
11147 
11148 public:
11149  ON_SubDComponentBase() = default;
11150  ~ON_SubDComponentBase() = default;
11151  ON_SubDComponentBase(const ON_SubDComponentBase&) = default;
11152  ON_SubDComponentBase& operator=(const ON_SubDComponentBase&) = default;
11153 
11154 public:
11155  static int CompareId(
11156  const ON_SubDComponentBase* lhs,
11157  const ON_SubDComponentBase* rhs
11158  );
11159 
11160 
11161 public:
11162  // The audience for this comment is anybody who wants to change the data
11163  // fields in ON_SubDComponentBase. Everyone else should ignore this comment.
11164  // ON_SubD components come from ON_FixedSizePool and ON_SubD code
11165  // uses ON_FixedSizePool.ReturnElement. The first sizeof(void*) bytes
11166  // must be a data field that is not referenced in returned elements.
11167  // Since a returned element cannot have a "next level vertex",
11168  // m_subd_point1 is a good data member to put first.
11169 
11170  // m_subd_point1 points to the next level's vertex when this component
11171  // has been subdivided using an algorithm like Catmull-Clark or Loop-Warren.
11172  const class ON_SubDVertex* m_subd_point1 = nullptr;
11173 
11174 public:
11175  // The audience for this comment is anybody who wants to change the data
11176  // fields in ON_SubDComponentBase. Everyone else should ignore this comment.
11177  // It is critical that the offset of m_id in ON_SubDComponentBase be >= sizeof(void*).
11178  // ON_SubD components come from ON_FixedSizePool and ON_SubD code
11179  // use ON_FixedSizePool.ElementFromId and ON_FixedSizePool.ReturnElement.
11180  // Once assigned, m_id is never changed and that allows ON_SubD component
11181  // indices to work.
11182 
11183  // Id assigned to this component. NEVER MODIFY THE m_id VALUE.
11184  // It is assigned by allocators and used to find the component
11185  // from an ON_COMPONENT_INDEX.
11186  unsigned int m_id = 0;
11187 
11188 private:
11189  // The m_archive_id must be immediately after the m_id field.
11190  // A value of ON_UNSET_UINT_INDEX indicate the component was
11191  // in use and then deleted. See ON_SubDHeap Return...() functions
11192  // for more details.
11193  mutable unsigned int m_archive_id = 0;
11194 
11195 public:
11196 
11197  /*
11198  Returns:
11199  Subdivision level (0 to 255)
11200  */
11201  unsigned const SubdivisionLevel() const;
11202 
11203  /*
11204  Parameters:
11205  level - [in]
11206  Subdivision level (0 to 255)
11207  */
11208  void SetSubdivisionLevel(unsigned level);
11209 
11210 
11211 public:
11212  const ON_ComponentStatus Status() const;
11213 
11214 
11215 public:
11216  mutable ON_ComponentStatus m_status = ON_ComponentStatus::NoneSet;
11217 
11218  /*
11219  Returns:
11220  The current value of the component mark ( m_status->RuntimeMark() ).
11221  Remarks:
11222  SubD components have a mutable runtime mark that can be used
11223  in any context where a single thread cares about the marks.
11224  Any code can use Mark() at any time. You cannot assume that
11225  other functions including const will not change its value.
11226  It is widely used in many calculations to keep track of sets of
11227  components that are in a certain context specfic state.
11228  */
11229  bool Mark() const;
11230 
11231  /*
11232  Description:
11233  Clears (sets to false) the value of the component mark.
11234  Remarks:
11235  SubD components have a mutable runtime mark that can be used
11236  in any context where a single thread cares about the marks.
11237  Any code can use Mark() at any time. You cannot assume that
11238  other functions including const will not change its value.
11239  It is widely used in many calculations to keep track of sets of
11240  components that are in a certain context specfic state.
11241  Returns:
11242  Input value of Mark().
11243  */
11244  bool ClearMark() const;
11245 
11246  /*
11247  Description:
11248  Sets (sets to true) the value of the component mark.
11249  Remarks:
11250  SubD components have a mutable runtime mark that can be used
11251  in any context where a single thread cares about the marks.
11252  Any code can use Mark() at any time. You cannot assume that
11253  other functions including const will not change its value.
11254  It is widely used in many calculations to keep track of sets of
11255  components that are in a certain context specfic state.
11256  Returns:
11257  Input value of Mark().
11258  */
11259  bool SetMark() const;
11260 
11261  /*
11262  Description:
11263  Sets the value of the component mark to bMark.
11264  Parameter:
11265  bMark - [in]
11266  Remarks:
11267  SubD components have a mutable runtime mark that can be used
11268  in any context where a single thread cares about the marks.
11269  Any code can use Mark() at any time. You cannot assume that
11270  other functions including const will not change its value.
11271  It is widely used in many calculations to keep track of sets of
11272  components that are in a certain context specfic state.
11273  Returns:
11274  Input value of Mark().
11275  */
11276  bool SetMark(
11277  bool bMark
11278  ) const;
11279 
11280  /*
11281  Returns:
11282  The current value of the component mark bits ( m_status->MarkBits() ).
11283  Remarks:
11284  Mark() and MarkBits() are independent.
11285 
11286  SubD components have a mutable runtime mark bits that can be used
11287  in any context where a single thread cares about the mark bits value.
11288  Any code can use MarkBits() at any time. You cannot assume that
11289  other functions including const will not change their value.
11290  It is widely used in many calculations to keep track of sets of
11291  components that are in a certain context specfic state.
11292 
11293  MarkBits() is used in more complex calculations where the single true/false
11294  provided by Mark() is not sufficient. Typically MarkBits() is used when
11295  a collecection of components needs to be partitioned into more than two
11296  sets or when the value of Mark() cannot be changed.
11297  */
11298  ON__UINT8 MarkBits() const;
11299 
11300  /*
11301  Returns:
11302  Set the component mark bits ( m_status->SetMarkBits( mark_bits ) ).
11303  Remarks:
11304  Mark() and MarkBits() are independent.
11305 
11306  SubD components have a mutable runtime mark bits that can be used
11307  in any context where a single thread cares about the mark bits value.
11308  Any code can use MarkBits() at any time. You cannot assume that
11309  other functions including const will not change their value.
11310  It is widely used in many calculations to keep track of sets of
11311  components that are in a certain context specfic state.
11312 
11313  MarkBits() is used in more complex calculations where the single true/false
11314  provided by Mark() is not sufficient. Typically MarkBits() is used when
11315  a collecection of components needs to be partitioned into more than two
11316  sets or when the value of Mark() cannot be changed.
11317  Returns:
11318  Input value of MarkBits().
11319  */
11320  ON__UINT8 SetMarkBits(
11321  ON__UINT8 mark_bits
11322  ) const;
11323 
11324  /*
11325  Returns:
11326  Set the component mark bits to 0 ( m_status->SetMarkBits( 0 ) ).
11327  Remarks:
11328  Mark() and MarkBits() are independent.
11329 
11330  SubD components have a mutable runtime mark bits that can be used
11331  in any context where a single thread cares about the mark bits value.
11332  Any code can use MarkBits() at any time. You cannot assume that
11333  other functions including const will not change their value.
11334  It is widely used in many calculations to keep track of sets of
11335  components that are in a certain context specfic state.
11336 
11337  MarkBits() is used in more complex calculations where the single true/false
11338  provided by Mark() is not sufficient. Typically MarkBits() is used when
11339  a collecection of components needs to be partitioned into more than two
11340  sets or when the value of Mark() cannot be changed.
11341  Returns:
11342  Input value of MarkBits().
11343  */
11344  ON__UINT8 ClearMarkBits() const;
11345 
11346 
11347 public:
11348 
11349  //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
11350  //
11351  // Saved subdivision point
11352  //
11353  /*
11354  Description:
11355  Set the saved subdivision point.
11356  Parameters:
11357  subdivision_point - [in]
11358  includes displacement if it exists
11359  Returns:
11360  true if successful
11361  */
11362  bool SetSavedSubdivisionPoint(
11363  const double subdivision_point[3]
11364  ) const;
11365 
11366  bool GetSavedSubdivisionPoint(
11367  double subdivision_point[3]
11368  ) const;
11369 
11370  /*
11371  Description:
11372  Clears saved subdivision and limit surface information for this component.
11373  Attached components are not modifed.
11374  */
11375  void ClearSavedSubdivisionPoint() const;
11376 
11377  /*
11378  Returns:
11379  Saved subdivision point. If a point has not been saved,
11380  ON_3dPoint::NanPoint is returned.
11381  */
11382  const ON_3dPoint SavedSubdivisionPoint() const;
11383 
11384  /*
11385  Returns:
11386  True if the subdivision point is cached.
11387  */
11388  bool SavedSubdivisionPointIsSet() const;
11389 
11390  //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
11391  //
11392  // displacement applied to subdivision point
11393  //
11394  bool SetSubdivisionDisplacement(
11395  const double displacement[3]
11396  );
11397 
11398  bool GetSubdivisionDisplacement(
11399  double displacement[3]
11400  ) const;
11401 
11402  /*
11403  Returns:
11404  subdivision displacement. If a displacement has not been set,
11405  ON_3dPoint::ZeroVector is returned.
11406  */
11407  const ON_3dVector SubdivisionDisplacement() const;
11408 
11409  /*
11410  Returns:
11411  True if the subdivision displacment vector is valid and not zero.
11412  */
11413  bool SubdivisionDisplacementIsNonzero() const;
11414 
11415 
11416  void ClearSubdivisionDisplacement() const;
11417 
11418 protected:
11419  friend class ON_Internal_SubDFaceMeshFragmentAccumulator;
11420  friend class ON_SubDHeap;
11421  enum SavedPointsFlags : unsigned char
11422  {
11423  // if ( 0 != (m_saved_points_flags & SubDDisplacementVIsSet), then m_displacementV is set.
11424  SubdivisionDisplacementBit = 0x20,
11425 
11426  // if ( 0 != (m_saved_points_flags & SubdivisionPointBit), then m_cache_subd_P is set.
11427  SubdivisionPointBit = 0x40,
11428 
11429  // if ( 0 != (m_saved_points_flags & SurfacePointBit), then ON_SubDVertex.m_limit* values are set.
11430  // ON_SubDVertex: Set means one or more sector limit surface points are saved in ON_SubDVertex.m_limit_point.
11431  // ON_SubDEdge: Set means the limit surface NURBS curve control points are cached.
11432  // ON_SubDFace: Set means limit surface mesh fragments are saved in ON_SubDFace.m_surface_mesh_fragments.
11433  // Unset means any information in the fields identified above is invalid and must be recalculated.
11434  SurfacePointBit = 0x80,
11435 
11436  // ControlNetFragmentBit | SubdivisionPointBit | SubdivisionDisplacementBit | SurfacePointBit
11437  CachedPointMask = 0xF0
11438  };
11439 
11440  enum ModifiedFlags : unsigned char
11441  {
11442  // if ( 0 != (m_saved_points_flags & Modified1Bit), then the component has been modified and
11443  // cached subdivision information needs to be recalculated.
11444  Modified1Bit = 0x01,
11445 
11446  // if ( 0 != (m_saved_points_flags & Modified2Bit), then the component is adjacent to
11447  // a modified component and cached subdivision information needs to be recalculated.
11448  Modified2Bit = 0x02,
11449 
11450  // ModifiedFlagsMask = Modified1Bit | Modified2Bit
11451  // if ( 0 != (m_saved_points_flags & ModifiedFlagsMask), then any cached subdivision information
11452  // on that component needs to be recalculated.
11453  ModifiedFlagsMask = 0x03
11454  };
11455 
11456  // m_saved_points_flags is a bit field based on ON_SubDComponentBase::SavePointsFlags values.
11457  // GetSurfacePoint( bUseSavedSurfacePoint=true ) can change the value of m_saved_points_flags
11458  void Internal_SetSavedSurfacePointFlag(bool bSavedSurfacePointFlag) const;
11459  void Internal_SetModified1Flag() const;
11460  void Internal_SetModified2Flag() const;
11461 
11462  /*
11463  Returns:
11464  True if Modified1Bit or Modified2Bit is set.
11465  */
11466  bool Internal_Modified1IsSet() const;
11467 
11468  /*
11469  Returns:
11470  True if Modified1Bit or Modified2Bit is set.
11471  */
11472  bool Internal_Modified1or2IsSet() const;
11473 
11474  void Internal_ClearModifiedFlags() const;
11475  mutable unsigned char m_saved_points_flags = 0U;
11476 
11477  unsigned char m_level = 0U;
11478 public:
11479 
11480  // All the faces with the same nonzero value of m_group_id are in the same "group".
11481  // SDK interface on ON_SubD will be added after we get a better idea of how this
11482  // feature will be used.
11483  mutable unsigned int m_group_id = 0U;
11484 
11485 protected:
11486  /*
11487  Description:
11488  Clears the flags indicating the saved subdivision point and surface point information
11489  is current.
11490  */
11491  void Internal_ClearSubdivisionPointAndSurfacePointFlags() const;
11492 
11493  /*
11494  Description:
11495  Clears the flag indicating the saved subdivision point is current.
11496  */
11497  void Internal_ClearSubdivisionPointFlag() const;
11498 
11499  /*
11500  Description:
11501  Clears the flag indicating the saved surface point information is current.
11502  */
11503  void Internal_ClearSurfacePointFlag() const;
11504 
11505  bool Internal_SubdivisionPointFlag() const;
11506 
11507  bool Internal_SurfacePointFlag() const;
11508 
11509  void Internal_TransformComponentBase(bool bTransformationSavedSubdivisionPoint, const class ON_Xform& xform);
11510  // GetSubdivisionPoint( bUseSavedSubdivisionPoint=true ) can change the value of m_cache_subd_P
11511  mutable double m_saved_subd_point1[3]; // saved subdivision point
11512 
11513 protected:
11514  // optional displacement applied to standard subdivision point.
11515  double m_displacement_V[3];
11516 
11517 public:
11518  /*
11519  Description:
11520  Pretend ArchiveId() and SetArchiveId() do not exist.
11521  Returns:
11522  The ArchiveId is a value set and used by ON_BinaryArchive Read() and Write()
11523  functions and copy constructors and operator=().
11524  A public interface is supplied because it is not practical to use friends.
11525  Remarks:
11526  A value of ON_UNSET_UINT_INDEX indicates the component is not in use.
11527  */
11528  unsigned int ArchiveId() const
11529  {
11530  return m_archive_id;
11531  }
11532 
11533  void SetArchiveId(
11534  unsigned int archive_id
11535  ) const
11536  {
11537  // m_archive_id is mutable
11538  if ( ON_UNSET_UINT_INDEX != archive_id )
11539  m_archive_id = archive_id;
11540  }
11541 
11542 protected:
11543  void CopyBaseFrom(
11544  const ON_SubDComponentBase* src
11545  );
11546 
11547 private:
11548  ON_SubDComponentPtr m_reserved; // reserved for the symmetric component when symmetry is implemnted.
11549 };
11550 
11551 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
11552 //
11553 // ON_SubDVertexEdgeProperties
11554 //
11555 class ON_CLASS ON_SubDVertexEdgeProperties
11556 {
11557 public:
11558  ON_SubDVertexEdgeProperties() = default;
11559  ~ON_SubDVertexEdgeProperties() = default;
11560  ON_SubDVertexEdgeProperties(const ON_SubDVertexEdgeProperties&) = default;
11561  ON_SubDVertexEdgeProperties& operator=(const ON_SubDVertexEdgeProperties&) = default;
11562 
11563 public:
11564  static const ON_SubDVertexEdgeProperties Zero; // all member values are zero.
11565 
11566  /*
11567  Returns:
11568  True if there are no null edges and there are two edges with a single face and all remaining edges have two faces.
11569  Remarks:
11570  Tags are ignored.
11571  */
11572  bool HasInteriorVertexTopology() const;
11573 
11574  /*
11575  Returns:
11576  True if there are no null edges, exactly two boundary edges, and any other edges have two faces.
11577  Remarks:
11578  Tags are ignored.
11579  */
11580  bool HasBoundaryVertexTopology() const;
11581 
11582  /*
11583  Returns:
11584  HasInteriorVertexTopology() || HasBoundaryVertexTopology().
11585  */
11586  bool HasManifoldVertexTopology() const;
11587 
11588  /*
11589  Returns:
11590  True if there are no null edges and there is an edge with zero faces or an edge with three or more faces.
11591  Remarks:
11592  Tags are ignored.
11593  */
11594  bool HasNonmanifoldVertexTopology() const;
11595 
11596  /*
11597  Returns:
11598  Number of edges.
11599  */
11600  unsigned EdgeCount() const;
11601 
11602 public:
11603  // Number of null edges
11604  unsigned short m_null_edge_count = 0;
11605 
11606 
11607  /////////////////////////////////////////////////////
11608  //
11609  // Vertex attached component counts
11610  //
11611 
11612  // vertex->m_edge_count
11613  unsigned short m_edge_count = 0;
11614 
11615  // vertex->m_face_count
11616  unsigned short m_face_count = 0;
11617 
11618  /////////////////////////////////////////////////////
11619  //
11620  // Edge tag counts
11621  //
11622 
11623  // Number of edges tags ON_SubDEdgeTag::Unset
11624  unsigned short m_unset_edge_count = 0;
11625 
11626  // Number of edges tags ON_SubDEdgeTag::Smooth or ON_SubDEdgeTag::SmoothX
11627  unsigned short m_smooth_edge_count = 0;
11628 
11629  // Number of edges tags ON_SubDEdgeTag::Crease
11630  unsigned short m_crease_edge_count = 0;
11631 
11632  /////////////////////////////////////////////////////
11633  //
11634  // Edge topology counts
11635  //
11636 
11637  // Number of wire edges (0 attached faces)
11638  unsigned short m_wire_edge_count = 0;
11639 
11640  // Number of boundary edges (1 attached face)
11641  unsigned short m_boundary_edge_count = 0;
11642 
11643  // Number of interior edges (2 attached faces)
11644  unsigned short m_interior_edge_count = 0;
11645 
11646  // Number of nonmanifold edges (3 or more attached faces)
11647  unsigned short m_nonmanifold_edge_count = 0;
11648 
11649 
11650  /////////////////////////////////////////////////////
11651  //
11652  // Edge face counts
11653  //
11654 
11655  // Minimum value of attached edges's m_face_count.
11656  unsigned short m_min_edge_face_count = 0;
11657 
11658  // Maximum value of attached edges's m_face_count.
11659  unsigned short m_max_edge_face_count = 0;
11660 };
11661 
11662 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
11663 //
11664 // ON_SubDVertex
11665 //
11666 class ON_CLASS ON_SubDVertex : public ON_SubDComponentBase
11667 {
11668 private:
11669  friend class ON_SubDArchiveIdMap;
11670  friend class ON_SubDEdge;
11671  friend class ON_SubDFace;
11672 
11673 public:
11674  ON_SubDVertex() = default;
11675  ~ON_SubDVertex() = default;
11676  ON_SubDVertex(const ON_SubDVertex&) = default;
11677  ON_SubDVertex& operator=(const ON_SubDVertex&) = default;
11678 
11679 public:
11680  unsigned int VertexId() const;
11681 
11682 public:
11683  /*
11684  Description:
11685  Clears saved subdivision and limit surface information for this vertex.
11686  Attached edges and faces are not modifed.
11687  */
11688  void ClearSavedSubdivisionPoints() const;
11689 
11690 public:
11691  static const ON_SubDVertex Empty;
11692 
11693  bool Write (
11694  class ON_BinaryArchive& archive
11695  ) const;
11696 
11697  static bool Read (
11698  class ON_BinaryArchive& archive,
11699  class ON_SubD& subd,
11700  class ON_SubDVertex*& vertex
11701  );
11702 
11703  const ON_wString ToString(
11704  bool bIncludeControlNetPoint,
11705  bool bIncludeTopology
11706  ) const;
11707 
11708  /*
11709  Parameters:
11710  bIncludeEdges - [in]
11711  If true, then attached edges are included.
11712  bIncludeFaces - [in]
11713  If true, then attached faces are included.
11714  Returns:
11715  A ON_ComponentStatusLogicalOr() of this vertex's status and the
11716  specified attached components.
11717  See Also:
11718  ON_SubDComponentBase::Status()
11719  */
11720  const ON_ComponentStatus NeighborhoodStatusLogicalOr(
11721  bool bIncludeEdges,
11722  bool bIncludeFaces
11723  ) const;
11724 
11725  /*
11726  Description:
11727  Apply a tranxfomration matrix to vertex geometry information.
11728  Parameters:
11729  bTransformationSavedSubdivisionPoint - [in]
11730  If the transformation is being applied to every vertex, edge and
11731  face in every level of a subdivision object, and the transformation
11732  is an isometry (rotation, translation, ...), a uniform scale, or a
11733  composition of these types, then set
11734  bTransformationSavedSubdivisionPoint = true to apply the
11735  transformation to saved subdivision and saved limit point information.
11736  In all other cases, set bTransformationSavedSubdivisionPoint = false
11737  and any saved subdivision points or saved limit points will be
11738  deleted. When in doubt, pass false.
11739 
11740  xform - [in]
11741  */
11742  bool Transform(
11743  bool bTransformationSavedSubdivisionPoint,
11744  const class ON_Xform& xform
11745  );
11746 
11747  bool SetControlNetPoint(
11748  ON_3dPoint control_net_point,
11749  bool bClearNeighborhoodCache
11750  );
11751 
11752 
11753  ON_BoundingBox ControlNetBoundingBox() const;
11754 
11755 #if defined(OPENNURBS_PLUS)
11756  ON_BoundingBox SurfaceBoundingBox(
11757  const ON_SubD& subd
11758  ) const;
11759 
11760  const ON_BoundingBox BoundingBox(ON_SubDComponentLocation subd_appearance, const ON_SubD& subd) const;
11761 
11762 #endif
11763 
11764 public:
11765  const ON_COMPONENT_INDEX ComponentIndex() const;
11766  const ON_SubDComponentPtr ComponentPtr() const;
11767 
11768 public:
11769  // m_prev_vertex, m_next_vertex must be the first data members of ON_SubDVertex
11770  const class ON_SubDVertex* m_prev_vertex = nullptr; // linked list of vertices on this level
11771  const class ON_SubDVertex* m_next_vertex = nullptr; // linked list of vertices on this level
11772 
11773 public:
11774  ON_SubDVertexTag m_vertex_tag = ON_SubDVertexTag::Unset;
11775 
11776 
11777 private:
11778  //ON_SubD::VertexEdgeOrder m_vertex_edge_order = ON_SubD::VertexEdgeOrder::unset;
11779  unsigned char m_reserved1 = 0;
11780  unsigned short m_reserved2 = 0;
11781  unsigned int m_reserved3 = 0;
11782 
11783 public:
11784  unsigned short m_edge_count = 0;
11785  unsigned short m_face_count = 0;
11786 
11787  unsigned short m_edge_capacity = 0;
11788  unsigned short m_face_capacity = 0;
11789 
11790 public:
11791  // Array of m_edge_count edges.
11792  // m_edge[i].EdgeDirection() indicates which edge end is located at this vertex
11793  // If m_edge_capacity > 0, m_edge_capacity is the number of elements that
11794  // may be used in m_edges[].
11795  class ON_SubDEdgePtr* m_edges = nullptr;
11796 
11797  // Array of m_face_count faces.
11798  // If m_face_capacity > 0, m_face_capacity is the number of elements that
11799  // may be used in m_faces[].
11800  const class ON_SubDFace** m_faces = nullptr;
11801 
11802  /*
11803  Description:
11804  Expert user tool to remove an edge from the vertex's m_edges[] array.
11805  Remarks:
11806  Does not modify the edge. If the vertex is referenced by the edge,
11807  then the vertex must be removed from edge's m_vertex[] array.
11808  */
11809  bool RemoveEdgeFromArray(
11810  const class ON_SubDEdge* f
11811  );
11812 
11813  /*
11814  Description:
11815  Expert user tool to remove a face from the vertex's m_faces[] array.
11816  Remarks:
11817  Does not modify the face or any edges. The faces edges must be updated accordingly.
11818  */
11819  bool RemoveFaceFromArray(
11820  const class ON_SubDFace* f
11821  );
11822 
11823  /*
11824  Parameters:
11825  bApplyInputTagBias - [in]
11826  If bApplyInputTagBias is true, the current tag value is used
11827  to choose between possible output results. When in doubt, pass false.
11828  bReturnBestGuessWhenInvalid
11829  If bReturnBestGuessWhenInvalid is true and the topology and current edges
11830  tags do not meet the conditions for a valid vertex, then a best guess for
11831  a vertex tag is returned. Otherwise ON_SubDVertexTag::Unset is returned.
11832  When in doubt pass false and check for unset before using.
11833  Returns:
11834  The suggested value for this vertices tag based on its current tag value and
11835  its current edges. Assumes the vertex and edge topology are correct and the
11836  edge tags are correctly set.
11837  */
11838  ON_SubDVertexTag SuggestedVertexTag(
11839  bool bApplyInputTagBias,
11840  bool bReturnBestGuessWhenInvalid
11841  ) const;
11842 
11843 public:
11844  double m_P[3]; // vertex control net location
11845 
11846  ///<summary>
11847  /// The SubD vertex control net point.
11848  ///</summary>
11849  const ON_3dPoint ControlNetPoint() const;
11850 
11851 private:
11852  // Cached limit point and limit normal
11853  // GetSurfacePoint( bUseSavedSurfacePoint=true ) can change the value of m_limit_point.
11854  // If the limit point is set and vertex has a single sector, then
11855  // m_limit_point.m_sector_face = nullptr and m_limit_point.m_next_sector_limit_point = nullptr.
11856  // If the limit point is set and vertex has a multiple sectors, then
11857  // m_limit_point.m_sector_face = first face in the sector.
11858  // If multiple limit points are set, then they are in a linked list
11859  // traversed using the ON_SubDSectorSurfacePoint.m_next_sector_limit_point.
11860  // The second and any additional limit points are managed by a fixed size pool.
11861  // Calling ClearSurfacePoint() will return these to the pool.
11862  mutable ON_SubDSectorSurfacePoint m_limit_point = ON_SubDSectorSurfacePoint::Unset;
11863 
11864 public:
11865  enum : unsigned int
11866  {
11867  MaximumEdgeCount = 0xFFF0U,
11868  MaximumFaceCount = 0xFFF0U
11869  };
11870 
11871  static int CompareUnorderedEdges(
11872  const ON_SubDVertex* a,
11873  const ON_SubDVertex* b
11874  );
11875 
11876  static int CompareUnorderedFaces(
11877  const ON_SubDVertex* a,
11878  const ON_SubDVertex* b
11879  );
11880 
11881  static int CompareUnorderedEdgesAndFaces(
11882  const ON_SubDVertex* a,
11883  const ON_SubDVertex* b
11884  );
11885 
11886  ///*
11887  //Description:
11888  // Sort the m_edges[] and m_faces[] arrays so radial groups are together.
11889  // After the sorting is completed, m_vertex_edge_order is set to recored
11890  // the current sorting state and its value is returned.
11891  // The sorting is done unconditionally.
11892  //*/
11893  //ON_SubD::VertexEdgeOrder SortEdges();
11894 
11895  unsigned int EdgeCount(
11896  ON_SubDEdgeTag edge_tag
11897  ) const;
11898 
11899  unsigned int EdgeCount() const;
11900 
11901  const class ON_SubDEdge* Edge(
11902  unsigned int i
11903  ) const;
11904 
11905  const ON_SubDEdgePtr EdgePtr(
11906  unsigned int i
11907  ) const;
11908 
11909  ON__UINT_PTR EdgeDirection(
11910  unsigned int i
11911  ) const;
11912 
11913  unsigned int EdgeArrayIndex(
11914  const ON_SubDEdge* edge
11915  ) const;
11916 
11917  unsigned int FaceCount() const;
11918 
11919  const class ON_SubDFace* Face(
11920  unsigned int i
11921  ) const;
11922 
11923  unsigned int FaceArrayIndex(
11924  const ON_SubDFace* face
11925  ) const;
11926 
11927  /*
11928  Description:
11929  Expert user tool to replace reference to old_face with a reference to new_face.
11930  Parameters:
11931  old_face = [in]
11932  Cannot be nullptr.
11933  new_face = [in]
11934  If new_face is nullptr, old_face is simply removed.
11935  Returns:
11936  If the replacement was successful, then the m_faces[] array index where old_face/new_face replacement occured is returned.
11937  Otherwise ON_UNSET_UINT_INDEX is returned.
11938  Remarks:
11939  No modifications are made to old_face or new_face.
11940  */
11941  unsigned int ReplaceFaceInArray(
11942  const ON_SubDFace* old_face,
11943  const ON_SubDFace* new_face
11944  );
11945 
11946  /*
11947  Returns:
11948  True if m_vertex_tag is ON_SubDVertexTag::Smooth.
11949  */
11950  bool IsSmooth() const;
11951 
11952  /*
11953  Returns:
11954  True if m_vertex_tag is ON_SubDVertexTag::Crease.
11955  */
11956  bool IsCrease() const;
11957 
11958  /*
11959  Returns:
11960  True if m_vertex_tag is ON_SubDVertexTag::Corner.
11961  */
11962  bool IsCorner() const;
11963 
11964  /*
11965  Returns:
11966  True if m_vertex_tag is ON_SubDVertexTag::Dart.
11967  */
11968  bool IsDart() const;
11969 
11970  /*
11971  Returns:
11972  True if m_vertex_tag is ON_SubDVertexTag::Smooth or ON_SubDVertexTag::Crease.
11973  */
11974  bool IsSmoothOrCrease() const;
11975 
11976  /*
11977  Returns:
11978  True if m_vertex_tag is ON_SubDVertexTag::Crease or ON_SubDVertexTag::Corner.
11979  */
11980  bool IsCreaseOrCorner() const;
11981 
11982  /*
11983  Returns:
11984  True if m_vertex_tag is ON_SubDVertexTag::Dart, ON_SubDVertexTag::Crease or ON_SubDVertexTag::Corner.
11985  */
11986  bool IsDartOrCreaseOrCorner() const;
11987 
11988 
11989  /*
11990  Returns:
