14309  {
14310  return m_face_count;
14311  }
14312 
14313  const class ON_SubDFace* operator[](unsigned int i) const
14314  {
14315  return (i < m_face_count) ? m_a[i] : nullptr;
14316  }
14317 
14318 private:
14319  ON_SubD m_subd;
14320  const class ON_SubDFace*const* m_a = nullptr;
14321  unsigned int m_face_count = 0;
14322 
14323 #pragma ON_PRAGMA_WARNING_PUSH
14324 #pragma ON_PRAGMA_WARNING_DISABLE_MSC( 4251 )
14325  // C4251: ... needs to have dll-interface to be used by clients of class ...
14326  // m_sp is private and all code that manages m_sp is explicitly implemented in the DLL.
14327 private:
14328  std::shared_ptr< const class ON_SubDFace* > m_sp;
14329 #pragma ON_PRAGMA_WARNING_POP
14330 };
14331 
14332 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
14333 //
14334 // ON_SubDVertexIterator
14335 //
14336 class ON_CLASS ON_SubDVertexIterator
14337 {
14338 public:
14339  // The best way to get an ON_SubDVertexIterator is so use the ON_SubD member function
14340  // ON_SubDVertexIterator vit = subd.VertexIterator();
14341  ON_SubDVertexIterator(
14342  const class ON_SubD& subd
14343  );
14344 
14345  // The best way to get an ON_SubDVertexIterator is so use the ON_SubD member function
14346  // ON_SubDVertexIterator vit = subd.VertexIterator();
14347  ON_SubDVertexIterator(
14348  const class ON_SubDRef& subd_ref
14349  );
14350 
14351  // Construct and interator that iterates over a single vertex.
14352  ON_SubDVertexIterator(
14353  const class ON_SubD& subd,
14354  const class ON_SubDVertex& vertex
14355  );
14356 
14357  // Construct and interator that iterates over a single vertex.
14358  ON_SubDVertexIterator(
14359  const class ON_SubDRef& subd_ref,
14360  const class ON_SubDVertex& vertex
14361  );
14362 
14363  // Construct and interator that iterates over the vertices of an edge.
14364  ON_SubDVertexIterator(
14365  const class ON_SubD& subd,
14366  const class ON_SubDEdge& edge
14367  );
14368 
14369  // Construct and interator that iterates over the vertices of an edge.
14370  ON_SubDVertexIterator(
14371  const class ON_SubDRef& subd_ref,
14372  const class ON_SubDEdge& edge
14373  );
14374 
14375  // Construct and interator that iterates over the vertices of a face.
14376  ON_SubDVertexIterator(
14377  const class ON_SubD& subd,
14378  const class ON_SubDFace& face
14379  );
14380 
14381  // Construct and interator that iterates over the vertices of a face.
14382  ON_SubDVertexIterator(
14383  const class ON_SubDRef& subd_ref,
14384  const class ON_SubDFace& face
14385  );
14386 
14387  ON_SubDVertexIterator() = default;
14388  ON_SubDVertexIterator(const ON_SubDVertexIterator&) = default;
14389  ON_SubDVertexIterator& operator=(const ON_SubDVertexIterator&) = default;
14390 
14391 #if defined(ON_HAS_RVALUEREF)
14392  // rvalue copy constructor
14393  ON_SubDVertexIterator( ON_SubDVertexIterator&& ) ON_NOEXCEPT;
14394  // rvalue assignment operator
14395  ON_SubDVertexIterator& operator=( ON_SubDVertexIterator&& );
14396 #endif
14397 
14398  /*
14399  Returns:
14400  The subD object for this iterator.
14401  */
14402  const class ON_SubD& SubD() const
14403  {
14404  return m_subd_ref.SubD();
14405  }
14406 
14407  const class ON_SubDRef& SubDRef() const
14408  {
14409  return m_subd_ref;
14410  }
14411 
14412  /*
14413  Description:
14414  Increment the iterator.
14415  Returns:
14416  Current vertex.
14417  Remarks:
14418  operator++ and NextVertex() behave differently.
14419  */
14420  const class ON_SubDVertex* operator++()
14421  {
14422  const class ON_SubDVertex* v = m_v_current;
14423  NextVertex();
14424  return v;
14425  }
14426 
14427  /*
14428  Return:
14429  Number of vertices this iterator will iterate through.
14430  */
14431  unsigned int VertexCount() const
14432  {
14433  return m_vertex_count;
14434  }
14435 
14436  /*
14437  Return:
14438  Interator index of the current vertex.
14439  */
14440  unsigned int CurrentVertexIndex() const
14441  {
14442  return m_vertex_index;
14443  }
14444 
14445  /*
14446  Description:
14447  Set the iterator to the beginning of the vertex list.
14448  Returns:
14449  First vertex in the list.
14450  */
14451  const class ON_SubDVertex* FirstVertex()
14452  {
14453  m_vertex_index = 0;
14454  return (m_v_current = m_v_first);
14455  }
14456 
14457  /*
14458  Description:
14459  Increment the iterator.
14460  Returns:
14461  Next vertex.
14462  Remarks:
14463  operator++ and NextVertex() behave differently.
14464  */
14465  const class ON_SubDVertex* NextVertex()
14466  {
14467  m_vertex_index++;
14468  if (m_vertex_index < m_vertex_count)
14469  {
14470  if (0 == m_component_ptr.m_ptr)
14471  {
14472  if (nullptr != m_v_current)
14473  m_v_current = m_v_current->m_next_vertex;
14474  }
14475  else
14476  {
14477  const ON_SubDEdge* edge = m_component_ptr.Edge();
14478  if (nullptr != edge)
14479  {
14480  m_v_current = edge->Vertex(m_vertex_index);
14481  }
14482  else
14483  {
14484  const ON_SubDFace* face = m_component_ptr.Face();
14485  if (nullptr != face)
14486  m_v_current = face->Vertex(m_vertex_index);
14487  else
14488  m_v_current = nullptr;
14489  }
14490  }
14491  }
14492  else
14493  {
14494  m_vertex_index = m_vertex_count;
14495  m_v_current = nullptr;
14496  }
14497  return m_v_current;
14498  }
14499 
14500  /*
14501  Returns:
14502  Current vertex;
14503  */
14504  const class ON_SubDVertex* CurrentVertex() const
14505  {
14506  return m_v_current;
14507  }
14508 
14509  /*
14510  Description:
14511  Set the iterator to the end of the vertex list.
14512  Returns:
14513  Last vertex in the list.
14514  */
14515  const class ON_SubDVertex* LastVertex()
14516  {
14517  m_vertex_index = (m_vertex_count > 0) ? (m_vertex_count - 1) : 0;
14518  return (m_v_current = m_v_last);
14519  }
14520 
14521 private:
14522  void Internal_Init(
14523  const ON_SubDRef& subd_ref,
14524  unsigned int vertex_count,
14525  const ON_SubDVertex* first,
14526  const ON_SubDVertex* last,
14527  ON_SubDComponentPtr component_ptr
14528  );
14529  ON_SubDRef m_subd_ref;
14530  const ON_SubDVertex* m_v_first = nullptr;
14531  const ON_SubDVertex* m_v_last = nullptr;
14532  const ON_SubDVertex* m_v_current = nullptr;
14533  unsigned int m_vertex_index = 0;
14534  unsigned int m_vertex_count = 0;
14535  ON_SubDComponentPtr m_component_ptr = ON_SubDComponentPtr::Null;
14536 };
14537 
14538 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
14539 //
14540 // ON_SubDVertexIdIterator
14541 //
14542 
14543 class ON_SubDVertexIdIterator : private ON_FixedSizePoolIterator
14544 {
14545 public:
14546  ON_SubDVertexIdIterator() = default;
14547  ~ON_SubDVertexIdIterator() = default;
14548  ON_SubDVertexIdIterator(const ON_SubDVertexIdIterator&) = default;
14549  ON_SubDVertexIdIterator& operator=(const ON_SubDVertexIdIterator&) = default;
14550 
14551 public:
14552  ON_SubDVertexIdIterator(const ON_SubDRef& subd_ref);
14553  ON_SubDVertexIdIterator(const ON_SubD& subd);
14554 
14555 public:
14556  /*
14557  Description:
14558  In general, you want to use a ON_SubDVertexIterator to loop through SubD vertices.
14559  This is a special tool for unusual sitiations wheh it is necessary to
14560  iteratate through every vertex on every level of a SubD in order
14561  of increasing m_id value.
14562  Returns:
14563  The vertex with the smallest id.
14564  */
14565  const ON_SubDVertex* FirstVertex();
14566 
14567  /*
14568  Description:
14569  In general, you want to use a ON_SubDVertexIterator to loop through SubD vertices.
14570  This is a special tool for unusual sitiations wheh it is necessary to
14571  iteratate through every vertex on every level of a SubD in order
14572  of increasing m_id value.
14573  Returns:
14574  The vertex in order of increasing id.
14575  */
14576  const ON_SubDVertex* NextVertex();
14577 
14578  /*
14579  Returns:
14580  The most recently returned vertex from a call to FirstVertex() or NextVertex().
14581  */
14582  const ON_SubDVertex* CurrentVertex() const;
14583 
14584 private:
14585  friend class ON_SubDHeap;
14586  ON_SubDRef m_subd_ref;
14587  void Internal_Init();
14588 };
14589 
14590 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
14591 //
14592 // ON_SubDEdgeIterator
14593 //
14594 class ON_CLASS ON_SubDEdgeIterator
14595 {
14596 public:
14597  // The best way to get an ON_SubDEdgeIterator is so use the ON_SubD member function
14598  // ON_SubDEdgeIterator eit = subd.EdgeIterator();
14599  ON_SubDEdgeIterator(
14600  const class ON_SubD& subd
14601  );
14602 
14603  // The best way to get an ON_SubDEdgeIterator is so use the ON_SubD member function
14604  // ON_SubDEdgeIterator eit = subd.EdgeIterator();
14605  ON_SubDEdgeIterator(
14606  const class ON_SubDRef& subd_ref
14607  );
14608 
14609  // Construct and interator that iterates over a single edge.
14610  ON_SubDEdgeIterator(
14611  const class ON_SubD& subd,
14612  const class ON_SubDEdge& edge
14613  );
14614 
14615  // Construct and interator that iterates over a single edge.
14616  ON_SubDEdgeIterator(
14617  const class ON_SubDRef& subd_ref,
14618  const class ON_SubDEdge& edge
14619  );
14620 
14621  // Construct and interator that iterates over the edges of a vertex.
14622  ON_SubDEdgeIterator(
14623  const class ON_SubD& subd,
14624  const class ON_SubDVertex& vertex
14625  );
14626 
14627  // Construct and interator that iterates over the edges of a vertex.
14628  ON_SubDEdgeIterator(
14629  const class ON_SubDRef& subd_ref,
14630  const class ON_SubDVertex& vertex
14631  );
14632 
14633  // Construct and interator that iterates over the edges of a face.
14634  ON_SubDEdgeIterator(
14635  const class ON_SubD& subd,
14636  const class ON_SubDFace& face
14637  );
14638 
14639  // Construct and interator that iterates over the edges of a face.
14640  ON_SubDEdgeIterator(
14641  const class ON_SubDRef& subd_ref,
14642  const class ON_SubDFace& face
14643  );
14644 
14645  ON_SubDEdgeIterator() = default;
14646  ON_SubDEdgeIterator(const ON_SubDEdgeIterator&) = default;
14647  ON_SubDEdgeIterator& operator=(const ON_SubDEdgeIterator&) = default;
14648 
14649 #if defined(ON_HAS_RVALUEREF)
14650  // rvalue copy constructor
14651  ON_SubDEdgeIterator( ON_SubDEdgeIterator&& ) ON_NOEXCEPT;
14652  // rvalue assignment operator
14653  ON_SubDEdgeIterator& operator=( ON_SubDEdgeIterator&& );
14654 #endif
14655 
14656  /*
14657  Returns:
14658  The subD object for this iterator.
14659  */
14660  const class ON_SubD& SubD() const
14661  {
14662  return m_subd_ref.SubD();
14663  }
14664 
14665  const class ON_SubDRef& SubDRef() const
14666  {
14667  return m_subd_ref;
14668  }
14669 
14670  /*
14671  Description:
14672  Increment the iterator.
14673  Returns:
14674  Current edge.
14675  Remarks:
14676  operator++ and NextEdge() behave differently.
14677  */
14678  const class ON_SubDEdge* operator++()
14679  {
14680  const class ON_SubDEdge* e = m_e_current;
14681  NextEdge();
14682  return e;
14683  }
14684 
14685  /*
14686  Return:
14687  Number of edges this iterator will iterate through.
14688  */
14689  unsigned int EdgeCount() const
14690  {
14691  return m_edge_count;
14692  }
14693 
14694  /*
14695  Return:
14696  Interator index of the current edge.
14697  */
14698  unsigned int CurrentEdgeIndex() const
14699  {
14700  return m_edge_index;
14701  }
14702 
14703  /*
14704  Description:
14705  Set the iterator to the beginning of the edge list.
14706  Returns:
14707  First edge in the list.
14708  */
14709  const class ON_SubDEdge* FirstEdge()
14710  {
14711  m_edge_index = 0;
14712  return m_e_current = m_e_first;
14713  }
14714 
14715  /*
14716  Description:
14717  Increment the iterator.
14718  Returns:
14719  Next edge.
14720  Remarks:
14721  operator++ and NextEdge() behave differently.
14722  */
14723  const class ON_SubDEdge* NextEdge()
14724  {
14725  m_edge_index++;
14726  if (m_edge_index < m_edge_count)
14727  {
14728  if (0 == m_component_ptr.m_ptr)
14729  {
14730  if (nullptr != m_e_current)
14731  m_e_current = m_e_current->m_next_edge;
14732  }
14733  else
14734  {
14735  const ON_SubDVertex* vertex = m_component_ptr.Vertex();
14736  if (nullptr != vertex)
14737  {
14738  m_e_current = vertex->Edge(m_edge_index);
14739  }
14740  else
14741  {
14742  const ON_SubDFace* face = m_component_ptr.Face();
14743  if (nullptr != face)
14744  m_e_current = face->Edge(m_edge_index);
14745  else
14746  m_e_current = nullptr;
14747  }
14748  }
14749  }
14750  else
14751  {
14752  m_edge_index = m_edge_count;
14753  m_e_current = nullptr;
14754  }
14755  return m_e_current;
14756  }
14757 
14758  /*
14759  Returns:
14760  Current edge;
14761  */
14762  const class ON_SubDEdge* CurrentEdge() const
14763  {
14764  return m_e_current;
14765  }
14766 
14767  /*
14768  Description:
14769  Set the iterator to the end of the edge list.
14770  Returns:
14771  Last edge in the list.
14772  */
14773  const class ON_SubDEdge* LastEdge()
14774  {
14775  m_edge_index = (m_edge_count > 0) ? (m_edge_count - 1) : 0;
14776  return m_e_current = m_e_last;
14777  }
14778 
14779 private:
14780  void Internal_Init(
14781  const ON_SubDRef& subd_ref,
14782  unsigned int edge_count,
14783  const ON_SubDEdge* first,
14784  const ON_SubDEdge* last,
14785  ON_SubDComponentPtr component_ptr
14786  );
14787  ON_SubDRef m_subd_ref;
14788  const ON_SubDEdge* m_e_first = nullptr;
14789  const ON_SubDEdge* m_e_last = nullptr;
14790  const ON_SubDEdge* m_e_current = nullptr;
14791  unsigned int m_edge_index = 0;
14792  unsigned int m_edge_count = 0;
14793  ON_SubDComponentPtr m_component_ptr = ON_SubDComponentPtr::Null;
14794 };
14795 
14796 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
14797 //
14798 // ON_SubDEdgeIdIterator
14799 //
14800 
14801 class ON_SubDEdgeIdIterator : private ON_FixedSizePoolIterator
14802 {
14803 public:
14804  ON_SubDEdgeIdIterator() = default;
14805  ~ON_SubDEdgeIdIterator() = default;
14806  ON_SubDEdgeIdIterator(const ON_SubDEdgeIdIterator&) = default;
14807  ON_SubDEdgeIdIterator& operator=(const ON_SubDEdgeIdIterator&) = default;
14808 
14809 public:
14810  ON_SubDEdgeIdIterator(const ON_SubDRef& subd_ref);
14811  ON_SubDEdgeIdIterator(const ON_SubD& subd);
14812 
14813 public:
14814  /*
14815  Description:
14816  In general, you want to use a ON_SubDEdgeIterator to loop through SubD edges.
14817  This is a special tool for unusual sitiations wheh it is necessary to
14818  iteratate through every edge on every level of a SubD in order
14819  of increasing m_id value.
14820  Returns:
14821  The edge with the smallest id.
14822  */
14823  const ON_SubDEdge* FirstEdge();
14824 
14825  /*
14826  Description:
14827  In general, you want to use a ON_SubDEdgeIterator to loop through SubD edges.
14828  This is a special tool for unusual sitiations wheh it is necessary to
14829  iteratate through every edge on every level of a SubD in order
14830  of increasing m_id value.
14831  Returns:
14832  The edge in order of increasing id.
14833  */
14834  const ON_SubDEdge* NextEdge();
14835 
14836  /*
14837  Returns:
14838  The most recently returned edge from a call to FirstEdge() or NextEdge().
14839  */
14840  const ON_SubDEdge* CurrentEdge() const;
14841 
14842 private:
14843  friend class ON_SubDHeap;
14844  ON_SubDRef m_subd_ref;
14845  void Internal_Init();
14846 };
14847 
14848 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
14849 //
14850 // ON_SubDFaceIterator
14851 //
14852 class ON_CLASS ON_SubDFaceIterator
14853 {
14854 public:
14855  // The best way to get an ON_SubDFaceIterator is so use the ON_SubD member function
14856  // ON_SubDFaceIterator fit = subd.FaceIterator();
14857  ON_SubDFaceIterator(
14858  const class ON_SubD& subd
14859  );
14860 
14861  // The best way to get an ON_SubDFaceIterator is so use the ON_SubD member function
14862  // ON_SubDFaceIterator fit = subd.FaceIterator();
14863  ON_SubDFaceIterator(
14864  const class ON_SubDRef& subd_ref
14865  );
14866 
14867  // Construct and interator that iterates over the single face.
14868  ON_SubDFaceIterator(
14869  const class ON_SubD& subd,
14870  const class ON_SubDFace& face
14871  );
14872 
14873  // Construct and interator that iterates over the single face.
14874  ON_SubDFaceIterator(
14875  const class ON_SubDRef& subd_ref,
14876  const class ON_SubDFace& face
14877  );
14878 
14879  // Construct and interator that iterates over the faces of a vertex.
14880  ON_SubDFaceIterator(
14881  const class ON_SubD& subd,
14882  const class ON_SubDVertex& vertex
14883  );
14884 
14885  // Construct and interator that iterates over the faces of a vertex.
14886  ON_SubDFaceIterator(
14887  const class ON_SubDRef& subd_ref,
14888  const class ON_SubDVertex& vertex
14889  );
14890 
14891  // Construct and interator that iterates over the faces of an edge.
14892  ON_SubDFaceIterator(
14893  const class ON_SubD& subd,
14894  const class ON_SubDEdge& edge
14895  );
14896 
14897  // Construct and interator that iterates over the faces of an edge.
14898  ON_SubDFaceIterator(
14899  const class ON_SubDRef& subd_ref,
14900  const class ON_SubDEdge& edge
14901  );
14902 
14903  ON_SubDFaceIterator() = default;
14904  ON_SubDFaceIterator(const ON_SubDFaceIterator&) = default;
14905  ON_SubDFaceIterator& operator=(const ON_SubDFaceIterator&) = default;
14906 
14907 #if defined(ON_HAS_RVALUEREF)
14908  // rvalue copy constructor
14909  ON_SubDFaceIterator( ON_SubDFaceIterator&& ) ON_NOEXCEPT;
14910  // rvalue assignment operator
14911  ON_SubDFaceIterator& operator=( ON_SubDFaceIterator&& );
14912 #endif
14913 
14914  /*
14915  Returns:
14916  The subD object for this iterator.
14917  */
14918  const class ON_SubD& SubD() const
14919  {
14920  return m_subd_ref.SubD();
14921  }
14922 
14923  const class ON_SubDRef& SubDRef() const
14924  {
14925  return m_subd_ref;
14926  }
14927 
14928  /*
14929  Description:
14930  Returns the current face and increment the iterator.
14931  Returns:
14932  Current face.
14933  Remarks:
14934  operator++ and NextFace() behave differently.
14935  */
14936  const class ON_SubDFace* operator++()
14937  {
14938  const class ON_SubDFace* f = m_face_current;
14939  NextFace();
14940  return f;
14941  }
14942 
14943  /*
14944  Return:
14945  Number of faces this iterator will iterate through.
14946  */
14947  unsigned int FaceCount() const
14948  {
14949  return m_face_count;
14950  }
14951 
14952  /*
14953  Return:
14954  Interator index of the current face.
14955  */
14956  unsigned int CurrentFaceIndex() const
14957  {
14958  return m_face_index;
14959  }
14960 
14961 
14962  /*
14963  Description:
14964  Set the iterator to the beginning of the face list.
14965  Returns:
14966  First face in the list.
14967  */
14968  const class ON_SubDFace* FirstFace()
14969  {
14970  m_face_index = 0;
14971  return (m_face_current = m_face_first);
14972  }
14973 
14974  /*
14975  Description:
14976  Returns the next face and incrments the iterator.
14977  Returns:
14978  Next face.
14979  Remarks:
14980  operator++ and NextFace() behave differently.
14981  */
14982  const class ON_SubDFace* NextFace()
14983  {
14984  m_face_index++;
14985  if (m_face_index < m_face_count)
14986  {
14987  if (0 == m_component_ptr.m_ptr)
14988  {
14989  if (nullptr != m_face_current)
14990  m_face_current = m_face_current->m_next_face;
14991  }
14992  else
14993  {
14994  const ON_SubDVertex* vertex = m_component_ptr.Vertex();
14995  if (nullptr != vertex)
14996  {
14997  m_face_current = vertex->Face(m_face_index);
14998  }
14999  else
15000  {
15001  const ON_SubDEdge* edge = m_component_ptr.Edge();
15002  if (nullptr != edge)
15003  m_face_current = edge->Face(m_face_index);
15004  else
15005  m_face_current = nullptr;
15006  }
15007  }
15008  }
15009  else
15010  {
15011  m_face_index = m_face_count;
15012  m_face_current = nullptr;
15013  }
15014  return m_face_current;
15015  }
15016 
15017  /*
15018  Returns:
15019  Current face;
15020  */
15021  const class ON_SubDFace* CurrentFace() const
15022  {
15023  return m_face_current;
15024  }
15025 
15026  /*
15027  Description:
15028  Set the iterator to the end of the face list.
15029  Returns:
15030  Last face in the list.
15031  */
15032  const class ON_SubDFace* LastFace()
15033  {
15034  m_face_index = (m_face_count > 0) ? (m_face_count - 1) : 0;
15035  return (m_face_current = m_face_last);
15036  }
15037 
15038 #if defined(OPENNURBS_PLUS)
15039  unsigned int MeshFragmentCount() const;
15040 #endif
15041 
15042 private:
15043  void Internal_Init(
15044  const ON_SubDRef& subd_ref,
15045  unsigned int face_count,
15046  const ON_SubDFace* first,
15047  const ON_SubDFace* last,
15048  ON_SubDComponentPtr component_ptr
15049  );
15050  ON_SubDRef m_subd_ref;
15051  const ON_SubDFace* m_face_first = nullptr;
15052  const ON_SubDFace* m_face_last = nullptr;
15053  const ON_SubDFace* m_face_current = nullptr;
15054  unsigned int m_face_index = 0;
15055  unsigned int m_face_count = 0;
15056  ON_SubDComponentPtr m_component_ptr = ON_SubDComponentPtr::Null;
15057 };
15058 
15059 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
15060 //
15061 // ON_SubDFaceIdIterator
15062 //
15063 
15064 class ON_SubDFaceIdIterator : private ON_FixedSizePoolIterator
15065 {
15066 public:
15067  ON_SubDFaceIdIterator() = default;
15068  ~ON_SubDFaceIdIterator() = default;
15069  ON_SubDFaceIdIterator(const ON_SubDFaceIdIterator&) = default;
15070  ON_SubDFaceIdIterator& operator=(const ON_SubDFaceIdIterator&) = default;
15071 
15072 public:
15073  ON_SubDFaceIdIterator(const ON_SubDRef& subd_ref);
15074  ON_SubDFaceIdIterator(const ON_SubD& subd);
15075 
15076 public:
15077  /*
15078  Description:
15079  In general, you want to use a ON_SubDFaceIterator to loop through SubD faces.
15080  This is a special tool for unusual sitiations wheh it is necessary to
15081  iteratate through every face on every level of a SubD in order
15082  of increasing m_id value.
15083  Returns:
15084  The face with the smallest id.
15085  */
15086  const ON_SubDFace* FirstFace();
15087 
15088  /*
15089  Description:
15090  In general, you want to use a ON_SubDFaceIterator to loop through SubD faces.
15091  This is a special tool for unusual sitiations wheh it is necessary to
15092  iteratate through every face on every level of a SubD in order
15093  of increasing m_id value.
15094  Returns:
15095  The face in order of increasing id.
15096  */
15097  const ON_SubDFace* NextFace();
15098 
15099  /*
15100  Returns:
15101  The most recently returned face from a call to FirstFace() or NextFace().
15102  */
15103  const ON_SubDFace* CurrentFace() const;
15104 
15105 private:
15106  friend class ON_SubDHeap;
15107  ON_SubDRef m_subd_ref;
15108  void Internal_Init();
15109 };
15110 
15111 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
15112 //
15113 // ON_SubDComponentIterator
15114 //
15115 class ON_CLASS ON_SubDComponentIterator
15116 {
15117 public:
15118  static const ON_SubDComponentIterator Empty;
15119 
15120  // The ON_SubD member function
15121  // ON_SubDComponentIterator ON_SubD::ComponentIterator(subd_level_index)
15122  // is the best way to get a component iterator for a subd level.
15123  ON_SubDComponentIterator(
15124  const class ON_SubD& subd
15125  );
15126  ON_SubDComponentIterator(
15127  const class ON_SubDRef& subd_ref
15128  );
15129 
15130  ON_SubDComponentIterator() = default;
15131  ON_SubDComponentIterator(const ON_SubDComponentIterator&) = default;
15132  ON_SubDComponentIterator& operator=(const ON_SubDComponentIterator&) = default;
15133 
15134 #if defined(ON_HAS_RVALUEREF)
15135  // rvalue copy constructor
15136  ON_SubDComponentIterator( ON_SubDComponentIterator&& ) ON_NOEXCEPT;
15137  // rvalue assignment operator
15138  ON_SubDComponentIterator& operator=( ON_SubDComponentIterator&& );
15139 #endif
15140 
15141  /*
15142  Returns:
15143  The subD object for this iterator.
15144  */
15145  const class ON_SubD& SubD() const
15146  {
15147  return m_subd_ref.SubD();
15148  }
15149 
15150  const class ON_SubDRef& SubDRef() const
15151  {
15152  return m_subd_ref;
15153  }
15154 
15155  /*
15156  Returns:
15157  The subD level for this iterator.
15158  */
15159  unsigned int SubDLevel() const
15160  {
15161  return m_subd_level;
15162  }
15163 
15164  /*
15165  Description:
15166  Returns the current component and increment the iterator.
15167  Returns:
15168  Current component.
15169  Remarks:
15170  operator++ and NextComponent() behave differently.
15171  */
15172  const class ON_SubDComponentPtr operator++()
15173  {
15174  const class ON_SubDComponentPtr cptr = m_cptr_current;
15175  NextComponent();
15176  return cptr;
15177  }
15178 
15179  /*
15180  Description:
15181  Set the iterator to the beginning of the component list.
15182  Returns:
15183  First component in the list.
15184  */
15185  const class ON_SubDComponentPtr FirstComponent();
15186 
15187  /*
15188  Description:
15189  Returns the next component and incrments the iterator.
15190  Returns:
15191  Next component.
15192  Remarks:
15193  operator++ and NextComponent() behave differently.
15194  */
15195  const class ON_SubDComponentPtr NextComponent();
15196 
15197  /*
15198  Returns:
15199  Current component;
15200  */
15201  const class ON_SubDComponentPtr CurrentComponent() const
15202  {
15203  return m_cptr_current;
15204  }
15205 
15206  /*
15207  Description:
15208  Set the iterator to the end of the component list.
15209  Returns:
15210  Last component in the list.
15211  */
15212  const class ON_SubDComponentPtr LastComponent();
15213 
15214 private:
15215  ON_SubDRef m_subd_ref;
15216  unsigned int m_subd_level = 0;
15217  const ON_SubDVertex* m_vertex_first = nullptr;
15218  const ON_SubDVertex* m_vertex_last = nullptr;
15219  const ON_SubDEdge* m_edge_first = nullptr;
15220  const ON_SubDEdge* m_edge_last = nullptr;
15221  const ON_SubDFace* m_face_first = nullptr;
15222  const ON_SubDFace* m_face_last = nullptr;
15223  ON_SubDComponentPtr m_cptr_current = ON_SubDComponentPtr::Null;
15224 };
15225 
15226 
15227 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
15228 //
15229 // ON_SubDMeshFragmentIterator
15230 //
15231 
15232 class ON_CLASS ON_SubDMeshFragmentIterator
15233 {
15234 public:
15235  ON_SubDMeshFragmentIterator() = default;
15236  ~ON_SubDMeshFragmentIterator() = default;
15237  ON_SubDMeshFragmentIterator(const ON_SubDMeshFragmentIterator&);
15238  ON_SubDMeshFragmentIterator& operator=(const ON_SubDMeshFragmentIterator&);
15239 
15240 public:
15241  ON_SubDMeshFragmentIterator(const class ON_SubDMesh limit_mesh);
15242  ON_SubDMeshFragmentIterator(ON_SubDRef& subd_ref);
15243  ON_SubDMeshFragmentIterator(const ON_SubD& subd);
15244  ON_SubDMeshFragmentIterator(const ON_SubDFaceIterator& fit);
15245 
15246 public:
15247  const ON_SubDMeshFragment* FirstFragment();
15248  const ON_SubDMeshFragment* NextFragment();
15249  const ON_SubDMeshFragment* CurrentFragment();
15250 
15251  bool IsEmpty() const;
15252 
15253  const ON_SubD& SubD() const;
15254 
15255  /*
15256  Returns
15257  ON_SubDComponentLocation::Surface or ON_SubDComponentLocation::ControlNet
15258  */
15259  ON_SubDComponentLocation SubDAppearance() const;
15260 
15261  /*
15262  Parameters:
15263  subd_appearance_override - [in]
15264  ON_SubDComponentLocation::Unset - appearance controlled by SubD().SubDAppearance().
15265  ON_SubDComponentLocation::Surface
15266  ON_SubDComponentLocation::ControlNet
15267  Returns
15268  ON_SubDComponentLocation::Surface or ON_SubDComponentLocation::ControlNet
15269  */
15270  void SetSubDAppearanceOverride(ON_SubDComponentLocation subd_appearance_override);
15271 
15272 
15273  /*
15274  Returns:
15275  Density setting used to create the fragments and the maximum mesh density
15276  these fragments can deliver.
15277  Remarks:
15278  0: a single mesh quad per SubD quad
15279  1: 4 mesh quads per SubD quad (n mesh quads per SubD n-gon when n != 4)
15280  d: 4^d mesh quads per SubD quad (n*(4^(d-1)) mesh quads per SubD n-gon when n != 4)
15281  */
15282  unsigned int MaximumMeshDensity() const;
15283 
15284 
15285  /*
15286  Returns:
15287  Minimum mesh density that can be extracted from these fragments.
15288  Remarks:
15289  0 = all fragments are full sized.
15290  1 = there are half sixed fragments because the SubD has n-gons with n != 4.
15291  */
15292  unsigned int MinimumMeshDensity() const;
15293 
15294  /*
15295  Parameters:
15296  candidate_mesh_density - [in]
15297  Returns:
15298  If candidate_mesh_density > MeshDensity(), then MeshDensity() is returned.
15299  If candidate_mesh_density < MinimumMeshDensity(), then MinimumMeshDensity() is returned.
15300  Otherwise, candidate_mesh_density is returned.
15301  */
15302  unsigned int ClampMeshDensity(
15303  unsigned int candidate_mesh_density
15304  ) const;
15305 
15306  /*
15307  Returns:
15308  Total number of fragments.
15309  */
15310  unsigned int FragmentCount() const;
15311 
15312  /*
15313  Returns:
15314  Total number of full sized fragments.
15315  Remarks:
15316  A full sized fragment covers an entire quad face.
15317  */
15318  unsigned int FullSizeFragmentCount() const;
15319 
15320  /*
15321  Returns:
15322  Total number of half sized fragments.
15323  Remarks:
15324  A half sized fragment covers the corner of an N-gon and are used when N != 4.
15325  */
15326  unsigned int HalfSizeFragmentCount() const;
15327 
15328 
15329  /*
15330  Parameters:
15331  full_size_fragment_count - [out]
15332  Number of full sized fragments. These cover an entire quad face.
15333  half_size_fragment_count - [out]
15334  Number of half sized fragments. These cover a corner of an N-gon
15335  and are used when N != 4.
15336  Returns:
15337  Total number of fragments.
15338  */
15339  unsigned int GetFragmentCounts(
15340  unsigned int& full_size_fragment_count,
15341  unsigned int& half_size_fragment_count
15342  ) const;
15343 
15344  /*
15345  Parameters:
15346  mesh_density - [in]
15347  MinimumMeshDensity() <= mesh_density <= MeshDensity()
15348  Returns:
15349  Total number of mesh quads in at the specified mesh density.
15350  */
15351  unsigned int TotalQuadCount(unsigned int mesh_density) const;
15352 
15353  /*
15354  Parameters:
15355  mesh_density - [in]
15356  MinimumMeshDensity() <= mesh_density <= MeshDensity()
15357  Returns:
15358  Total number of mesh points delivered at the specified mesh density.
15359  */
15360  unsigned int TotalPointCount(unsigned int mesh_density) const;
15361 
15362  /*
15363  Returns:
15364  Total number of mesh quads delivered at MaximumMeshDensity().
15365  */
15366  unsigned int MaximumDensityQuadCount() const;
15367 
15368  /*
15369  Parameters:
15370  mesh_density - [in]
15371  MinimumMeshDensity() <= mesh_density <= MeshDensity()
15372  Returns:
15373  Total number of mesh points delivered at MaximumMeshDensity().
15374  */
15375  unsigned int MaximumDensityPointCount() const;
15376 
15377  const ON_BoundingBox SurfaceBoundingBox() const;
15378  const ON_BoundingBox ControlNetQuadBoundingBox() const;
15379  /*
15380  Returns:
15381  If this->SubDAppearance() is ON_SubDComponentLocation::ControlNet, then this->ControlNetQuadBoundingBox() is returned.
15382  Otherwise this->SurfaceBoundingBox() returned.
15383  */
15384  const ON_BoundingBox BoundingBox() const;
15385 
15386 private:
15387  void Internal_CopyFrom(const ON_SubDMeshFragmentIterator& src);
15388 
15389  ON_SubDMesh m_limit_mesh;
15390  ON_SubD m_subd;
15391  ON_SubDFaceIterator m_fit;
15392  const ON_SubDMeshFragment* m_current_fragment = nullptr;
15393  bool m_bFromFaceFragments = false;
15394  mutable bool m_bHaveCounts = false;
15395 
15396  // used to override the appearance of SubD().SubDApperance().
15397  ON_SubDComponentLocation m_subd_appearance_override = ON_SubDComponentLocation::Unset;
15398 
15399  mutable unsigned int m_maximum_mesh_density = 0; // See MaximumMeshDensity() comment
15400 
15401  // full sized fragment count (for quads)
15402  mutable unsigned int m_full_size_fragment_count = 0;
15403 
15404  // half sized fragment count (for n-gons with n != 4)
15405  mutable unsigned int m_half_size_fragment_count = 0;
15406 };
15407 
15408 
15409 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
15410 //
15411 // ON_SubDSectorIterator
15412 //
15413 
15414 class ON_CLASS ON_SubDSectorIterator
15415 {
15416 public:
15417  static const ON_SubDSectorIterator Empty;
15418 
15419  ON_SubDSectorIterator() = default;
15420  ~ON_SubDSectorIterator() = default;
15421  ON_SubDSectorIterator(const ON_SubDSectorIterator&) = default;
15422  ON_SubDSectorIterator& operator=(const ON_SubDSectorIterator&) = default;
15423 
15424 
15425  /*
15426  Parameters:
15427  center_vertex - [in]
15428  The vertex on initial_face that will be iterated around.
15429  center_vertex->Face(0) is used to select the sector.
15430  Returns:
15431  If input is valid, a pointer to the center vertex is returned.
15432  Otherwise, nullptr is returned.
15433  */
15434  const ON_SubDVertex* Initialize(
15435  const ON_SubDVertex* center_vertex
15436  );
15437 
15438  /*
15439  Parameters:
15440  initial_face - [in]
15441  iterator_orientation - [in]
15442  0: (more common)
15443  "next" means counter-clockwise with respect to the orientation of initial_face
15444  1: (less common)
15445  "next" means clockwise with respect to the orientation of initial_face
15446  center_vertex - [in]
15447  The vertex on initial_face that will be iterated around.
15448  Returns:
15449  If input is valid, a pointer to the center vertex is returned.
15450  Otherwise, nullptr is returned.
15451  */
15452  const ON_SubDVertex* Initialize(
15453  const ON_SubDFace* initial_face,
15454  ON__UINT_PTR iterator_orientation,
15455  const ON_SubDVertex* center_vertex
15456  );
15457 
15458  /*
15459  Parameters:
15460  initial_face - [in]
15461  iterator_orientation - [in]
15462  0: (more common)
15463  "next" means counter-clockwise with respect to the orientation of initial_face
15464  1: (less common)
15465  "next" means clockwise with respect to the orientation of initial_face
15466  face_vertex_index - [in]
15467  initial_face->Vertex(face_vertex_index) is the center vertex
15468  that will be iterated around.
15469  Returns:
15470  If input is valid, a pointer to the center vertex is returned.
15471  Otherwise, nullptr is returned.
15472  */
15473  const ON_SubDVertex* Initialize(
15474  const ON_SubDFace* initial_face,
15475  ON__UINT_PTR iterator_orientation,
15476  unsigned int face_vertex_index
15477  );
15478 
15479  bool InitializeToCurrentFace();
15480 
15481  void Initialize();
15482 
15483  /*
15484  Description:
15485  The current ring index reports the total increment from the
15486  start to the current state. It can be positive or negative.
15487  */
15488  int CurrentRingIndex() const;
15489 
15490  const ON_SubDVertex* CenterVertex() const;
15491 
15492  const ON_SubDFace* InitialFace() const;
15493 
15494  unsigned int InitialFaceCenterVertexIndex() const;
15495 
15496  const ON_SubDFace* CurrentFace() const;
15497 
15498  unsigned int CurrentFaceDirection() const;
15499 
15500  ON_SubDFacePtr CurrentFacePtr() const;
15501 
15502  unsigned int CurrentFaceCenterVertexIndex() const;
15503 
15504 
15505  /*
15506  Parameters:
15507  face_side_index - [in]
15508  0: Return the edge entering the center vertex.
15509  1: Return the edge leaving the center vertex.
15510  Returns:
15511  The requested edge.
15512  */
15513  ON_SubDEdgePtr CurrentEdgePtr(
15514  unsigned int face_side_index
15515  ) const;
15516 
15517  /*
15518  Description:
15519 
15520  CurrentEdge(1)
15521  |
15522  |
15523  NextFace() | CurrentFace()
15524  |
15525  |
15526  *------------- CurrentEdge(0)
15527  PrevFace()
15528 
15529  The asterisk (*) marks the center vertex.
15530  The diagram is With respect to the initial iterator orientation.
15531 
15532  Parameters:
15533  face_side_index - [in]
15534  CurrentEdge(0) = edge on the clockwise (PrevFace) side of the current face
15535  CurrentEdge(1) = edge on the counterclockwise (NextFace) side of the current face
15536  The directions "counterclockwise" and "clockwise" are with respect to the
15537  initial iterator orientation.
15538  Returns:
15539  The requested edge or nullptr if the iterator is not initialized,
15540  has terminated, or is not valid.
15541  When the sector iterator is initialized and valid, sit.CenterVertex() = CurrentEdge(*).RelativeVertex(0).
15542  */
15543  const ON_SubDEdge* CurrentEdge(
15544  unsigned int face_side_index
15545  ) const;
15546 
15547  ON__UINT_PTR CurrentEdgeDirection(
15548  unsigned int face_side_index
15549  ) const;
15550 
15551  /*
15552  Returns:
15553  The vertex on CurrentEdge(face_side_index) that is opposite
15554  the central vertex.
15555  */
15556  const ON_SubDVertex* CurrentEdgeRingVertex(
15557  unsigned int face_side_index
15558  ) const;
15559 
15560  enum class StopAt : unsigned char
15561  {
15562  ///<summary>
15563  /// Sector iteration will terminate when the edge being crossed does not have two faces.
15564  ///</summary>
15565  Boundary = 0,
15566 
15567  ///<summary>
15568  /// Sector iteration will terminate when the edge being crossed does not have two faces
15569  /// or that edge is tagged as ON_SubDEdgeTag::Crease.
15570  ///</summary>
15571  AnyCrease = 1,
15572 
15573  ///<summary>
15574  /// Sector iteration will terminate when the edge being crossed does not have two faces
15575  /// or that edge is tagged as ON_SubDEdgeTag::Crease and has no dart vertices.
15576  ///</summary>
15577  HardCrease = 2,
15578  };
15579 
15580  /*
15581  Description:
15582  Advance the "current" face to the "next" face in the ring
15583  by crossing CurrentEdge(1).
15584 
15585  If the current face is not reversed (1 == CurrentFaceDirection),
15586  then this rotation is counter-clockwise with respect to
15587  the current face's orientation.
15588 
15589  If the current face is reversed (1 == CurrentFaceDirection),
15590  then this rotation is clockwise with respect to
15591  the current face's orientation.
15592  Parameters:
15593  stop_at - [in]
15594  Determines that type of CurrentEdge(1) will terminate iteration.
15595  Returns:
15596  When the input CurrentEdge(1) has exactly two faces and
15597  is not tagged as a crease or bStopAtCrease is false, the
15598  face on the other side of CurrentEdge(1) becomes the new
15599  current face and a pointer to this face is returned.
15600  Remarks:
15601  Identical to calling IncrementFace(+1,bStopAtCrease);
15602  */
15603  const ON_SubDFace* NextFace(
15604  ON_SubDSectorIterator::StopAt stop_at
15605  );
15606 
15607  /*
15608  Description:
15609  Advance the "current" face to the "previous" face in the ring
15610  by crossing CurrentEdge(0).
15611 
15612  If the current face is not reversed (0 == CurrentFaceDirection),
15613  then this rotation is clockwise with respect to
15614  the current face's orientation.
15615 
15616  If the current face is reversed (1 == CurrentFaceDirection),
15617  then this rotation is counter-clockwise with respect to
15618  the current face's orientation.
15619  Parameters:
15620  stop_at - [in]
15621  Determines that type of CurrentEdge(0) will terminate iteration.
15622  Returns:
15623  When the input CurrentEdge(0) has exactly two faces and
15624  is not tagged as a crease or bStopAtCrease is false, the
15625  face on the other side of CurrentEdge(0) becomes the new
15626  current face and a pointer to this face is returned.
15627  In all other cases, nullptr is returned
15628  Remarks:
15629  Identical to calling IncrementFace(-1,bStopAtCrease);
15630  */
15631  const ON_SubDFace* PrevFace(
15632  ON_SubDSectorIterator::StopAt stop_at
15633  );
15634 
15635  /*
15636  Description:
15637  Advance the "current" face by "hopping across" the edge
15638  CurrentEdge((increment_direction>0) ? 1 : 0).
15639 
15640  If the current face is not reversed (0 == CurrentFaceDirection),
15641  then increment_direction>0 rotates counter-clockwise with respect to
15642  the current face's orientation.
15643 
15644  If the current face is reversed (1 == CurrentFaceDirection),
15645  then increment_direction>0 rotates clockwise with respect to
15646  the current face's orientation.
15647  Parameters:
15648  increment_direction - [in]
15649  > 0 advance the "current" face to next face
15650  <= 0 advance the "current" face to previous face
15651  stop_at - [in]
15652  Determines that type of CurrentEdge((increment_direction>0) ? 1 : 0) will terminate iteration.
15653  If true and the input value of CurrentEdge((increment_direction>0) ? 1 : 0)
15654  When iteration terminates at a crease,
15655  CurrentFace() becomes nullptr
15656  CurrentEdge((increment_direction>0) ? 1 : 0) becomes nullptr
15657  CurrentEdge((increment_direction>0) ? 0 : 1) points at the crease
15658  and nullptr returned.
15659  Returns:
15660  nullptr if iteration terminates.
15661  */
15662  const ON_SubDFace* IncrementFace(
15663  int increment_direction,
15664  ON_SubDSectorIterator::StopAt stop_at
15665  );
15666 
15667  /*
15668  Description:
15669  Increment the iterator until it reaches a face with
15670  a crease
15671  Parameters:
15672  increment_direction - [in]
15673  > 0 advance next until CurrentEdge(1) is a crease.
15674  <= 0 advance previous until CurrentEdge(0) is a crease.
15675  Returns:
15676  nullptr - the sector has no creases.
15677  not nullptr - incremented to a crease
15678  */
15679  const ON_SubDFace* IncrementToCrease(
15680  int increment_direction
15681  );
15682 
15683  /*
15684  Description:
15685  Reset iterator to initial face.
15686  */
15687  const ON_SubDFace* FirstFace();
15688 
15689  bool IsValid() const;
15690 
15691 private:
15692  const ON_SubDVertex* m_center_vertex = nullptr;
15693  const ON_SubDFace* m_initial_face = nullptr;
15694  const ON_SubDFace* m_current_face = nullptr;
15695 
15696  // m_current_eptr[0].Edge() = "prev" side edge
15697  // m_current_eptr[1].Edge() = "next" side edge
15698  // center vertex = m_current_eptr[i].RelativeVertex(0)
15699  ON_SubDEdgePtr m_current_eptr[2] = {}; // default = { ON_SubDEdgePtr::Null, ON_SubDEdgePtr::Null };
15700 
15701  unsigned int m_initial_fvi = 0;
15702  unsigned int m_current_fvi = 0;
15703  unsigned int m_current_fei[2] = {}; // default = { 0, 0 }; // "prev" and "next"
15704 
15705  // m_initial_face_dir
15706  // 0: "next" means clockwise with respect to the initial face's orientation.
15707  // 1: "next" means counter-clockwise with respect to the initial face's orientation.
15708  unsigned int m_initial_face_dir = 0;
15709 
15710  // m_current_face_dir
15711  // 0: "next" means clockwise with respect to the initial face's orientation.
15712  // 1: "next" means counter-clockwise with respect to the initial face's orientation.
15713  // When the subd faces around the center vertex are consistently oriented,
15714  // m_current_face_dir is always equal to m_initial_face_dir.
15715  unsigned int m_current_face_dir = 0;
15716 
15717  int m_current_ring_index = 0;
15718 };
15719 
15720 
15721 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
15722 //
15723 // ON_SubDFaceEdgeIterator
15724 //
15725 class ON_CLASS ON_SubDFaceEdgeIterator
15726 {
15727 public:
15728  ON_SubDFaceEdgeIterator();
15729 
15730  /*
15731  Description:
15732  Construct an iterator for going around the edges on a face.
15733  Parameters:
15734  face - [in]
15735  first_edge - [in]
15736  starting edge for the iterator or nullptr to start at face->Edge(0).
15737  */
15738  ON_SubDFaceEdgeIterator(
15739  const ON_SubDFace* face
15740  );
15741 
15742  ON_SubDFaceEdgeIterator(
15743  const ON_SubDFace* face,
15744  const ON_SubDEdge* first_edge
15745  );
15746 
15747 
15748  /*
15749  Description:
15750  Initialize an iterator for going around the edges on a face.
15751  Parameters:
15752  face - [in]
15753  first_edge - [in]
15754  starting edge for the iterator or nullptr to start at face->Edge(0).
15755  */
15756  unsigned int Initialize(
15757  const ON_SubDFace* face
15758  );
15759 
15760  unsigned int Initialize(
15761  const ON_SubDFace* face,
15762  const ON_SubDEdge* first_edge
15763  );
15764 
15765  unsigned int EdgeCount() const;
15766 
15767  /*
15768  Returns:
15769  Resets the iterator and returns the first edge.
15770  */
15771  const ON_SubDEdge* FirstEdge();
15772 
15773  /*
15774  Description:
15775  Increments the iterator and returns the edge.
15776  */
15777  const ON_SubDEdge* NextEdge();
15778 
15779  /*
15780  Description:
15781  Decrements the iterator and returns the edge.
15782  */
15783  const ON_SubDEdge* PrevEdge();
15784 
15785 
15786  /*
15787  Parameters:
15788  bReturnNullAtFirstEdge = [in]
15789  If true and the next edge would be FirstEdge(), the nullptr is returned
15790  and CurrentEdge() is not changed.
15791  Description:
15792  Increments the iterator and returns the edge.
15793  */
15794  const ON_SubDEdge* NextEdge(
15795  bool bReturnNullAtFirstEdge
15796  );
15797 
15798  /*
15799  Parameters:
15800  bReturnNullAtLastEdge = [in]
15801  If true and the previous edge would be FirstEdge(), the nullptr is returned
15802  and CurrentEdge() is not changed.
15803  Description:
15804  Decrements the iterator and returns the edge.
15805  */
15806  const ON_SubDEdge* PrevEdge(
15807  bool bReturnNullAtFirstEdge
15808  );
15809 
15810  /*
15811  Returns:
15812  Current edge.
15813  */
15814  const ON_SubDEdge* CurrentEdge() const;
15815 
15816  unsigned int FirstEdgeIndex() const;
15817 
15818  unsigned int CurrentEdgeIndex() const;
15819 
15820 private:
15821  const ON_SubDFace* m_face;
15822  unsigned int m_edge_count;
15823  unsigned int m_edge_index0;
15824  unsigned int m_edge_index;
15825 };
15826 
15827 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
15828 //
15829 // ON_SubDFromMeshParameters
15830 //
15831 class ON_CLASS ON_SubDFromMeshParameters
15832 {
15833 public:
15834 
15835  // Default construction is identical to ON_SubDFromMeshParameters::Smooth.
15836  ON_SubDFromMeshParameters() = default;
15837  ~ON_SubDFromMeshParameters() = default;
15838  ON_SubDFromMeshParameters(const ON_SubDFromMeshParameters&) = default;
15839  ON_SubDFromMeshParameters& operator=(const ON_SubDFromMeshParameters&) = default;
15840 
15841  ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
15842  //
15843  // Crease options
15844  //
15845 
15846  // No interior creases and no corners.
15847  static const ON_SubDFromMeshParameters Smooth;
15848 
15849 
15850  // Create an interior sub-D crease along all input mesh double edges.
15851  static const ON_SubDFromMeshParameters InteriorCreases;
15852 
15853  // Look for convex corners at sub-D vertices with 2 edges
15854  // that have an included angle <= 90 degrees.
15855  static const ON_SubDFromMeshParameters ConvexCornersAndInteriorCreases;
15856 
15857  ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
15858  //
15859  // Custom interior crease options
15860  //
15861 #pragma region RH_C_SHARED_ENUM [ON_SubDFromMeshParameters::InteriorCreaseOption] [Rhino.Geometry.SubDCreationOptions.InteriorCreaseOption] [nested:byte]
15862  /// <summary>
15863  /// Specifies the test used to determine when an interior mesh edge generates an interior SubD creased edge.
15864  /// </summary>
15865  enum class InteriorCreaseOption : unsigned char
15866  {
15867  ///<summary>The interior crease test is not defined.</summary>
15868  Unset = 0,
15869 
15870  ///<summary>No interior creases.</summary>
15871  None = 1,
15872 
15873  ///<summary>An interior mesh double edge will create an interior SubD creased edge.
15874  /// An interior mesh double edge occurs when the sides of two mesh faces have
15875  /// have distinct vertex indices and identical vertex locations.
15876  ///</summary>
15877  AtMeshDoubleEdge = 2,
15878  };
15879 #pragma endregion
15880 
15881  static ON_SubDFromMeshParameters::InteriorCreaseOption InteriorCreaseOptionFromUnsigned(
15882  unsigned int interior_crease_option_as_unsigned
15883  );
15884 
15885  /*
15886  Parameters:
15887  interior_crease_option - [in]
15888  */
15889  void SetInteriorCreaseOption(
15890  ON_SubDFromMeshParameters::InteriorCreaseOption interior_crease_option
15891  );
15892 
15893  /*
15894  Returns:
15895  The interior crease option.
15896  */
15897  ON_SubDFromMeshParameters::InteriorCreaseOption GetInteriorCreaseOption() const;
15898 
15899  /*
15900  Description:
15901  Copy all settings that control how interior crease edges are created.
15902  Parameters:
15903  source_options - [in]
15904  Returns:
15905  The currently selected interior crease option.
15906  */
15907  ON_SubDFromMeshParameters::InteriorCreaseOption CopyInteriorCreaseTest(
15908  ON_SubDFromMeshParameters source_options
15909  );
15910 
15911 
15912  ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
15913  //
15914  // Convex corner options
15915  //
15916 #pragma region RH_C_SHARED_ENUM [ON_SubDFromMeshParameters::ConvexCornerOption] [Rhino.Geometry.SubDCreationOptions.ConvexCornerOption] [nested:byte]
15917  /// <summary>
15918  /// Defines how convex corners are treated.
15919  /// </summary>
15920  enum class ConvexCornerOption : unsigned char
15921  {
15922  ///<summary>The option is not set.</summary>
15923  Unset = 0,
15924 
15925  ///<summary>No convex coners.</summary>
15926  None = 1,
15927 
15928  ///<summary>A convex subd corner will appear at input mesh boundary vertices
15929  /// where the corner angle &lt;= MaximumConvexCornerAngleRadians() and
15930  /// the number of edges the end at the vertex is &lt;= MaximumConvexCornerEdgeCount().
15931  ///</summary>
15932  AtMeshCorner = 2
15933  };
15934 #pragma endregion
15935 
15936  static ON_SubDFromMeshParameters::ConvexCornerOption ConvexCornerOptionFromUnsigned(
15937  unsigned int convex_corner_option_as_unsigned
15938  );
15939 
15940  /*
15941  Parameters:
15942  convex_corner_option - [in]
15943  */
15944  void SetConvexCornerOption(
15945  ON_SubDFromMeshParameters::ConvexCornerOption convex_corner_option
15946  );
15947 
15948  /*
15949  Returns:
15950  The currently selected convex corner option.
15951  */
15952  ON_SubDFromMeshParameters::ConvexCornerOption GetConvexCornerOption() const;
15953 
15954  /*
15955  Description:
15956  If ConvexCornerTest() ConvexCornerOption::at_mesh_corner, then an
15957  input mesh boundary vertex becomes a sub-D corner when the number of
15958  edges that end at the vertex is <= MaximumConvexCornerEdgeCount() edges
15959  and the corner angle is <= MaximumConvexCornerAngleRadians().
15960  Parameters:
15961  maximum_convex_corner_edge_count - [in]
15962  */
15963  void SetMaximumConvexCornerEdgeCount(
15964  unsigned int maximum_convex_corner_edge_count
15965  );
15966 
15967  /*
15968  Description:
15969  If ConvexCornerTest() ConvexCornerOption::at_mesh_corner, then an
15970  input mesh boundary vertex becomes a sub-D corner when the number of
15971  edges that end at the vertex is <= MaximumConvexCornerEdgeCount() edges
15972  and the corner angle is <= MaximumConvexCornerAngleRadians().
15973  Returns:
15974  The maximum number of edges at a convex corner vertex.
15975  */
15976  unsigned int MaximumConvexCornerEdgeCount() const;
15977 
15978  /*
15979  Description:
15980  If ConvexCornerTest() ConvexCornerOption::at_mesh_corner, then an
15981  input mesh boundary vertex becomes a sub-D corner when the number of
15982  edges that end at the vertex is <= MaximumConvexCornerEdgeCount() edges
15983  and the corner angle is <= MaximumConvexCornerAngleRadians().
15984  Parameters:
15985  maximum_convex_corner_angle_radians - [in]
15986  > 0.0 and < ON_PI
15987  */
15988  void SetMaximumConvexCornerAngleRadians(
15989  double maximum_convex_corner_angle_radians
15990  );
15991 
15992  /*
15993  Description:
15994  If ConvexCornerTest() ConvexCornerOption::at_mesh_corner, then an
15995  input mesh boundary vertex becomes a sub-D corner when the number of
15996  edges that end at the vertex is <= MaximumConvexCornerEdgeCount() edges
15997  and the corner angle is <= MaximumConvexCornerAngleRadians().
15998  Returns:
15999  The maximum corner angle.
16000  */
16001  double MaximumConvexCornerAngleRadians() const;
16002 
16003  /*
16004  Description:
16005  Copy all settings that control how convex corner vertices are created.
16006  Parameters:
16007  source_options - [in]
16008  Returns:
16009  The currently selected convex corner option.
16010  */
16011  ON_SubDFromMeshParameters::ConvexCornerOption CopyConvexCornerTest(
16012  ON_SubDFromMeshParameters source_parameters
16013  );
16014 
16015 
16016  ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
16017  //
16018  // Concave corner options
16019  //
16020 #pragma region RH_C_SHARED_ENUM [ON_SubDFromMeshParameters::ConcaveCornerOption] [Rhino.Geometry.SubDCreationOptions.ConcaveCornerOption] [nested:byte]
16021  /// <summary>
16022  /// Defines how concave corners are treated.
16023  /// </summary>
16024  enum class ConcaveCornerOption : unsigned char
16025  {
16026  ///<summary>The option is not set.</summary>
16027  Unset = 0,
16028 
16029  ///<summary>No concave coners. In general, this is the best choice.</summary>
16030  None = 1,
16031 
16032  ///<summary>A concave subd corner will appear at input mesh boundary vertices
16033  /// where the corner angle &gt;= MinimumConcaveCornerAngleRadians() and
16034  /// the number of edges the end at the vertex is &gt;= MinimumConcaveCornerEdgeCount().
16035  ///</summary>
16036  AtMeshCorner = 2
16037  };
16038 #pragma endregion
16039 
16040  static ON_SubDFromMeshParameters::ConcaveCornerOption ConcaveCornerOptionFromUnsigned(
16041  unsigned int concave_corner_option_as_unsigned
16042  );
16043 
16044  /*
16045  Parameters:
16046  concave_corner_option - [in]
16047  */
16048  void SetConcaveCornerOption(
16049  ON_SubDFromMeshParameters::ConcaveCornerOption concave_corner_option
16050  );
16051 
16052  /*
16053  Returns:
16054  The currently selected concave corner option.
16055  */
16056  ON_SubDFromMeshParameters::ConcaveCornerOption GetConcaveCornerOption() const;
16057 
16058  /*
16059  Description:
16060  If ConcaveCornerTest() = ConcaveCornerOption::AtMeshConcaveCorner, then an
16061  input mesh boundary vertex becomes a sub-D corner when the number of
16062  edges that end at the vertex is >= MinimumConcaveCornerEdgeCount() edges
16063  and the corner angle is >= MinimumConcaveCornerAngleRadians().
16064  Parameters:
16065  minimum_concave_corner_edge_count - [in]
16066  */
16067  void SetMinimumConcaveCornerEdgeCount(
16068  unsigned int minimum_concave_corner_edge_count
16069  );
16070 
16071  /*
16072  Description:
16073  If ConcaveCornerTest() ConcaveCornerOption::AtMeshConcaveCorner, then an
16074  input mesh boundary vertex becomes a sub-D corner when the number of
16075  edges that end at the vertex is >= MinimumConcaveCornerEdgeCount() edges
16076  and the corner angle is >= MinimumConcaveCornerAngleRadians().
16077  Returns:
16078  The minimum number of edges at a concave corner vertex.
16079  */
16080  unsigned int MinimumConcaveCornerEdgeCount() const;
16081 
16082  /*
16083  Description:
16084  If ConcaveCornerTest() ConcaveCornerOption::AtMeshConcaveCorner, then an
16085  input mesh boundary vertex becomes a sub-D corner when the number of
16086  edges that end at the vertex is >= MinimumConcaveCornerEdgeCount() edges
16087  and the corner angle is >= MinimumConcaveCornerAngleRadians().
16088  Parameters:
16089  minimum_concave_corner_angle_radians - [in]
16090  > ON_PI and <= ON_2PI
16091  */
16092  void SetMinimumConcaveCornerAngleRadians(
16093  double minimum_concave_corner_angle_radians
16094  );
16095 
16096  /*
16097  Description:
16098  If ConcaveCornerTest() ConcaveCornerOption::AtMeshConcaveCorner, then an
16099  input mesh boundary vertex becomes a sub-D corner when the number of
16100  edges that end at the vertex is >= MinimumConcaveCornerEdgeCount() edges
16101  and the corner angle is >= MinimumConcaveCornerAngleRadians().
16102  Returns:
16103  The minimum corner angle.
16104  */
16105  double MinimumConcaveCornerAngleRadians() const;
16106 
16107  /*
16108  Description:
16109  Copy all settings that control concave corner vertices are created.
16110  Parameters:
16111  source_options - [in]
16112  Returns:
16113  The currently selected concave corner option.
16114  */
16115  ON_SubDFromMeshParameters::ConcaveCornerOption CopyConcaveCornerTest(
16116  ON_SubDFromMeshParameters source_parameters
16117  );
16118 
16119  /*
16120  Returns:
16121  false - In ON_SubD::CreateFromMesh(), input mesh vertex locations will be used to set subd vertex control net locations.
16122  true - In ON_SubD::CreateFromMesh(), input mesh vertex locations will be used to set subd vertex limit surface locations.
16123  Remark:
16124  Interpolation computation is available in Rhino, Rhino compute, Rhino Inside,
16125  Grasshopper. Interpolation computation is not available in the opennurbs IO toolkit.
16126  */
16127  bool InterpolateMeshVertices() const;
16128 
16129  /*
16130  Parameters:
16131  false
16132  In ON_SubD::CreateFromMesh(), input mesh vertex locations will be used to set subd vertex control net locations.
16133  This is the fastest and most robust way to create a subd from a mesh.
16134  true
16135  In ON_SubD::CreateFromMesh(), input mesh vertex locations will be used to set subd vertex limit surface locations.
16136  If there are a large number of vertices, this option can require lots of computation.
16137  Remark:
16138  Interpolation computation is available in Rhino, Rhino compute, Rhino Inside,
16139  Grasshopper. Interpolation computation is not available in the opennurbs IO toolkit.
16140  */
16141  void SetInterpolateMeshVertices(
16142  bool bInterpolateMeshVertices
16143  );
16144 
16145 
16146  ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
16147  //
16148  // Texture coordinates
16149  //
16150 #pragma region RH_C_SHARED_ENUM [ON_SubDFromMeshParameters::TextureCoordinatesOption] [Rhino.Geometry.SubDCreationOptions.TextureCoordinateOption] [nested:byte]
16151  /// <summary>
16152  /// Specifies how texture coordinate information is transfered from the mesh to the SubD.
16153  /// </summary>
16154  enum class TextureCoordinatesOption : unsigned char
16155  {
16156  ///<summary>The option is not set.</summary>
16157  Unset = 0,
16158 
16159  ///<summary>No texture coordianate information is transfered from the mesh.</summary>
16160  None = 1,
16161 
16162  ///<summary>
16163  /// If the mesh has a mapping, then TextureCoordinatesOption::CopyMapping is used.
16164  /// Otherwise if the mesh has texture coordinates, then TextureCoordinatesOption::CopyCoordinates is used.
16165  /// Otherwise TextureCoordinatesOption::Packed is used.
16166  ///</summary>
16167  Automatic = 2,
16168 
16169  ///<summary>
16170  /// No texture coordianate information is transfered from the mesh.
16171  /// The SubD faces are packed.
16172  ///</summary>
16173  Packed = 3,
16174 
16175  ///<summary>Texture coordinates mapping information is copied from the mesh.
16176  /// Generally this is the best choice because common mappings, like planar,
16177  /// will appear as most people expect on the SubD.
16178  ///</summary>
16179  CopyMapping = 4,
16180 
16181  ///<summary>
16182  /// If a mesh has custom texture coordinates, the custom texture coordinates
16183  /// are transfered to the SubD. This requires more memory resources,
16184  /// slows subdivision evaluation, often produces unattractive
16185  /// results on n-gons, and distorts the texture when comes from a common mapping
16186  /// technique, like planar. This option may be useful when the mesh contains only
16187  /// triangles and quads and the custom texture coordinates are of high quality.
16188  ///</summary>
16189  CopyCoordinates = 5,
16190  };
16191 #pragma endregion
16192 
16193 
16194  /*
16195  Description:
16196  Set the texture coordinates option.
16197  Parameters:
16198  texture_coordinates_opton - [in]
16199  */
16200  void SetTextureCoordinatesOption(
16201  ON_SubDFromMeshParameters::TextureCoordinatesOption texture_coordinates_opton
16202  );
16203 
16204  /*
16205  Returns:
16206  The texture coorindates option.
16207  */
16208  ON_SubDFromMeshParameters::TextureCoordinatesOption GetTextureCoordinatesOption() const;
16209 
16210  static ON_SubDFromMeshParameters::TextureCoordinatesOption TextureCoordinatesOptionFromUnsigned(
16211  unsigned int texture_coordinates_opton_as_unsigned
16212  );
16213 
16214 
16215  /*
16216  Returns:
16217  true - In ON_SubD::CreateFromMesh(), colinear boundary edges belonging to the same face are merged into a single edge.
16218  false - In ON_SubD::CreateFromMesh(), each mesh boundary edge becomes a SubD boundary edge.
16219  */
16220  bool MergeColinearBoundaryEdges() const;
16221 
16222  /*
16223  Parameters:
16224  bMergeColinearBoundaryEdges - [in]
16225  true
16226  In ON_SubD::CreateFromMesh(), colinear boundary edges belonging to the same face are merged into a single edge.
16227  In general, this is the best choice and leads to the highest quality of SubD object.
16228  false
16229  In ON_SubD::CreateFromMesh(), each mesh boundary edge becomes a SubD boundary edge.
16230  Use this when the boundary topology of the mesh and SubD should be identical.
16231  */
16232  void SetMergeColinearBoundaryEdges(
16233  bool bMergeColinearBoundaryEdges
16234  );
16235 
16236  /*
16237  Returns:
16238  true - In ON_SubD::CreateFromMesh(), colinear interior edges between two faces are merged into a single edge.
16239  false - In ON_SubD::CreateFromMesh(), each mesh interior edge becomes a SubD interior edge.
16240  */
16241  bool MergeColinearInteriorEdges() const;
16242 
16243  /*
16244  Parameters:
16245  bMergeColinearInteriorEdges - [in]
16246  true
16247  In ON_SubD::CreateFromMesh(), colinear interior edges between two faces are merged into a single edge.
16248  In general, this is the best choice and leads to the highest quality of SubD object.
16249  false
16250  In ON_SubD::CreateFromMesh(), each mesh interior edge becomes a SubD interior edge.
16251  Use this when the interior topology of the mesh and SubD should be identical.
16252  */
16253  void SetMergeColinearInteriorEdges(
16254  bool bMergeColinearInteriorEdges
16255  );
16256 
16257 
16258 private:
16259  enum : unsigned char
16260  {
16261  MergeColinearBoundaryEdgesMask = 1,
16262  MergeColinearInteriorEdgesMask = 2
16263  };
16264  unsigned char m_merge_edges_bits = 0; // clear bit (0) = "true, set bit (1) = "false"
16265 
16266  bool m_bInterpolateMeshVertices = false;
16267 
16268  ON_SubDFromMeshParameters::InteriorCreaseOption m_interior_crease_option = ON_SubDFromMeshParameters::InteriorCreaseOption::None;
16269  ON_SubDFromMeshParameters::ConvexCornerOption m_convex_corner_option = ON_SubDFromMeshParameters::ConvexCornerOption::None;
16270  ON_SubDFromMeshParameters::ConcaveCornerOption m_concave_corner_option = ON_SubDFromMeshParameters::ConcaveCornerOption::None;
16271  ON_SubDFromMeshParameters::TextureCoordinatesOption m_texture_coordinates_option = ON_SubDFromMeshParameters::TextureCoordinatesOption::None;
16272 
16273  unsigned short m_maximum_convex_corner_edge_count = 2U;
16274 
16275  unsigned short m_minimum_concave_corner_edge_count = 4U;
16276 
16277  unsigned short m_reserved2 = 0;
16278  unsigned int m_reserved3 = 0;
16279 
16280  double m_reserved4 = 0.0;
16281 
16282  double m_maximum_convex_corner_angle_radians = 120.0 * ON_DEGREES_TO_RADIANS; // 120 degrees
16283  double m_minimum_concave_corner_angle_radians = 240.0 * ON_DEGREES_TO_RADIANS; // 240 degrees
16284 };
16285 
16286 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
16287 //
16288 // ON_SubDComponentRef
16289 //
16290 // Used when an ON_SubD vertex, edge or face needs to be sent around as
16291 // a piece of ON_Geometry.
16292 //
16293 class ON_CLASS ON_SubDComponentRef : public ON_Geometry
16294 {
16295  ON_OBJECT_DECLARE(ON_SubDComponentRef);
16296 public:
16297  static const ON_SubDComponentRef Empty;
16298 
16299  ON_SubDComponentRef() = default;
16300  ~ON_SubDComponentRef() = default;
16301  ON_SubDComponentRef(const ON_SubDComponentRef&) ON_NOEXCEPT;
16302  ON_SubDComponentRef& operator=(const ON_SubDComponentRef&);
16303 
16304 #if defined(ON_HAS_RVALUEREF)
16305  // rvalue copy constructor
16306  ON_SubDComponentRef( ON_SubDComponentRef&& ) ON_NOEXCEPT;
16307 
16308  // The rvalue assignment operator calls ON_Object::operator=(ON_Object&&)
16309  // which could throw exceptions. See the implementation of
16310  // ON_Object::operator=(ON_Object&&) for details.
16311  ON_SubDComponentRef& operator=( ON_SubDComponentRef&& );
16312 #endif
16313 
16314  /*
16315  Parameters:
16316  subd_ref - [in]
16317  component_index - [in]
16318  component_location - [in]
16319  */
16320  static const ON_SubDComponentRef Create(
16321  const ON_SubDRef& subd_ref,
16322  ON_COMPONENT_INDEX component_index,
16323  ON_SubDComponentLocation component_location,
16324  ON__UINT_PTR reference_id
16325  );
16326 
16327  static const ON_SubDComponentRef Create(
16328  const ON_SubDRef& subd_ref,
16329  ON_SubDComponentPtr component_ptr,
16330  ON_SubDComponentLocation component_location,
16331  ON__UINT_PTR reference_id
16332  );
16333 
16334  static const ON_SubDComponentRef Create(
16335  const ON_SubDRef& subd_ref,
16336  const class ON_SubDVertex* vertex,
16337  ON_SubDComponentLocation component_location,
16338  ON__UINT_PTR reference_id
16339  );
16340 
16341  static const ON_SubDComponentRef Create(
16342  const ON_SubDRef& subd_ref,
16343  const class ON_SubDEdge* edge,
16344  ON_SubDComponentLocation component_location,
16345  ON__UINT_PTR reference_id
16346  );
16347 
16348  static const ON_SubDComponentRef Create(
16349  const ON_SubDRef& subd_ref,
16350  const class ON_SubDFace* face,
16351  ON_SubDComponentLocation component_location,
16352  ON__UINT_PTR reference_id
16353  );
16354 
16355  void Clear();
16356 
16357  ON_SubDRef SubDRef() const;
16358 
16359  const class ON_SubD& SubD() const;
16360 
16361  ON_COMPONENT_INDEX ComponentIndex() const override;
16362 
16363  ON_SubDComponentPtr ComponentPtr() const;
16364 
16365  ON_SubDComponentLocation ComponentLocation() const;
16366 
16367  /*
16368  The interpretation of this value depends on the context.
16369  */
16370  ON__UINT_PTR ReferenceId() const;
16371 
16372  void SetReferenceId(
16373  ON__UINT_PTR reference_id
16374  );
16375 
16376  const class ON_SubDVertex* Vertex() const;
16377 
16378  const class ON_SubDEdge* Edge() const;
16379 
16380  const class ON_SubDFace* Face() const;
16381 
16382  static int Compare(const ON_SubDComponentRef* lhs, const ON_SubDComponentRef* rhs);
16383  static int Compare2(const ON_SubDComponentRef* const* lhs, const ON_SubDComponentRef* const* rhs);
16384 
16385 private:
16386  ON_SubDRef m_subd_ref;
16387  ON_SubDComponentPtr m_component_ptr = ON_SubDComponentPtr::Null;
16388  ON_COMPONENT_INDEX m_component_index = ON_COMPONENT_INDEX::UnsetComponentIndex;
16389  ON_SubDComponentLocation m_component_location = ON_SubDComponentLocation::Unset;
16390  ON__UINT_PTR m_reference_id = 0;
16391 
16392 public:
16393  // overrides of virtual ON_Object functions
16394  bool IsValid( class ON_TextLog* text_log = nullptr ) const override;
16395  void Dump( ON_TextLog& ) const override;
16396  unsigned int SizeOf() const override;
16397  ON::object_type ObjectType() const override;
16398 
16399  // overrides of virtual ON_Geometry functions
16400  int Dimension() const override;
16401 
16402  // virtual ON_Geometry GetBBox override
16403  bool GetBBox( double* boxmin, double* boxmax, bool bGrowBox = false ) const override;
16404 };
16405 
16406 class ON_CLASS ON_SubDComponentRefList
16407 {
16408 public:
16409  ON_SubDComponentRefList() = default;
16410  ~ON_SubDComponentRefList();
16411  ON_SubDComponentRefList(const ON_SubDComponentRefList& src);
16412  ON_SubDComponentRefList& operator=(const ON_SubDComponentRefList& src);
16413 
16414  /*
16415  Description:
16416  Append a ON_SubDComponentRef to the identified component.
16417  Returns;
16418  A pointer to the ON_SubDComponentRef managed by this class or
16419  nullptr if the input is not valid.
16420  */
16421  const ON_SubDComponentRef& Append(
16422  const ON_SubDRef& subd_ref,
16423  ON_COMPONENT_INDEX ci,
16424  ON_SubDComponentLocation component_location,

16426  );

16429  const ON_SubDRef& subd_ref,
16430  ON_SubDComponentPtr component_ptr,
16431  ON_SubDComponentLocation component_location,
16432  ON__UINT_PTR reference_id
16433  );

16438  managed by this class.
16439  */
16440  const ON_SubDComponentRef& Append(const ON_SubDComponentRef& src_ref);
16441  const ON_SubDComponentRef& Append(const ON_SubDComponentRef* src_ref);
16442 
16443  /*
16444  Description:
16445  Expert user function to transfer managment of an ON_SubDComponentRef on the heap
16446  to this class.
16447  */
16448  const ON_SubDComponentRef& AppendForExperts(ON_SubDComponentRef*& ref);
16449 
16450  /*
16451  Description:

16453  The expert user is responsible for insuring subd exists fot the lifetime of this
16454  class.
16455  */
16456  const ON_SubDComponentRef& AppendForExperts(
16457  const ON_SubD& subd,
16458  ON_COMPONENT_INDEX ci,
16459  ON_SubDComponentLocation component_location,
16460  ON__UINT_PTR reference_id
16461  );
16462 
16463  const ON_SubDComponentRef& AppendForExperts(
16464  const ON_SubD& subd,
16465  ON_SubDComponentPtr component_ptr,
16466  ON_SubDComponentLocation component_location,
16467  ON__UINT_PTR reference_id
16468  );
16469 
16470  /*
16471  Description:
16472  Sort by ON_SubDComponentRef::Compare2() and remove duplicates and empty elements.
16473  Returns:
16474  Length of clean list.
16475  */
16476  int Clean();
16477 
16478 
16479  /*
16480  Returns:
16481  Number of refs in the list.
16482  */
16483  int Count() const;
16484

16486 
16487  /*
16488  Description:
16489  Transfers the ref to an expert user who is responsible for properly managing it.
16490  */
16491  ON_SubDComponentRef* TransferForExperts(int i);
16492 
16493  const ON_SubDComponentRef& operator[](int) const;
16494 
16495  /*
16496  Returns:
16497  If the list is clean, the number of subd objects in the list. Mutiple components can belong to the same SubD.
16498  If the list is not clean, 0.
16499  Remarks:
16500  Use Clean() to get a clean list.
16501  */
16502  int SubDCount() const;
16503 
16504  /*
16505  Returns:
16506  Number of vertices.
16507  */
16508  int VertexCount() const;
16509 
16510  /*

16512  Number of vertices with the specified tag.
16513  */

16517  Returns:
16518  Number of edges.
16519  */

16521

16525  */
16526  int EdgeCount(ON_SubDEdgeTag edge_tag) const;
16527
