16530  Returns:
16531  Number of faces.
16532  */
16533  int FaceCount() const;
16534 
16535  /*
16536  Returns:
16537  Number of components.
16538  */
16539  int ComponentCount() const;
16540 
16541 private:
16542 #pragma ON_PRAGMA_WARNING_PUSH
16543 #pragma ON_PRAGMA_WARNING_DISABLE_MSC( 4251 )
16544  // C4251: ... needs to have dll-interface to be used by clients of class ...
16545  // m_subdimple_sp is private and all code that manages m_subdimple_sp is explicitly implemented in the DLL.
16546  ON_SimpleArray< class ON_SubDComponentRef* > m_list;
16547 #pragma ON_PRAGMA_WARNING_POP
16548 
16549  int m_subd_count = 0;
16550  int m_subd_vertex_smooth_count = 0;
16551  int m_subd_vertex_dart_count = 0;
16552  int m_subd_vertex_crease_count = 0;
16553  int m_subd_vertex_corner_count = 0;
16554  int m_subd_edge_smooth_count = 0;
16555  int m_subd_edge_crease_count = 0;
16556  int m_subd_face_count = 0;
16557 
16558  bool m_bIsClean = false; // true if m_list is clean.
16559 
16560  unsigned char m_reserved1 = 0;
16561  unsigned short m_reserved2 = 0;
16562  unsigned int m_reserved3 = 0;
16563  ON__UINT_PTR m_reserved4 = 0;
16564 
16565 private:
16566  bool Internal_UpdateCount(const ON_SubDComponentRef& r, int delta);
16567  void Internal_Destroy();
16568  void Internal_CopyFrom(const ON_SubDComponentRefList& src);
16569 };
16570 
16571 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
16572 //
16573 // ON_SubDComponentPoint
16574 //
16575 // Used in selection tests to return a point and parameters on a component.
16576 //
16577 class ON_CLASS ON_SubDComponentPoint
16578 {
16579 public:
16580  static const ON_SubDComponentPoint Unset;
16581 
16582  ON_SubDComponentPoint() = default;
16583  ~ON_SubDComponentPoint() = default;
16584  ON_SubDComponentPoint(const ON_SubDComponentPoint&) = default;
16585  ON_SubDComponentPoint& operator=(const ON_SubDComponentPoint&) = default;
16586 
16587  /*
16588  Description:
16589  Dictionary compare of component type, component pointer, and component direction (partial).
16590  This function is useful for sorting arrays of ON_SubDComponentPoint values remove duplicates.
16591  */
16592  static int CompareComponentAndDirection(
16593  const ON_SubDComponentPoint* a,
16594  const ON_SubDComponentPoint* b
16595  );
16596 
16597  // m_component_ptr will be face, edge or vertex
16598  ON_SubDComponentPtr m_component_ptr = ON_SubDComponentPtr::Null;
16599 
16600  //// If the point is on a a face that does not have the ordinary number of
16601  //// edges for the subdivision type, then m_face_corner_index identifies the
16602  //// subfragment corner.
16603  //unsigned int m_face_corner_index = ON_UNSET_UINT_INDEX;
16604 
16605  //// If m_level_index is ON_UNSET_UINT_INDEX, the point is on the limit surface.
16606  //// Otherwise the point is on the control net at the specified level.
16607  //unsigned int m_level_index = ON_UNSET_UINT_INDEX;
16608 
16609  ON_PickPoint m_pick_point = ON_PickPoint::Unset;
16610 };
16611 
16612 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
16613 //
16614 // ON_SubDMatrix
16615 //
16616 class ON_CLASS ON_SubDMatrix
16617 {
16618 public:
16619  ON_SubDMatrix() = default;
16620 
16621  static const ON_SubDMatrix Empty;
16622 
16623  /*
16624  Description:
16625  Precise evaluation of cos(a) and cos(a) where a = i/n pi.
16626  These values are required for high qualitiy limit surface evaluation.
16627  Parameters:
16628  j - [in]
16629  n - [in]
16630  cos_theta - [out]
16631  cos(j/n pi)
16632  sin_theta - [out]
16633  sin(j/n pi)
16634  */
16635  static bool EvaluateCosAndSin(
16636  unsigned int j,
16637  unsigned int n,
16638  double* cos_theta,
16639  double* sin_theta
16640  );
16641 
16642  bool IsValid() const;
16643 
16644  bool IsValidPointRing(
16645  const double* point_ring,
16646  size_t point_ring_count,
16647  size_t point_ring_stride
16648  ) const;
16649 
16650  bool EvaluateSubdivisionPoint(
16651  unsigned int component_index,
16652  const double* point_ring,
16653  size_t point_ring_count,
16654  size_t point_ring_stride,
16655  double subd_point[3]
16656  ) const;
16657 
16658  bool EvaluateSurfacePoint(
16659  const double* point_ring,
16660  size_t point_ring_count,
16661  size_t point_ring_stride,
16662  bool bUndefinedNormalIsPossible,
16663  double limit_point[3],
16664  double limit_tangent1[3],
16665  double limit_tangent2[3],
16666  double limit_normal[3]
16667  ) const;
16668 
16669  bool EvaluateSurfacePoint(
16670  const double* point_ring,
16671  size_t point_ring_count,
16672  size_t point_ring_stride,
16673  bool bUndefinedNormalIsPossible,
16674  class ON_SubDSectorSurfacePoint& limit_point
16675  ) const;
16676 
16677  /*
16678  Description:
16679  Get the subdivision matrix information for the case specified
16680  by the input parameters. This information is retrieved from
16681  a cache. In some cases, it will be calculated the first time
16682  it is needed.
16683  Parameters:
16684  facet_type - [in]
16685  vertex_tag - [in]
16686  valence - [in]
16687  The input parameters identify the subdivision case.
16688  Remarks:
16689  Every member function of ON_SubDMatrix, including this one
16690  is thread safe.
16691  */
16692  static const ON_SubDMatrix& FromCache(
16693  ON_SubDSectorType sector_type
16694  );
16695 
16696  ON_SubDSectorType m_sector_type;
16697 
16698  unsigned int m_R = 0; // the matrix m_S is m_R x m_R (m_R = m_sector_type.PointRingCount())
16699 
16700  // The term "standard vertex ring points" is used below.
16701  //
16702  // If "C" is an interior vertex (m_vertex_tag is smooth or dart),
16703  // (E[0], ...., E[N-1]) is a radially sorted list of its edges,
16704  // (F[0], ..., F[N-1]) is a radially sorted list of its faces,
16705  // and (P[0], ..., P[N-1]) is a list of the edge vertices opposite C,
16706  // E0type = smooth for a smooth vertex and crease for a dart vertex,
16707  // then C is "standard" if E[0] has type E0type, every other
16708  // edge E[i] is smooth, every outer vertex/ P[i] is smooth, and every
16709  // face F[i] has the stadard facet type (tri or quad) for the subdivision
16710  // algorithm.
16711  //
16712  // If If "C" is a boundary vertex (m_vertex_tag is crease or corner), the conditions
16713  // listed above are satisified except
16714  // E[0] and E[N-1] are tagged as crease edges,
16715  // P[0] and P[N-1] are tagged as crease vertices (NOT corners),
16716  // and there are N-2 faces,
16717  // then "C" is a standard boundary vertex.
16718  //
16719  // If the facet type is triangle and C is a standard interior or boundary vertex,
16720  // then the "standard vertex ring" is the list of N+1 points
16721  // (C, P[0], ...., P[N-1]).
16722  //
16723  // If the facet type is quad, and C is a standard interior vertex,
16724  // then the "standard vertex ring" is the list of 2*N+1 points
16725  // (C, P[0], Q[0], ...., P[N-1], Q[N-1]), where Q[I] is the vertex of quad F[i] diagonally across from C.
16726  //
16727  // If the facet type is quad, and C is a standard boundary vertex,
16728  // then the "standard vertex ring" is the list of 2*N points
16729  // (C, P[0], Q[0], ...., P[N-1]).
16730 
16731  // m_S = R x R subdivision matrix
16732  // If (vertexR[0], ..., vertexR[R-1]) is a list of standard vertex ring points,
16733  // then then the location of the subdivided ring points
16734  // (vertexR1[0], ..., vertexR1[R-1]) can be calculated from m_S.
16735  // vertexR1[i] = m_S[i][0]*vertexR[0] + ... + m_S[i][R-1]*vertexR[R-1]
16736  const double* const* m_S = nullptr;
16737 
16738  // m_LP[] = limit point evaluation vector.
16739  // The array m_LP[] has m_R elements.
16740  // If (vertexR[0], ..., vertexR[R-1]) is a list of standard vertex ring points,
16741  // then Limit point = m_LP[0]*vertexR[0] + ... + m_LP[R-1]*vertexR[R-1].
16742  // m_LP is the eigenvector of Transpose(m_S) with eigenvalue = 1.
16743  // Length(m_LP) = 1.
16744  const double* m_LP = nullptr;
16745 
16746  // m_L1 and m_L2 = tangent space evaluation vectors.
16747  // The arrays m_L1[] and m_L2[] have m_R elements.
16748  // If (vertexR[0], ..., vertexR[R-1]) is a list of standard vertex ring points,
16749  // then the two vectors
16750  // V1 = m_L1[0]*vertexR[0] + ... + m_L1[R-1]*vertexR[R-1].
16751  // V2 = m_L2[0]*vertexR[0] + ... + m_L2[R-1]*vertexR[R-1].
16752  // span the tangent plane and
16753  // N = V1 x V2 is perpindicular to the limit tangent plane.
16754  // In general and almost always in practice, V1 and V2 are not unit vectors
16755  // and it is best to noramalize V1 and V2 before taking the cross product.
16756  // m_L1 and m_L2 are subdominant eigenvectors of Transpose(m_S).
16757  // When the subdominant eigenvalue has geometric multiplicity 2,
16758  // m_L1 and m_L2 span the same space as m_E1 and m_E2.
16759  // The values stored in m_L1 and m_L2 are chosen to provide accurate
16760  // evaluation. In come common cases m_L1 and m_L2 are equal to m_E1 and m_E2,
16761  // but not in all cases.
16762  const double* m_L1 = nullptr;
16763  const double* m_L2 = nullptr;
16764 
16765  /*
16766  Description:
16767  Set the values in this ON_SubDMatrix so the information
16768  can be used to evaluate the case identified by the input
16769  parameters.
16770  Parameters:
16771  facet_type - [in]
16772  vertex_tag - [in]
16773  sector_edge_count - [in]
16774  The input parameters identify the subdivision case.
16775  Returns:
16776  R > 0: Success. The matrix is R x R.
16777  0: Failure.
16778  */
16779  unsigned int SetFromSectorType(
16780  ON_SubDSectorType sector_type
16781  );
16782 
16783  /*
16784  Returns:
16785  ON_UNSET_VALUE - serious error
16786  >= 0:
16787  Maximum value of numbers that should be zero in and ideal world.
16788  When the matrices, eigenvalues and eigenvectors are correctly calculated,
16789  this returned value is in the range from 1e-16 to 5e-13 as valence goes
16790  from 3 to 100.
16791  For valences < 100, if a value larger than 1.0e-12 occurs, there is a bug in the code.
16792  */
16793  double TestMatrix() const;
16794 
16795  /*
16796  Description:
16797  Run evaluation tests on this subdivision case.
16798  Returns:
16799  >= 0.0: Test passed. Maximum deviation found in any test is returned.
16800  ON_UNSET_VALUE: Test failed.
16801  */
16802  double TestEvaluation() const;
16803 
16804  /*
16805  Description:
16806  Run evaluation tests on a range of subdivision cases.
16807  Parameters:
16808  sector_type - [in]
16809  If ON_SubDSectorType::Empty, then all supported sector types types are tested.
16810  minimum_sector_face_count - [in]
16811  If 0, then testing begins at ON_SubDSectorType::MinimumSectorFaceCount(vertex_tag)
16812  when testing vertex_tag types
16813  maximum_sector_face_count - [in]
16814  If 0, then testing stops at ON_SubD::maximum_evaluation_valence.
16815  text_log - [out]
16816  If not nullptr, then a brief written report is printed for each test case.
16817  Returns:
16818  >= 0.0: Test passed. Maximum deviation found in any test is returned.
16819  ON_UNSET_VALUE: Test failed.
16820  */
16821  static double TestEvaluation(
16822  ON_SubDSectorType sector_type,
16823  unsigned int minimum_sector_face_count,
16824  unsigned int maximum_sector_face_count,
16825  ON_TextLog* text_log
16826  );
16827 
16828  double TestComponentRing(
16829  const ON_SubDComponentPtr* component_ring,
16830  size_t component_ring_count
16831  ) const;
16832 
16833  /*
16834  Description:
16835  Test cached subdivision matrix on sector identified by sit.
16836  Parameters:
16837  subd_type - [in]
16838  subd_recursion_count - [in]
16839  number of times to subdivide
16840  sit - [in]
16841  vertex to subdivide
16842  component_ring - [out]
16843  subd_points - [out]
16844  limit_point - [out]
16845  limit_tangent0 - [out]
16846  limit_tangent1 - [out]
16847  limit_normal - [out]
16848  */
16849  static double TestEvaluation(
16850  const unsigned int subd_recursion_count,
16851  ON_SubDSectorIterator sit,
16852  ON_SimpleArray<ON_SubDComponentPtr>& component_ring,
16853  ON_SimpleArray< ON_3dPoint >& subd_points,
16854  class ON_SubDSectorSurfacePoint& limit_point
16855  );
16856 
16857 private:
16858  unsigned int m__max_R = 0;
16859  ON_Matrix m__S; // m_S matrix memory
16860  ON_SimpleArray<double> m__buffer; // m_LP, m_L1, m_L2, m_E1, m_E2 memory
16861 };
16862 
16863 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
16864 //
16865 // ON_SubD_FixedSizeHeap
16866 //
16867 
16868 /*
16869 Description:
16870  A ON_SubD_FixedSizeHeap is used to manage heap used for a local subdivision.
16871 */
16872 class ON_CLASS ON_SubD_FixedSizeHeap
16873 {
16874 private:
16875  static unsigned int m__sn_factory;
16876 
16877 public:
16878  // The serial number is used for debugging purposes.
16879  const unsigned int m_sn = ++m__sn_factory;
16880 
16881 public:
16882  ON_SubD_FixedSizeHeap() = default;
16883  ~ON_SubD_FixedSizeHeap();
16884 
16885  /*
16886  Description:
16887  Reserve enough room to for a subdivision of a vertex sector.
16888  Parameters:
16889  sector_edge_count - [in]
16890  Number of edges in the sector.
16891  */
16892  bool ReserveSubDWorkspace(
16893  unsigned int sector_edge_count
16894  );
16895 
16896  /*
16897  Description:
16898  Reserve enough room for a local subdivide the neighborhood of center_face.
16899  Parameters:
16900  center_face0 - [in]
16901  */
16902  bool ReserveSubDWorkspace(
16903  const ON_SubDFace* center_face0
16904  );
16905 
16906 private:
16907  bool Internal_ReserveSubDWorkspace(
16908  size_t vertex_capacity,
16909  size_t face_capacity,
16910  size_t array_capacity,
16911  bool bEnableHashTable
16912  );
16913 
16914  bool Internal_ReserveSubDWorkspace_HashTable();
16915 
16916 public:
16917 
16918  /*
16919  Description:
16920  Reset this ON_SubD_FixedSizeHeap so it can be used again.
16921  */
16922  void Reset();
16923 
16924  /*
16925  Description:
16926  Deallocate all reserved heap.
16927  */
16928  void Destroy();
16929 
16930  bool InUse() const;
16931 
16932  ON_SubDVertex* AllocateVertex(
16933  const double vertexP[3],
16934  unsigned int edge_capacity
16935  );
16936 
16937  /*
16938  Description:
16939  Allocate a vertex located at the vertex0 subdivision point.
16940 
16941  Parameters:
16942  vertex0 - [in]
16943  edge_capacity - [in]
16944  If the returned vertex will be interior in a local subdivision,
16945  then pass vertex0->EdgeCount().
16946  If the returned vertex will be an outer ring vertex in a local subdivision,
16947  then pass 3.
16948  */
16949  ON_SubDVertex* AllocateVertex(
16950  const ON_SubDVertex* vertex0,
16951  unsigned int edge_capacity
16952  );
16953 
16954  /*
16955  Description:
16956  Allocate a vertex located at the edge0 subdivision point.
16957  The vertex will have an edge and face capacity of 4.
16958  Parameters:
16959  edge0 - [in]
16960  */
16961  ON_SubDVertex* AllocateVertex(
16962  const ON_SubDEdge* edge0
16963  );
16964 
16965  /*
16966  Description:
16967  Find or allocate a vertex located at the edge0 subdivision point.
16968  The vertex will have an edge and face capacity of 4.
16969  Parameters:
16970  edge0 - [in]
16971  Remarks:
16972  In order for FindOrAllocateVertex() to find a vertex, that vertex must
16973  have been created by an earlier call to FindOrAllocateVertex().
16974  Typically, AllocateVertex(edge0) is used for center face boundary edges
16975  and FindOrAllocateVertex(edge0) is used for ring edges.
16976  */
16977  ON_SubDVertex* FindOrAllocateVertex(
16978  const ON_SubDEdge* edge0
16979  );
16980 
16981  /*
16982  Description:
16983  Allocate a vertex located at the edge0 subdivision point.
16984  The vertex will have an edge and face capacity of 4.
16985  Parameters:
16986  edge0 - [in]
16987  */
16988  ON_SubDVertex* AllocateEdgeSubdivisionVertex(
16989  bool bUseFindOrAllocate,
16990  const ON_SubDEdge * edge0
16991  );
16992 
16993  /*
16994  Description:
16995  Find or allocate a vertex and the face subdivision point. The vertex will have an
16996  edge and face capacity of face0->EdgeCount().
16997  Parameters:
16998  face0 - [in]
16999  outer face in a local subdivision situation
17000  Remarks:
17001  In order for FindOrAllocateVertex() to find a vertex, that vertex must
17002  have been created by an earlier call to FindOrAllocateVertex().
17003  Typically, AllocateVertex(edge0) is used for the center face and
17004  and FindOrAllocateVertex(edge0) is used for ring faces.
17005  */
17006  ON_SubDVertex* FindOrAllocateVertex(
17007  const ON_SubDFace* face0
17008  );
17009 
17010 
17011  /*
17012  Description:
17013  Allocate a vertex located at the sector_face0 subdivision point.
17014  The vertex will have an edge and face capacity of 3.
17015  Parameters:
17016  sector_face0 - [in]
17017  A face in a vertex sector.
17018  */
17019  ON_SubDVertex* AllocateSectorFaceVertex(
17020  const ON_SubDFace* sector_face0
17021  );
17022 
17023 
17024  /*
17025  Parameters:
17026  v0 - [in]
17027  v0_sector_weight - [in]
17028  If v0 null or ON_SubDVertexTag::Smooth == v0->m_vertex_tag, and v1 is null or tagged,
17029  then m_sector_weight[0] is set to v0_sector_weight.
17030  In all other cases the value of v0_sector_weight is ignored and m_sector_weight[0]
17031  is set to ON_SubDSectorType::IgnoredSectorCoefficient.
17032  v1 - [in]
17033  v1_sector_weight - [in]
17034  If v1 null or ON_SubDVertexTag::Smooth == v1->m_vertex_tag, and v0 is null or tagged,
17035  then m_sector_weight[1] is set to v1_sector_weight.
17036  In all other cases the value of v1_sector_weight is ignored and m_sector_weight[1]
17037  is set to ON_SubDSectorType::IgnoredSectorCoefficient.
17038  Returns:
17039  An edge.
17040  The vertex parameter information is used to set the ON_SubDEdge.m_vertex[]
17041  and ON_SubDEdge.m_sector_weight[] values.
17042  If v0 and v1 are not null and both are tagged, then ON_SubDEdge.m_edge_tag is
17043  set to ON_SubDEdgeTag::Crease.
17044  In all other cases, ON_SubDEdge.m_edge_tag is set to ON_SubDEdgeTag::Smooth.
17045  If v0 or v1 is not null, then ON_SubDEdge.m_level is set to the
17046  maximum of v0->m_level or v1->m_level.
17047  */
17048  const ON_SubDEdgePtr AllocateEdge(
17049  ON_SubDVertex* v0,
17050  double v0_sector_weight,
17051  ON_SubDVertex* v1,
17052  double v1_sector_weight
17053  );
17054 
17055  /*
17056  Description:
17057  NOTE WELL:
17058  In order for FindOrAllocateEdge() to find an edge, that edge must have been created
17059  by an earlier call to FindOrAllocateEdge().
17060  */
17061  const ON_SubDEdgePtr FindOrAllocateEdge(
17062  ON_SubDVertex* v0,
17063  double v0_sector_weight,
17064  ON_SubDVertex* v1,
17065  double v1_sector_weight
17066  );
17067 
17068  const ON_SubDEdgePtr AllocateEdge(
17069  bool bUseFindOrAllocatEdge,
17070  ON_SubDVertex* v0,
17071  double v0_sector_weight,
17072  ON_SubDVertex* v1,
17073  double v1_sector_weight
17074  );
17075 
17076 
17077 
17078  private:
17079  /*
17080  Returns:
17081  A face with all field values zero (same values as ON_SubDEdge::Face), except ON_SubDFace.m_id.
17082  */
17083  ON_SubDFace* Internal_AllocateFace(
17084  unsigned int zero_face_id,
17085  unsigned int parent_face_id
17086  );
17087  public:
17088 
17089  ON_SubDFace* AllocateQuad(
17090  unsigned int zero_face_id,
17091  unsigned int parent_face_id,
17092  const ON_SubDEdgePtr eptrs[4]
17093  );
17094 
17095  ON_SubDFace* AllocateQuad(
17096  unsigned int zero_face_id,
17097  unsigned int parent_face_id,
17098  ON_SubDEdgePtr e0,
17099  ON_SubDEdgePtr e1,
17100  ON_SubDEdgePtr e2,
17101  ON_SubDEdgePtr e3
17102  );
17103 
17104  /*
17105  Parameters:
17106  capacity - [in]
17107  desired array size
17108  bZeroMemory - [in]
17109  If true, all array element values are zero.
17110  If false, array element values are undefined.
17111  Returns:
17112  An array of capacity ON__UINT_PTR pointers.
17113  */
17114  ON__UINT_PTR* AllocatePtrArray(
17115  unsigned int capacity,
17116  bool bZeroMemory
17117  );
17118 
17119  /*
17120  Description:
17121  Return the most recent array obtained from AllocatePtrArray().
17122  so it can be reused.
17123  Returns:
17124  True:
17125  Success.
17126  False:
17127  Failure. The array was not the most recent array obtained
17128  from AllocatePtrArray().
17129  */
17130  bool ReturnPtrArray(
17131  void* p,
17132  unsigned int capacity
17133  );
17134 
17135 private:
17136  ON_SubDVertex* m_v = nullptr;
17137  unsigned int m_v_capacity = 0;
17138  unsigned int m_v_index = 0;
17139 
17140  ON_SubDEdge* m_e = nullptr;
17141  unsigned int m_e_capacity = 0;
17142  unsigned int m_e_index = 0;
17143 
17144  ON_SubDFace* m_f = nullptr;
17145  unsigned int m_f_capacity = 0;
17146  unsigned int m_f_index = 0;
17147 
17148  ON__UINT_PTR* m_p = nullptr;
17149  unsigned int m_p_capacity = 0;
17150  unsigned int m_p_index = 0;
17151 
17152 private:
17153  // Used to find level 1 subdivision vertex from level 0 component
17154  class ON_SubD_FixedSizeHeap_ComponentPairHashElement** m_hash_table = nullptr;
17155  class ON_SubD_FixedSizeHeap_ComponentPairHashElement* m_hash_elements = nullptr;
17156  unsigned int m_h_capacity = 0; // m_hash_table[] capacity.
17157  unsigned int m_h_count = 0; // 0xFFFFFFFFU means hash is disabled
17158  enum : unsigned int
17159  {
17160  DisabledHashCount = 0xFFFFFFFFU
17161  };
17162 
17163  bool Internal_HashEnabled() const;
17164  unsigned int Internal_Hash(ON_SubDComponentPtr component0);
17165  class ON_SubDVertex* Internal_HashFindVertex1(unsigned int hash, ON_SubDComponentPtr component0);
17166  void Internal_HashAddPair(unsigned int hash, ON_SubDComponentPtr component0, class ON_SubDVertex* vertex1);
17167 
17168 private:
17169  // copies not supported
17170  ON_SubD_FixedSizeHeap(const ON_SubD_FixedSizeHeap&) = delete;
17171  ON_SubD_FixedSizeHeap& operator=(const ON_SubD_FixedSizeHeap&) = delete;
17172 };
17173 
17174 class ON_CLASS ON_SubDEdgeChain
17175 {
17176 public:
17177  ON_SubDEdgeChain() = default;
17178  ~ON_SubDEdgeChain() = default;
17179  ON_SubDEdgeChain(const ON_SubDEdgeChain&) = default;
17180  ON_SubDEdgeChain& operator=(const ON_SubDEdgeChain&) = default;
17181 
17182 public:
17183  static const ON_SubDEdgeChain Empty;
17184 
17185 public:
17186 
17187  /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
17188  //
17189  // Edge chain tools
17190  //
17191  /*
17192  Description:
17193  Sort edges into a chains
17194 
17195  Parameters:
17196  unsorted_edges - [in]
17197  To sort an array in place, pass the same array as both parameters.
17198  If unsorted_edges[] contains three or more edges that share a common vertex,
17199  then all of the edges that share that vertex are ignored.
17200  The edges can be from one or more SubDs.
17201 
17202  unsigned int minimum_chain_length - [in]
17203  minimum number of edges to consider for a chain.
17204 
17205  edge_chains - [out]
17206  The edge_chains[] has the edges grouped into edge chains.
17207 
17208  In an edge chain subsequent edges share a common vertex; i.e.
17209  edge_chains[i].RelativeVertex(1) == edge_chains[i+1].RelativeVertex(0).
17210 
17211  When edge_chains[i].RelativeVertex(1) != edge_chains[i+1].RelativeVertex(0),
17212  a chain ends at edge_chains[i] and another begins at edge_chains[i+1].
17213 
17214  The first edge in every chain has the same orientation as the input edge
17215  from edge_chains[].
17216 
17217  Returns:
17218  Number of chains in edge_chains[].
17219  */
17220  static unsigned int SortEdgesIntoEdgeChains(
17221  const ON_SimpleArray< ON_SubDEdgePtr >& unsorted_edges,
17222  unsigned int minimum_chain_length,
17223  ON_SimpleArray< ON_SubDEdgePtr >& edge_chains
17224  );
17225 
17226  static unsigned int SortEdgesIntoEdgeChains(
17227  const ON_SimpleArray< const ON_SubDEdge* >& unsorted_edges,
17228  unsigned int minimum_chain_length,
17229  ON_SimpleArray< ON_SubDEdgePtr >& edge_chains
17230  );
17231 
17232  static unsigned int SortEdgesIntoEdgeChains(
17233  const ON_SimpleArray< ON_SubDComponentPtr >& unsorted_edges,
17234  unsigned int minimum_chain_length,
17235  ON_SimpleArray< ON_SubDEdgePtr >& sorted_edges
17236  );
17237 
17238  static unsigned int SortEdgesIntoEdgeChains(
17239  const ON_SubD& subd,
17240  const ON_SimpleArray< ON_COMPONENT_INDEX >& unsorted_edges,
17241  unsigned int minimum_chain_length,
17242  ON_SimpleArray< ON_SubDEdgePtr >& edge_chains
17243  );
17244 
17245  /*
17246  Description:
17247  Orient edges[] into edge chains preserving the order of edges[].
17248  Returns:
17249  Number of chains in edge_chains[].
17250  */
17251  static unsigned int OrientEdgesIntoEdgeChains(
17252  const ON_SubD& subd,
17253  const ON_SimpleArray< ON_COMPONENT_INDEX >& edges,
17254  ON_SimpleArray< ON_SubDEdgePtr >& edge_chains
17255  );
17256 
17257  /*
17258  Description:
17259  Orient edges[] into edge chains preserving the order of edges[].
17260  Returns:
17261  Number of chains in edge_chains[].
17262  */
17263  static unsigned int OrientEdgesIntoEdgeChains(
17264  const ON_SimpleArray< const ON_SubDEdge* >& edges,
17265  ON_SimpleArray< ON_SubDEdgePtr >& edge_chains
17266  );
17267 
17268  /*
17269  Description:
17270  Orient edges[] into edge chains preserving the order of edges[].
17271  Returns:
17272  Number of chains in edge_chains[].
17273  */
17274  static unsigned int OrientEdgesIntoEdgeChains(
17275  const ON_SimpleArray< ON_SubDComponentPtr >& edges,
17276  ON_SimpleArray< ON_SubDEdgePtr >& edge_chains
17277  );
17278 
17279 #if defined(OPENNURBS_PLUS)
17280  /*
17281  Parameters:
17282  edge_count - [in]
17283  edge_chain[] - [in]
17284  A chain of contiguous edges. The conversion into a NURBS curve will
17285  stop if a link is not contiguous with the previous link.
17286  converted_count = [in]
17287  If not nullptr, the number of edges converted into the returned curve
17288  is returned.
17289  ON_NurbsCurve* destination - [in]
17290  If not nullptr, the limit curve is created in this instance.
17291  Returns:
17292  A NURBS curve that lies on the limit surface edges. The domain
17293  is (0,edge_count+1) and the subdomain for the i-th edge is (i,i+1).
17294  */
17295  static ON_NurbsCurve* GetEdgeSurfaceCurve(
17296  const ON_SimpleArray<ON_SubDEdgePtr>& edge_chain,
17297  unsigned int* converted_count,
17298  ON_NurbsCurve* destination
17299  );
17300 
17301  static ON_NurbsCurve* GetEdgeSurfaceCurve(
17302  const ON_SubDEdgePtr* edge_chain,
17303  size_t edge_count,
17304  unsigned int* converted_count,
17305  ON_NurbsCurve* destination
17306  );
17307 
17308  static ON_NurbsCurve* GetLoftCurve(
17309  const ON_SimpleArray<ON_SubDEdgePtr>& edge_chain,
17310  ON_NurbsCurve* destination
17311  );
17312 
17313  static ON_NurbsCurve* GetLoftCurve(
17314  const ON_SubDEdgePtr* edge_chain,
17315  size_t edge_count,
17316  ON_NurbsCurve* destination
17317  );
17318 
17319  ON_NurbsCurve* EdgeSurfaceCurve(
17320  ON_NurbsCurve* destination
17321  ) const;
17322 
17323  /*
17324  Description:
17325  Get a NURBS curve that is appropriate for lofting SubDs.
17326  Parameters:
17327  destination - [in]
17328  If not nullptr, then the curve is created in this instance.
17329  Returns:
17330  A pointer to the curve or nullptr if the edge is not valid.
17331  */
17332  ON_NurbsCurve* LoftCurve(
17333  ON_NurbsCurve* destination
17334  ) const;
17335 #endif
17336 
17337  /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
17338  //
17339  // Edge chain tools
17340  //
17341 
17342  /*
17343  Description:
17344  Get the neighboring link in an edge chain.
17345  Parameters:
17346  starting_edge - [in]
17347  search_direction - [in]
17348  ON_ChainDirection::Previous or ON_ChainDirection::Next.
17349  The search direction is relative to this->EdgeDirection().
17350  chain_type - [in]
17351  Determines what edge/vertex tag conditions must be satisified by the neighbor.
17352  Returns:
17353  The next or previous edge in the chain if it exists.
17354  Otherwise, nullptr is returned.
17355  Remarks:
17356  When multiple edges are candidates, there is a bias to preserve smooth/crease and a bias to
17357  preserve face count. If the biases don't reduce the list of candidates to one or bStopAtBreak is true
17358  and a creaase/smooth break is encountered, then ON_SubDEdgePtr::Null is returned.
17359  */
17360  static const ON_SubDEdgePtr EdgeChainNeighbor(
17361  ON_SubDEdgePtr starting_edge,
17362  ON_ChainDirection search_direction,
17363  ON_SubD::ChainType chain_type
17364  );
17365 
17366  /*
17367  Description:
17368  Get the neighboring link in an edge chain.
17369  Parameters:
17370  starting_edge - [in]
17371  search_direction - [in]
17372  ON_ChainDirection::Previous or ON_ChainDirection::Next.
17373  The search direction is relative to this->EdgeDirection().
17374  chain_type - [in]
17375  Determines what edge/vertex tag conditions must be satisified by the neighbor.
17376  bEnableStatusCheck - [in]
17377  status_pass - [in]
17378  status_fail - [in]
17379  If bEnableStatusFilter is false, then no status checks are performed.
17380  If bEnableStatusFilter is true, ON_ComponentStatus::StatusCheck(candidate_edge->m_status,status_pass,status_fail)
17381  must be true for candidate_edge to be returned.
17382  Returns:
17383  The next or previous edge in the chain if it exists.
17384  Otherwise, nullptr is returned.
17385  Remarks:
17386  When multiple edges are candidates, there is a bias to preserve smooth/crease and a bias to
17387  preserve face count. If the biases don't reduce the list of candidates to one or bStopAtBreak is true
17388  and a creaase/smooth break is encountered, then ON_SubDEdgePtr::Null is returned.
17389  */
17390  static const ON_SubDEdgePtr EdgeChainNeighbor(
17391  ON_SubDEdgePtr starting_edge,
17392  ON_ChainDirection search_direction,
17393  ON_SubD::ChainType chain_type,
17394  bool bEnableStatusCheck,
17395  ON_ComponentStatus status_pass,
17396  ON_ComponentStatus status_fail
17397  );
17398 
17399  /*
17400  Description:
17401  Reverse the orientation of the elements and the order
17402  of the elements in the edge_chain[] array.
17403  Parameters:
17404  edge_chain - [in/out]
17405  */
17406  static void ReverseEdgeChain(
17407  ON_SimpleArray< ON_SubDEdgePtr >& edge_chain
17408  );
17409 
17410  /*
17411  Description:
17412  Reverse the orientation of the elements and the order
17413  of the elements in the edge_chain[] array.
17414  Parameters:
17415  edge_count - [in]
17416  Number of elements in edge_chain[]
17417  edge_chain - [in/out]
17418  */
17419  static void ReverseEdgeChain(
17420  ON_SubDEdgePtr* edge_chain,
17421  size_t edge_count
17422  );
17423 
17424  /*
17425  Description:
17426  Checks that all edge and vertex pointers are not nullptr
17427  and that adjacent edges in the list share the same vertex.
17428  Parameters:
17429  edge_chain - [in]
17430  Edge chain to test
17431  bCheckForDuplicateEdges - [in]
17432  If bCheckForDuplicateEdges true, then false is returned if
17433  there are duplicate edges or duplicate interior vertices.
17434  Returns:
17435  True if edge_chain[] is valid.
17436  */
17437  static bool IsValidEdgeChain(
17438  const ON_SimpleArray< ON_SubDEdgePtr >& edge_chain,
17439  bool bCheckForDuplicateEdges
17440  );
17441 
17442  /*
17443  Description:
17444  Checks that all edge and vertex pointers are not nullptr
17445  and that adjacent edges in the list share the same vertex.
17446  Parameters:
17447  edge_count - [in]
17448  Number of elements in edge_chain[] to test.
17449  edge_chain - [in]
17450  Edge chain to test
17451  bCheckForDuplicateEdges - [in]
17452  If bCheckForDuplicateEdges true, then false is returned if
17453  there are duplicate edges or duplicate interior vertices.
17454  Returns:
17455  True if edge_chain[] is valid.
17456  */
17457  static bool IsValidEdgeChain(
17458  const ON_SubDEdgePtr* edge_chain,
17459  size_t edge_count,
17460  bool bCheckForDuplicateEdges
17461  );
17462 
17463 public:
17464  /*
17465  Returns:
17466  Current EdgeChain
17467  */
17468  const ON_SimpleArray<ON_SubDEdgePtr>& EdgeChain() const;
17469 
17470 
17471  const ON_SubD& SubD() const;
17472  const ON_SubDRef SubDRef() const;
17473 
17474  bool InChain(
17475  const ON_SubDEdgePtr edge_ptr
17476  ) const;
17477 
17478  bool InChain(
17479  const ON_SubDEdge* edge
17480  ) const;
17481 
17482  bool InChain(
17483  const ON_SubDVertex* vertex
17484  ) const;
17485 
17486  /*
17487  Returns:
17488  True if the edge chain has 3 or more edges that form a closed loop.
17489  */
17490  bool IsClosedLoop() const;
17491 
17492  /*
17493  Parameters:
17494  bStrictlyConvex - [in]
17495  If true, then a colinear pair of edges is not considered convex.
17496  Returns:
17497  True if the edge chain has 3 or more edges that forma a convex loop.
17498  */
17499  bool IsConvexLoop(
17500  bool bStrictlyConvex
17501  ) const;
17502 
17503 
17504  /*
17505  Parameters:
17506  persistent_subd_id - [in]
17507  If this edge chain needs to persist in a 3dm archive, then persistent_subd_id
17508  should identify the subd in its current context.
17509  If that context is an ONX_Model, then the persistent id is the ON_ModelGeometryComponent.Id().
17510  If that context is a CRhinoDoc, then the persistent id is CRhinoObject.ModelObjectId().
17511  If the edge chain is being used in a runtime context and will not be saved in a 3dm archive
17512  or otherwise serialized, then persistent_subd_id can be ON_nil_uuid.
17513 
17514  */
17515  unsigned int BeginEdgeChain(
17516  ON_UUID persistent_subd_id,
17517  ON_SubDRef subd_ref,
17518  const ON_SubDEdge* initial_edge
17519  );
17520 
17521  /*
17522  Parameters:
17523  persistent_subd_id - [in]
17524  If this edge chain needs to persist in a 3dm archive, then persistent_subd_id
17525  should identify the subd in its current context.
17526  If that context is an ONX_Model, then the persistent id is the ON_ModelGeometryComponent.Id().
17527  If that context is a CRhinoDoc, then the persistent id is CRhinoObject.ModelObjectId().
17528  If the edge chain is being used in a runtime context and will not be saved in a 3dm archive
17529  or otherwise serialized, then persistent_subd_id can be ON_nil_uuid.
17530 
17531  */
17532  unsigned int BeginEdgeChain(
17533  ON_UUID persistent_subd_id,
17534  ON_SubDRef subd_ref,
17535  const ON_SimpleArray<const ON_SubDEdge* >& initial_edge_chain
17536  );
17537 
17538  /*
17539  Parameters:
17540  persistent_subd_id - [in]
17541  If this edge chain needs to persist in a 3dm archive, then persistent_subd_id
17542  should identify the subd in its current context.
17543  If that context is an ONX_Model, then the persistent id is the ON_ModelGeometryComponent.Id().
17544  If that context is a CRhinoDoc, then the persistent id is CRhinoObject.ModelObjectId().
17545  If the edge chain is being used in a runtime context and will not be saved in a 3dm archive
17546  or otherwise serialized, then persistent_subd_id can be ON_nil_uuid.
17547 
17548  */
17549  unsigned int BeginEdgeChain(
17550  ON_UUID persistent_subd_id,
17551  ON_SubDRef subd_ref,
17552  const ON_SubDEdge*const* initial_edge_chain,
17553  size_t edge_count
17554  );
17555 
17556  /*
17557  Parameters:
17558  persistent_subd_id - [in]
17559  If this edge chain needs to persist in a 3dm archive, then persistent_subd_id
17560  should identify the subd in its current context.
17561  If that context is an ONX_Model, then the persistent id is the ON_ModelGeometryComponent.Id().
17562  If that context is a CRhinoDoc, then the persistent id is CRhinoObject.ModelObjectId().
17563  If the edge chain is being used in a runtime context and will not be saved in a 3dm archive
17564  or otherwise serialized, then persistent_subd_id can be ON_nil_uuid.
17565 
17566  */
17567  unsigned int BeginEdgeChain(
17568  ON_UUID persistent_subd_id,
17569  ON_SubDRef subd_ref,
17570  ON_SubDEdgePtr initial_edge
17571  );
17572 
17573  /*
17574  Parameters:
17575  persistent_subd_id - [in]
17576  If this edge chain needs to persist in a 3dm archive, then persistent_subd_id
17577  should identify the subd in its current context.
17578  If that context is an ONX_Model, then the persistent id is the ON_ModelGeometryComponent.Id().
17579  If that context is a CRhinoDoc, then the persistent id is CRhinoObject.ModelObjectId().
17580  If the edge chain is being used in a runtime context and will not be saved in a 3dm archive
17581  or otherwise serialized, then persistent_subd_id can be ON_nil_uuid.
17582 
17583  */
17584  unsigned int BeginEdgeChain(
17585  ON_UUID persistent_subd_id,
17586  ON_SubDRef subd_ref,
17587  const ON_SimpleArray<ON_SubDEdgePtr>& initial_edge_chain
17588  );
17589 
17590  /*
17591  Parameters:
17592  persistent_subd_id - [in]
17593  If this edge chain needs to persist in a 3dm archive, then persistent_subd_id
17594  should identify the subd in its current context.
17595  If that context is an ONX_Model, then the persistent id is the ON_ModelGeometryComponent.Id().
17596  If that context is a CRhinoDoc, then the persistent id is CRhinoObject.ModelObjectId().
17597  If the edge chain is being used in a runtime context and will not be saved in a 3dm archive
17598  or otherwise serialized, then persistent_subd_id can be ON_nil_uuid.
17599 
17600  */
17601  unsigned int BeginEdgeChain(
17602  ON_UUID persistent_subd_id,
17603  ON_SubDRef subd_ref,
17604  const ON_SubDEdgePtr* initial_edge_chain,
17605  size_t edge_count
17606  );
17607 
17608  unsigned int EdgeCount() const;
17609 
17610  void SetStatusCheck(
17611  bool bEnableStatusCheck,
17612  ON_ComponentStatus status_check_pass,
17613  ON_ComponentStatus status_check_fail
17614  );
17615 
17616  bool StatusCheckEnabled() const;
17617 
17618  const ON_ComponentStatus StatusCheckPass() const;
17619 
17620  const ON_ComponentStatus StatusCheckFail() const;
17621 
17622  bool StatusCheck(
17623  const ON_SubDEdge* edge
17624  ) const;
17625 
17626  void Reverse();
17627 
17628  const ON_SubDEdgePtr FirstEdgePtr() const;
17629  const ON_SubDEdgePtr LastEdgePtr() const;
17630  const ON_SubDEdgePtr EdgePtr(int edge_index) const;
17631 
17632  const ON_SubDEdge* FirstEdge() const;
17633  const ON_SubDEdge* LastEdge() const;
17634  const ON_SubDEdge* Edge(int edge_index) const;
17635 
17636  const ON_SubDVertex* FirstVertex() const;
17637  const ON_SubDVertex* LastVertex() const;
17638  const ON_SubDVertex* Vertex(int vertex_index) const;
17639 
17640  unsigned int AddOneNeighbor(
17641  ON_ChainDirection direction,
17642  ON_SubD::ChainType chain_type
17643  );
17644 
17645  unsigned int AddAllNeighbors(
17646  ON_ChainDirection direction,
17647  ON_SubD::ChainType chain_type
17648  );
17649 
17650  unsigned int AddEdge(
17651  const ON_SubDEdge* edge
17652  );
17653 
17654  unsigned int RemoveEdges(
17655  const ON_SubDEdge* first_edge,
17656  const ON_SubDEdge* last_edge
17657  );
17658 
17659  void ClearEdgeChain();
17660 
17661  /*
17662  Returns:
17663  The persistent id of the parent subd object.
17664  If the context is an ONX_Model, then the persistent id is the ON_ModelGeometryComponent.Id().
17665  If the context is a CRhinoDoc, then the persistent id is CRhinoObject.ModelObjectId().
17666  */
17667  const ON_UUID PersistentSubDId() const;
17668 
17669  bool HasPersistentEdgeIds() const;
17670 
17671  bool HasRuntimeEdgePtrs() const;
17672 
17673  bool SetPersistentEdgeIdsFromRuntimeEdgePtrs() const;
17674 
17675  /*
17676  Description:
17677  In situations where this edge chain is being read from a 3dm archive,
17678  or a similar serialization context, this function uses the saved edge
17679  id information to initialize the runtime ON_SubDEdgePtr information.
17680  Parameters:
17681  persistent_subd_id - [in]
17682  This id is passed to insure it matches the saved persistent_subd_id.
17683  The source of the id depends on the context of the model managing the subd.
17684  If that context is an ONX_Model, then the persistent id is the ON_ModelGeometryComponent.Id().
17685  If that context is a CRhinoDoc, then the persistent id is CRhinoObject.ModelObjectId().
17686  Returns:
17687  True if successful.
17688  False if not successful.
17689  */
17690  bool SetRuntimeEdgePtrsFromPersistentSubD(
17691  ON_UUID persistent_subd_id,
17692  ON_SubDRef persistent_subd_ref
17693  );
17694 
17695  bool Write(class ON_BinaryArchive& archive) const;
17696  bool Read(class ON_BinaryArchive& archive);
17697  void Dump(class ON_TextLog& text_log) const;
17698 
17699 private:
17700  ON_SubDRef m_subd_ref;
17701  ON_SimpleArray<ON_SubDEdgePtr> m_edge_chain;
17702 
17703 
17704  // If m_persistent_subd_id, then the id identifies the parent subd in the model.
17705  // In an ONX_Model, this is the ON_ModelGeometryComponent.Id() value
17706  // of the corresponding ON_SubD in the ONX_Model.
17707  // In Rhino, this is the CRhinoObject.ModelObjectId() value
17708  // of the corresponding CRhinoSubDObject in the CRhinoDoc.
17709  ON_UUID m_persistent_subd_id = ON_nil_uuid;
17710 
17711  // If m_persistent_subd_id is set and m_persistent_edge_id[] is not empty,
17712  // m_persistent_edge_id[] is a list of edge ids and orientations.
17713  // unsigned id = m_persistent_edge_id[] & 0xFFFFFFFF.
17714  // reversed orientation = (0 != (m_persistent_edge_id[] & 0x8000000000000000)).
17715  // The persistent id information is saved in 3dm archives. When that archive is read,
17716  // the SetRuntimeEdgePtrsFromPersistentSubD() can be used to set the runtime edge chain values.
17717  // These mutable fields are set by Write and used by Read.
17718  mutable ON_SimpleArray<unsigned int> m_persistent_edge_id;
17719  mutable ON_SimpleArray<ON__UINT8> m_persistent_edge_orientation; // 0 = not reversed, 1 = reversed.
17720 
17721  ON_UniqueTester m_unique_tester;
17722  ON_ComponentStatus m_status_check_pass = ON_ComponentStatus::NoneSet;
17723  ON_ComponentStatus m_status_check_fail = ON_ComponentStatus::Selected;
17724  bool m_bEnableStatusCheck = false;
17725 };
17726 
17727 class ON_CLASS ON_SubDComponentFilter
17728 {
17729 public:
17730  ON_SubDComponentFilter() = default;
17731  ~ON_SubDComponentFilter() = default;
17732  ON_SubDComponentFilter(const ON_SubDComponentFilter&) = default;
17733  ON_SubDComponentFilter& operator=(const ON_SubDComponentFilter&) = default;
17734 
17735 public:
17736 
17737  ///<summary>
17738  /// No filters are set and all components are accepted.
17739  ///</summary>
17740  static const ON_SubDComponentFilter Unset;
17741 
17742  ///<summary>
17743  /// Only vertices are accepted.
17744  ///</summary>
17745  static const ON_SubDComponentFilter OnlyVertices;
17746 
17747  ///<summary>
17748  /// Only edges are accepted.
17749  ///</summary>
17750  static const ON_SubDComponentFilter OnlyEdges;
17751 
17752  ///<summary>
17753  /// Only faces are accepted.
17754  ///</summary>
17755  static const ON_SubDComponentFilter OnlyFaces;
17756 
17757  /*
17758  Parameters:
17759  bAcceptVertices - [in]
17760  If true, all vertices are accepted. Otherwise, all vertices are rejected.
17761  bAcceptEdges - [in]
17762  If true, all edges are accepted. Otherwise all edges are rejected.
17763  bAcceptFaces - [in]
17764  If true, all faces are accepted. Otherwise all faces are rejected.
17765  */
17766  static const ON_SubDComponentFilter Create(
17767  bool bAcceptVertices,
17768  bool bAcceptEdges,
17769  bool bAcceptFaces
17770  );
17771 
17772 public:
17773  ///<summary>
17774  /// Topology filters.
17775  ///</summary>
17776  enum class Topology : unsigned char
17777  {
17778  ///<summary>
17779  /// No topology filter.
17780  ///</summary>
17781  Unset = 0,
17782 
17783  ///<summary>
17784  /// A boundary vertex has a single sector bounded by two boundary edges.
17785  /// A boundary edge has a single face.
17786  /// A boundary face has at least one boundary edge.
17787  ///</summary>
17788  Boundary = 1,
17789 
17790  ///<summary>
17791  /// An interior vertex has the same number of edges and faces and all edges are interior.
17792  /// An interior edge has two faces.
17793  /// An interior face has all interior edges.
17794  ///</summary>
17795  Interior = 2,
17796 
17797  ///<summary>
17798  /// A nonmanifold vertex is a vertex that is neither boundary nor interior.
17799  /// A nonmanifold edge is an edge that is neither boundary nor interior.
17800  /// A nonmanifold face is a face that is neither boundary nor interior.
17801  ///</summary>
17802  Nonmanifold = 4,
17803 
17804  ///<summary>
17805  /// A component that is either boundary or interior.
17806  ///</summary>
17807  BoundaryOrInterior = 3,
17808 
17809  ///<summary>
17810  /// A component that is either boundary or nonmanifold.
17811  ///</summary>
17812  BoundaryOrNonmanifold = 5,
17813 
17814  ///<summary>
17815  /// A component that is either interior or nonmanifold
17816  ///</summary>
17817  InteriorOrNonmanifold = 6
17818  };
17819 
17820  bool AcceptComponent(
17821  const class ON_Geometry* geometry
17822  ) const;
17823 
17824  bool AcceptComponent(
17825  ON_COMPONENT_INDEX component_index,
17826  const class ON_Geometry* geometry
17827  ) const;
17828 
17829  bool AcceptComponent(
17830  const class ON_SubDComponentRef* cref
17831  ) const;
17832 
17833  /*
17834  Returns:
17835  True if the filter accepts the component. False otherwise.
17836  */
17837  bool AcceptComponent(ON_SubDComponentPtr cptr) const;
17838 
17839  /*
17840  Returns:
17841  True if the filter accepts the vertex. False otherwise.
17842  */
17843  bool AcceptVertex(ON_SubDVertexPtr vptr) const;
17844 
17845  /*
17846  Returns:
17847  True if the filter accepts the edge. False otherwise.
17848  */
17849  bool AcceptEdge(ON_SubDEdgePtr eptr) const;
17850 
17851  /*
17852  Returns:
17853  True if the filter accepts the face. False otherwise.
17854  */
17855  bool AcceptFace(ON_SubDFacePtr fptr) const;
17856 
17857  /*
17858  Returns:
17859  True if the filter accepts the vertex. False otherwise.
17860  */
17861  bool AcceptVertex(const ON_SubDVertex* v) const;
17862 
17863  /*
17864  Returns:
17865  True if the filter accepts the edge. False otherwise.
17866  */
17867  bool AcceptEdge(const ON_SubDEdge* e) const;
17868 
17869  /*
17870  Returns:
17871  True if the filter accepts the face. False otherwise.
17872  */
17873  bool AcceptFace(const ON_SubDFace* f) const;
17874 
17875  void SetAcceptVertices(bool bAcceptVertices);
17876 
17877  bool AcceptVertices() const;
17878 
17879  void SetAcceptEdges(bool bAcceptEdges);
17880 
17881  bool AcceptEdges() const;
17882 
17883  void SetAcceptFaces(bool bAcceptFaces);
17884 
17885  bool AcceptFaces() const;
17886 
17887  void SetVertexTopologyFilter(ON_SubDComponentFilter::Topology vertex_topology_filter);
17888 
17889  void ClearVertexTopologyFilter();
17890 
17891  ON_SubDComponentFilter::Topology VertexTopologyFilter() const;
17892 
17893  void SetEdgeTopologyFilter(ON_SubDComponentFilter::Topology edge_topology_filter);
17894 
17895  ON_SubDComponentFilter::Topology EdgeTopologyFilter() const;
17896 
17897  void ClearEdgeTopologyFilter();
17898 
17899  void SetFaceTopologyFilter(ON_SubDComponentFilter::Topology face_topology_filter);
17900 
17901  ON_SubDComponentFilter::Topology FaceTopologyFilter() const;
17902 
17903  void ClearFaceTopologyFilter();
17904 
17905  bool AcceptVertexTag(ON_SubDVertexTag vertex_tag) const;
17906 
17907  void AddAcceptedVertexTag(ON_SubDVertexTag vertex_tag);
17908 
17909  void ClearVertexTagFilter();
17910 
17911  bool AcceptEdgeTag(ON_SubDEdgeTag edge_tag) const;
17912 
17913  void AddAcceptedEdgeTag(ON_SubDEdgeTag edge_tag);
17914 
17915  void ClearEdgeTagFilter();
17916 
17917  bool AcceptFaceEdgeCount(
17918  unsigned face_edge_count
17919  ) const;
17920 
17921  void SetFaceEdgeCountFilter(
17922  unsigned minimum_face_edge_count,
17923  unsigned maximum_face_edge_count
17924  );
17925 
17926  void ClearFaceEdgeCountFilter();
17927 
17928 private:
17929  bool m_bRejectVertices = false;
17930  ON_SubDComponentFilter::Topology m_vertex_topology_filter = ON_SubDComponentFilter::Topology::Unset;
17931  ON_SubDVertexTag m_vertex_tag_filter[4] = {};
17932 
17933  bool m_bRejectEdges = false;
17934  ON_SubDComponentFilter::Topology m_edge_topology_filter = ON_SubDComponentFilter::Topology::Unset;
17935  ON_SubDEdgeTag m_edge_tag_filter[2] = {};
17936 
17937  bool m_bRejectFaces = false;
17938  ON_SubDComponentFilter::Topology m_face_topology_filter = ON_SubDComponentFilter::Topology::Unset;
17939  unsigned m_minimum_face_edge_count = 0U;
17940  unsigned m_maximum_face_edge_count = 0U;
17941 };
17942 
17943 #if defined (OPENNURBS_PLUS)

17948  //ON_SubDQuadFacePackSide() = default;
17949  //~ON_SubDQuadFacePackSide() = default;

18024  );

18027  ON_SubDQuadFacePackSide* strip,
18028  unsigned strip_count
18029  );
18030

18033 };

18036 #if defined (OPENNURBS_PLUS)
18037 class ON_CLASS ON_SubDQuadFacePack
18038 {
18039 public:
18040  static const ON_SubDQuadFacePack Empty;
18041 
18042 public:
18043  ON_SubDQuadFacePack() = default;
18044  ~ON_SubDQuadFacePack() = default;
18045  ON_SubDQuadFacePack(const ON_SubDQuadFacePack&) = default;
18046  ON_SubDQuadFacePack& operator=(const ON_SubDQuadFacePack&) = default;
18047 
18048  /*
18049  Parameters:
18050  pack_seed_size - [in]
18051  >= 0
18052  The minimum size quad grid that will be returned is pack_seed_size X pack_seed_size.
18053  face - [in]
18054  The quad pack will be grown around this face.
18055  pack_id - [in]
18056  If a quad pack is found, this is the id that will be assinged to each ON_SubDFace.m_pack_id
18057  in the quad pack.
18058  Returns:
18059  If a pack is found, ON_SubDQuadFacePack has details.
18060  Otherwise, ON_SubDQuadFacePack::Empty is returned.
18061  */
18062  static const ON_SubDQuadFacePack GetPack(
18063  unsigned int pack_seed_size,
18064  ON_SubDFace* face,
18065  unsigned int pack_id
18066  );
18067 
18068  unsigned FaceCount() const;
18069 
18070 public:
18071  ON_2udex m_size = ON_2udex::Zero;
18072  ON_SubDQuadFacePackSide m_corners[4] = { ON_SubDQuadFacePackSide::Null, ON_SubDQuadFacePackSide::Null, ON_SubDQuadFacePackSide::Null, ON_SubDQuadFacePackSide::Null };
18073 };
18074 #endif
18075 
18076 #if defined (OPENNURBS_PLUS)
18077 
18078 class ON_CLASS ON_SubDEdgeChainCurve : public ON_Curve
18079 {
18080  ON_OBJECT_DECLARE(ON_SubDEdgeChainCurve);
18081 
18082 public:
18083  ON_SubDEdgeChainCurve() = default;
18084  ~ON_SubDEdgeChainCurve() = default;
18085  ON_SubDEdgeChainCurve(const ON_SubDEdgeChainCurve&) = default;
18086  ON_SubDEdgeChainCurve& operator=(const ON_SubDEdgeChainCurve&) = default;
18087 
18088  ON_SubDEdgeChainCurve(
18089  const ON_SubDEdgeChain& edge_chain
18090  );
18091 
18092  /*
18093  Parameters:
18094  persistent_subd_id - [in]
18095  If this edge chain needs to persist in a 3dm archive, then persistent_subd_id
18096  should identify the subd in its current context.
18097  If that context is an ONX_Model, then the persistent id is the ON_ModelGeometryComponent.Id().
18098  If that context is a CRhinoDoc, then the persistent id is CRhinoObject.ModelObjectId().
18099  */
18100  ON_SubDEdgeChainCurve(
18101  ON_UUID persistent_subd_id,
18102  const ON_SubDRef subd_ref,
18103  const ON_SimpleArray<ON_SubDEdgePtr>& edge_chain
18104  );
18105 
18106  /*
18107  Parameters:
18108  persistent_subd_id - [in]
18109  If this edge chain needs to persist in a 3dm archive, then persistent_subd_id
18110  should identify the subd in its current context.
18111  If that context is an ONX_Model, then the persistent id is the ON_ModelGeometryComponent.Id().
18112  If that context is a CRhinoDoc, then the persistent id is CRhinoObject.ModelObjectId().
18113  */
18114  ON_SubDEdgeChainCurve(
18115  ON_UUID persistent_subd_id,
18116  const ON_SubD& subd,
18117  const ON_SimpleArray<ON_SubDEdgePtr>& edge_chain
18118  );
18119 
18120 
18121 public:
18122  // ON_Object virtual interface
18123  bool IsValid(class ON_TextLog* text_log = nullptr) const override;
18124  void Dump(ON_TextLog&) const override;
18125  unsigned int SizeOf() const override;
18126  ON__UINT32 DataCRC(ON__UINT32 current_remainder) const override;
18127  bool Write(ON_BinaryArchive& binary_archive) const override;
18128  bool Read(ON_BinaryArchive& binary_archive) override;
18129  void DestroyRuntimeCache(bool bDelete = true) override;
18130 
18131 public:
18132  // ON_Geometry virtual interface
18133  int Dimension() const override;
18134  bool GetBBox(double* boxmin,double* boxmax,bool bGrowBox = false) const override;
18135  bool GetTightBoundingBox(class ON_BoundingBox& tight_bbox, bool bGrowBox = false, const class ON_Xform* xform = nullptr) const override;
18136  void ClearBoundingBox() override;
18137  bool Transform(const ON_Xform& xform) override;
18138  bool IsDeformable() const override;
18139  bool Morph(const class ON_SpaceMorph& morph) override;
18140  bool IsMorphable() const override;
18141 
18142 public:
18143  // ON_Curve virtual interface
18144  ON_Interval Domain() const override;
18145  bool SetDomain(double t0,double t1) override;
18146  bool ChangeClosedCurveSeam(double t) override;
18147  bool ChangeDimension(int desired_dimension) override;
18148  int SpanCount() const override;
18149  bool GetSpanVector(double* span_parameters) const override;
18150  bool GetSpanVectorIndex(double t,int side,int* span_vector_index,ON_Interval* span_domain) const override;
18151  int Degree() const override;
18152  bool GetParameterTolerance(double t,double* tminus,double* tplus) const override;
18153  bool IsLinear(double tolerance = ON_ZERO_TOLERANCE) const override;
18154  int IsPolyline(ON_SimpleArray<ON_3dPoint>* pline_points = nullptr,ON_SimpleArray<double>* pline_t = nullptr) const override;
18155  bool IsArc(const ON_Plane* plane = nullptr,ON_Arc* arc = nullptr,double tolerance = ON_ZERO_TOLERANCE) const override;
18156  bool IsEllipse(const ON_Plane* plane = nullptr,ON_Ellipse* ellipse = nullptr,double tolerance = ON_ZERO_TOLERANCE) const override;
18157  bool IsPlanar(ON_Plane* plane = nullptr,double tolerance = ON_ZERO_TOLERANCE) const override;
18158  bool IsInPlane(const ON_Plane& test_plane, double tolerance = ON_ZERO_TOLERANCE) const override;
18159  bool IsClosed() const override;
18160  bool IsPeriodic() const override;
18161  bool GetNextDiscontinuity(ON::continuity c,double t0,double t1,double* t,int* hint = nullptr,int* dtype = nullptr,double cos_angle_tolerance = ON_DEFAULT_ANGLE_TOLERANCE_COSINE,double curvature_tolerance = ON_SQRT_EPSILON) const override;
18162  bool IsContinuous(ON::continuity c,double t,int* hint = nullptr,double point_tolerance = ON_ZERO_TOLERANCE,double d1_tolerance = ON_ZERO_TOLERANCE,double d2_tolerance = ON_ZERO_TOLERANCE,double cos_angle_tolerance = ON_DEFAULT_ANGLE_TOLERANCE_COSINE,double curvature_tolerance = ON_SQRT_EPSILON) const override;
18163  bool Reverse() override;

18169  int IntersectSelf(ON_SimpleArray<ON_X_EVENT>& x,double intersection_tolerance = 0.0,const ON_Interval* curve_domain = 0) const override;

18206  unsigned int SetEdgeChain(
18207  const ON_SubDEdgeChain& edge_chain
18208  );
18209 
18210  /*
18211  Parameters:
18212  persistent_subd_id - [in]
18213  If this edge chain needs to persist in a 3dm archive, then persistent_subd_id
18214  should identify the subd in its current context.
18215  If that context is an ONX_Model, then the persistent id is the ON_ModelGeometryComponent.Id().
18216  If that context is a CRhinoDoc, then the persistent id is CRhinoObject.ModelObjectId().
18217  */
18218  unsigned int SetEdgeChain(
18219  ON_UUID persistent_subd_id,
18220  const ON_SubDRef subd_ref,
18221  const ON_SimpleArray<ON_SubDEdgePtr>& edge_chain
18222  );
18223 
18224  /*
18225  Parameters:
18226  persistent_subd_id - [in]
18227  If this edge chain needs to persist in a 3dm archive, then persistent_subd_id
18228  should identify the subd in its current context.
18229  If that context is an ONX_Model, then the persistent id is the ON_ModelGeometryComponent.Id().
18230  If that context is a CRhinoDoc, then the persistent id is CRhinoObject.ModelObjectId().
18231  */
18232  unsigned int SetEdgeChain(
18233  ON_UUID persistent_subd_id,
18234  const ON_SubD& subd,
18235  const ON_SimpleArray<ON_SubDEdgePtr>& edge_chain
18236  );
18237 
18238  ON_NurbsCurve* EdgeSurfaceCurve(
18239  ON_NurbsCurve* destination
18240  ) const;
18241 
18242  /*
18243  Description:
18244  Get a NURBS curve that is appropriate for lofting SubDs.
18245  Parameters:
18246  destination - [in]
18247  If not nullptr, then the curve is created in this instance.
18248  Returns:
18249  A pointer to the curve or nullptr if the edge is not valid.
18250  */
18251  ON_NurbsCurve* LoftCurve(
18252  ON_NurbsCurve* destination
18253  ) const;
18254 
18255 private:

18275 #if defined(ON_COMPILING_OPENNURBS)
18276 /*
18277 The ON_SubDAsUserData class is used to attach a subd to it proxy mesh
18278 when writing V6 files in commercial rhino.
18279 */
18280 class ON_SubDMeshProxyUserData : public ON_UserData
18281 {
18282 public:
18283  /*
18284  Returns:
18285  A pointer to a mesh that now manages subd.
18286  */
18287  static ON_Mesh* MeshProxyFromSubD(
18288  const ON_SubD* subd
18289  );
18290 
18291  /*
18292  Returns:
18293  A pointer to a subd and deletes mesh.
18294  */
18295  static ON_SubD* SubDFromMeshProxy(
18296  const ON_Mesh* mesh
18297  );
18298 
18299  /*
18300  Returns:
18301  A pointer to a subd and deletes mesh.
18302  */
18303  static bool IsSubDMeshProxy(
18304  const ON_Mesh* mesh
18305  );
18306

18308 
18309 private:
18310  ON_OBJECT_DECLARE(ON_SubDMeshProxyUserData);
18311

18331  const class ON_Object* parent_object
18332  ) const override;
18333 
18334 private:

18336  mutable ON_SubD* m_subd = nullptr;
18337 
18338 private:

18340  mutable unsigned int m_mesh_face_count = 0;
